text: This is probably the closest thing to 'Local Kine Grinds' without having to get on a plane to the 808.  Definitely the best in Southwest Vegas.  My go to plate is the Furikake Chicken.  So flavorful!

A displaced local buddy (who now lives in LV, i guess it makes him a LV local) took me to this place and walked out with a smile on my tummy.  A little off the beaten path from the Strip, but stepping into this place I felt if I stepped back into Hawaii.  Even the people eating here had some connection to the islands.  I had the Kalbi and the Chop Steak.  Mmmm so ono, even by local standards.  My buddy had the fried chicken and always gets it so I know that gotta be a winna.  I will make it a point to stop here whenever I am in Sin City.

Drove in from Reno and Even with a group as big as ours (13 to be exact) arriving at 845 at night when they close at 930 the Customer service was still on point.  The servings were huge, we each had to share a plate and some of us still couldn't finish it. Their Furikake chicken is BOMB!!! And their cakes are so Ono you have to try it!!! Definitely coming here again!!

Island Flavor is one of the best spots to eat Hawaiian food. They have great service, huge portions (really great to share but even better to eat by yourself), reasonable prices, clean, and what else can I say the food is delicious. My all time favorite is the oxtail soup; the taste is just perfect. If you never tried fried poke you are definitely missing out. Make sure you save room for dessert because I highly recommend trying the bread pudding and the mud pie.
Went to Island Flavor for lunch food was great.

Great Hawaiian food. Portions are huge as well! I recommend the oxtail soup, loco moco and kalua pig rice plate. Also, don't forget dessert and order the chantilly cake! Sooo delicious. If you want authentic Hawaiian food, check this place out asap!
Garlic noodles with chicken. Get some of that and forget about your diet for one meal.

There are not many restaurants by my house, so I was pleasantly surprised when I came across Island Flavor! Some of my favorite dishes include their poke and chicken katsu. I especially love that the portions are huge - great for leftovers! This is the perfect restaurant to order to-go and enjoy a some authentic Hawaiian flavors.

The best Hawaiian BBQ in Vegas period! I know my Asian BBQ because I personally cook them all the time and these are the best. They use real grill not like other franchise H BBQ who just fry them. Chicken is perfectly marinated and Kalbi is cooked well too. Taste reminded me of the BBQ in Maui.

This and ross J's are my favorite 808 restaurants in Vegas! I especially love coming when they hire this guy to sing! It makes dinner fun! It's a small place, but it's homey and you can tell they love their customers. Service is the best you can get here in Vegas. And the foooood!!!! If you like loco moco, brown gravely, Mac salad, any kind of Hawaiian food you can't go wrong by coming here. This will soon be your new favorite place! They do take out too! And prices are pretty decent!
Best Hawaiian food on the 9th island! Big portions and fairly priced! The plate lunches can honestly be 2 meals for some people.
The service is great the food portion is huge and everything taste so good! I cant wait to come again. For hawaiian food this is the place to go.

Love the kahlua pig.  So much flavor. Short ribs are super tasty and the mac salad is delish. I always get the guava juice so sweet and yummy. Would give 5 stars if the musubi was better but hey I can easily make that at home. Haven't stepped foot in L&L since finding this place.

I went last Friday night (12/18/15). They had live music and it was AMAZING!!! We arrived at the perfect time, 6pm right when the music was about to start. I ordered the Mixed Plate: Furikake Chicken and Chicken Katsu with brown rice and mac salad (my friend ordered the fried rice, I am getting that next time). IT WAS THE BEST FOOD I HAVE EVER HAD IN TOWN! Now, typically when I consume that much food all I want to do is go home and lay on the couch until it digests.... Boy was I wrong!!!! I found myself not even wanting to leave. After attempting to eat all of our food (it was huge). We decided if we wanted to stay and watch the rest of the performance it was only necessary to try some dessert. Well, we couldn't narrow it down to just one, so we tried 4 different desserts. We ordered the Chantilly Cake, Guava Cake, Haupia Cake, and the Coco Puffs! We couldn't decide if the Chantilly or the Guava was our favorite, but they were all delicious. Like I said in the beginning, we arrived at 6pm but fell in love with everything about this restaurant and the atmosphere that we didn't end up leaving until 9. NEEDLESS TO SAY I WILL BE BACK & A REGULAR, WHEN I COME BACK FROM OAHU.

As others have mentioned this review is long overdue!  

Hubby and I have been here several times and it is one of the friendliest restaurants I have ever been to - the service is amazing and you feel like you are your server's only customers even though everytime we have been there the place is rockin' and packed!  

Unfortunately I tried L&L before coming here and that experience almost made me not try this wonderful little gem in the southwest.  I know... lumping L&L to all Hawaiian restaurants would be like comparing McDonalds to In-n-Out - my mistake :)

I love the traditional Loco Moco - the gravy is like a culinary orgasm and the eggs are always cooked perfectly!  The hamburger patty is always moist and juicy and the seasoning is perfect too!  It is mind blowing...  Plus they provide so much food (with a side of the best mac salad I've ever had) each time I have had to take over half home with me (and it is just as amazing the next day!)

Hubby gets something different each and every time and he has always been very pleased (and too busy mmmmming to talk much during our meals there!)

Make sure you grab some of their amazing banana nut bread when you are leaving - you will be way too full to have some during your visit...

I was thinking while I was writing this that I should keep my mouth shut and not share my experience - this restaurant may be even more crowded my next visit and when Loco Moco is calling my name - I do not want to wait any longer than absolutely necessary!

Its probably a lucky thing for me that this place is on the opposite side of town, because otherwise I might live here. I spent 20 years in Hawai'i, and I know my Hawaiian BBQ, and this is as good as the best I've had in Hawai'i and by far the best outside of it. 
The portions are heavy, they use great quality cuts of meat (not like the fatty gristly cheap stuff you too often find), and they serve with Aloha. My absolute favorite is the beef teriyaki steak which is always perfectly done. My girlfriend loves the fried poke salad, which I often share with her, and is truly great. If you're able to manage dessert after eating all of that, the Guava cake is definitely worth trying. 

Now aside from being the best Hawaiian BBQ in town, they truly live Aloha. I wont give all the details other than to say that yesterday I went there, and despite a bad situation (which had nothing to do with the restaurant) the management showed me an act of kindness that blew my mind. I cannot recommend this place enough.
Island Flavor is the best place for Poke' and they have the best teriyaki mixed plate in town.
Favorite Hawaiian place to eat in Vegas. Portions are huge, good is a great price, and service is friendly. Highly recommend!
Just ordered take out first time customer I heard lots of good things about this place and it exceeded my expectations hands down best island food in town. Love the pork won tons.
Haupia cake is bomb! One of the best mac salads I've had. Great food at an awesome affordable price. Highly recommend furikake poke and their korean chicken

The Bkgd - Tired of usual food options..so thanks to yelp arrived here...

The Point - Good, simple, heavy, large potion food =) A perfect fix for lunch & leftovers for dinner. Nice friendly/chill ppl along w/ nice music.

~The Order~
Hawaiian Plate - $9.75
*  Homemade Lau lau, 2 scoops rice, ahi poke, salmon, haupia & mac salad. Take that!
* Real good portions and a nice mix of food. The Poke & salmon was my fav.
* The Lau lau (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lau_lau) had pork I think & fish?  was good portions a bit dry but still good. 
*And so was the desert thingy..(http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haupia) i usually don't like coconut..but my taste buds made an exceptions because I finished it all. 
* Perfect leftovers

Mixed Plate of Shrimp & Teriyaki Chicken ~ $9.75
* BF got ~ 5 fried shrimp & ~5 chicken thighs w/ yummy sauce
* he can eat and he still had leftovers

Overall reminded me of a local place my friend's family took us in honolulu...but here
Def. will be back to try to ribs & Ox Tail next time....

We were interested in finally trying Island Flavor, so I arrived here in a party of three one weekend. We stood waiting at the front without being noticed for who knows how long. The cashier woman and the three servers went about their business acting unaware we were there. Not one glance and not a single 'Hi, just a moment please' or 'Have you been helped yet?' (you know, those simple phrases that every other restaurant uses to greet incoming customers?). After standing idle up there for an indefinite period of time we were miraculously sat down. 

So we quickly ordered realizing things would take forever if we didn't take action immediately. The food was good and they do give you fairly large portions for what you pay for. However, the restaurant's bizarre ongoing neglectful behavior ensued. As we were eating, another party sat down next to us and I witnessed as all three servers took turns coming by this table to give their happy undivided attention within a brief time span while we were barely serviced by our lone server during our entire stay. We thought of trying the Chantilly Cake, but after realizing what we'd have to put up with we just decided to pay. After not being able to get someone's attention again (even when calling out!) we got up, paid at the cash register, then drove off to find dessert elsewhere.   

From the moment we walked in to the moment we left it felt like we weren't wanted there and the people working could care less. When I read through Island Flavor's other one-star reviews on Yelp I found out that those people's experiences were very similar to mine. I don't understand this restaurant. It's like they deliberately ignore and sacrifice certain customers just so they can give everybody else the VIP Hawaiian treatment. Okay fine, I don't really expect to be given the same amount of attention the regulars get, but when it gets to a point that they start ignoring the basics of simple service (just to prioritize some customers over others) then that's not right. 

For those of you who were able to enjoy yourselves and give this place a glowing review, I hate and envy you very much.

Love this place! Everytime I come here from L.A I always make it a point to eat here. 

You have to eat the Loco Moco the best I've ever had and it's "HUGE" also the Kalbi is great also. I am a huge Hawaiian food fan and there's nothing like this in L.A!!!

I REALLY wanted to like this place. I even tried it twice to make sure they weren't just having an off day or something. I'm actually pretty annoyed that furikake chicken is under their "review highlights" because that must mean it's a popular dish, which is weird to me. I LOVE furikake. Seriously, if you put furikake on anything, I'm bound to love it. I was really disappointed with this chicken though... Again, I tried the same dish twice. 

Both times I tried the chicken, it was overcooked and dry. This is why I don't understand how it's such a popular dish. You must all have pretty low standards for food, I guess. 

I'm from Hawaii and I love finding all of the Hawaiian places around town to try, but this place did NOT satisfy. Maybe I should try some of their other menu items??? A little scared though because any restaurant that can't cook chicken properly is automatically sus to me. This dish just isn't right and they need to re-evaluate the execution of it. I was expecting something more similar to the Garlic Chicken at 808 Hawaii Mixed Plate. Now THAT is some ono chicken...

Not much more needs to be said. This is some of the best plate lunch I've had on the mainland and I think the quality is better than Ross J's however for local kind breakfast I still prefer Island sushi if you're near 215/eastern. For lunch though I think Island flavor has them all beat!

Sorry, even the decor and friendly servers just can't mask the taste of awful food!

This doesn't taste like food back home. I tried a lot of things on their menu and everything but desserts disappointed. Their desserts don't count since most of them are baked by Andrea's World of Cakes?

Roast Pork: Where's the meat? Why is there so much fat? 

Chicken Katsu: Why is it burnt? 

Korean Chicken: Where's the spice? Why is there chicken fuzz still on it? Eeewww!

Kalbi/Short Ribs: Why so stingy and too sweet?

Portuguese Sausage: What is that weird after taste? 

Lau Lau: Why is it so dry? Almost like shredded wet cardboard. 

Furikake Shrimp: What's so special about breaded fried shrimp with furikake sprinkles on it? Come on, lets get more creative here.

Loco Moco & Hamburger Steak: Sure, it's big but why is it so bland? 

Mac Salad: No, no. (shaking my head) So salty. 

Spam Musubi: How can you sell cold musubi left for hours on the counter? 

Kikoman "cheap stuff" soy sauce? You know everyone back home favors Aloha Shoyu! 

UGH!  I gave this place so many chances and I ALWAYS left disappointed. Hey, shame on me for expecting the inevitable from this restaurant.

Best Hawaiian food I've ever had! The portions are huge and it always tastes fresh. Mac salad is the best I've tasted. My go-to is the mixed plate with Furikake chicken and teriyaki steak, and to switch it up I'll get the Kalua pig and cabbage with salmon lomi. Every time a plate passes by me even though it's not what I ordered it looks amazing. TRY THIS PLACE! And the staff is always friendly. I can't say enough good things about his place, except I wish it was closer to me!

Holy mother of God, if you do anything with your life, make sure you go here and get the furikake chicken!! I don't really remember what else we got because it was THAT good. I think we got some combo stuff with katsu, probably kalua pork, and maybe shrimp? I remember it was all good though. Got the mud pie, honestly it was meh, only ate a quarter. BUT, will most definitely be back to try the guava cake (knew I shoulda picked that one instead!), along with their other delicious looking menu items. Atmosphere was great, cashier nice, and before we left, half a dozen Metro officers came in to eat, so you know this place is legit!!

This review is long overdue but this place is amazing.  Better than a lot of local joints in Hawaii too. Everything was so flavorful, fresh , great portions, and so reasonably priced . The menu has all your typical dishes and a couple  of poke variations . I  Ordered the poke , loco loco, and kalua pork . My plate also came with a Mac salad and coconut haupia pudding cup . oN point! I wish Seattle had Hawaiian places like this. Sigh. Next time I'm in vegas, this place is a must .
My favorite place to eat for Hawaiian style food. I even like it better than any place back at home. The furikake chicken....the best.

I'm just going to agree with the rest of the bunch. All good.
Too bad it is far from where I live... I would eat more often here otherwise :)

I got a combo - chopped steak with onions and furikake shrimp. Steak was tender, onions tasted good and shrimp was crunchy on outside and tender inside. Portion was more than generous so I almost fell into 'food coma' afterward :)

This is where I git my shoyu poke on!! My only concern is, no ogo da poke...but that's ok, I usually have a stash so I add, let rest then eat. My Hawaii taste is simple yet flavorful, don't  care for most poke bars AND I git a 1 stop shop...poi kulolo, slippah, bread, poke...pau!

That's some good Island Flavor. Love the Shoyu Ahi Poke and the soup here. Better than the one at CA Hotel.

Our 3rd time back we took our family of 13 here and everyone ate everything from Kalbi ribs, Loco Moco, Stew, Poke, Chicken Terriyaki, Spam Masubi, Guava Cake, Chicken Katsu. It was all good.

The food is decent ... the service was okay ... the people just looked pissed most of the time . If you don't like your job find another job . I don't like rude service . They even said to one of my friends that's it ?? Just ordering the side of fried rice. Not cool. I'm not coming here again ... the first time was great and even the 2nd time ... now it's just plain fully bad . Treat your customers with respect even though we're not Hawaiian . Don't hire people who treat customers like shit. Hands down don't go here for shitty service . I would go to Hawaiian BBQ at least they smile . I hope they will eventually learn to smile .

I'd thought I would suffer from plate lunch withdrawals when I moved to LV. Island Flavor hits da spot! Proper local style food from Big-Island-transferred-folks.

All the other "local Hawaiian food" themed food taste like crappy L&L. Yeah there is a clear difference between non Hawaii raised people trying to make Hawaii style plate lunch food.

The food was great, the loco moco was very filling and the gravy was tasty and complimented the dish well, thick burger patty! Once you walk into this restaurant, you immediately get a good vibe feeling that the food is going to be good. The drive from the airport or downtown may seem long, but It's located just before it seems like its off the beaten path...bring your gps
Must try this place best island food in town.. Craving for good hawaiian food visit island flavor southwest area..

My absolute favorite restaurant in all of Las Vegas. I am not Hawaiian but love Hawaiian food. Since living in Vegas, Ive eaten at tons of different Hawaiian restaurants. Most of the time when one opens the food will be really good, then all of a sudden the quality goes down the tubes and it becomes just like the rest of them. 

Island Flavor is the shiznittle bam. It reminds me of north shore shack in Honolulu(which isn't on north shore. The Kalbi is the best in the city. Its hard to find good kalbi. The only thing is the musubi, its always gone when i get there. One day though. The service is always really good, even on busy nights. Personable and relaxed. If you don't know, now u do. If you haven't been, then you should!

This place is by far the best Hawaiian food in town. They have HUGE portions, totally worth the price. I usually get the Shoyu Chicken on their Thursday special. Staff is extremely friendly and funny. The specials are awesome. Great seasoning on everything. The cakes are huge and delicious. I also love their spam musubi. Go check em out. Had the Kalbi short ribs.....mmmmmm
I love everything about this place!  The loco moco is as good as you get in Hawaii.  The cake options here are also awesome.

Island Flavor is the best Hawaiian food in LV. The chicken Katsu and roast pork are great and the portions are large. The restaurant gets super busy because it really is delicious food. The wait at the front is long sometimes and it gets a bit confusing when some people are there to be seated and others are there for pick up. This is my one hesitation.

I'm from California. I've eaten at a lot of Hawaiian restaurant in cali.. By far this is the best Hawaiian restaurant  ...!people are friendly ..nice little spot... portions are good. The food is delicious! Every Time I come to visit Las Vegas i will always make sure i.eat here before I go back to Cali....

The food is good!! the owner is a nice man. but that's ware the good ends. our family will naver go back. 3week ago we went for dinner. there was only one other table with costomers.we seated ourself because waitress was talking to the other waitress. the waitress looked at us many time for the next 10min. but naver brought us a menu or smiled. when she finley the came we ask why take a long. she give us a mean look and said because you seated yourself i made you wait. all in a all our experance was almost the same as luisa c review date 8/21/2012 our waitess was a large hawaian women who walked so slow like a gangbanger in a closswalk.. I feel bad for the owner but this business will fail unress he upgrade the quarity of the waitress. we left with out eating because we feared she may my mess with our food.
The owner is amazing! Very friendly and always checking on the guests! The good is good, my favorite is the oxtail soup! big portions! and oh the chantilly cake is to die for!

We usually order take out because the seats aren't too comfortable. I like the kalbi short ribs and the teriyaki chicken. Each order comes with rice, macaroni salad and salad. Portion was big that we always have leftover.

I'm giving Island Flavor a 3 star review because when I went there (only been once) it was a Friday at around 7:30 pm and the place was FREEZING. There was a wait and there is no where for a waiting party to sit, so we had to go outside abs stand or sit in the car. 

The decor.....well there's no decor or even an attempt at one. It's a small restaurant in a strip mall and it shows for it. 

Food was good, the Chicken Katsu a bit flavorless but still good. The Portuguese Bean Soup tasted more like Pork and Beans from a can, it was just ok. 

Eating in freezing temperatures is not fun and the servers weren't the friendliest. 

It's ok for a quick or "I'm driving by it" bite.

Oh my Hawaiian! This is owned and ran buy Hawaiians restaurant who are so sweet;)!  The flavors were great!

Worth the 20-minute drive from the strip to have great food from the island!

Good food even greater service! My go to place if I have people from out of town! Roast pork loco moco best rice combo! Poke salad is the bomb! order the fish fresh! Oxtail soup will hit the spot! Love this place! Love the staff very friendly and accommodating!

First time here, but not our last!  Furikake chicken was so tasty!  A little rich and very filling.  Most servings were large portions big enough for 2 people to share.   

We'll have to go back to try the other menu items.
Had the shoyu chicken was delicious! The staff were so friendly I will definitely be back. They also have a nice little Hawaiian market right next door.

This place has all the local dishes just like back home and their portions are definitely generous! I ordered a local staple, Loco Moco. It was just as good as anything I've eaten back home. I judge Loco Moco by the quality of the brown gravy. Their gravy was the consistency just how I like it, not too thick and not like soup. I ordered my eggs over easy and it was cooked to perfection. As easy as it may sound, many times eggs aren't cooked as actually ordered. I look forward to returning and ordering their kalua pork and cabbage, another local staple. The service was friendly and I recommend this place to try

I love Chicken Katsu and Kalbi short ribs. Their foods are so good and huge portions for $10. You guys should try :) they have good food and good service. So we can't go wrong for that. And Bradley is the best server :)

I cannot believe that such a place that serves delicious food is brought to one star due to horrible service. I always get the Ahi Poke with a scoop of rice and a scoop of macaroni salad. It's very good, but on September 25 approximately 3:15pm, their credit card system was down. I had called in advance to place my order since I was not going to dine in. When I told the younger lady if I needed to pay with cash since the front of the door had a sign that said "cash only", she said yes. I informed her that I was not told that on the phone. She then proceeded on telling me that I could go to the gas station nearby and use their ATM ..I said no it's going to charge me, I'm not doing that. 

The whole time she did not apologize at the fact that I drove far and they didn't tell me it was cash only at that time . She then said, "I'll try" with an attitude. The card went through. She got the receipt for me to print and after I signed it she went to get the food, brought it back, and walked away. The whole time no "here you go" "thank you" "I apologize" nothing. 

Sad thing is that I would go very often and witnessed so many other issues. One day a group of three ordered their food and it took forever and they purposely left the food intact as soon as it arrived and left. 

The first time I went, they took 30 minutes to serve us and it was the wrong order. 

I really wanted to give it a shot because of their food, but trust me, some of the people that work there will not smile or serve you well unless you are Hawaiian. 

Also, be careful when you order ahi poke, they don't tell you they have an option of half a pound. They will always give you the full pound.

I would suggest you pass this place unless you like rude customer service and long waits.

"I consider myself a connoisseur of Hawaiian plate lunch. Regularly eat at Diamond Head Grill, Ted's Bakery and Rainbow drive in. Island Flavors is the real deal. In fact just as good if not better than my favorites in Oahu. I was thoroughly surprised today."

One of the best off-island Hawaiian places Ive been to!! Service to Food was absolutely amazing :)

You wont regret your visit!!
Love love love the food here. Loco moco and chicken katsu! They also had sweet potato haupia pie that was out of this world!

Great place to go if you're craving Hawaiian food while in Vegas. The portions are ridiculously large - two could get away with sharing one plate. Highlights of eating here would be the furikake chicken, kalbi short ribs, and their mac salad. I'm a fan of the traditional loco moco with hamburger meat, but the chicken katsu loco moco was worth trying. Make sure to order it with the egg cooked over-easy! 

Overall, the service was friendly and the food was delicious. Would definitely come back again!

Food was exceptional for the price!  Staff was absolutely superb!!! Desert was good.....tad chilly so make sure you bring a light jacket when dining in.  Atmosphere reminds you of a cafeteria setting.  Overall a must go to if in the area!

Was excited at trying this place for the first time. Got seated in 5 mins & was waiting for someone to take our order. About 30 mins went by & no one took our order. Some people that came in 20 mins after us sat down, got there drinks & ordered. At this time I was really upset. Stopped one of the workers & told her that we've been waiting about 30 mins for someone to take our order & I see people that got seated way after we arrived ordering. She was telling me they have a phone order & I said no they came in after we got here. We were so ready to walk out but my kids were hungry. After this happening we are "NEVER" coming here again. BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!

This ain't no L&L, this is the real deal! Every time I've eaten here the food has always been fresh and tasted authentic. I think their oxtail soup is as good as it gets when you don't want to trek to Downtown and visit the Cal. Honestly I feel the oxtail is much better here than the Cal. ;) Portion size is everything here, so you get what you pay for that's for sure.

Now this place is located near Rhodes Ranch. I would say that 90% of their business is take out so the restaurant is never really busy. But if you do decide to eat there, it's a pretty laid-back place no fancy decorations. The owners add their own personal touch but displaying pictures of friends and family on the wall.
Food is always bomb! Folks are always welcoming! Little pricey but worth it! All time FAM favorite!
Gotta eat here once or twice a month. Can't get chantilly cake anywhere else that good. The food is awesome not to mention the servings.
Great food, fast service, reasonable prices.  What more can you ask for?

Never had Hawaiin food before and won't be the last time. Friendly Hawaiin staff and the food is very generously portioned. I can recommend the mixed plate with Hawaiin roast pork and steak and onions with fried rice. I'm from NY and when I come down to Vegas I will be coming back.

This is my one and only go to place if I ever want hawaiian food, which is like any time. haha They give large portion sizes, so if you feel it might be two expensive, just remember each dish is good for two people. I have never ever finished and entree there.

For starters they have the best Poke' in town that come in different seasoning, Furikake and Shoyu, Sorry I forgot the other flavor. But all our good just depends on which you like better. I recommend sharing this though tis too much for one person, well at least to me.

I have tried every dish, and all are great. no joke. The have the best roast pork loco moco in town. It's like a loco mock, but no hamburger meat just lots of tender pork. They're loco mock is also bomb with huge serving. The kalbi ribs and korean chicken wings are so delicious, like finger licking good. I think they're fired rice is the best in town because it gives me flash back of my childhood, when my aunt first cooked and served me the first time i ever ate friend rice. Like that critic from ratatouille, when he took a bite and he remembered his mom making it for him. haha If you can ever make it on fridays nights, they have the best LauLau to me in town, this dish really reminds me for hawaii. I wasn't born in Hawaii but i do go there yearly, so this food is as good as it gets to hawaiian dishes.

Lastly, if you can save room for deserts. They are all great,a dn from what i heard they are made by the bakery next door to it. You must eat Huapia cake and Chantilly cake, I would say a slice but they way they serve slices, its like a small cake. haha

the staff is always friendly, never had a bad encounter, just don't be shocked how fast they move, because they do everything, there are no busers or food runners helping, just the waitress.
Update: I'm giving this place 3 stars so far for the effort of trying to fix the problem, but still haven't tried the food yet (again) so I still can't update that issue. More update to come.

usually i go to vegas talk about casinos but no i go home talking about island flavor. simple place is too good to not go everythime youre here. but get there early you will wait because of the popularity

My first time trying Hawaiian food and I was not disappointed. Ordered the Kalbi plate and it was delish! And the serving was huge! Also had lau lau, flavor was good but it was a tad salty, but from what I'm told it's  made like that. They have guava juice and other tropical drinks that were really yummy. Their servings and prices were good too. Definite food spot added to my list!

This is probably my favorite hawaiian restaurant in vegas. The portions are actually large portions! All the other places don't give you much for your buck. I've tried the kalbi, saimin, poke, etc. I love it here and the service is great. You have to get dessert! Love the haupia ice cream cake. Big portion again so you need to share but it is amazing. 

If they aren't open then I'm not eating hawaiian food anywhere else. I'd wait till the next day.

For once I felt like I was at home. Their menu definitely satisfied my Hawaiian food cravings. The portions are so huge that you can take it home and it'll be enough for a regular meal serving. I got the Kalbi ribs and it came with 4-5 large strips! When ordering there's an option between steamed rice, fried rice, or even fries. I highly recommend the fried rice. Also, you can never go wrong with their pokè!

Due to the large portions, I ate the rest the next day and it was still good! I just had to heat it up and it tasted as if it was still fresh.
Great food, great service...brings me back to Grama' house on the  Island. Prices are low and portions are plentiful. Def gonna be a regular, ALOHA
Awesome food. Furikake chicken was amazing. If you're in a hurry I don't suggest coming here. Portions are huge!

After going to Oahu this summer for a conference, I was super excited to find a good Hawaiian restaurant near where I live here in Vegas.  For those of you that know and have been to Rainbow Drive In on Oahu, you will surely be a fan of this place.

First off I have to say that the portions here are HUGE!!!! So come hungry or be prepared to share or take a doggy bag home.  The mixed plate comes with your choice of two items off the menu, along with 2 scoops of rice and a scoop of mac salad.  I've had the Portuguese bean soup, the Kahlua pork and cabbage, the Hawaiian style roast pork, and the chicken Katsu, and all were delicious.  Both times the pork has been done perfectly, tender and still juicy, which was a nice surprise.  I also liked the brown gravy that they served the roast pork with, it added just the right amount of richness to the dish.  I've also tried the lomi lomi salmon, and it was tasty too, but I'm just not a huge fan of salmon so I didn't think that much of it overall.

The service here is great, and the ladies, when they're not run off their feet, are happy to chat with you, and play do we know anyone in common from back on the islands.  Prices are great considering the amount of food you get here.  Overall, I say go go go if you want a taste of real Hawaiian food.

If I lived a little bit closer I would probably eat here at least once a week.  The service is always great and friendly.  The laulau is great and the haupia cake is a great dessert.  

When I crave good comfort food I always stop by.

By far the best Hawaiian food I've ever had in Las Vegas

I ordered the short ribs and my sister had the  the chicken katsu both were extremely fresh and not mainstream tasting and the service was great too will be coming back the next time I am in Vegas.

My only regret is I wish I ordered more spam Musubi before my road trip back to San Diego

Hey guys it's me Hungry Panda at it again. 

This time a shorter review than usual, sorry.

You know how i always mention Love, it's because I believe Love is an ingredient in amazing food. Also in life, but thats a story for another time :)

Hands Down, The fried stuff the grilled stuff and idk maybe the baked stuff.. MADE WITH LOVE. If your looking for healthy, good luck finding that here, but this place makes food to make your taste buds pop. 

MY FAVORITE: the chicken wings, extra crispy, with the sauce on the side. I do that so that when i get my chicken wings i can still have the fresh crispy wings and not let the breading get too soft and moist. LOL! i said soft and moist, of course were talking about breading on the chicken wings, and thats a big NO NO.

THIS PLACE, PERFECT! service, food, seating, price. maybe a better bathrom but hey i can pee before i leave the house :)

Service is bad!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Especially the cashier!!!!!!!!!!! The girl gave bad looks while I was ordering, and she purposely/intentionally took the orders of 3 customers who werent there yet when I arrived... She constantly interrupts my ordering while continuously prioritizing other customers who just got in. Very rude!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Island flavor always satisfies my Hawaiian food cravings.  A home away from home from the food to the people. 
To me,  the servings are large and good enough to share. 
Must order: Furikake Chicken
My husband's favorite.  Deep fried bite sized chicken with a sugar glazed furikake sauce that's grinds!!! 
Poke is also a hit.  Not fresh from the ocean like back in Hawaii, but it's pretty close....
Service was great! Food was delicious . We ordered the oxtail soup, furikake chicken and chicken katsu. Will definitely return when back in Vegas

I would give this place 5 stars, but I had to deduct a star because the food is just way too salty for me.  No need for soy sauce.  But I am definitely a fan!  I love their ahi poke!!!!  I just wished they served lomi lomi everyday and not just on Fridays.

I always eat at this place when I come to Vegas with my family!!  I'm glad they serve brown rice with there meals that's a plus  for me!  Their bbq chicken is tasty and their ribs! The serving size is huge especially their desserts!  Guava cake and pineapple ice cream are ONO!!!  My kids love eating their spam musubi!  I would recommend this place to everyone got to try it!
Awesome service and great quality food. Lots of food for the money.Bruce is a great guy become a regular you will not be sorry.

When your appetite demands island size proportions; Island Flavor has your fix. This neighborhood delight has everyone leaving properly satisfied every time. Bring your loved ones and your appetite and get fed well at Island Flavor. Try and share the Furikake Chicken!

I LOVE this place. Friday's are always my favorite days to go so I can get the Hawaiian plate, but you have to substitute steamed rice with fried rice. Buggah is ono! Not only is it tasty, but the portions are HUGE. That's one thing I love about a place....the portions! They have some other island favorites Kalua Pig and cabbage, Chicken Katsu  and Kalbi Short Ribs are just a few to mention. Top if off with some haupia cake and you've got a meal.

The menu was very extensive for a Hawaiian restaurant. I had Teriyaki chicken which consisted of quite a lot of delicious marinated chicken with huge portions of rice and macaroni salad for just a little over $10.00. I had some left over for dinner another day. The service was good and the ambience casual and comfortable.

This is the 3rd time I tried to go to this place. They closed early twice! Still, after eating here, I have to say, it's awesome. We ordered Chicken Katsu Loco Moco, Kalua Pig, a Meat special with cabbage and Fried Poke. We then got a Mud Pie desert. Also huge. Also delicious. One desert was enough to share for all of us. The bill came out to $50 for 4 people. Very reasonable. The portions are huge! The food is delicious! I will be a regular here.

This place is right down the street from us just past Rhodes Ranch coming from the freeway.. we ordered to-go.

Order 1 Kalbi ribs entree and an order of Hawaiian pork.  Both came with rice and mac salad or toss salad.  They didn' t have mashed potatoes or spam musubi when we went.

The ribs were delicious, but some of the ribs were mostly fat (4 in total)
Hawaiian pork, huge portion, tender and with lots of gravy!
Mac salad- I've had better but still good
salad with papaya dressing - dressing was creamy and sweet, some of the salad looked wilted

cheap prices too $9 for each, def be back soon!
This place is a freakin joke. The food sucks even if you're Really hungry .Chewy meat with gristles, where do they get this cheap meat? Place sucks . I had like two bites, then tossed it out.

After reading the reviews in LV Weekly, decided to try..although it is about 25 miles away from home.  From Hawaii, and miss the food back home.  Portion size varies.. On the mixed plates, they were generous but BF ordered Teri beef and portion was small.  Laulau had lots of meat but missed the taste of the butterfish that you get back home. Ahi poke was very fresh.  Korean chicken wings were not crispy. Macaroni salad disappointing. Service is slow and waitress is missing the aloha spirit. Prices are higher than the other Hawaiian food places.  Would return there again for the poke but for the rest of the menu...I can find it closer to home.
This place is amazing. So friendly, such amazingly authentic food. I couldn't be happier knowing you guys are down the street with the best kalbi ribs in vegas.

We were around the area and yelped local restaurants. This place was 4.5 stars out of 200+ reviews. It was definitely a local favorite and one of mine as well. Portions were large (as we saw other customers local moco) and good. 

We ordered the poke and korean BBQ ribs. Poke was market price ($16), but it looked like we got about $25 worth. They were large slices and great tasting. The BBQ ribs ($11) were great tasting as well. There were four pieces along with mac salad and rice. 

If anyone is in that area, Island Flavor is definitely a place to visit.

Best local Hawaiian food in Las Vegas. Mix plate with da kine, Kalbi Shirt Ribs and Furikake Chicken add fried rice. Also they get Fried Rice, Portuguese Sausage, with egg for breakfast. Drink, get POG.
The food here is amazing and the portions are huge! The furikake chicken is a must try and the fried rice is the best I've ever had.

The best Hawaiian food that I have had. I had the chicken katsu and Kalbi short rib mixed plate ($12.49)  Chicken katsu was crisp and good. Kalbi short ribs had a charbroiled flavor. Hubby got the Laulau, the special for Friday night, which was very good too ($11.99) Large portions at reasonable prices.  We were there on a Friday night and they had live Hawaiian music. I really wanted to try the Huapai cake but was way too full but it looked great. It was very busy though but only a short wait, maybe a few minutes, but it was worth the wait. We will definitely be back.

Had the roast pork and chix katsu mix. Big portions . Roast pork was tender gravy alright , good but just a basic brown gravy. Chix katsu crispy , like it should be. Mac salad good. Also had the chantiily cake for dessert , I  don't think they make it in house , but it was still good . Over all very good, we will b back

Authenticity? Well, this place seems to be a go-to place for Hawaiian natives
Pricing? Plates average $9-$11 and can easily feed 2.  Makes this place a frequent option for our family.
Service? Pretty darn good
Kids? Kids always love teriyaki and the Kona Mud Pie
Food? It's hella hearty and comforting.  Wife loves the macaroni salad.  Recommendations:  Poki salad, Tonkatsu w/ Gravy, Steak Teriyaki,, Loco Moco, Fried noodles & Teri chicken.
I have yet to try the haupia cake since I'm the only one in my family who loves coconut, but one of these days!

The best Ive had in a long time! They treated us like family and the food was wonderful. Finally a place w/ island style portions and recipes! I will be using the service I just received as a model for the restaurant I manage. Thanks Island Flavor
The entrees are plentiful and tasty.  The desserts were fabulous.  Last but not least, aloha is evident in the service provided.

Tried this one out to satisfy our oxtail soup craving for dinner, since California Hotel doesn't start serving theirs till after 11pm.  It's 1 less star for the wait.  We read reviews that lines could get long especially at night and we were so prepared for that.  Just a little disappointed that we saw 3 tables empty but they couldn't seat us.  They just didn't have enough servers to actually accomodate the people.  All the servers were stressed, kept running around.  Nevertheless, food came out great.  It was as good as we expected and yes, oxtail soup craving satisfied.  DH had the kalbi and steak combo and it looked more like a family meal to us.  Furikake chicken and poke bowl was bomb.  I'd come back definitely, but probably at an odd time next time.  I wish they had a bigger place too.  Maybe it's time to expand! ;P

Best place to grab Hawaiian food! I grew up in Hawaii and whenever I start to crave for Hawaiian food I stop here. Considering the fact this place is literally right down the street from where I live it's really convenient. I always get the loco moco or Kalua pork and it's always cooked to perfection! Definitely a returning customer.

Went here twice in two weeks.  I have no idea why people like this place.  Sick both times from the food.  I guess compared to Aloha Kitchen or L&L they might be decent.  What is also bs is that the first time I did not get mac salad.  So the next time I ordered it as a side thinking this was an add on, but later find out that it was supposed to come with the meal.  Portion sizes are big?  Huge portion sizes of crap.  You do not have to be from Hawaii to rate this place as good or bad.  Apparently they are popular, but the food sucks.

Pork Loco Moco - Pork was dried out to the point of cardboard.  Gravy bland and tasteless.

Loco Moco - Whatever they used for the burger was the cheapest ground beef you will ever see.  Looked and tasted like ground up cat food.

Poke - What kind of Hawaiian serves pre-frozen cheap Ahi for poke?

Fried Rice - This was a joke, mushy rice with some sauce mixed in.  Even the egg and sausage didn't help.  

Portuguese Bean Soup - Mediocre, tomato soup with too much flour, no smokiness, very disappointing.  

Lau Lau - Dried out and tasteless, might as well get the same frozen one from L&L because it is cheaper.

SERVICE - "Oh my God this is great"

Visited more than a dozen Hawaiian suggestions via Yelp. Island Flavor is the best place for local grinz hands down. The furikake chicken, the sweet sour spare ribs, and the roast pork are all very good. The deserts are HUGE. Bring your appetite!!!

We were visiting LV for a week on a movie shoot and I heard great reviews about this place so we decided to give it a try. I was raised in Hawaii, am half Haw'n and my mother was a caterer and an awesome cook so naturally I became a caterer too. After the 1st meal here, I was sold and so was the other 4 people with me. During the week we tried to make it there everyday, but filming a couple of long days kept us away. We all tried different things and I got to try various dishes and they were all great. The sauces were not to over powering, but just right. Even the desserts are amazing. I wish there was one of these in San Diego or Arizona. I met the owner and he is like ohana (family). Awesome...awesome....awesome.
We just moved here last week but we've been here several times already. Will definitely come back for more...

Me: "That's the closest Hawaiian restaurant by our house."
My mom: "What is Hawaiian food?" 
Me: "Umm. It's a lot of Asian food you've had before. Except there always seems to be macaroni salad on the side."
My mom: "What do you mean?"
Me: "You know! Like kalbi. WIth macaroni salad."
My mom: "What else?"
Me: "Uhh, chicken teriyaki. With macaroni salad."
My mom: "Is that it?"
Me: "Well they have some unique things. They have something called Kalua pork. It comes with macaroni salad too." 

So I'm going to be completely honest. I don't even totally know what Hawaiian food consists of. I stopped by once to get lunch to go and ordered a 2-item combo with Kalua pork and tonkatsu. I really appreciated that you could substitute white rice for brown at no additional charge. 

The joint's in what looks like a deserted strip mall and the windows are extra tinted to the point where you're not sure if you're in Detroit or southwest Las Vegas, so I'm not ever sure if it's open or not. Either way, it's good to know we have some dining options in our neck of the woods.

P.S. Oh! I forgot to mention there was macaroni salad in my to go order. ALOHA.

This place is awesome! The food is flavorful and the prices are right, the ribs are the best!!!... we bought sheets of food for a party once and everybody were asking for the food because was a hit!! I recommend this place to everybody!

It's not often that you find a place that reminds you of home. When you do, you know it's a keeper. I've had just about everything on their menu, from the Furikake chicken which is their best seller to local favorites like Loco Moco, Chicken Katsu, Saimin, Roast Pork and lots more. Prices are up to par with the food quality and service. So whether you're from the islands or not, this place is definitely a must try when in Vegas!

Positive - Amazing food! Large portions and good prices. Try the Furikake style Poke!

Negative - None really
Great food, good service, a true taste of Hawaii for those who have never been. I am definitely a fan and will be back soon!
I love this place. Food tastes great and the portions are huge. The kalbi ribs are my favorite!

While in town we decided to give this a try for lunch...we ordered the ahi tuna poke, oxtail soup, Korean fried chicken wings, kalbi short ribs w/fried rice Mac salad & chantilly cake. Ahi poke was bright & tasted very fresh, the oxtail soup was just ok not to crazy about big ginger, the Korean fried chicken wings was so tiny & very salty, The kalbi short ribs was ok but also tasted salty the bbq pork fried rice was also salty i was hoping for spam fried rice like hawaiian style the mac salad tasted good had a small amount. The chantilly cake was the best it tasted so good!!! I give it 3 stars cuz food was ok & service was ok. Mahalo!

Ahhh!! They forgot my Haupia which is the main reason I got their special.  My lomi salmon was salty too!! I definitely hope this place is not going down hill after the opening of their second location.

I've tried twice at this place. This place is 3 stars. Nothing seemed so special. I'm from LA and had much better Hawaiian dishes with better prices. Today I ordered oxtail soup Togo with no spoon...ummm how am I suppose to eat this?!  The cashier guy was inattentive although it wasn't busy. 
Conclusion: I wouldn't go back when I'm in Vegas. I would rather try different Hawaiian places.

Been wanting to try this place for awhile now. I pass by it every time I come to Vegas to see some family. Finally had an opportunity to go and this place is LEGIT!!! There was about 6 of us that went and everyone had something different which turned out to benefit me since I got to go all "vulture mode" on everything. I will make this a staple on my subsequent return visits. Sunday's are weird hours but if you want an epic meal you'll figure something out.

Super nice and friendly staff.  I love their food.  Their portion sizes are huge.  Island vibe is strong within the restaurant.  If my waistline didn't hate me so much, I'd be eating their weekly instead of monthly!

WARNING. The portions are GIGANTIC and can feed 2-3 people. The dinner was pretty good but what makes this place a must come back for us are the Chantilly and Guava cake. I have said enough. 

Also staff is very laid back and friendly people

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.  The service is good although sometimes that I have been here i waited longer than usual but it was all worth it.  The food is good and they give you huge portions and best of all it is cheap.

I came here recently due to a coupon from restaurant.com which by the way was on sale for $1 with the promo code "ninety" 9-13-09 will be the last day I believe! Everyone should take full advantage of it! 

Food was simply AMAZING! This place will not let you down and I definitely will be back!

KOREAN CHICKEN: I HiGhLy recommend the Korean Chicken. Although this place is Hawaiian based, do NOT be discouraged by the word 'Korean' on the menu you will NOT be disappointed. The Korean Chicken is coated fried chicken wings with some flavorful meat that will burst in your mouth! I kid you not my first bite was over the top! 

FURIKAKE SHRIMP: I also tried the shrimp which was part of my plate combo...It was also pretty good but nothing to rave about.. I think I'll stick to my tempura shrimp at the Japanese restaurants. But do not be discouraged about trying it I am extremely picky when it comes to shrimp!

TERIYAKI CHICKEN: It was also pretty good although I'm not too much of a fan of teri chicken in general. I personally get tired of it easily after a few bites. You need not worry about the flavor here as well, the teriyaki sauce is glazed with generous amounts all over and the portions once again are tremendous.

PORK WON TONS: Pretty good way to start off the meal although not necessary because you will be full by any of the plates that you order. Pretty much your typical fried won ton complimented with the sweet chili sauce that kicked it up a notch.

MAC SALAD: ehh the mac salad was nothing special to me I've definitely had better.

So what we gonna have DESSERT or disaster?

Dessert was definitely not a disaster... the portions are very generous in this aspect as well... definitely something to share.

MANGO ICE CREAM: Hmm couldn't know how to describe this but it being mango ice cream. It's so hard to pin point what I can compare this to because any mango ice cream I've ever tried is always so different in taste, yet always delicious. It came with about 3-4 scoops of ice cream.

KONA COFFEE PIE: This delectable dessert was great! Especially me being a fan of coffee ice cream... the slice was huge and the consistency of the ice cream was perfect. 

TROPICAL ICE TEA: Just to warn you all this is unsweetened. However, on my second refill I asked for 1/2 raspberry ice tea + 1/2 tropical ice tea= an EXCELLENT combo... not too sweet not too bland I would definitely get the same for when I come back!

If your HUN-GARY then you've come to the right spot. Their portions are HUGE, so HUGE no can eat anymore. You have to try this place on one empty stomach, otherwise you in trouble. The GUAVA CAKE is to die for, you cannot eat here without at least having this cake. Mahalo to the staff, always showing what TRUE ALOHA really means.

Took my 7 year old to Island Flavor after picking him up from school yesterday. Overall have to say I was pleased. Having been in Vegas for ten years, I've seen 'local' food places come and go, and I hope this place sticks around awhile. Friendly island folks in the front of the house AND the kitchen (which is a rarity). Had the sweet & sour spare ribs off the daily specials menu. Didn't know what to expect, but first bite left me nodding in approval. Son liked the mini chicken katsu plate he ordered. Mac salad was good as well. We both shared an order of the coconut-pineapple ice cream, served with whip cream. Will definitely be back even if it is a bit of a drive from Summerlin.

This is a first for me two 5 star reviews in a row. What the hell is the world coming to? A co-worker of mine recommend that we go there for lunch today. As I am writing this I am slipping into a food coma from the aftermath of lunch. It is bliss, I had the loco moco which was just huge. I lost against it. My buddy had the Hawaiian sampler, which he thoroughly enjoyed. 

Another reviewer was right about this place, it is going to spoil you and you will not be able to do some of the lesser quality Hawaiian food we have in the valley.
Their Furikake chicken is addicting! Always on my pick up order list. After your meal you must order the Kona Coffee mudpie! It's delish!

My family and I wanted to try this place after reading the reviews on yelp. When we got there, there was a little bit of a wait. Not too long. Once we got seated we ordered our food. We waited for quite a while before our waitress came by to let us know they ran out of white rice. She gave us the option of waiting for the white rice or changing it to brown rice. Since our kids were really hungry we decided to change to brown rice. We were assured that our food will be out right away. We continue to wait. We thought we would get our food right away since we decided to change to brown rice. The table next to us came in around the same time we did and were also given the option of waiting for white rice or brown rice. They opted to wait for white rice. They received their food before we did even though we had opted not to wait for the white rice. We received our food about 10-15 minutes after them. We had to ask about our food multiple times. The food was ok. I really wanted to like this place.

I thought I had died and gone to heaven when I had my first meal here.  Seriously, the food is really good and they give you HUGE portions.  I had been going to L&L before I discovered this hidden oasis and it is really incomparable. They also know what Aloha Spirit is - the staff is super friendly even when my boys are screaming or making a mess.  It's nice to know I can get authentic Hawaiian Food in the desert.  My favs are the Korean BBQ shortribs, Korean Chicken (mmm..seriously yummy), and the Haupia Cake!

The plates are huge. I usually share or take home the rest for another meal. The hoisin rubs fall off the bone you don't need a knife. Wish they had the cookies because they make the best cookies but they say it's too busy lately :(
This place is amazing. The Poke was amazing. Though I have to say when ordering it make sure you know what your doing cause one mistake and you'll be paying an arm and leg. Lol
Came here for kona coffee mudd pie and loved every bit of it! Reminded me of kona :) Really enjoyed the music and aloha spirit! Mahalo!

You really get a lot for your money here. Prices are cheap and portions are massive! 1 order can seriously feed 2-3 people, so I always have leftovers to take home. Food is delicious and fresh. My favorites are the chicken katsu and kalbi. I also tried the cocoa puffs which are 6 for $5. Service is pretty fast and the staff is always friendly and helpful.

I live for the chantilly cake they serve. The best!

It's a local joint with tasty food, huge portions and good service- no dirty looks, no attitude, and I'm not even Hawaiian to be deserving of their consistently good customer service.  The furikake chicken and roast pork loco are excellent.  Chantilly cake is to die for.  Rule of thumb: pace yourself.  Otherwise, you won't have room for dessert that is so worth having.

Thought I've already written a review for this place! I eat here at least once a week if not several times and it has been amazing every time. This is some of the best Hawaiian food I've had in vegas better than aloha kitchen and L&L for sure! Their quality of meat is good hardly any fat or just bone which I get a lot of at aloha kitchen. Ever since I found this place this is where I go for Hawaiian food every time. Their customer service is good too I've never actually ate in the restaurant only Togo but the one time there was something wrong with my order they remade it no questions asked and even let me keep what I already had. Their portions are pretty big the loco moco is bombbbbbb and so is their fried rice!

My family and I use to come here a lot when they first opened up. We moved out of area and haven't been there in over a year so for my brothers birthday we decided to come back there because the food was really good. We were so disappointed when we left.... The cooks weren't the same, the servers weren't the same and the food wasn't the same. Rice was like paste, teriyaki steak was salty, and the Katsu wasn't breaded like before. I noticed other people's plates around us left their rice on their plates as well so I knew we weren't the only ones. 

The only positive thing that night was the server giving my brother a free desert for his birthday.

This is by far the most amazing Hawaiian BBQ food you'll find in vegas. This food is so freaking good that I may name my first born child after it. Flavor Williams.... This will probably be a tough battle I'll have with my future wife, and I'll probably lose, but I'll still try. Anyways eat here, it will improve your life.

Probably the best Hawaiian food outside of Hawaii and better than some in Hawaii. The poke is very good and the Kali is awesome. Portions are huge and the whole place has an authentic relaxed plate lunch vibe to it. Better table management and shorter wait times would get them up to 5 stars. The food and service is already there.
I eat here all the time because the first day i visited i had my money's worth and the services was awesome.the food is great,you can't go wrong.

I always love the family restaurant feeling and food here. All the employees always ask you how you are and how you like the food. Better to be asked a lot then not asked at all.
I also love the food and like everything that ive tried. 

Although if you want spam musubi call and ask before 11 am they run out fast!

Went to island flavor on an aloha Friday, da music was jamming. Short wait for a table, of course we found this place by ohana raving about Ono grinds . You get island flavor, island  hospitality, and island portions ! This was my first visit but no way my last.
Big portions of that island flavor.  BUGGAH IS WINNAHZ.  Deserts are home made and broke da mout.

YUM!  ARE YOU LOOKING FOR HAWAIIAN SOUL FOOD????  Every one of my Hawaii-Vegas relatives has recommended Island Flavor.  Its the food you ate at your Aunties house.....but only the good stuff, lol!

We regularly order a pound of pokè and the chicken katsu - its enough for hubby and I to share and also have a few bites the next day.  SO MUCH FOOD!

Occasionally they have signs for pre-ordering kulolo amd poi, flown in fresh weekly from Hawaii.  Next door is a Hawaiian shop carrying favorite drinks and snacks - even Locals slippers!

Not so very impressed with Island Flavor. The Kalua pig was bland, saimen was sort of gummy,fishy and bland also. The chicken Katsu was chewy and gristly and lacked in flavor as well. My husband and I agreed the Katsu sauce was yummy, but the food should have been better. Don't think we'll be back.  I was so excited to find a Hawaiian place with such excellent reviews, but don't see what all the hype is about.

My wife and I moved here from Hawaii in December, and one of the things we really missed was local-kine plate lunch. We drove all over Vegas checking places out but only so-so--no flavor or too salty, too expensive and manini portions, no can cook rice--whaaat? So when we found Island Flavor only a few miles from our house in the southwest part of town--oh, yeah! Generous portions for the price, great variety and taste, local dishes on-point--Zippy's should get lessons from these guys! Even the sides are great, like the mac salad and green salad--the dressing is some secret recipe and supa ono! Crew working there are really friendly and make you feel like you're ohana, even crack jokes with us, which is so welcome. Wife loves the furikake chicken and Korean chicken, while I like everything but their beef stew is broke da mouth (special on Saturday only--made me wanna lick the bowl!) and the Hawaiian style roast pork (gravy all over--awesome!). We bring friends from Hawaii here, and they all agree that Island Flavor is aurite!! So go check'um out!

Possibly the best Hawaiian food you will find in town! The portions are huge!!! Loved the oxtail soup and the kalbi ribs were just delicious. oh and did I mention the portions are huge?? The atmosphere is great as they sometimes have live music playing in the restaurant. I just wished it wasn't so far away from where I lived though or I would be here all the time.

Authentic Hawaiian food. Style, flavor and gargantuan portions will take you back to the islands. 

*Korean style chicken wings - crispy, sweet and spicy. Very nice.

* Kalbi - big portions and nice flavor. 

* Teriyaki beef - good flavor on tender pieces of beef.Perfect with rice.

* House salad - super good dressing!!!!!

*MAC salad - tasty; it's coma time!!!!!!

*Oxtail Soup - If you're in the mood to slurp. Go for it. Fall of the bone goodness. 

Places like this will always be a crowd favorite due to the excellent value for your money. To the owners of Island Flavor...I love this place. Keep serving it up.

Just tried Island Flavor for the first time, and was very pleased. I will definitely be coming back. I recommend the Furikake Chicken. Large portions. Very reasonably priced. Calm music playing. Friendly staff. Impressive desserts.

First timers,  we ordered a pound of shoyu ahi poke (fresh ), spam and eggs, combo plate with kalbi short ribs and furtikake chicken.. Everything was good but the furtikake chicken was amazing! We will definitely be back.

Oh and the service was good too!

I'm from out of town and was looking for lunch on my way back to the Strip from a visit to Red Rock Canyon. Both Yelp and Google reviews for this place were excellent so we stopped in. Great food, and a lot of it. The chicken loco moco might be the greatest hangover cure in history. Friendly service too. Don't let the bland strip mall exterior distract you.
On the way to our volleyball tournament and stopped here to eat. The food here is onolicious! The portions are good. The food is very tasty. You get what you pay for.

From OC. First time here. Friday night. Surprised to see live Hawaiian music and hula. Was tempted to dance when the guitarist asked if there were any other hula dancers out there but didn't want to embarrass myself since I'm so rusty.  Ordered the roast pork loco moco. The serving size was huge!  I couldn't finish it so I doggie bagged it. 3 girls from a local halau did a nice hula auana. Made me want to do hula again. Anyways this is a great place to eat with friendly people and a friendly atmosphere.
My favorite place for Island flavor , huge portions , authentic taste, guava juice on tap, desserts specials, one of the best if not the best loco mocos in town, they know how to do it right .

Parties of 6 or more BEWARE!!!**

I have eaten here many times with co-workers and have always enjoyed the food.  I brought my family (party of 6) and ate, then paid the bill and left.  It wasn't until the next day that I noticed that they had put an 18% automatic gratuity on my check...the waitress didn't point it out to me when she brought me the check, and I even had problems with the machine so had to try to put it in multiple times while she stood there and still no comment about the added gratuity.  My fault for not looking first, but I am very rarely charged an automatic gratuity for 6 people and I would know because we eat out quite a bit.  So I ended up paying a 40% tip - sorry, the service is not that great.

I had forgotten my credit card so went back the next day to get it and when I brought it up they said there wasn't anything they could do about it since the bill had already been run the previous day.  Not cool.

Now I'm not sure if I'll go back, the food is good but the experience leaves a sour taste.
Always great food! This is the only Hawaiian restaurant I go to now. The service is okay, but the food makes up for it. The portions are big and the prices are very reasonable.
This is probably my new favorite place in town. Great atmosphere with mouth watering dishes! Great service makes it even better!

I'd probably go with 3.5 stars instead of 3. 

This place is one of the better Hawaiian restaurants we have here in Vegas. When I lived on that side of town I would frequent often because of the thick and juicy Kalbi ribs and big portions. Now that I live further away I get their food delivered from roadrunner.com. 

My favorites are definitely the oxtail soup, although the flavor isn't consistent. Some days it can be the best oxtail soup I've ever had, and other days not as tasty. Again, they make my favorite Kalbi by far. Their spam musubis are great because they add Furikake to them. Their dessert portions are huuuuuge and delicious especially the guava and chantilly cake. 

The Kahlua Pork and the Roast pork are definitely not one of their better dishes. They both lack flavor that I come to expect from hawaiian food and a little on the dry side. 

Other than that, I really don't think you can leave this place hungry and anything on the menu. Oh and I forgot to mention, you can get brown rice instead of white. But we all know Hawaiian food always tastes much better with sticky white rice !

Decided to try out this place after reading so many positive reviews. After inputting the address realized it was much further than I thought... Just under 10 miles from my house.  The storefront had blacked out windows and I thought they were closed. Went inside and was blown away by the heat! It had to be over 90 degrees in there! Oh well hope my order doesn't take too long. Decided on Kalbi ribs and Teriyaki chicken. Also got an order of banana bread pudding and haupia cake. The portions were large. Both plates came with 2 scoops of rice and macaroni salad. Rice is rice and Mac salad was okay.. Kind of bland though. The Kalbi had great flavor ( I should know .. I'm Korean) but could've been a little more tender and was a little too fatty. I think the highlight was the chicken. They were super flavorful , tender and so juicy!!! The bread pudding was enough for 4 people and pretty yummy. The haupia cake was to die for !!! All in all I was pretty happy and would go again and try some other items on their menu. Just too far to go regularly.

As a fellow local Hawaiian boy I can confirm that this place really gives a taste of home. I came to Island Flavor when it first opened, back when they had a huge bar in the middle of the restaurant. I met the owner and his wife, they were lovely people and it's good to see that their restaurant is so popular now and I am absolutely thrilled for them. 

Don't go spending your money at L&L or some other poor example of Hawaiian food. And I say that not only because Island Flavor hits the spot but because we need to support local businesses!! Not to mention, you get way more bang for you buck here. Would you really spend $10 at L&L when you can spend $5 more here and get literally triple the quantity than what they would serve at L&L. 

The restaurant is very clean, extremely family friendly and family oriented, and on Fridays they even have live music!!! The restaurant's lighting can be kinda dim and bothersome sometimes, but it's nothing too big to complain about. They even recently expanded and opened up a shop next door that sells all my favorite Hawaiian candies and snacks! 

Lastly, I love their mixed plates! It comes with two scoops of rice (with your choice of brown, white, or fried), mac salad, and your two choices of meats. The portion of the mixed plate is so big that it's enough to feed two people! I always get the furikake chicken and hamburger steak. And if you have enough room in your stomach, try out the mud pie too!

I love this place! The food portions are so generous at a really reasonable price, you'll probably get at least two meals out of each order. What's good here? The lau lau, mac salad, kalbi, chicken, oxtail soup, loco moco, korean chicken, kahlua pork, pretty much everything. Don't forget their desserts either!! The mud pie is amazing! You'll definitely leave feeling 5 lbs heavier, which I think is comforting every so often :)

Of all the places outside of hawaii, so far this is my favorite place to get hawaiian food.
Amazing! Nuff said...L & L Hawaiian BBQ on steroids. Great food, huge portions, friendly staff. Place was packed.

I've driven past this place many times not knowing what it was. I finally decided to stop by one day and it is the BEST Hawaiian Food I've had in Vegas! Not only are the portions big, but the flavor is fantastic! Expect to get the ITIS and fall asleep after eating

LOVE! LOVE! Island Flavor. All the food is GREAT! The service is excellent! They make you feel like family. I bring all my friends and family there and I tell everyone if they are in the mood for hawaiian this is the spot!

We order carry out from here a lot because it's really busy for sit down (but it's worth the wait). The portions a enough to share and the food it delicious. We love the kalbi ribs and everything is better with brown gravy!
real ono, noka'oi hawaiian food in vegas...!! good portions, price, atmosphere, and real hawaiian cooking in the kitchen!!!
Excellent food! Had the fried rice with veggie mix they even took out the animal products for me being that I'm vegan. Great customer service and food came out fast!

This was one of my first times trying Hawaiian style BBQ and I was not disappointed. Dining room was nice and clean. Service was great. Staff was very attentive. I ordered the Hawaiian style roast pork and Kalbi short ribs. Amazing and tender. Melt in your mouth. I got three huge short ribs plus a huge bowl of roast pork. My boyfriend got the furikake chicken and teriyaki beef. The furikake chicken was the best. Nice and crisp. Great flavor. For sides you get white rice or fried rice and macaroni salad. Fried rice was good. White rice and Mac salad was ok.  Prices are cheap for the large amount of food you get. We took most home and had the rest at dinner. I did have Hawaiian style BBQ at another place near the airport but I couldn't finish it, not even in their league. Island flavor is definitely a front runner. Must try.

What I had: Mix plate = Roasted pork (w/ gravy) (left) + Souyou Chicken (right) + 2 scoops rice + Mac + drink = $14+

The waitresses are nice and attended to me 3-4 times. The "big one" has a strong Hawaiian vernacular which I liked

THE GOOD: Better roasted pork then most other hawaiian places, covered with gravy loco moco style while other Hawaiian restaurants actually use hamburger patties for their loco moco. I prefer this roasted pork, reminds me of turkey and gravy and will PUT YOU TO SLEEP - I saw someone on here complaining about it being mostly fat - He must've gotten the bottom of the barrel because mine was mostly meat with only 1-2 pieces of fat - HUGE Portions - bring a toothpick ;)

The Souyou chicken is like a bowl with ACTUAL chicken breast and leg pieces in the soupy teriyaki-like thick broth. Not too sweet which is good cause teriyaki can make or break a dish... teriyaki taste was perfect, not too sweet, not too salty - This was on special because it was thursday and it was $9 by itself - but the waitress was kind enough to suggest i get the mix plate with that on it instead which was only $13 (before drink(s) - the chicken skin fat was ACTUALLY EDIBLE... unlike L&L BBQ which is veiny, super fat and makes me gag. Great food period

The mac and rice were decent but nothing to brag about

THE BAD: The "Tropical flavor" ice tea was disappointing because I was expecting something NICE - it was REALLY just passionfruit ice tea and it was bland and not even sweet. I had to add a couple Splenda packs to make it good

All-in-all I would highly recommend this place. It may seem pricey but the portion size will leave you stuffed and makes it well worth the money - You could NOT eat all day, then eat one $14 meal here and be stuffed.

On a total whim, I decided I wanted kalbi. And haupia anything. I was about to leave work and checked Yelp (which is practically my best friend at this point) and found out Island Flavor was only five minutes away. Called and ordered to go. It was ready a few minutes after I got there. Had the kalbi and haupia cake and they were both AMAZING. Fresh and delicious. The prices were pretty good and everyone there was super friendly and helpful. This is my new "after work on a Saturday" place to go.

I just moved here from Florida and my girlfriend took me here. The food and portions are excellent!!! Put that with great service and on Friday nights they also have a beautiful family perform live and well ... what more can I say!!! This is a great spot to take your family to! Be sure to try the Furikake chicken and a slice of Guava cake ... sooo good!!!!

A must visit whenever I'm in vegas! This place is bomb. Short ribs, steak, Mac salad, guava juice, pulled pork, fried chicken....basically everything on the menu is good. If you love tuna, try the tuna poke. So delicious! Even the staff is amazing. They're so friendly. I love this place.

We used to come here when they first opened years ago when my son was just 8. Moved to CA and make sure to stop by everytime we're in town. The same great old food and warm island hospitality. Kalbi.. we love you!
Love that this is a local spot with live music. Very simple place nothing fancy. For the amount of food they serve, the prices are very affordable.

I often complain about the lack of good eats in the depths of SW Las Vegas.  Sure, we have a few decent spots on Rainbow but i feel like we deserve more place in my neighborhood.  I've probably eaten at about 8 different Hawaiian places in the vegas valley - I give my local place, Island Flavor, the GOLD !

First of all, the employees are great - great attitudes, great services and consistent food.  The space is pretty simple - i'm pleased that they recently remodeled the space that resulted in adding more table space.  I've been told by a couple of the employees they make more $$ on catering than the restaurant itself.  I've been in a few times while they've prepped the food for catering events - it's a sight to see !

Anyways, the food - large portions, very reasonable prices and good 'ol stick to the ribs style grub !  My personal favs ?  The pork loco moco ( awesome !! ), the korean ribs,  the mac salad,  i REALLY dig the gravy ! and most of desserts.

It' all good !!
My kind of place. Love the portion and the food is delicious. I go here at least couple times a month. Roast pork and Korean chicken is bomb

When in Las Vegas, and If you are missing the local foods found in Hawaii, or if you want to immerse yourself in the flavors of Hawaii without venturing outside of the "ninth island" , this is the place to go.  Often, the flavors of food from different regions are adjusted to fit the tastes of the people living in the area.  It's as if they teleport their foods from Hawaii!  I was amazed to see kulolo from Kaua'i in a case next to a case of spam musubi on my way out!   It's just the spot to go to especially if you have a craving for chicken katsu!  I need to try those tall yummy looking cakes that they seemed to purposely hold at eye level as they slowly passed our table.  But, like plates in Hawaii, the portions are huge!  You need to purposefully leave room for dessert.

Good flavor to the meals.  

Keep in mind that on busy nights like Friday, Saturday....service can be a bit slow.
Made another trip here still the best Hawaiian food anywhere, and the friendliest people.  It's a must have when we come to Las Vegas.

I live 2 mins away here so I ordered lunch!im hungry! I did the yelp online ordering. 30 mins wait I guess it's ok. I ordered fried rice, and furikake chicken with rice. OMG they are both burnt! My fried rice was way too salty and the bottom
Part of the rice is all black. My chicken was cooked too much that is was so hard to bite it. Can't even taste the flavor due to over cooked. No sesame seeds, no nothing! I was really disappointed. I ended up throwing both food always which costs me  at least 16$. It was so bad. Don't go here, they rush your food. And the place looks so ghetto and small. Tables and chairs, decor so outdated. Considering they charge too much for their food and they seem busy at times. But anyways, will never go back here. I dnt know why I can't give no stars!!!

I got the mixed plate . teriyaki beef and chicken katsu. Portion size is important to me and this place definitely fulfilled that aspect for me. the food was delicious, the service was quick and i would recommend this spot for Hawaiian food any day.
Restaurant has a lot of great local options. Love the kalbi, furikake chx, Portuguese bean soup and desserts.

I enjoy tuna very much but nothing like this. So delicious probably the best I've had in a while and very affordable.  The atmosphere is relaxing and music is cool. I also had the ribs, delicious and if you like sticky rice this is the place.  Yummy!

The only Hawaiian BBQ place I'm used to from Cali is L&L Hawaiian BBQ but that place has no comparison to Island Flavor. HUGE portions! Super fresh food. Prices are definitely decent. 

What I tried:
