$12 for a combo plate with two diff types of meats. (meals come with 2 scoops of rice (they have brown rice), & a scoop of macaroni salad. I tried the furikake chicken X kalbi short ribs. Short ribs were good, not chewy & not too fatty. Chicken was a little on the sweet side but super crispy.
$9 chicken katsu loco moco. I had the gravy put on the side so my chicken was super crispy. 
$14 furikake ahi tuna. Fresh & big chunks. Flavoring was really good but just a little too smokey.

Can't wait to go back to try more!

After a whole day of watching my nephews baseball tournament, a group of us were starving for some real food. We decided on Island Flavor and I saw that it closed at 10pm. Cool, we still had a half hour. WRONG! We got there and the sign on the door had their new hours.... closed at 9:30pm. NOOOO!!!! Wait, what's going on? What the heck? We were going in the door. They said yes! They took us all at closing time without hesitation or an attitude. We sat down, ordered and ate. One of the waitresses worked at the same location as my friend (at her other job). What a great staff! The food was ono and the portions were frickin' huge. I ordered the fried rice which came with egg on top and a few pieces of the biggest Portuguese sausage EVER! Everyone really loved the food and most of us had to take the leftovers to go. The Chantilly cake is awesome! It seems like the hours have changed again according the their website. Go early, be hungry. Thank you to the staff that night for taking us in and being great about it.

Excellent great Hawaiian food and period!!!!!!

If u don't believe me ask ABE!

One dish is Food for 2 and some on tha portions!

I can't say I have ever tried big island Hawaiian food but decided to do so while looking for something different over the casino buffets and Asian offerings in Vegas Chinatown (or Asian strip malls) - and what a great place.  Great Hawaiian welcome, service, food, and greater portions.  Ordered the Kalbi short ribs and it was delicious.  My boys (about 8 of us) were also all happy with their selections, service, and portions!

This is our second time at Island Flavor. I'll be honest, our first trip was nothing spectacular nor memorable. We ordered the special of the day, but the flavors just weren't for us. After a year, we decided to give this place another try since we were craving Hawaiian food. 

I am SO HAPPY we came back! We ordered the Furikake Chicken which was so delicious and crispy and the Kalbi Short Ribs which had great grilled flavor. Portions are huge so come hungry or ready to share. Amongst three of us, we could only eat half of each entree so had to pack the rest. Definitely looking forward to those leftovers later. 

If you've saved room for dessert, the Chantilly Cake is a must. Chocolate Chiffon cake with butterscotch frosting. Need I say more. 

Service-so friendly and attentive-5 stars
Food-very flavorful and huge portions-5 stars

We will be back!

I tried island flavor express in east side and it was really good so i decided to try this place since i moved to west side.

Howerever, the food was not that good as much as it in east side.

Short ribs were all burnt and the portion was smaller.
Will not go back.

Coming off the highway Yelp told me Island Flavor was closing in 10 minutes. I got there with 5 minutes left and the guy working the cashier greeted and treated me like they had just opened. Friendly, gracious, and even let me buy the spam Musubi he had set aside for himself. I ordered the Chicken Furikake. The kitchen staff, working like a well oiled machine, got my order out in less than 10 minutes. The cashier, still friendly and still helpful bagged me up and got me out the door. 

I'm moving more than 20 minutes away from Island Flavor in a few days. I will be driving back just to give them my business and to enjoy their wonderful food. 

Highly recommend this gem.

Definitely the best Hawaiian place in town. Seriously, I can't eat chicken katsu anywhere else anymore. And if you feel like eating oxtail soup during normal hours and don't want to go all the way to California Hotel, this is the place to be. Thanks for ruining every other Hawaiian place for me, Island Flavor.

The best Hawaiian food that I've had in the states. It's a little far from the strip, but having lunch there before heading to the airport was perfect plan. 

Where to start?  Their fried rice is highly recommended. You can add it to your plate for an additional $2. I tried their chicken katsu loco moco and it was Massive. I can have a big appetite at times, but I wasn't able to finish this monster dish.  

For the size, quality, and price this is definitely 100x better than the typical L&L that you'll find in CA.

Four stars for decently cooked food with large portion sizes. Nice staff. However, I wanted to try the tuna poke salad and it was listed as "market price" - ended up being $16. Was so disappointed. :(  I wouldn't mind coming here again but I do wish that the tuna poke was more reasonably priced.

Honestly this place is actually pretty good. I've heard from mangy people to come here but never had a chance to.
The restaurant had a look to it with friendly service.

The only thing I didn't like about this place is the loco moco. The gravy is a tad bit too salty. Taste like salt to me. But it's just my opinion idk.

Overall this is a good place to eat! I'd definitely come back!

WOW!  Best hawaiian island flavors for sure!  Reminds us of Big Island where we once called home!  Much mahalo Island Flavor!  We will definitely be back & will highly recommend this place!  Much aloha & mahalo!!!

Stopped in to pick up my order. I ordered kalbi ribs and chicken Katsu. It comes with Mac salad and steamed white rice. The Katsu was, as always, tender and amazing. The ribs had amazing flavor but were very fatty. If you've never had them before and you don't like the fat, you should skip out on them. But the flavor is top notch. A little mix up with our order being sent in, but not the restaurants fault. Super amazing staff.

The best tasting Hawaiian food in Las Vegas. Been to both locations and the food is excellent.  The oxtail stew or soup (depends on how you look at it) is th bomb ! Every time I  come here I try to have something different so that I can say I had everything.  Half way there . You can beat the service. And the prices are affordable. Bring everyone!

First time we came here, it was because I was craving poke and our regular place was already closed for the evening.  Now I can't imagine going to Vegas without hitting this place up for a meal.  It's about 5 miles from the strip but soo worth the drive.  The ladies who work there are super friendly and the food is delish (I've tried the pork chops, chicken katsu loco moco, and roast pork).  They have specials on Friday nights as well as entertainment (at least on the Friday we were there.. Our last trip we went on a Saturday and they seemed to also have had entertainment then but not when we were there).

Anywhoo, I don't have anything negative to say about this place.... it's just good Hawaiian food.  Oh, and definitely order the gravy.  Maybe 2 of them.  You're welcome.
This place blows L&L and other Hawaiian food I've tried in Vegas out of the water. The wait staff is also very friendly on top of that!
BOMB.COM my wife and I come here all the time and it never fails  definitely a loyal customer...

This restaurant definitely has a special place in my heart. The food is ono and reminds me so much of home. The island music and "aloha spirit" shared by the employees is definitely an A+ in my book. The ahi poke was tender and the right consistency. As for my favorite dish, the furikake chicken, it tastes so amazing and very unique. It reminds me of the chicken served at The Alley or Queen Street Cafe back home in Aiea, Oahu. The food is served in good sized portions and you get a good bang for your buck. Easily now one of my favorite places to go to for Hawaiian food in town. I highly recommend this place!

Island Flavor was a palce that I would definitely go again. The atmosphere was great, the portions of the food were unreal, the food was very unique and original and the service was great. 5 stars for Island Flavor!

Also I am not a big sweets fan but the desserts were to die for!

I may have gained most of my vacation weight from Island Flavor. Also, the super friendly staff is even nice to a bunch of unruly tourists. Nine of us came through and ordered a lot of things off the menu, some from our own fat desires and some from the staff suggestions.

Hoisin Glazed Ribs - Good but a little extra saucy. The ribs fell off the bone and is great with the rice.
Ahi Poke - Probably the best part of the meal. Order the big big portion and share. If you talk to the staff nicely, they'd be willing to give you portions of each kind they have. My favorite was the shoyu or sesame. Light in flavor but not completely lackluster.
Kalbi Short Ribs - The flavor is akin to many of the korean style ribs but a little sweet.
Hawaiin Style Pork Roast - Great tender pork. Hands down some good flavor.
Loco Moco - It was Hawaiian food and we felt obligated to order this. Would we do it again, maybe but I'd have to reduce how much we ordered. I think since we ordered so much food, I wasn't able to enjoy this meal as much as I'd have liked.

I may have found my far off the strip place to eat. Damn good and worth the drive away from the craziness of the strip.
Great food and good service...you'll get waaayyyyy more food then u can handle well at least for me. Literally more then two days and less then 10 dollars and on Friday's they have a live band

Updated review 9/30

So my love for their furikake chicken is unwavering.  I always accompany my meal with a some shoyu poke which tastes oh so good.  Swear every time perfectly done, fresh taste.  Definitely one of my go-to's for poke and only place I trust for furikake chicken.

Just recently went in and sat down and got served by Sunshine, if I recall correctly and no doubt loved her service.  My meal was perfect again with my aforementioned meal consisting of said furikake chicken and a 1 pound of shoyu poke "appetizer".  Loved the crunchy, flavorful, perfectly seasoned chicken and both meals had a simple arrangement with a very flavorful and great tasting kick.

I have to thank Sunshine because when I originally ordered I had forgotten to ask for my mother's opakapaka to be broiled instead of sautéed... I asked her and she said her food was being plated, but that it would be no problem and they ended up remaking it which I greatly appreciated.  After my mother's surgery she'd been advised to cut down on oil and therefore broiled was the way to go.

And I have to tell you the aroma off the opakapaka was phenomenal.  I love my raw fish, but have to admit when that plate of broiled opakapaka came out, I wanted to to take it from my mom lol... I did end up tasting it and by far I can say it will be the onlyyyyyy cooked fish I would not mind eating here in the valley.  I'm not a cooked fish fan (whether it's fish tacos, fried fish, baked fish), but this definitely made me reconsider that choice.

All in all thanks to Sunshine and the other servers who were just kind and attentive, thanks to the cooks for such great fare.  Thank you Island Flavor for everything, definitely 5 stars!

The food here is better than some of the Hawaiian restaurants in Oahu.

We ordered the Aloha Friday Special with Kalua Pork and Lau Lau. Both dishes were delicious. The pork in the Lau Lau was very tender and cooked just right. 

They give you good portions of food which is more than enough to satisfy your appetite. We couldn't finish all of it so we took some home. Our waitress best described the portion of food as "Go Big or Go Home". I think she was right about that.

The staff that work at the restaurant are very friendly and have a great sense of humor. They are very attentive to your needs. 

We would definitely return here again the next time we are in Vegas.
Absolute terrific. I never miss an opportunity to stuff my face with their big island goodness! Love it! Bring your appetite because it's all good! Ohana Island Flavor and Island Flavor Express.
Best food in Las Vegas!!!  Authentic Hawaiian food. Not only do you get a lot of food the prices are great too. It's definitely a destination place for us every time we go to Vegas.

This family run locals spot is a gem!
Nothing at all like the Hawaiian barbecue chains with boring mayo noodles and canned brown gravy on frozen fries.  This is home cooked island fare with a touch of love and happiness....in a portion large enough to put you in a coma!

I've actually converted 2 Hawaiian barbecue nay-sayers in their 1st visit here.

Mmmmmm summarizes.
Definitely like eating on the Big Island.  Super nice and friendly service, huge portions, quality food!  Great place in Las Vegas to get Hawaiian food.

I had their combo. Kalbi + chicken katsu.

The kalbi was little bit salty, and the katsu sauce was salty too.
Their service was really good.

HOWEVER, a HUUUUUUGE HOWEVER, their food was really good none the less.

First of all, you're eating the food with rice and their amazingly delicious macaroni salad, so that kind of evens out.  Their  signage is pretty small, and it can be easily missed, as I missed it, and had to bust a U at the Chevron gas station. It's located right next to the gas station mall strip.

Next time I'm in vegas, I want to come back.

Came here for Nelson's B-day UYE, got here rather late so i figure i'd order something quick to save my beloved fellow friends the agony of watching me slowly eating the same dishes that they have just finished eating. 

On that notion Lynn warmly recommended the hawaiian Ahi poke, the one with sesame, she suggested.  Ahi poke it is, big chunks of deep red and raw goodness nicely marinated with shoyu, green onions, sesame oil and more sesame~ To keep the ahi entertained, i also ordered some french fries along with a side of macaroni salad to satisfy my secret urge to eat fries with mayonnaise.  This combo initially raised a few eyebrows but after some effort on my part to promo the mayo-fries duo, there were empathetically accepted.

Although this joint does not fall on my normal route of commute, i will not hesitate to go back and try out a few more items on the menu.
Food was legit. Reminded me of home. Service was kind of slow but I think it was due to lack of staff. Poor thing they were swamped with people and only say two people working the dining area.

Great quick food.  The sesame poke is awesome here, and at a good price(14$ish per lb) for the amount.  The teriyaki and furikake are also awesome.  I'm only a few visits in, but I plan to come back to try more.  I'm not usually a macaroni salad fan, but theirs is a really good little side.  I'd skip the fried rice, but that's just my personal opinion, because there brown rice is good and plenty.  Best Hawaii food off the island.  Warning, big portions.

As I opened the door, a wave of sound exploded in my face unexpectedly. I have never been here before so I didn't think that such a small place can have a live band playing. How awesome is that?! I always wanted to try this place because: 1. It's right around my area, 2. I heard a scrumptious amount of pleasant reviews on the food here, and 3. It's Hawaiian food dude! Unfortunately I could not stay and eat inside the restaurant, but I did get to experience the ambience of the atmosphere while I was waiting for my order that I made to-go. 

First thing that caught my eye that made me happy was the size of the portions of the food when I looked around at people's plate. Second thing was that I could order a mix of the two entree! The menu also gave an option for brown rice too, hellyeah. There were other healthier options too in replacement of the macaroni salad, but that is too good to replace. So when I got my order, I bolted over to my friends house and opened my treasure box of satiation. The portion size, good. I like it. I can eat a whole cow and maybe half a horse, yeah it's kind of a curse sometimes. So I got the chicken katsu and half with the chicken teriyaki. I didn't expect the brown rice to be more of a mushy texture, but I didn't really mind it. It went well with the food in my opinion. The chicken was good, chicken teriyaki was good, and the macaroni salad, too good. I also ate the remaining 1/4 of my girlfriend's food cause she didn't finish it. It also came with a sauce; I think it was for the teriyaki but I just used it for everything lol.. It tastes good so why not. 

As for the first impression if trying this place, I regret not getting the loco moco to try but there will definitely be a second time.

I'm from Hawaii.
I might say the plate lunch I had at Island Flavor might be better than most places in Honolulu? wha? sacrilege?

Ok, they don't have fountain fanta fruit punch (which has a strawberry accent) like in Hawaii... but everything else--delicious.

The service is of a local flavor--the friendly kind. I wanted to try two things not typically ordered together, and the waitress was super flexible about it.  Yes!

The teri beef was delicious--and if it was salty--i only noticed it after the meal. But what I most appreciated was that it had a good char from the grill they have in the kitchen. Also, the cut of meat was not tender in itself (skirt or ny?) but it was handled perfectly. It had both a solid beefy taste and with the slices of meat going across the grain, each piece was mouth tender. It was a beautiful, expert touch. The teri sauce was solid--not like mainland style teriyaki--but local flavor.
The sweet sour spareribs--also quite good--a tiny bit oily. big piece of ginger, and turnips, carrots--it was good and hearty--like what you'd make at home.  not as good as the teri beef though. I ended up finishing all the teri beef and taking the SSS home. And PS--it tasted great as leftovers later that night.
mac salad was solid
Haupia cake--also world class. Reminiscent of Napoleans (Zippy's) in terms of the lightness of the cake.  I would not be surprised if the owner's used to run that bakery or someplace like that. All that cake for only $5!  

I'm so full again. Two meals in from one plate lunch (and a piece of cake)

Clearly these people know what they're doing. I have to really search to give any suggestions at all:
* Is it possible to make slightly better rice?  Pressure cooker might make the rice stand out too? The steamed rice scoops were pretty dense and was the weakest part of the meal. 
* I found myself waiting to pay for quite a while at the register.  It'd be nice if the wait staff took the payment--but hey, I won't complain.
Best Hawaiian food in Vegas.. Hawaiian plate on Friday only, lau lau, poke, haupia, mac salad, rice for under 10 bucks. Big portions!! Roast is another favorite. Friendly staff
Food was like always good and service as well just didn't like the whole yelp ordering system has trouble with it but I will be back soon

I love hawaiian food. I used to work at a hawaiian BBQ. Nothing beats Island Flavor here in Vegas! I am so happy I live close to this place. First of all, the portions are HUGE for what you pay. I always have to box up my meal because I can't finish it in one sitting. I usually get the katsu moco and the gravy is incredible - bar none. It isn't the fanciest place, but the staff is always hospitable and the food is always amazing. That's enough to keep me coming back!

I've been back many times since my last review in 2013 and the food is still delicious! I've tried their Kalbi, Loco Moco, Saimin and many more and I've never been disappointed with the quality and taste of the food. 

The disappointment is in their customer service. I remember dining in with a friend who knew one of the servers and the service was absolutely amazing even at busy peak hours! But other times dining by myself with other friends, the service was slow and even unfriendly. The aloha spirit should be with every customer, not just people you know. They will really go out of their way if they know you or if you're a regular there but for someone who dines every now and then, customer service is not always the best.

For example, I was looking forward to dining in today during my lunch break but our server's sassy attitude just killed it for me. Subpar service has happened in the past but today has been the worst so far. We walked in & no acknowledgement from anyone. They'd look at us but then look down or start talking to other customers instead. Not even a smile or "I'll be right with you!" I remember they used to do that a few years ago.

After several minutes of waiting, they sat us but no menus so I grabbed them myself. Our server took our orders with a stink face. Auntie, if you're having a bad day, excuse yourself and don't bring that attitude to customers! I said thank you when she set the food down, but didn't get a "You're welcome." she literally just walked away. A customer she knew walked in few minutes later and her attitude changed--she immediately smiled & was talking in a peppy voice! My friend even said "Oh, there you go, there's her smile!" 

Don't get me wrong, I'll probably still come back for the food but maybe delivery or take-out from now on. Like some people on here, I've noticed that the service has gone down hill over the years. It sucks cause I absolutely LOVE the food but today's visit will be memorable for the wrong reasons.
Love this place!! Great staff and food! Generous portions of tastiness, love the pork chops, yummy :)

Decided to come here for the first time to this location after work recently. I think I've been to their sister location in the north? (off craig and something by poke express) but correct me if im wrong xD 

I had put the order in on yelp prior to leaving work, but since it was so close to work, I still at to wait at the restaurant. 

Located just south of the Rhodes Ranch entrance on Durango, by windmill, it sits in a small shopping strip with some other places (totally looked but don't remember whats near by)

The restaurant itself is a decent size and was pretty busy, considering it was dinner time anyway.. Lol the kitchen was pushing out food really fast but it still took another 10 minutes or so for me to receive my food. Coincidentally saw Melissa because she was picking up food too xD 

I had ordered the "Furikake Chicken" to go w/ fried rice and mac salad. The Furikake Chicken is a deep-fried boneless chicken tossed in a furikake glaze. 

Let me be not the first person to say this, but to some people, me saying this may have more of an effect... HOLY THESE PORTIONS ARE HUGE ! Even with a fairly empty stomach after work, I barely ate half. The other half was saved for the next day. 

Not only was the amount of chicken a lot, even the fried rice portion was larger than expected. I'm not complaining about the amount of food. Its a great thing for the price you're paying. For me, it was two meals. For some smaller eaters, this could easily be 3 maybe 4 meals. 

I was a bit scared in the beginning because a friend of mine went to another location on eastern and said this chicken was bland. Mine was nothing but bland. sweet and savory sauce covering huge chunks of deep fried chicken, its like the Hawaiian version of orange chicken? XD ok not really... 

The fried rice was filled with ingredients. good size pieces of Chinese bbq pork. 

Not much of a fan of mac salad overall. It seemed like a normal mac salad. 

Overall, food was good. Overly stuffed from it. Wonder if other stuff is made to these sized portions as well?? time will tell... until the next time I work nearby :P

This place is right down the street from us.  I accidently found it on yelp and we decided lets go get some. I got a mixed plate. Teriyaki chicken and beef. I took one bite of the beef and I was in Heaven. (Usually a chicken girl) It was so amazing. I'm only going there from now on. Very friendly there too.  We got it too go so not sure if you get more when you dine there. Portion was plentiful.

Love the food here. The teriyaki beef is like no other. They actually use good cuts of beef. On occasion though they can go overboard with the sauce on the beef and you'll need extra rice to tone it down. All their cakes are delicious as well. My husband loves the furikake chicken and my kids love the chicken katsu.
Best hawaiian food in town, the food is so awesome here. Very large portions and the service is GREAT.

pretty authentic tasting island grinds!! ordered the saimin for takeout, liked how they kept the noodles & soup in separate containers, and was nicely surprised to have bokchoy - tasty indeed!! fried rice was good but would have been nice to add a few more ingredients to make it even tastier. seeing asian/islander folks in the restaurant made me feel confident that their food was "ono"

This place is almost reason enough to visit LV.  I was taken here by a bunch of 300lb native Hawaiians so I knew it was going to be legit.  It's the kind of restaurant where you really wish that a) they offered a sampler menu, or b) that you could somehow figure out a way to eat 7 entrees.  We had a large group, and every meal was amazing.  This is the real deal, folks.

This is probably the best hawaiian food that I have ever tried. Im from San Jose and we have alot of L&L type Hawaiian bbq places that generally has the same menu,  but different flavors,  so when I was going through Island Flavors menu I was really excited. The portions of food are big and share friendly. We sat down to eat and the customer service was top notch. The atmosphere is really laid back with island reggae music in the background. You know that the food is good when you devour everything on the plates and don't even talk to the people you came with at the table. We had the furikake chicken, the kalbi short ribs, fried rice, and spam musubi. It was all so flavorful and would definitely recommend those items if its also your first time here and you are debating on what to get. The only thing about the spam musubi, in my opinion, is that its made with too much rice and not much sauce, but despite that, this place is amazing. Next time I come to Vegas I'll be sure to tackle some more items on the menu.
Wow what more can I say about this place! Probably my favorite place to eat. Great combo plate that's well worth the price.

Oh my....I am speechless when I comes to this place!!  A friend of mine from Hawaii told me I have to go here!  After almost a year of living five minutes from this restaurant I finally went!  The food was absolutely fabulous and I am so glad I finally tried it.  My only qualm with it was we went kind of late(7pm)...on a Tuesday night, it didn't seem that busy but with all the call in orders we waited 50 minutes for our food!  Thank goodness it was good or I would have been way too hangry! Lol!
This is my go to spot for Hawaiian food. Great classic flavors to chose from and the best Mac in town! Also the Chantilly cake is a must try!
Furikake chicken. That's all you need to know. SUPER DELICIOUS!!! Also love the super friendly staff!
The food here at island flavor was amazing! Great experience with the staff here. This tops off L&L Hawaiian barbecue. If you are looking for some real Hawaiian food, go here!

Awww yeah. I meant to go to Island Style but got routed here instead. Located in a nondescript Vegas strip mall. Walked in and the girls that work there are really nice. 

After a flight from SFO, we are super hungry. We ordered the stuff below:

Furikake ahi poke...ah good stuff. Came out a bit on the cold side, but the flavor on them cubes were on point. Not so powerful, but just right. Onions, hawaiian salt, fresh cracked pepper, and some oil

Chicken katsu... good but not great. Average taste, on the dry side. But still good when you're hungry.

Furikake chicken...dang! broke da mouth dis one. Geez, so tasty and flavorful and Im sure oh so bad for you but whatever. I'm in it for the taste. Love this dish.

Kalua cabbage...it's good, but the pork that I got was more on the fatty side. I like mines with lean pork. But it was still good, and not overly salty like some other places. 

Fried rice....also good, but not great. But I also compare fried rice to my faves at Side Street Inn and Big City Diner in Hawaii.

All in all, this place is really good. Come here for good food. And although we were way too full to eat their dessert, their haupia cake looked friggin amazing.
Seriously the best place in Las Vegas. Awesome staff even better food! The chicken Katsu is where it's at. Everything on the menu is bomb.com one visit and you'll never go anywhere else!!!

Giving it a solid 5 because of Price, Proportions, and the Furikake Chicken.

Second time eating there, first time checking in with the Yelp app. Their Furikake Chicken is reason enough for you to be a regular at this place. Whenever I see a customer not eating the Furikake Chicken, I think, "Come on maaaang" O_O.

I did try the other stuff too. The Roast Pork is nothing spectacular and their fried rice is soy sauce with char siu pork. Again, nothing spectacular. 

Their Kalbi though is amazing. Tasted way different that any Korean or Hawaiian kalbi I ever tasted. 

So heres the dream team mix plate you want to order everytime: Mix plate with Furikake Chicken, Kalbi, and white rice. 

Friendly Staff, Great price, Atmosphere is meh but if you're going to get the chicken and the kalbi, who has time to look around?

I am not a big Hawaiian food fan, because so many of them butcher kalbi (no pun intended). Island Flavor has the best kalbi I have ever tasted from a Hawaiian joint, and their portions are huge! I got like 6 big pieces of meat! Also, I chose their salad instead of the mac, and shut the front door, the dressing was divine! And the craziest part is that they are known for their chicken and mac... If their kalbi n salad are this good, the chicken and mac must be way too killer!!! First time Hawaiian foodies, go straight here -- skip L&L!!!!!

Food is legit. The portions are good, prices are fairly reasonable. My favorites are the bbq short rib and the shoyu poke. 

My only gripe is the wait time when there is a crowd. The wait time seems to be a little longer than desired. Other than that, for take out, I always call ahead and food is usually good even when I have it at home.

Went here for lunch last week. I had the loco moco which was HUGE and super Yummy! My friend had the fried poke which was also very Yummy. Staff was super friendly and provided quick service. Restaurant was also clean.

I stumbled across this place the other night while searching for a Mongolian Grill in the neighborhood. Within seconds of stepping into this place, I knew I made the right decision. I started my dining experience with a BBQ pork steamed bun. This bun was so fresh and flavorful. it was much larger than your standard bun and it was packed with meat! For my meal I opted for the combo plate with fried rice. For the meats I got chicken Katsu and beef teriyaki steak. The katsu was one of the best I've had in town, but it was just not even on the same level of this teriyaki steak. This steak was one of the most tender and flavorful items of ever tasted in my life. I just couldn't get over how good it was. A+++++. As for the fried rice, they load it with massive chunks of BBQ pork. This fried rice could have been my dinner and I would have been damn pleased!! So impressed by this place and can't wait to go back!!!

I came here to meet up friends for lunch and I tried their ox-tail soup.

I have been on the hunt for delicious ox-tail soup that is available during the day (because I'm always going to The California hotel for ox-tail soup but it is only offered after 11pm there) 

I have to say that their ox-tail soup is a-ok the broth was good and they gave a lot of hunks of the ox-tail. 

I did however try the loco moco that my boyfriend had and the gravy was reaaally good! 

We also ordered the guava cake and that was also really good! and the portion was gigantic -- definitely sharing size for 2 or more people. 

Overall, we had a great experience. I'm a little biased because all I had to rate was based off their ox-tail soup and I love the california hotel's ox-tail soup.

ISLAND FLAVOR, you have my heart!

Large portions of authentic Hawaiian food.
Words can't describe how ono this place is!

If you're in Las Vegas and don't make time to swing by, you're seriously missing out!

I had no idea Vegas was the ninth Hawaiian Island but now I know! What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas! What everyone should do in Vegas is enjoy some Island Flavor!

This place is incredibly awesome! The service is enthusiastic and friendly and literally everything we've eaten has been amazing, plentiful, affordable, flavorful, and worth coming back for! 

Cucumber Kimchee! Zowie! A veritable taste explosion!
Hawaiian Poke! Super fresh, perfectly salty, and delicious!
Kalbi Short Ribs! Sweet, savory, moist, and memorable!
Guava Cake for Dessert! Light and huge, and something we've never had before or since!

I could list every item on their menu but what's the fun in that?! Instead, you should just go there and try it yourself! We'll be back!
Delicious food, very reasonably priced and great friendly service.  We're looking forward to the live music on Friday nights!

I wish I could give a zero star from our experience on how my family and I were treated last night.  We got to the restaurant about 730pm and had to put our names on the waiting list because it was a Friday night and a little crowded.  We were told there was two parties a head of us and it's going to be around 20 minutes or little longer which is fine since we drove all the way down from  northwest las vegas.  We waited outside with the other two parties and  ten minutes had past and one party was called.  About twenty minutes later a young couple arrived and went inside but never came out so I'm guessing they must have tables available.  Its about 8:15 and we have been waiting for 30 minutes now outside in the  mid 90s heat so my wife went inside to check how much longer the wait would be but come to find out our name was crossed off the list and the couple  who had came 10 minutes after us was already seated.  So I asked the gentlemen at the counter the one I had talked to when i first put my name on the list why my name was crossed off and he said that someone said you had cancelled....REALLY!  Someone else had said I cancelled not I   but someone else.  I was shocked that I was told someone had cancelled our names that was not me. And the young man tries to blamed this on us and then says that there was still a bigger party ahead of us which I knew but that wasn't my point.  If you are running the front counter and the list pay attention to who comes first and who is waiting especially since you have a big window and can obviously see outside because there was no room inside to wait.  My point was that the customer who came 10 minutes later were already  seated on a table seating for four when they were a party of two.  Our name was put back on the list but we never got I'm sorry we made a mistake so we home.  I wish I was writing a review on how good or bad the food was but we will never get a chance because my family and I will never go back.  We are from Hawaii and always support Hawaiian own business but never been treated like that before.  

B.D

Great HAYN STYLE FOOD if you no then you no can can also a small store next door for the thing you may not be able to find only thing that I didn't like was the prices of the shirts 30+ and the unavailable sizes always
My brother took us to this wonderful little family style Hawaiian home cooking. The food was delish!

I was pleasantly surprised with this small mom n pop restaurant, four of us went in about 3
in the afternoon, the place was packed with Hawaiians, first good sign, second we ordered their
3 juice mixture, delicious, we ordered the cucumbers w kimchi, the correct amount of heat for us :) yummy appetizer. we ordered the barbecue 
ribs and roast pork were cooked perfectly, with yummy spice, the macaroni salad was very 
creamy and just like homemade. The furikake chicken was very tender , their flavors are 
traditional and you will not be disappointed :)

I love the food here! This is the go to place for great local plate lunch. The service is aloha all the way, now let's talk about some serious grinds.

The food is always on point, I love the roast pork with gravy, the beef teriyaki steak is so good! Loco moco is a must if you want something different try the Chicken Katsu loco moco..... This is just to name a few they have so many Choices here! The kalbi and chop steak and onions are a must.

My favorite place to get Hawaiian food in Vegas! A must try is their chicken Katsu loco moco over fried rice! The portion is huge! I think it would feed me for 3 meals! Their poke is good. I'm sure everything on the menu is yummy. But make sure to save room for dessert!
terrible service, hair on food, they screw up your order on the phone and dinning in.

If Island Flavor isn't your  #1 Authentic Hawaiian Spot, then its definitely top 3 on anyone's list. This is the spot to go. Hawaiian Food is probably one of my fav things to eat. we can sit here and talk about how good the place ism but I like to rate places  in comparison to others in the entire city. my favorite dish is kalua pork. the taste here is different from the others, not sure what it is, but it's like its cooked fresh everytime, one way you can tell is by looking at the cabbage, and its color.

Second kalbi ribs, amazing taste, I've had it at other places, and this is definitely a cut above the rest. great service, and they make you feel welcome. I don't work to far from the place, so its definitely a great place to go. They have so many other things that they don't serve at other hawaiian places or they're version is wayy better than others. it might just be me, but I definitely recommend anyone visiting vegas to try this place first for hawaiian before any other place

Food, service always da best.

Portion of food is huge.  Always will return.  They normally have live music Fridays.

By far the best Hawaiian restaurant I've been to so far; delicious and authentic. I loved the service, the food and the atmosphere. I don't normally write reviews, but this place deserves a good one. I had kalua pig and cabbage, and some poke, they were delicious. If you want good authentic hawaiian food, this is the place to go to.

We went here after all the hype we've heard around it. The service was good, everyone has the island friendly mentality which was nice and inviting to be around. We weren't impressed with the food, which took a long time to come out. I got chicken katsu and short ribs with fried rice and Mac salad. I loved my short ribs, slightly tough and overdone but so delicious and full of flavor. The chicken katsu was mediocre and not the best I've had but it wasn't terrible. Mac salad tasted more plain than usual but I finished it anyway. My boyfriend got the teriyaki chicken. I didn't get a chance to try it but he definitely voiced not liking it. I definitely would not recommend the fried rice. It did not taste anything like fried rice, which to me ALWAYS tastes the same. I couldn't even eat it. It was literally rice saturated in soy sauce. It had some pork pieces in it which were okay but we couldn't stomach the overwhelming flavor of soy sauce (and FYI we always put soy sauce on our rice anyway)... I think it is a cool place to check out, other people seem to have enjoyed the food, however we will not be returning.

Had a frustrating experience the last time I dined with this restaurant but Bruce (owner) convinced me to return and give it another shot. Staff was phenomenally kind and understanding of the previous situation. Food came out hastily and hot. Waited no more than 10 minutes for a takeout order. Food tasted absolutely delicious and exceeded my expectations.  Will definitely be coming back again! 

Definitely made up for my previous visit.

I'm reviewing this place again because of the change in ownership. Having read some of the latest yelp reviews I've decided to eat at this place again really because I was craving my favorite dish from here, Hawaiian Roast Pork. I ordered the mixed plate, my two choices were the Furikake Chicken & Hawaiian Roast Pork, the other members of my party had 1) Loco Moco 2) Chicken Katsu 3) Furikake Chicken. For appetizers we had a full order of Poke Combo the types were 1) Hawaiian style 2) Furikake 3) Sesame Poke and two orders of Cucumber Kimchi. For dessert we had 1) Haupia Cake 2) Guava Cake 3) Coconut ice cream. These are all dishes we've eaten here many times before and we all agree they've remained the same. The amount of food was still the same. The prices to us were the same, reasonable, it's not like we looked at the prices and thought "wow this is expensive". The staff was the same, friendly and welcoming people we've been waited upon in the past. The place was going through an expansion process. Apparently they're going to knock out the wall to make the dining room bigger, which should help because this place gets really crowded. I just hope they also expand the kitchen too because more customers means you gonna need more cooks. So my take on the change in ownership is so far, everything is still the same, but how the new owners go from here is full of possibility. Still a five star and still the place recommended to anybody that asks me "So since you're from Hawaii were is the best place to eat Hawaiian food in Las Vegas?" I'll still say Island Flavor.

Came here upon a referral from a buddy of mine from Honolulu.  It's about a 15 minute drive from The Strip, but it's well worth it.  The staff were very friendly and courteous.  

My wife ordered the friend noodle special (Tuesday).  This is quite possibly the best friend noodle/saimin I have ever tried.  It's loaded with Cha Siu, Kamaboko, spam and topped with grilled Chicken Teriyaki.  

After talking to the owner, I ordered the Furikake Chicken which was fabulous.  It was crispy and full of flavor.  I also enjoyed the scoop of Mac Salad as well.  In fact, the flavors here are as big as their portions "BIG".  I'm going to have to try their Kalbi Ribs upon my next visit.  

I wanted to order the Guava Cake or Mud Pie for dessert, but I was just too full.  I guess that will have to wait til my next trip as well.

We are so glad our Hawaiian friends introduced us to this local fave.

We ordered
* Kalbi beef - enjoyed gnawing the meat around the bones 
* Chicken Katsu - perfectly crispy outside 
* Pork Moco was drowned (in a good way) with gravy yumminess
* Chicken Teriyaki - love the simple, charbroiled flavor.

We wished the place was bigger as it is hard to accommodate more than 3 families of parry larger than 5ppl.

They are equally busy with their to-go orders, so try callimg ahead if you dont have time to wait.

I love this place mainly for their large servings and flavorful dishes. I often get the mixed plate, which allows you to choose two courses from the list. I highly recommend the BBQ kalbi, furikake shrimp, and Korean chicken wings. All their orders come with rice and macaroni salad. As far as service goes, the staff are all very friendly, however, on busy days they seem to just focus their hospitality on their "usual" or Hawaiian customers. To me it doesn't bother me as long as I get my food but it would be nice if they were consistent on their good service. Overall, this place has great island food and you should take the time to try it.

Definitely my favorite Hawaiian food place to eat! Their food is pretty darn good and the portions as most Hawaiian places are generous for great prices. They do take out as well as dine in. They have one of the best chicken teriyaki dishes I've had, and their amazing chicken furikake is pretty unique in itself. They flavor it very well,and I recommend for anybody to give it a try and find out for yourself. On top of all the good food they have live music on Fridays and Saturday's if anybody wants to feel like you're closer to the islands. I'd recommend this place to anybody to give it a go! You won't be disappointed!

Always busy, cause the food is great! Portions are good, always have enough for leftovers for the next day even after a full belly. Only time we had an issue with food was when they burnt the chicken to the garden salad. My grandma put it to the side and the server hadn't checked on our table till we asked for the bill (a helper brought the food over and another server refilled out drinks). But our server came back with the bill and mentioned to us then that he took off the meat from the bill and just charged us for a regular salad because he didn't realize how bad the cooks had burnt the chicken and apologized for them and for him not having seen it sooner. I appreciate it!
This place never let's me down. The katsu sauce isn't all that great but everything else is bomb. Must try the furikaki chix and Teri beef.

I stopped in yesterday for my pickup of Loco Moco. However when I got home I checked and my hamburger patty was burnt. I called and they offered to  redo my order. Wonderful customer service and the good is great. I love love love the Chantilly and Guava cake.
Love the service and most of all the food! When I crave for local Hawaiian food... Island Flavor is the place to go!
Simply put....Service is on point, portions is BIG time and food is crazy good. Reminds me of home every time I walk in. Mahalo Island Flavors for representing Hawaii, the food and the Aloha Spirit.

It's no surprise that I love Hawaiian food to my friends. I have recently been surprised as to the quantity of good Hawaiian places in Las Vegas. Island Flavor was recommended by a colleague and I was game. It's a lot further away from most everything, but absolutely worth the drive. I hope you are hungry when you go, because they give you enough to feed one army and at a reasonable price. Loco Moco was broke da mouth! Will be back fo sho when I go come back to town!
Simply the best Hawaiian food in Las Vegas and Henderson. The gravy on the Loco Moco. Homemade. Potato salad. Just the best
So Ono! Try their furikake chicken, Korean chicken, Hawaiian pork, and Kailua pork! Their max salad is also solid! Great great spot! I look forward to coming back!
I am not a big fan of Hawaiian restaurants outside of Hawaii (shocker huh) but after trying their fried rice omelet I have slowly changed my mind. their portions are also ginormous and the Delicious.

First and foremost I enjoy the music playing over head, it has a big island melody, a true feel of Island Flavor!

On the plates: oxtail soup, furakaki chicken, kalbi short ribs with a side of bomb ass macaroni. Dessert called for freshly baked banana bread pudding.

This maybe my first check in however I am far from being a nube! As a regular I highly recommend the oxtail soup every visit! Hats off to the chef! The meat is always tender and the soup is a burst of ginger and beef broth flavor. The other must have dish is the spicy, avocado ahi poke. Somehow I feel compelled to say it makes a statement! I've tried the poke around town and nothing compares. It has the right amount of piscine taste and the avocado gives it the right creamy freshness. The furakaki chicken is a burst of flavor at your first crunchy bite and as you get to the chicken; it is tender and moist. The kalbi ribs are a tasty cocktail of salty, spicy and uuuumaaami!!! 

Last but not to say the least, dessert!!! This is my first time ordering the banana bread pudding; it was fresh out of the oven, topped with cinnamon cream pudding. I love how moist the bread was and the banana was not over powering. What a late night delight. 

I never dread the bill because the serving size is plentiful and the service is above par. 

I always leave with my belly full and an upside down frown.

My favorite island food !!! Can't beat the Hawaiian hospitality !!! I go here at least once a month. The food is so ono !!! They also play live music. Absolutely the best !!! Be prepared with a huge appetite the plates are amazingly huge enough to feed two people, Love this place. Been coming here for years !!!

I was born and raised in greater Los Angeles.  Therefore, my sense of time and timing is rather precise.  You learn, if you show up late for work, school or an appointment, there's repercussions.  And, on the extreme end, if you take your time walking across the street, you'll get run over.  Bottom line, there's no concept of polychronic "Island Time" where I come from.
  
Coming from L.A. also gives you the ability to quickly adapt to situations, and walking through the door of Island Flavor (on a Saturday afternoon) means you have to immediately switch to Island Time.  You're probably going to stand in line, with some element of uncomfortable heat, for quite a while, as tables slowly get cleared and diners (possibly drunk on carbs) take their sweet ass time moving along.  It's the nature of the beast of Island Flavor.  You put your best smiley face on and suck it up.

And, when you've finally been seated and placed your order, and 20 minutes later the waitress says, "sorry, we lost your ticket" and asks you to re-order, you keep on smiling.  After all, the massive plate of satisfying Hawaiian comfort food headed your way is worth it all.  Aloha!

For a restaurant representing Hawaii, some of their employees have no ALOHA at all. Being a customer since they've opened for business in the southwest I've noticed that they spread ALOHA to those they want to. I was born and raised in Hawaii and they obviously don't have Hawaiian spirit customer service here.  I've let the SASSINESS of their employees slide all these years because I come for the food, hence that's why they deserve 1 star. 

Today 11/7/17 at 11:15am, 2 of their sassy female employees tipped the ice berg for me. One was even fixing her band aid on her finger while packing my food. GROSS! I'm so tired of their ATTITUDES and I've put up with it all these years. You ask them one question, effin' attitude ALL the damn time! What's up with that?! Bad day? Leave that sh*t at the front door. 

If you don't like your job, go and get a job at McDonalds with that stink attitude of yours so you can fit in. Go to ISLAND FLAVOR for the food but don't expect to get great customer service taking out or dining in.

There are times in this life when a plate of food just touches your soul. The furikake chicken plate at this joint IS that plate.

I was down the street looking for lunch and was about settle in to Cafe Rio, but couldn't find a parking spot in the crowded EOS parking lot. I got frustrated and stormed out towards Island Flavor because my buddy ate here earlier in the day. It looked good so I figured, why not?

On his advice, I got the furikake chicken. It's bite sized (a bit larger than bite sized) chicken that's fried, and doused in some sort of furikake sauce (google it so I don't have to explain it), served with Mac salad and rice.

Do yourself a favor and mix a little rice with the Mac salad. It's the gangsta move.

All of this for about $10.

Thank me later.

I have come to this establishment a numerous amount of times, and swore i had wrote a review, but when I went to "update" my review, I see now that it looks as if I haven't!

As always, the staff is friendly. Me and two of my best girlfriends went around 1 in the afternoon. It wasn't as busy as I thought it would be, so finding a seat was not hard at all. 

It didn't take long for our waitress to get our drink orders, and bring it in a timely matter. I've noticed tho, that the prices has gone up quite a bit since the last time I was here a couple years ago. I was about to order the usual mix plate when I noticed the Daily Specials Menu placed inside the Menu Booklet. 

Menu Specials when I went there Last Week...
My Order: Kalua Luau. side order of sweet potato with sesame sauce
Friend 1: Furikake Chicken 
Friend 2: Pork Chop (on regular menu) 

The kalua luau was good, its different type of luau to my family luau. Our luau is more creamier, but this one was a bit more on the roughage green leafy side. But it was still so ono. I opted for brown rice and it also comes with mac salad. THe mac salad was a little too "mayonaisy" for me, but if my palate didn't change since i moved from the rock ten years ago, it would've been right up my alley! I ordered up a side of cooked sweet potato and the dipping sauce was divine. Just a great amount of sweet and salty to compliment the potato. 

The Furikake CHicken was broke the mouth. As much as i LOVED the Luau, I was picking the chicken off my friends plate just as much as she was picking the luau off of mines. We should've just switched our plates. I was under the impression it was a full chicken breast, but they came out as nuggets. Sweet and savory, with bits of furikake all over! Now i'm not a big fan of any kind of fried chicken, but I couldn't control my hand. It kept reaching over to her plate to grab more!  A definite must try!! 

Last but not least, the pork chops with smothered onions. Now what is NOT to like from this all time favorite. Now I've had charbroiled pork chops, teriyaki pork chops, char siu pork chops, apple pork chops, etc. But I love having just a regular, salt and pepper seasoned home style pork chops once in a while. That brought it all home. It was served with two scoops of white rice and a side salad with your choice of dressing. 

I didn't opt out for dessert this trip, but from previous visits, I do recommend the Chantilly cake and the Banana Bread Pudding! I tried the Kona Coffee Mud Pie, but when I got it, it was just a oreo crust with three inch high of ice cream and stuff drizzled all over it. Not exactly what I call a mud pie, but it was delicious as just Kona coffee ice cream! (It was still Ono! ) 

I hope to be back soon!!!
We loved this place, I had the shoyu chicken and my husband had beef ribs both dishes were onolicious, very large portionsand the poke was winnas, .  We will be back in April to try the desserts.
Teri beef is the winna!    It is actually a teriyaki steak, cut up.    I had the tossed salad on the side and it was a generous portion.    Definitely recommended!
Didn't get what I ordered. I drove 20 minutes to get there and 20 back to find out the guy gave me the wrong order. Now they won't answer the phone. Go to the one on eastern.
Great food. Awesome service. Priced right. Always a family feel, full stomachs, and a big smile.

Mean da "Aloha"...
Was sat down by the hostess and a braddah came out and took my order. Was looking forward to eat as I hadn't eaten all day. I watched 3 groups get seated and thought nothing of it. As I looked up from my phone, one of 3 previously mention groups was finished and paying their bill. I went up to the hostess to explain that it had bee at least half an hour since my order was taken. He came back more than 5 minutes later saying that there was a mistake. At this point I'd be waiting 45min. As a customer and someone from the islands. There was no "aloha" here. Customer service put a bad taste is my mouth.

Island Flavor is without a doubt one of the best local spots in town. They have a menu with a wide variety of options and huge portions. I usually like to get a combo plate and mix it up every once in a while. It's a nice quaint restaurant that makes you feel like you're definitely in Hawaii. Service is friendly, and I've never had a bad experience when calling in orders for pick up. This place is a must try.

I come here more often now that I moved nearby and all I can say is I'm a regular.  All staff are awesome even for picky eaters like me!  Consistent food consistent service always clean chill atmosphere what more could you ask for?  Spam musubis?  R A J A H

For someone who's moved from Hawaii, this is as close as you can get to local food. Prices are decent and portions are huge! Friday's they have Hawaiian plates with Laulau, Lomi Lomi Salmon, and Haupia!  Our go to place when we're a little homesick

They are now open 7 days a week! Yippee!! ;)

I've tried many Hawaiian restaurants in Vegas and this is by far the best. My husband and I have been to Big Island, Oahu, Maui, and Kauai and tried many restaurants. We even asked for their recommendations before traveling to Hawaii and tried the places they told us to go to, and while we were in HI we both said we like Island Flavor more! 

So far I have not had a bad meal here. Teriyaki chicken is good (and this is something I never order anywhere but I like theirs). Korean short ribs, roast pork, loco moco, katsu, and my favorite is the Poke Salad with raw poke. I like the wontons, purple yam, tomatoes, cucumber, and sesame dressing! Unfortunately, the price has gone up because of the cost of tuna over the years making it an expensive dish, but still good quality nonetheless. 

The staff is pretty friendly here and the one time my poke was not made correctly (too spicy and way too much sauce) they were more than willing to correct it for me. 

We always get a seat when we go, but if you go on a Friday night expect a wait. There was live music and dancing when we went on a Friday night.
If you ever want to get that authentic taste. This is the place to do it. Great music, great service, and great company. If you go here don't leave without trying one of their desserts. Delicious!

this place reminds me of hawaii.

When you're sitting down, it feels like the beach is just outside... but its not.  I'll keep dreaming for now.

The portions are huge and pretty good.

What makes it Hawaiian is the workers.  They're all probably from there and just seeing them interact makes you feel you're back at the islands.  I don't know what it is but the aura they give off is very authentic.

Of course, its really good food.  Reminds me of a Hawaiian place I ate at back in Maui.
Love love love this place. Make me wish we were back on the islands. Come early because it fills up fast.
Good food, generous portions, friendly staff and a nice environment. I thoroughly enjoyed eating my Chicken Katsu plate lunch while island rhythm music was playing throughout the restaurant.

Amazing Hawaiian food !! The best Hawaiian food outside of Hawaii hands down. 
I visited Las Vegas from Los Angels and after experiencing most of the restaurants in the hotels and the strip...this one was the highlight of the trip and def worth the drive. 
The portions are huge and the prices are great !
I had the poke which was unbelievable. The Hawaiian fish Was incredible with a side of the sweet purple potatoes. 
We tried their chicken and the tried rice which was great. 
And for desert - guava cake - yum !!
Put it on your must try list when you are in Vegas next time and you would not regret it !:)

YESSSSS. Must have while in Vegas, but no offense to Aloha Kitchen. 

Portions are huge. Packed with flavor. Prices are great considering what you're getting and how much. Authentic Hawaiian family atmosphere. 

I've gone here twice already and was never disappointed with the food. A friend and I shared the Mixed Plate with Kalbi short ribs and Furikake chicken: WOW. Seriously. 

Any plate can be split between two people or you can take a little bit of Hawaii home with you. And the dessert! I think it's called the lava cake...anyway, it's stacked! Must have and share. Even their green tea ice cream is yummy.

My last visit was on Sunday, March 1. For whatever reason, when we first walked in, it was hot and stuffy in the restaurant. While waiting for a table to become available, I actually had to step outside to catch a breather, but when we actually sat down, the temperature dropped and I got cold. When I went to wash my hands in the women's restroom, I felt like I needed my jacket whereas my guy friends said it was like a sauna in the guys' bathroom. Weird. 

DO NOT LET THIS HINDER YOU FROM COMING IN. You're there for the food remember?

DEFINITELY COMING BACK.

This is where the locals eat. It gets very busy. There was a lot of food that looked good. But I was craving homey type food so I got the loco moco and spam & eggs. The loco moco really hit the spot with its seasoned beef patty. The spam for some reason was super salty and kind of ruin that dish. The musubi on the other hand was good and not salty at all.

You're just too good to be true
Can't take my mind off of you
Tropical food in L-V
Desert oasis, you see
Portions big on plate lunch
Oh how I loved it a bunch
You're just too good to be true
Can't take my mind off of you

Pardon the way that I eat
Such island flavors on meat
Chicken 'yaki sweet and sour
Chopped steak I quickly devour
Kalbi ribs were just fine
HOISIN RIBS so divine
You're just too good to be true
Can't take my mind off of you

I love you 'Flava
Your food is outta sight
I need you 'Flava
On a hot Vegas night
I love you 'Flava
Trust in me when I say
Oh Island Flavor
You beat all the buffets
Oh Island Flavor
You truly do amaze
And so I Yelp! you 'Flava
Let me Yelp! you...

You're just too good to be true
Can't take my mind off of you
Haupia cake so creamy light
Guava cake a delight
Opakapaka salad so fresh
Brought goosebumps to my flesh
You're just too good to be true
Can't take my mind off of you

 I love you 'Flava
Your food is outta sight
I need you 'Flava
On a hot Vegas night
I love you 'Flava
Trust in me when I say
Oh Island Flavor
You beat all the buffets
Oh Island Flavor
You truly do amaze
And so I Yelp! you 'Flava
Let me Yelp! you...
Imma keep is short and simple. This place rocks. Best hawaii cuisine in Las Vegas. Period.

First time at this location but I've been to the Eastern location numerous times. I didn't know that this place was a sit-down restaurant which it makes sense to me now that the one on Eastern says "Island Flavor Express" in their store front. 
My boyfriend and I were craving fried chicken so we decided to dine here for their well known furikake chicken. It was pretty busy for a weekday night but didn't expect our order to take so long to come out. It took over forty minutes to arrive to our table from the time we placed it. We thought this place would be a quick eat. Although we didn't really have a designated server (I think) , I wish someone like our server who took our order would've told us that their kitchen was backed up or something at least.
Most of the workers didn't look so happy to work there especially the hostess/cashier in front had the most annoyed look on her face whenever people came in & she was walking them to their tables. The only server that was actually friendly to us & the other tables around was the guy server. As for the food itself , furikake chicken was tasty and large portion to share for 9$. I love the food at both locations & think that it's way better than other Hawaiian establishments around Las Vegas. It's probably just better to just order to-go or for takeout here.
Other menu items I recommend that I tried from their other location: THEIR SPICY AVO POKE (worth ordering by the pound) , chicken katsu , kalbi short ribs , and all of the desserts (their chantilly and guava cake slices are bomb).

I want to order the other stuff on the menu but I always end up getting the Loco Moco or Oxtail soup! It's that good and I don't see myself getting tired of ordering the same thing anytime soon. Guess one day ill get to order the rest but for now I recommend those two dish if your not sure of what to get! Portions are huge so go hungry!

Delicious. I can't decide if I like this place more than Ross J's however. I have to try more dishes before I make the judgment. 

Food: I had the Chicken katsu/ hamburger steak mix combo. The chicken katsu was definitely better than what you'd get at L&L or Aloha kitchen. Juicy white meat pieces and a good sauce. The hamburger steak was the real winner for me. The patty was well seasoned, but the brown gravy was what made it. You could tell that they made their gravy from scratch not not a box like some places *cough*L&L*cough*. 

Service: The lady was really nice and attentive. She seated us and took our order right away. I did wait a little bit for a drink refill though. 

Misc: Its pretty nice inside. They have a bar eating area with a flat screen TV to watch. We used a coupon from Restaurant.com to get our food for cheaaaaap which made this meal even better. I'll be back real soon. -1 star however because the mac salad here sucks. Its like they put boiled egg yolk into it. Weird taste and texture.

Overall food was great.. Furikake chicken was awesome and could probably feed 2.. Teri chix was also good.. Saimin was pretty bland and probably wouldn't order that again .. That's why the minus 1 star. Need more seasoning in the broth, it actually tasted like hot water with my noodles. Can't even compare to frozen S&S.

Ancient Hawaiians ventured away from the islands in great, double-hulled canoes as far back as 900 AD, in search of food, new land, and entertainment, exploring Asia and the west coast of North America. They may have also been homesick, sailing back to their roots in Marquesas and Tahiti.

Back in June 2017, I traveled on double-engine Airbus 330 with Hawaiian Airlines to California in search of food and umm--well--entertainment. After a few days, in sunny Orange County, I drove to Las Vegas to continue my quest. Using GPS like my descendants will, the four-hour sojourn was successful, narrowly avoiding a five-hour delay on the I-15 when an RV blew up a few vehicles in front of me. A week on the Continent and feeling homesick, I searched for Hawaiian food.

My first stop in Las Vegas: Island Flavor off of a recommendation from a friend of a friend. I had the roast pork with gravy, and was thoroughly impressed with the service and quality of food. Heaping scoops of steamed rice, fabulous macaroni salad, and roast pork crusted with black pepper and smothered in silky, brown gravy. It was also a great place to meet other people from Hawaii on vacation or relocated to Las Vegas. Oddly, this was the best and cheapest Hawaiian food I've had, including everything I've experienced back home in Hawaii. Their five stars will help me navigate back to this place.

This is hands down by far my favorite Hawaiian food in Vegas. I judge all others we try against Island Flavor. You cannot beat the authentic food and portion size they offer here. Come hungry, because they will definitely fill you up. The loco moco is one of my go to's. The hamburger patty is fresh and has great flavor, along with the gravy. Other favorites are their korean chicken and roast pork. You will not be disappointed no matter what you try here, I've never had anything I didn't think was great. Even their desserts are fabulous, if you can make it to dessert with the amount of food they give you. The staff is friendly and the place has that local vibe.

This place is hands down the best Hawaiian food in town. I have eaten at many other locations and this one has them all beat.

We come here a couple of times a month minimum since moving on this side of town.

The prices are very decent as well and the portions are huge. 

Keep up the good work.

-Brian (Vegas native)

This is the place to eat while your in Vegas or if you live there too lol. The food always on point. You feel at home. The customer service always great. I ran into one of my childhood friends last time server Christina. She's The best. Sad she wasn't there this time around. Good to see aloha spirit even while on vacation. Keep up the great work.

Island Flavor is my go-to spot when I am craving some Hawaiian food (which is seriously all the time). I love it here so much that it's near/at the top of my go-to eating spots when friends and family visit town.

It can take awhile to get seated, due to the small amount of tables and seats available, but the wait is completely worth it. When you're seated, your server will be quick to get you your drink(s) and take your order. Never has my order taken more than 15 minutes -- they're really quick with your order, small or big! Speaking of big, their food portions are huge, especially for the price you pay! Most of their dishes are less than $10, but you'll feel that you are getting a $20 meal, portion and taste factored in.

My go-to meal is usually the furikake chicken. If you love breaded chicken and you love it sweet, definitely try this dish! You might even get carried away by ordering one for two people.

Food tastes amazing, and the staff there are just as great as the food! And let's say you prefer to take your food to-go, they're really quick and easy about that. I've ordered from their website plenty of times and had my food ready in about 15 minutes. Mahalo Island Flavor, and see you folks (again) very soon!

I do enjoy the food here . Finding good island food like how you would get in Hawaii is state find in Las Vegas. My favorites are the Kalbi, Fried rice and the weekly specials. My wife insists we come every Tuesday for the Fries Noodles. All dishes are ample portions. Most like you will have leftovers for the fridge tomorrow. The Chantilly vale is to for. The live music on the selected weekend is a treat. Service here is always on point. Keep up the great work it's like you on an island in the middle of the desert.
Food is great and worth the wait.  The wait is a result of many repeat customers who are addicted to their food.
Truly authentic Hawaiian food!  This place is wonderful, from the food to the service.  The Chantilly cake is Mmm Mmm GOOD, definitely a must have!

Probably the best local food in town.  HUGE portions that i always have to take home and enjoy the next day.  the Friday special of Lau Lau poke rice and mac salad with haupia cannot be beat. Even the basics like Loco Moco was delicious. one of the very few places in Vegas that seasons the meat patty.   Although the korean fried chicken was a little too sweet theres not much i can complain about with Island Flavor.
a little on the pricey side of local food but the portions are huge so it makes up for it.

recommended if you want some local hawaiian food
Awesome food and service!! They were very kind and attentive. The food portions are big at a great price. Very satifsifed with the food as well as the service

Island Flavor has authentic Hawaiian food. you can taste it no frills.
I love their Loco Moco not like other restaurant their patty is bought not made from scratch.   The atmosphere Aloha.   It reminded me when i visited hawaii at a place hole on the wall Drive Inn.  I enjoy coming to this restaurant when I visit vegas.
I stop by at least once a week for the poke. They also serve an amazing loco moco, chicken katsu... I could go on. Great spot!
place wasnt that great, had the oxtail soup.. i think california hotel was better... ac sucked, was semi sweating while eating... wouldnt mind trying again but diffent foods

All I'll say is that I was never really a boasting fan of Hawaiian food because it seemed way too simple to be considered it's own food. Now, I don't come here to eat spam, eggs, and rice because anyone can cook that at home. It's like buying cereal at a restaurant.

Nevertheless,  I will always be a fan of the Hoison glazed ribs! The Korean chicken, fried chicken, and katsu are also good too. But if there is something worth drooling for here, it is certainly the ribs. It is more pricey than everything else on the menu but the portions of this dish will make you feel every penny of that $14 you spend here.

This is the place I go when I'm craving Hawaiian food. It's a nice little mom and pop place that gets packed pretty quickly. I've introduced this place to a lot of my friends and everyone loved it. In fact, I took one friend here about 2 years ago and she came to visit recently and still remembered this place and wanted to eat here again. Service is good most of the time but can be inconsistent at times. I love getting the mix plate whenever I'm here. The ox tail soup is pretty good too but I can't justify ordering it and mix plate without having to share it with a friend or two because the portions are huge.

One can say the portions are huge, but the same can be said of most Hawaiian places.  And that said, Island Flavor is also your standard Hawaiian fare.  If I lived in the neighborhood, I'd certainly go there, but as an out of towner, I don't think I'll make a special trip just to eat there.

I had the Korean chicken, and it was good - the texture was great, and it was extra crispy, but although it had a kick to it, it could have had more of a kick, and it was a little bit too salty.  

The macaroni salad was also good, but still within the range of what you'd expect.  The rice, and if you have read my other reviews, I am picky about steamed rice, and here, they had the same issue as I have with  a lot of other places, and that is I found the rice to be too soft, and though I ate 75% of the two large scoops, I was not able to eat it all. 

I sampled some fries and I thought they were your everday run of the mill "thick" fries.   On the specials menu, they had cucumber kim chee for $2.00.  The taste was good, but we only got like a small sampler cup full, which would be about 1 1/2 banchan dishes at a Korean restaurant. 

Overall, the food was filling and enjoyable; the service was friendly, the people are nice.

I have to say among the Hawaiian places I've tried all over the valley... This bar far is the most and most authentic! Portion sizes are huge and more than enough to eat there be full and take plenty home. I've had the Korean garlic chicken, the hamburger loco moco, Katsu chicken loco moco, kalbi spare ribs and the spamasubi. I have never been disappointed food wise. 

The place on the outside looks nothing short of standard and not anything special or impressive at all. It's rather spacious inside and average amount of seating for a family owned establishment. It's always a good sign when you see islanders eating coz you know the food is legit. Always people in here eating and always at least someone from Hawaii inside enjoying the grub there. 

The most recent time I went tho, I have to say the service was on the poor side. Granted, it was really busy that day, but we waited for our check and refill on drink from at least ten minutes. A server or cook from the back came out to help seat people and saw someone she knew eating and got caught up talking to that table for a while. We kept trying to get her attention until finally the customer that was talking to this server told US that WE should just go up to the counter to get someone's attention... Excuse me?! Poor form. That person should told the employee "hey we'll talk later you have customers" and directed her to us.! So naw we sat there and waited. And poor form on that server for having a ten minute conversation with a table when the placed is packed and we can't get anyone to notice that we want the check and to go boxes to dip outta there. 

Normally neglect of service is something I hold highly to food and dining establishments and take off a whole star for that. But dam this place is so bomb with the food... I'll let that one time slide. The customer service can make or break a dining experience for a person. And if the service is exceptional or good like it's supposed to be... It can sometimes make the meal all the more enjoyable. Tighten up on that customer service... Then it's top notch best Hawaiian food in town.

First off, I just wanted to mention how great the service was here. More than one employee came to check on my fiancé and me throughout the meal which was really nice. 

Most importantly: the food. Let me tell you, the food was incredible. I had a combo furikake chicken and chicken katsu plate. I've tried both of these at a few other places around town and Island Flavor is easily my favorite for both. If I can make a suggestion, get some sesame dressing to dip your chicken katsu in, it's delicious! My fiancé had the teriyaki chicken salad and that, likewise, was great. The teriyaki sauce wasn't overpowering and tasted great.

Get the Beef Teriyaki Steak! I can not stress that enough! You will be glad you did! It is a busy place so I recommend calling in your order and picking it up, the tables are always filled. Prices are decent and service is good. I have had their food twice. The chicken furikake was a good texture when I first had it, the 2nd time it was way over done or fried. Too hard to eat or enjoy, but I will give it another go, at a later time. Love the Hawaiian store next to it!

Came in lookin for a seat, hostess did not greet us once we got in, after 5 minutes he came by and asked if we were waiting for a pickup, and we said we wanted to sit in the back, he directed us there and came with water and menus.

I ordered the Portuguese bean soup, my friend ordered the mix plate, it was good but the soup was kind of salty, the portion is huge!!!!:)

We were in Vegas a week ago and a friend of ours told us to try this place out, food was awesome and the service was great. I would recommend you try it out if you're in Vegas its a little far from the stripe but worth the drive.
Food was very good, but service was terrible. Took about 10 minutes to get waited on, once we did get waited on, i didn't have my water glass once. And it took forever to pay the check.
Amazing service onolicious grinds! We love the big island feeling you gotta try the Haupia and guava cake it's to die for!! Poke salad and furikake chicken was the bomb!! Mahalo Nui loa

My go to place for Hawaiian food in Las Vegas.
Huge portions and consistently great food.
Love their furikake chicken and chicken tonkastsu. If you have room left after your meal, be sure to order desserts. I have never had a disappointing experience here.
To go order portions are consistent with their dine in as well.

Noteworthy: After an amazing diner here, I miscalculated my bill total after adding in tip (I blame the always imminent food coma). Checked my card statement later to find that they had only charged me for the amount I had intended (as opposed to the amount I had written and signed with..which was several dollars more).
Best place for Hawaiian plate lunch.  Love the localmoco and spam musubi..Awesome place. Happy eats!!

My friend from work have been raving and raving about this place and she always comes here after church so one night before we all hung out we was like let's all go to dinner so we suggest it Island flavor and oh my God out of the park I loved everything about it they gave you big portions of food it's very inexpensive the food is taste fresh it was just awesome way way way way way better than Aloha Kitchen I had the combination plate  and it was amazing. We will definitely make this our favorite food place.

This has to be the closes quality Hawaiian food in LV. All the other Hawaiian restaurants don't compete to this level. And from a boy coming from the island I can say this is good quality food and the portions are worth the price.

This is my second visit and i have to say that the food did not impress me the first time and I'm hoping that it would impress me the second time.

I started off my taking one star off for the crappy service. Ok sure i was kind of greeted right away, by a surly guy asking me if i was dining in. When i said yes, just me. He asked how many.
