I used my hand and held up my index finger and said just one...me... Then he proceeded to lead me to a table and dropped off the menu and asked if i wanted anything to drink. I said water for right now and he looked so annoyed that i didn't have my drink order ready to go. He didn't bother asking if i had any questions on the menu just stalked off... When he dropped off the water, i asked him if he had coffee, he said yes and since I'm diabetic, i had to make sure that it would be just black coffee, i confirmed that info with him and yup you guessed it, he looked freaking annoyed that i was confirming that it would be just black coffee. Started my meal off with a very bad taste in my mouth. If the place had been crazy busy i would almost... And yes i said almost... Understand his surliness, but when you are in the food industry it doesn't matter what kind of day that you had or are having, you paste on a fake smile and smile to you guests. Maybe I'm overly critical as i am in the industry and i have days where i felt like crap but you know what? My guests never knew that i was having a crappy day.  He did improve towards the end of the meal... He was not exactly friendly but he did touch my table a couple of times to refill my coffee and to ask if i liked my food. Service(2/5)

Now onto the food.

After reading all the reviews, i was excited to try them again ...i thought that maybe i had gotten them on a bad day last time. So totally not. I was not impressed. The chicken katsu was just average. Nothing special about it. The furikake shrimp was very crispy and had a great texture but flavor was just decent. Nothing to write home about. I had to dip it into the the sweet chili sauce to get any better flavor. The fried rice that was $2 up charge was just too salty. And if i had a better "relationship" with the server i might have mentioned it but since he was the king of surly...i didn't say anything. The macaroni salad was just that. Nothing special about that either. :/ Food (2.75/5)

So overall, i won't be rushing back. I might stop by to give then a third try.. maybe third times the charm who knows? Being a little generous...i rounded it up to a 3 star. 

And the kicker, i did want to order cake but he didn't ask and after the attitude and surliness...it was too much effort on my part to ask for the guava cake.
This place has great food and the poke is one of the best I've had here in Vegas. Definitely return with the family.

Love this place!! Our go to Hawaiian BBQ!

Spam musubi is delicious. They make it with the spam in the middle with furukaki sprinkled on it & a light terriyaki sauce. We always order extra to keep for snacks later. 

Terriyaki chicken is super flavorful, thin pieces of white & dark chicken. 

Chicken katsu is very tender & perfectly fried every time. Nothing's worse then getting over fried hard katsu. 

Furukaki chicken is so delicious but very rich & salty. I can only eat a little, but it goes so well with rice & mac salad. Fried nuggets of chicken tossed in a furukaki glaze. 

Saimen is traditional saimen but they add wontons to it so it's like saimen meets Chinese wonton soup. I get it without egg bc it's little pieces of scrambled egg, not thin strips so I'm just not a fan of the egg. 

The portions are very large so we usually order 3 full plates & a musubi for everyone (3 adults & 2children) and it's more than enough. 

They deliver on bite squad but if you call in for pickup yourself it's usually ready in 10-15 min, even on busy weekend nights. 

They have a small store next door that sells Hawaiian food to make at home.

I came here with my parents after we went to look at a house in a nearby neighborhood off of Durango. It's about 15-20 mins off the strip, so I would only come if I were in the area.

Upon arriving to the complex, it looks dark and like everything is closed. Once you open the doors to the restaurant, there's so much light and space!

When we came in, the two waitresses were busy with other customers, so they told us to sit wherever. We also had to get our own menus since we were in a hurry. I'm used to the type of service where they pamper you and can get annoying by asking you too many questions. This was the complete opposite, but the waitresses were super sweet so I can't complain! Plus since I told them that we were sharing, they brought out an extra plate. Some places you have to remind or specifically ask for a plate.

The portions are HUGE and extremely filling! We got the Teriyaki Beef (I'm not sure exactly the name) and the Chicken Katsu Moco Loco. It came out relatively quickly. Each plate came with the respective meats, two scoops of rice, and a scoop of macaroni salad. 

My mom and I shared the Chicken Katsu plate, which had chicken that was deliciously crunchy and well-made and came with some sort of BBQ sauce on the side. The macaroni salad was also good; it is light and a good complement to the flavorful food. My dad's Teriyaki beef was good and reminded me of Korean BBQ. It was slightly salty and too flavorful for my liking, but if you mixed it in with the rice, it was much better. 

We saw some other people get the Korean short ribs, which looked awesome so if we're in the area, we're definitely getting it!

The prices were relatively cheap! It was around $9-12 for a plate with meat, rice, and macaroni salad. I'm not sure what the poke was, but it was listed three times on the menu, each time ranging around $17-20, which deterred me from ordering it.

Summary: Good (tasty food and pretty good service) Bad (far from strip and not too visually appealing building)
Good portions, wonderful service and staff. Furikake Shrimp and Oxtail Soup are my fav. Ask for Mark the server, he's super on top of it and sweet!

Went with my family during spring break. The family enjoyed the food - portions are huge! The staff was friendly to us and appreciated that they were on our must try list while on vacation.

Thumbs up on the Korean Fried Chicken (loved the flavor, would have loved it more if it was boneless white meat used instead of the wings - like they do in Hawaii). The Hawaiian roast pork was on point! The Chantilly cake was good - satisfied the craving. I still like Liliha Bakery's Chantilly cake better.

Will definitely come back if I'm in the area again.

What is left to say. This is one of the few places you dont ever have to worry about being dissapointed. The staff is always great, the food is always great and the portions are large. 

My favorites include the korean chicken, saimen and steak tips. 

I wish they would open a location in the north and expand the breakfast menu. My wife wishes they made malasadas but we are always too full for desert anyway.
Took my family here who's in town for the big kahuku football game and they loved it here! Hands down great island food. Wonderful poke and chicken.. yum try this place you'll love it!

This establishment has a very casual mom and pops feel to it. The food has the same kind of vibe. 

I stopped by only because i was airing up my tires and gassing up at the Chevron.

The menu doesn't have much of a selection which hurts variety but the prep time was pretty fast.

I've never had authentic Hawaiian food so i didnt know what to expect but the beef and the korean chicken i ordered had a very home style taste.

I'd likely not return due to personal preference but would recommend this place to others

Absolutely one of the best Hawaiian food I have ever had (other than Hawaii of course).

Randomly came here on a friday night 30 mins before closing.
Called in ahead of time and they offered to put our name down on the list. Awesome.

They have plenty of tables for small and large parties.

Everything on the menu sounds delicious and best part?
ITS SUPER CHEAP!!!! Each plate is less than or around $10.
And oh my lord, SOOOO MUCH FOOD!!!

Each plate can seriously be shared between two people.
I opted for the combo plate because I wanted to try more than one thing.

Hawaiian Style Roast Pork & Furikake Shrimp Combo
The pork is cooked local style w/Hawaiian salt, cracked black pepper, sliced thin and topped w/rich homemade brown gravy and the shrimp is jumbo shrimp coated with panko and furikake fried golden brown and served with oriental sauce. The pork was VERY tender with a nice ratio of meat to fat. And the shrimp was crunchy and delicious. I definitely recommend both options. I did ask for white rice, but the cook accidentally gave me fried rice instead, which was even better!!! Because it was a super large portion of fried rice and had bbq pork meat in it and a nice subtle flavor. The mac salad was the only thing that was a very small portion, but it was good as well.

We also shared the fresh made ahi poke. It was good as well. Especially with fresh sliced onions.

Overall, great service, great food, and great prices!!

Absolutely the best place I've ever had plate lunch.  Yes, we'd been working out and yes we were starving, but I still know good food when I taste it.

The furikake shrimp were perfectly crunchy on the outside and perfectly moist on the inside.  The mac salad MIGHT have been as good as mine.  The kalbi ribs were... Kalbi ribs.  Honestly with the bottled marinades these days even chain restaurants have a tough time screwing those up.

I don't venture near Vegas very often, but I'm ready to go back.  You just don't get food like this around here!
The best Hawaiian spot in the sw area! Mixed plate and ribs are the bomb! The staff is super nice and the portions are huge. Definitely gotta check this place out.

Long over due to write a review for this place. I've gone here for breakfast, lunch and dinner plenty of times. Its a tradition now, to take guests visiting, for at least one meal.

The interior is fully decorated island style and staff are all hawaiians as far as I can tell. Staff members are also very friendly and easily make you feel at home. They always got local island music playing that just adds on to the experience.

My Favorites:

Chicken Katsu Loco Moco: Perfectly breaded chicken cut into strips, white rice, pair of over easy eggs and they're rich and thick homemade brown gravy (they're gravy is what sets them apart from every other hawaiian bbq eatery)

Loco Moco: Same as above except for the chicken, its a grilled homemade hamburger patty

Kalbi Short Ribs: Charbroiled, quite tender and soaked with flavor. If the bone was edible, there would be nothing left..

Korean Chicken: fried little drumsticks and wings tossed in their special sauce. Mild and uniquely flavorful, I can put these down!

Pork Chops: 2 pieces of grilled bone-in pork chops, topped with mushroom and onions. I always get a side of their gravy and pour it over and smother the chops. So So Comforting!

I've also tried their teriyaki beef and chicken, fried rice.. everything is great!

**Portions are HUMONGOUS!! As the hawaiians say "Don't eat until your full, eat until you pass out" 

**Full Entree Orders Will Easily serve 2! Prices are very reasonable! Service is great!

One of My Favorite Hawaiian BBQ Spots!!! (and yes, I've been to L&L, Ohana, Shakas, the one in the California Hotel, Aloha Kitchen.. to name a few.. Not to mention some places in Hawaii itself)

I'm so glad I found his gem in Vegas ! The staff was super friendly and the service was great and quick! The food came out so fast and it was delicious! My bf and I shared the combo plate with chicken furikake and short ribs with fried rice which made us both stuffed and it was only 14 bucks! The chicken furikake was seriously the best fried chicken with a sweet tangy sauce. The chicken was still so deliciously crunchy when we ate it. Definitely coming back again!

Searching for authentic Island Flavor cuisine? This is your place. The L&L and other fast food Hawaiian spots can't compare. This is my first visit and the staff was very welcoming. These are real Hawaiian from Kona they tell me. This is not like the other places that are mostly Korean owned. This place takes pride in their food and it shows. The Kalbi ribs and fried shrimp is what was suggested. The owner hand cuts the ribs himself and marinades them. He said he never freezes the meat so its always fresh. The shrimp is hand cut and breaded with furikake sprinkled on it. I haven't had Hawaiian food this good since I was there last year. I kept driving by this place cause it by the house and now I'm glad I stopped in to try. I will be back.

I've never had the food, but a friend of mine brought over their banana bread pudding and it was soooooooooo good! I'm gonna pick some up tomorrow!  when i do have the food though, i'll be back for a better review!
Food was very good and the portion size is huge so try sharing the dishes. I had teriyaki chicken plate

Portions are HUGE!!! Like our server said, "Go big or go home!" I barely made it through my roast pork loco moco; only ate 1/4 of it. The loco moco was good but a bit too salty because of the gravy. My boyfriend had the Shoyu Chicken; he loved it. He compared it to Adobo. Got peer pressured to order the Kona Coffee Mud Pie. Liked it! It was huge; my boyfriend estimated it was around 5 scoops of ice cream. Our server was friendly. Would probably be back here with a bigger group.

Awesome food! Recommend this to anyone and quality is great! Guava cake was brilliant and loco moco, ask for gravy on the side because it's sort of overwhelming with their gravy. service has always been pretty prompt even when picking up. Korean chicken wings are off the hook, truly recommend on those bad boys!

In from Ohio ..local family members suggested we try Island Flavor for the best Loco Moco. Tried the pork Loco moco... was not disappointed!!! Portions are HUGE food was awesome! Next time we are in town we will be back! Mac salad was the best asked about the ingredients but no secrets were given. 
Awesome staff and food!

Okay, I absolutely love this place! It feels like home so much! The staff is amazing, always friendly and very welcoming. BIIIIIGGG portions!! I love their salads.. It's big and hearty and the dressing is just sooo yummy. All the salads are the same.. lettuce, thick slices of tomato, cucumbers, okinawan sweet potato and topped off with won ton chips with the creamy sesame dressing and then you can either pick the teriyaki chicken (which I really like) grilled opakapaka, fried poke or the katsu. Anyone you pick, they are all good!! Another thing I really like is the roast pork.. Omg so tender and salty, just how I like it. I don't know why I never ate the roast pork loco moco before but it all just make sense!! Amazing!!!! I guess it just really big and I can't eat as much as I used to. Korean fried chicken is another one of my faves. Kalbi is also tasty and meaty. And if you like fish, try the opakapaka with the miso plate.. Soooo good!! I've tried their desserts before too.. Fantastic!! Try this place if you want some bomb ass local food from hawaii, you won't be disappointed.

Have been here countless times and I don't know why I haven't written a review yet!!

I've been coming here since it first opened a few years back and will continue coming here again and again! If you are craving Hawaiian food for ribs, this is the place to go. 

Huge potions, awesome flavors, quality has been consistent over the years, very friendly and effective service! 

I have tried different dishes but usually always go for the combo with kalua prick and kalbi ribs! This is my go-to dish! And their macaroni salad is awesome!! 

Oxtail soup is also really good, loco moco, and their specials are also usually on point!

Ive been eating at Island Flavor since they first opened when there was a bar in the center.  So, Ive seen it go under many changes.  I understand that a restaurant must raise prices over time to compete with rising food costs and Ive gladly paid for it.  However, it is terrible when a restaurant  reduces the amount of food given AND charges more.  Plate lunch food has always been about value and taste.  I can no longer justify eating at Island Flavor if I have to pay $15 for a plate lunch, which, to me, is no longer a value.  It was a surprise when I looked at my recent bill and saw upcharges that were not there under the previous ownership.  For less food and $15, I'll save my money and eat elsewhere, especially, if I walk away after a meal feeling like I didnt get my money's worth.  BTW, I take pics of most of my meals at restaurants and the difference is drastic.  As a business person, I wish all the best to the new owners but as a patron, Ill be eating elsewhere.

Broke da mout! Amazing food and awesome portions! It's hard to find places where you find good local kine food similar tasting to back home. This place comes really close! The vibe in this place is similar to what you'll feel back on the islands. Very welcoming, but full of energy and a lot of other folks from Hawaii. They can get pretty busy, so seating might be tough. I like their loco moco here, but I get the oxtail most of the time! Been meaning to try their furikake chicken and I will sometime soon! Haven't gone here a lot because it is quite the drive from my house. The pricing is your usual $9-$20 range, but they give good portions! Back at home I was used to the generous portions... they definitely live up to it! If you live on this side and crave local food give this place a try! Promise you will like it.

My wife and I don't gamble, our clubbing days are in our rear view mirrors, and watching Las Vegas type shows are a little too pricey for us.  So, what the heck are we in Vegas for?  Our daughter and her club volleyball team are here for four days competing in the SCVA 30th Las Vegas Classic Volleyball Tournament.  Since we don't do any of things most people do while in Vegas, what else is there to do.  Well, I didn't mention the other thing people do, which is what we did here at Island Flavor.  EAT!!!

There are several Island Flavor restaurants in Vegas, but the one you have to visit is the one off of Durango.  Island Flavor resides amongst other tenants in a small strip mall.  We visited Island Flavor for dinner and from the outside you would think the restaurant is tiny, which it's not once you walk inside.  It's also dark from the outside because of tint they have on their windows, which is probably due to the scathing sun during the Las Vegas heat.  Once we entered, the restaurant was jam packed, meaning that we were about to embark on some good eats.  That was an understatement.  Our group of 5 had to wait a little while because of how popular this place is.  There's not much of a waiting area.  The decor is Hawaiian themed through and through with island decor all over the restaurant.  The staff worked hard to turn tables and provided decent customer service, but did the best they could considering how busy they were.

Island Flavor represented Hawaiian food really well.  As we walked into the restaurant, you are greeted by a display case filled with spam musubi, which should tell you what to expect.  I ordered the loco moco and ahi poke furikake.  Boy was I happy!!!  The ahi poke furikake was divine and tasty-licious.  It was fresh, seasoned just right, and combined with sliced vegetables.  I can say that Island Flavor's ahi poke can compete with the best of them.  I ordered half a pound, which was less than $8 and was a great appetizer.  When my loco moco was brought out, my group and I were amazed that it came out in a huge bowl.  Coming out in a bowl should tell you how much food you're getting.  It was massive and I didn't finish half of that dish.  It was doused with gravy, with cooked just right hamburger patty, had a bounty of rice, and was topped with two sunny side eggs.  Once I broke the yolk and watched it flow onto the gravy, hamburger, and rice, I was salivating before I took my first bite.  The conglomeration of everything really satisfied me except for one minus.  The gravy needed either salt or seasoning, but that meal with its massiveness is what I call true value for your money.

For my family of 3 and the amount of food we ordered, I really thought we got our money's worth and we were able to bring home leftovers.  I definitely recommend ahi poke furikake and the loco moco.  Although we don't do most of the usual Las Vegas things to do, we always do what Las Vegas is also known for, which is stuff your face until your belly hurts.  Thank you Island Flavor for doing this in spades.  Yummy-licious Big Time!!!
This Hawaiian food is as good as it gets!! My favorite is the mixed plate where I usually get the spare ribs, chicken furikake, and/or chicken katsu!! And can't forget my spam musubi!!

Had the Friday special and it was pretty good. Also had a slice of guava cake and not bad. Hopefully we can come back and try some different dishes. Overall, pretty good food. Not bad for Hawaiian food in the middle of a desert.

A really awesome brunch place with insane value! You get a huge portion of something delicious, and it's really affordable for the amount of food you're getting. 

I love their classic loco moco and chicken katsu plates! The gravy is savory and not too floury or thick. Their eggs are also always on point! The guava cake is pretty amazing too-- not too sweet but just delicate and fruity enough!

In the back of my mind, I thought it was another Hawaiian food restaurant with your normal menu... I was wrong! Island Flavor is awesome! I seem to be coming to this place at a weekly visit, when I'm not busy. The commute here is a distance... But it's worth it when you have their infamous furukaki chicken! The waiters/waitresses are very knowledgeable about the menu, and they suggest that you try something that you've never tried. Leilani is always there, and loves to joke and make trouble. Each item that they bring out the kitchen window seems to draw every patrons eyes! Not to mention their portions! 

Their kal-bi is awesome, and I never did like beef stew as a child, yet, these guys managed to change my mind! It's delicious! I love their Portuguese bean soup, and their fried noodles! I always gawk at their fried rice omelette with the Portuguese sausage. It's a inverted large bowl of fried rice! I believe I've tried a fraction of their menu, and the items that I've chosen so far aren't a disappointment! 

Then there is the DESSERT.... Even though some of the items come from next door which is a bakery, the Hawaiian desserts are top notch!! Guava cake, Cocoa Puffs.... etc... To die for! I think I'm heading there next week again!

One of my favorite local spots for Hawaiian food in vegas. 

The reason is bc of their chicken katsu Loco moco. Its basically a Loco moco but instead of the beef patties it has chicken katsu. This is amazing and only place that I have seen this dish. 

The spam musibu has way wayyyy too much rice imo.

Sunday, 4:04pm, a few hours before my flight home to DC:

Island Flavor: Hello!
Steve: Hi, I'd like to place a carryout order.
Island Flavor: Sorry, we closed at 4.
Steve: NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO

I would eat her twice a day if eating here just once didn't fill me up for two days! I'm coming back in a month for that furikake chicken, teriyaki beef, etc, etc, etc!

For me, Spam Musubi and Poke are the good combo.
Couldn't get the beef stew because it's a Saturday special? Loco was just so so..
I've been there 4(?) or 5(?) times already.
Oh and usually, a long line around 11 to 12pm.. 
Definitely, will go back for Poke and Spam Musubi! 

Food: Good
Price: Good
Service: Good
Parking: Good

I've never really had Hawaiian food before but I definitely want to have it again after trying this place. 

We started off with the ahi poke salad, sesame style. The server recommended it furikake style but since we were getting the furikake chicken, I didn't want to overload on that particular flavor. For a half pound of poke, it was only 7.95 which I thought was such a great deal. The sauce was really good but not too overpowering. 

We did the two meat special and got the furikake chicken and the roast pork, both of which were really good. The furikake chicken is crispy and sweet. I was hoping that it would be a little more salty but I still enjoyed it. We also got the macaroni salad as a side and it helped cut the richness of the meats. 

We couldn't bear to not get the kalbi. My boyfriend left only the bones. The portion was huge and the meat tender and sweet.

The front is all blacked out. When you enter it's a little run down family owned business. Standard looking for a Hawaiian place. Took forever for my food, got the order wrong too. If this had a better rating system 
Service 1
Environment 1
Food 4

The best local grinds in Vegas! Every time I go it's always busy so try to catch dinner a little earlier to avoid the rush. Everything I've ever had from here was the bomb and serves so much! The deserts are   so delicious but we're usually so full we have to take it to go.

Ok so I see this place every time I drive by but never ever stop to eat here. This past Friday I did and man oh man was I glad I did!!! 

You you live near here and never been this us a must. The cafe is a little under attractive but the food, the vibe and the people well makes up for that and in all honesty it's not a bad looking or gross place at all there are just no decor and it's just a room with tables and a few island pictures and arts on the wall nothing fancy but who cares. I think it makes you feel like you are in Hawaii.

I happen to go on a Luau Friday when they have a little band set up for entertainment. I was greeted oh so warmly by everyone one with Hughes and back pats i mean it was as friendly as it can get. 

We order the Chicken katsu with gravy on the side and the Chicken Furikake and Kalua Pork with cabbage and their churi fried rice and OMG let me tell you the Furikake chicken is (like most Yelpers have claimed) life changing. You must try to know what I am talking about and the Kalua port and cabbage I wish was a little bit more flavorful and juicy never the less was very good as well but man the Furikake chicken! The chicken katsu and gravy was amazing and the guava cake. Let's just say I'm not a huge guava liver and this cake was moist, tasty and the hint notes of the fruit with the semi sweet frosting was just perfect. 

I am now a ginormous fan of this place and glad I finally tried it and now I'm telling everybody about it!

Their glazed beef ribs is the best! It's affordable and big servings. I often visit here after we go hiking at red rock canyon. Absolutely satisfied my cravings and hunger after an intense workout. The ambience feels like I'm eating by the beach especially when the band starts to play their hawaiian music. It was such a very "chillax" place! :)

This place never disappoints. Customer service is outstanding, and their food is always on point. If you're looking for Hawaiian comfort food this is the place. I'm a big fan of their chicken papaya (served only on certain days) and their furikake chicken. Their portion sizes are huge! Though I would love it if they offered mini portions, I always have a good amount left over to take home.

They definitely dont skimp on portions here, so come hungry. I ordered food to go on my most recent visit 6/13/16. The guy on the phone was super helpful. I ordered a mixed plate combo with furikake chicken and teriyaki chicken. The plate comes with 2 scoops of white rice, and a side of mac salad. I also added on 2 orders of spam musubi. My total was $18.49. Island Flavor is located in BFE aka Durango and Windmill, right next to World Of Cakes. 

The food was really good. The furikake chicken was something I have never had before but I enjoyed it. It's chicken pieces breaded then deep fried and tossed in a sweet sauce and sprinkled with furikake. Something new for my taste buds for sure. The teriyaki chicken was okay. The problem was it was literally swimming in teriyaki sauce and it was sooo salty. I love teriyaki sauce, but would for sure ask for the sauce on the side next time. Especially since I had leftovers. Reheated teriyaki gets thick and goopy, and is not the business. The spam musubi were decent size and still tasted good the next day. They wrapped em in saran wrap so all I had to do was pop it in the microwave and I was good to go.
I enjoyed the mac salad. It was creamy and just about perfect, but I did add a dash of salt and pepper to it. All in all, everything was pretty ONOLICIOUS! 

This is not an area I am in often, but when I am in the area and craving Hawaiian food, I will stop in.

Went here one weekday just to test the yelp reviews that I've read and I'm glad I did. They food is delicious! Just like what you'd get in Hawaii. Very authentic and flavorful. The restaurant has a very laid back feel to go along with that "island style" of living. I went back later that week on Aloha Friday and there were food specials and live music. The place was packed and I'm glad I even got a table. All in all, the place is definitely a place I would go back to time and time again.
My favorite Hawaiian restraurant in Las Vegas :)) good service, good food!!! Onolicious deserts!!!  live Hawaiian music

Best Hangover Saimin ever !! Not to mention service was awesome! I also had the mix plate : furukaki chix and kalbi ribs which was also very good ! 
I've been to a lot of Hawaiian restaurants in Vegas but Island Flavor is by far the best one !

Out of all the hawaiian/local food places here in las vegas,  this is my favorite.  Huge portions of food for good prices. Chicken Katsu loco moco was a huge bowl that I couldn't finish. Good service and friendly staff. Nice decor with Local/reggae music playing inside as well. Definitely be back
My favorite "local" food in the 702.  I usually order the Mochiko Chicken but I just had the Poke and it was really good.  Only thing they lack is sometimes they don't have enough seating.

The poke as an "appetizer" is very filling.  You can actually have this as your meal for only $9.95.  As for the lunch special deals for about $10 is also very filling.  It's really "Big Island" style portions where you can share one meal with two people.  My boyfriend and I tasted the chicken katsu loco moco and the short ribs.  These two choices are superb.  

I'd definitely would come back to this place when I head back to Las Vegas again.  This is the spot to go to if you're missing the island flavors and you want to eat someplace away from the strip.
Their furikake chicken and garlic chicken is bomb! Customer service is always on point too. Can't wait for our next trip out there!

Furikake chicken and loco moco are my go-to dishes when I come here. GET THE CHANTILLY CAKE! Best chantilly cake I've had in Vegas so far. Amazing. Food comes in large portions and you get what you pay for.

The food here is usually good and the servers are friendly. However, I feel like every time I come here, there is some sort of long wait i. e. to be seated, for food to come out, or to get the check at the end of the meal. It's usually just one out of the three listed above. I mean, you can't rush perfection (lol), but it's especially frustrating when you're waiting for your check for about 15-20 mins.
Chantilly cake!!!!! SOOOO GOOD!!!!! really liked the Kalbi short ribs!!!  Definitely worth checking this place out when in Vegas!!  It's a little bit of Hawaii in Vegas!!
I haven't tried a single thing here that I don't enjoy. The chicken and kalbi are my regular order but the katsu tastes great too. Portions are huge.

Be ready for a plate large enough for two meals. It might be a good idea to share with someone...nah! Just unleash the beast within.

I tried out the mix plate here with chicken katsu and and chop steak with onion. The katsu is fried to perfection and comes with a delicious katsu sauce. The chop steak with onion was a little tough but very good as well. I also got a chance to try the kalbi here and I would get that next time along with katsu if choosing options for the mix plate.

I didn't know it's not listed on the menu, but you can order coffee here! It's pretty good and comes with free refills.

Excellent service, reminiscent of the hospitality of the islands.

Furikake poke!! I could eat this all day and not get fat! I was full of this stuff as it was the first thing served. 

I've been wanting to come here for years! We ordered two mixed plates. One with furikake chicken and Kalua pig & Cabbage. The other with kalbi short ribs and chopped steak and onions. 

After staring at photos of furikake chicken for years, my dream came true and was able to try it. Honestly, was a bit diappointed in the taste which is like something  you get a Chinese restaurant without the furikake. The Kalua pig and cabbage lacked the saltiness and smoked flavor you typically get. So, that was diappointing as well. The portions weren't a disappointment. Large enough to feed 2 people with mac salad. Can't believe I almost finished my plate. Oink..  

The kalbi short ribs were just like most. Good but not great. The chopped steak was decent and had a slight sweetness to it (sugar). 

Wish I had space or made space for desserts. The guava and chantilly cakes looked pretty good. 

Service here was just average and appeared shorthanded on a busy Sunday afternoon. 

I'll stick to Aloha Specialties next time for my garlic chicken.

Awesome Hawaiian food. The teriyaki beef is amazing! Actual chunks of steak instead of just cheap red meat. I'm all about customer service and this place is the best. You can't go wrong with the loco Moco!!

It's been a while since I've had true island home food and this place was amazing. I had the special fried omelette with Portuguese sausage and don't expect a huge portion. Was so good but couldn't finish it all. Also had the Korean chicken and oxtail soup, so delicious! Server and service was execellent! Reminded me of back home in Hawaii the aloha spirit. And to top off a great brunch my family and I shared the guava cake and the Chantilly cake. Omg was so good! Love this place and will definitely come back when we visit the family in Vegas again.
Amazing food good service big portions! Love their loco moco! And their chicken and teriyaki!

Bad ass food. Crappy ass host/servers. Placed in a take out order. I knew it was going to be a while so I got there 25 minutes after placing the order. Gave them my name when I got there. Another server asked for my name which I gave. They attend to some other customers. Few to go bags brought to counter. Servers asked for my name again. At this point we are at 15 mins. Waited another 15 minutes after that. Same server asked for my name again... waited 10 mins. Another server comes out and ask for my name then asked for my order. She looked at one of the bags and there it was; sitting right on the counter all nice and cold. Told her how long it's been out. She grabs the bag and brings it to the back. 10 mins later... nothing... I left... don't normally write reviews unless it's a constant occurrence. Third time this happened. Too bad they can't handle the rush. They're good but not good enough to be constantly messing up like this. Other places around that's just as good or even better

Came here with my buddy and his wife.  I thought it was decent for lunch on a friday.  Cheap deals (lunch special).  Portion is very generous and the roast pork is amazing.  Reminds me of Hawaii.  Service was wonderful and the place is clean.  

Parking is great, big lot.

This eatery was highly recommended and I now know why. Their menu is full of Hawaii local favorites, the serving portions are huge, the prices won't break your pocketbook and the service is quick and full of ALOHA! We walked in and the place was filled with local Hawaiians.....it was like being back on the islands! The walls are decorated with hula implements and posters and photos of the islands. And there's Hawaiian music playing overhead while you dine. For kaukau we had the 1/2 lb Hawaiian Style Ahi Poke, Kalbi short ribs plate with rice and mac salad, the Tuesday special of Fried Noodles and Grilled Teriyaki Chicken and for dessert, one heavenly slice of Guava Cake!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!
Best furikake chicken, Kalbi and Teri beef you'll ever taste!!!  Portions are large and the service is great.

First time here and I was disappointed. Must have been an off night though. My husband and I ordered a combo plate and spam musubi. The waiter gave us the spam musubi still wrapped in plastic while eating in. Cmon! You can at least take off the Saran Wrap for us so it doesn't look like you just slapped it on the plate. 

Our meal took about 45 minutes to come out and it wasn't even that busy. I got tired of waiting and wasn't even hungry anymore by the time it arrived. We ordered the kalua pig and furikake chicken with fried rice. The kalua pig and cabbage tasted really odd as if it had been cooked then microwaved. The fried rice was saturated in soy sauce and not thoroughly dispersed. The chicken was good but overcooked.  I just think they forgot about our order and then half assed it. 

We do love Hawaiian/island food so we will try again, but maybe not this location. My husband felt sick when he got home too so that didn't help. I do want to note that they did offer a free dessert for the long wait but we were over it by that point. They knew something was up though because we never complained and they just kept asking if we were ok.

FURIKAKE CHICKEN.

Just try it. Don't even hesitate to order when you see it on the menu. You will thank me later. You're welcome. 

This is Definitely a great place for local Hawaiian food. They serve humongous portions so you can actually split an order between two people and still be full. Nice and friendly staff. Great place to go when you're craving Hawaiian food without having to fly out to the islands.

OMG. Too much food!  Friend from LA told us this was the best.  Wow.  So good.  Enough food for 2x the number ordered.  Very nice people to go along win the great food.  Worth the pretty expensive cab ride from the strip.  The roast pork, delicious.  The macaroni and fried rice even better and whatever they did to the chicken and beef was delicious. 

Did I mention the nice people?

This place is definitely a good chowdown place (although in general, Hawaiian places tend to be chowdown places).

When you come here, it is not a fine dining experience. I mean, this is grubbing, stick-to-your-ribs, need-to-wear-pants-with-elastic-band-before-coming kind of food.

There are a couple of things are worth mentioning. 

The salads - most notably the fried poke and teriyaki chicken salad are excellent. It's hard to get tuna cooked right - meaty, tender red on the inside, seared perfectly on the outside. Those luscious cubes of fish really made this dish shine. Grilled teriyaki chicken thighs had a nice char on the outside without making it too dry. Perfection. Served on a bed of romaine with a side of tomato, cucumber, purple sweet potato  and fried wonton chips- this salad is not a light affair with its creamy sesame dressing. Normally, I order this salad with the dressing on the side and leave most of the chips next to it.

Chicken katsu was crispy on the outside, moist on the inside. The amount given is rather astounding - 3 fillets served with scoops of rice and macaroni salad. (One of our friends who loves to eat very light, was addicted to the macaroni salad. It was like watching a crack addict after a long period of abstinence.)

Steak and onions were packed with flavour. The steak was juicy and perfectly cooked to a medium to medium rare.

The only thing I didn't find that appetizing was their roasted pork dish. The gravy was overwhelming although the pork did have a nice flavour to it. If it wasn't for the gravy, the dish would have been infinitely better.

Portions are really big - bring friends. I'm serious. 3 dishes could easily feed 4 really hungry people or 5 not-so-hungry people.

Best Hawaiian food in the South West! Cant get enough of their BBQ Short Ribs as well as their Loco Moco. Many of my friends order the Furikake Chicken but I'm not a fan of anything with seaweed. I've also tried their Chicken Katsu and it's pretty amazing! The staff is super friendly, on busy nights, you will have a little wait for your food BUT it is worth the wait! Price is really good for the quality of the food. If you are craving for some Hawaiian, definitely check this place out! Yummm!

Never had a bad meal at this place never left hungry foods cooked to order so be patient! Service is great quality Hawaiian hospitality! I recommend the furiaki chicken & the Kalabi short ribs R  as well I prefer them well done! Then we end the meal with a slice of guava cake or kona coffee cake  after all this food u may not eat for 24-48 hrs lol but it's well worth it! Kind Ono grinds brahdah

Traveling around Las Vegas, there are plenty of options for good eats. Most are geared towards tourists and the standard fare, but it isn't easy to stumble upon a place where locals frequent and gets packed just before dinner time. Island Flavor gets excellent reviews and they are definitely warranted. I'm only here for a couple more hours, but I wish I can sample all their delicious authentic dishes and juices. Come in and have a seat, then you'll see that you made the right choice just by looking at all the happy and eager-to-eat local groups of friends, family, and the occasional non-Hawaiian customer like myself. Highly, HIGHLY recommended!

Live Hawaiian music...brings you back to the island with great food and friendly people
Aloha
Oxtail soup is good for the soul

My family came here a few days ago, and for myself and my sister, it was our first time having Hawaiian cuisine. My sister and I had the loco moco and my mom had the hoisin sauce ribs. The portions are just HUGE. My loco moco had huge scoops of rice, a good sized beef patty, the fried egg and a pool of gravy. I loved it. My mom's ribs were juicy and tender it was so much that we ended up eating the leftover's for dinner that night. The price was right for the portions as well, a little under $9 for each entree. My mom also said her coffee was the best she'd had in ages.
I eat here every Sunday. The food never fails me and Noah is so nice and genuine when taking my order and helping me decide what to get! Superb customer service and good food!!!

Food was great! Staff and place is really fun to be at! It's not like your everyday Hawaiian style restaurant because the servings here are huge! A friend of mine brought me here and I fell inlove with the Beef Kalbi! Love the staff because they were very accommodating.

So Ono!! It's weird that you have to go Vegas to get the best Hawaiian food. The service is always amazing. When your there you feel like your eating in Hawaii. Come with an appetite because you will be stuffed because the serving sizes are huge. But no complaints here. If you have room for desert order anything. They are all good but my favorite is the Haupia cake. At first I didn't wanna go but I'm sure glad I gave it a try.

Give this local grindz a 4.5! Pretty authentic Hawaiian food here with big portions. Of course the price goes along with it, but I must say....tastey!!! Don't waste your money on the guava cake, when u can have the kona mud pie. The guava didn't taste fresh. Must try their combo plate roast pork and kalbee! Oh and also their furikake chicken, Ono! Fried rice was a no go as it's too dry and best when using non sticky rice. Chicken katsu loco moco almost gave me a heart attack as it was so huge! Friendly staff and lots of memories of the islands.

Really tasty and authentic food! Not many healthier (non-fried) options on the menu, but this isn't a place you would visit to have a healthy meal! The teriyaki chicken is really great! Awesome customer service, too! Even servers who weren't assigned to us were checking in on us ensuring we enjoyed our experience!

Came here again the day after I visited Island Flavor for the first time.  Had the kalua pork and cabbage -- great!  However, the topper was the chantilly cake!!!!  SO GOOD.  4 layer chocolate cake with cream filling and a butterscotchy icing reminiscent of the icing for German chocolate cake....swoon.  Drool.

This is probably the best Hawaiian food in all of Las Vegas! The food, staff, and atmosphere at Island Flavor bring me back to my vacations in Hawaii. You definitely have come here hungry as the portions are big enough to share or to have left overs. I always get the poke appetizer which is very fresh tuna. I usually also get a mixed plate which lets you get 2 different local favorites (either chicken katsu, beef teriyaki, chicken teriyaki, hamburger steak, shrimp, kalbi ribs, roast pork, chop steak, or korean chicken). The Loco Moco is also very good and on Fridays you can get the Hawaiian plate special with lau lau. Come hungry, hang out and relax to traditional hawaiian food that makes you feel like you are back on the islands.

Only in a Hawaiian restaurant is it endearing (and not tacky) when your server comes around, holding her baby while taking your food order ;)

Seriously though, Island Flavor is legit! True Hawaiian food at its best!!! I found this restaurant through Yelp and it is worth the (less than) 20 minute drive from the strip. 

My boyfriend & I split the Furikake Poke, while he opted for the Fried Rice Omelet with Portuguese Sausage and I got the combo with KFC (Korean Fried Chicken) and Teri Beef.....Omgaaaah, so delicious (or should I say "ono"!) The portions were monstrous, but most importantly, the food was amazing.  I have been craving REAL Ahi Poke and I'm so glad I got to have my fix here! Huge chunks of fresh Ahi Poke sprinkled with Furikake mmm, it was perfect. I have also been on a Korean Fried Chicken kick recently, and Island Flavor definitely got it right. So crispy, juicy and garlicy! The Teri Beef was great quality (not thin or stringy at all) and the sweet sauce was the clincher. No lie, everything we ate was amazing....even the Mac salad and Guava Juice!

I am definitely going to try to come here next time I'm in Vegas :) Now seriously, can we get a Hawaiian joint as good as this in So Cal? Enough L&L, I want an Island Flavor haha!

Never going anywhere else for Hawaiian. I come here to cheat on my diet once a week. Always worth it. It takes all my strength and will power to not order more than one plate and I have the toughest time deciding on which dish is my favorite. So good, it's ridiculous.

Fyi, BEST AHI POKE IN TOWN. Ever.

This place is B.A.*

loco moco vs. Portuguese omelet. Whichever I want, I can not finish it. Huge portions. Bigger than your average spare tire. But the wait is long enough to start looking at other people's food while waiting. Long waits mean steak and burgers, no? But compensated by the sweet, genuine service.

And the bill, is ridiculously small. Had to whip out my magnifying glass to realize how cheap the tab was. 
 
I deeply recommend the mud pie dessert, which is also sharable.

*B.A.= bad ass

I experienced the worst service I've ever had out of all my years of dining out. Unbelievable. The food was alright, but that won't save it. I've never been to a place where i've felt outright ignored. It was that bad.

Is there no standard knowledge of basic service and etiquette here? Everyone working here seemed so careless and oblivious. No sense of urgency or organization. My friends and I entered and were not looked at, checked on, acknowledged, greeted, accommodated, nothing. I didn't know if I should've sat myself down or just wait and give them a chance (shouldn't have). Nope, just left to stand there like unwelcome guests as some lady at the cash register took care of some payment and then WALKED AWAY without acknowledging our presence. Hey guys, you do know customers enter through your front door, right?

After eating (which seemed like an eternity to get to that point), I raised my hand at least 5 times to ask question about the check, even speaking out to get someone's, anyone's attention. None of the employees looked my way. At this point I was beginning to question if these people were normal. A waitress briefly saw me with my hand RAISED and everything, but then she immediately changed direction and focused her attention elsewhere, striking up a conversation with a table of people she seemingly knew. Are you kidding me?? Fed up by now, I finally had to GET UP from my table to get this stupid little simple ordeal done and to finally pay.

Ditch this place.

The hoisin glazed beef is cooked to perfection. Even my picky daughter enjoyed it so much. We cannot finish the whole 8 rack but we are happy to take the rest home and thats the only left over that did not reach the next day.  And service was great too! Keep it up!!

This place is our favorite! We love Hawaiian food and this place does it the best. Everything is delicious and they give you huge portions! We love bringing our family here. We usually order the short ribs, teriyaki chicken, steak with onions and gravy, kalua pig with cabbage, rice, macaroni salad and spam musubi. Yum!!
Probably one of my absolute favorite local spots in Vegas. Portions are huge, staff is very friendly, low key atmosphere, amazing prices and the food is incredible. Will be back many more times.

There is a damn good reason why I have been going to this Hawaiian joint RELIGIOUSLY for the last 4-5 years or so that they have been open. It's not just the friendly/attentive staff, nor the delicious, never bland flavor of all their dishes, or the generosity in which they choose to portion their food, or the overall amazing atmosphere in this blessed eatery. It's the culmination and perfect balance of all those things.

Their spam musubi is to die for. Add a bit of Sriracha and you've got yourself a whole meal. All their entree items are a dream come true for a foodie like me. Beef teriyaki isn't the skin thick kind you get from L&L (smh), but rather steak like cuts of the cow. Katsu is perfectly fried and dont even let me get started on the Loco Moco. 

If you haven't, check this place out, if you have, then what the hell are you reading this for? Better be on your way to island flava!

Edit: Been 2014 since I last reviewed it. Just wanted to reassure everyone that they have kept true to their winning formula. Expect a great meal.

THE place for some great Hawaiian food!! 

We came for lunch and they were just starting to pick up. The ladies who were working saw us come in said mahalo and were really inviting. We were seated right away and immediately our drink order was taken. 

We had the loco moco and furikake poke. Bomb!!! The loco moco is huge!! This is definitely something tjay can be shared. The gravy smelled so good I could smell it while it was being carried to our table. The sunny side up eggs were a delicious and cooked just right. 

The poke was fresh and good sized pieces with onions. The serving portion of poke that they give is very generous for the price. Definitely the spot for some great poke!
The best Furikake Chicken, Lau Lau, and Kalbi!!!

This place is amazing! The staff is super friendly and I love their Hawaiian accents! The food is also really cheap for the amount that you're getting. I tend to order the half orders because one full serving is way too much! The only time I ever get a full order is if I'm ordering to-go so that I can eat it throughout the day. 

My favorite dish is the loco moco plate. The meat is huge!! They probably pack it there themselves because I rarely ever see such big portions anywhere else. It's a nice change from seeing the single beef patties on top of the rice like most other places. They're also very generous on the amount of gravy they pour over everything. Oh and the egg was cooked perfectly. I always get my eggs sunny side up and they have never messed it up here. Another one of my favorite items here is the furikake ahi poke. It used to be a lot cheaper per pound but now they sell it by market price. I believe it was around $14/lb last time I was there. Not too bad but it was definitely a lot cheaper before. They can do half orders for the poke too if you don't wanna spend too much. Another one of my favorites here is the katsu curry plate. Although last time I got it, the curry was a little salty. Not overly salty but I had to eat more rice to compensate. 

I've heard their oxtail soup here is to die for. I haven't tried it yet but it's on my list of things to try along with their guava cake. I can't wait! Island Flavor is my go to hawaiian food spot. Cheap food with giant portions... can't beat that!

Craving for some Hawaiian food and decided to check out Island Flavors.  Big Mahalo Yelp!

You can order a single entree or create your own mixed plate combination for a couple extra bucks.  Entrees are served with 2 scoops rice and 1 scoop mac salad.  Sounds like plate lunch time!

On our first visit, the server recommended the Kalbi and Furikaki chicken.  I decided on a combo of Furikake chicken and Kalua pork and cabbage.  The chicken was crispy and coated with a sweet glaze and Furikake.  The Kulua pork was a bit disappointing.  I didn't think it had enough smoke flavoring.  Hubby had oxtail soup.  The soup was very tasty although a little heavy on ginger.  Portions were very generous!

On our second visit I went with our server's recommendation.  Kalbi ribs and Furikake chicken.  Tummy was very happy.  A small complaint was that one piece was a little grisly.  Don't feel that's the restaurants fault.  The Kalbi was seasoned perfectly.  Hubby ordered the Lau Lau special which is served with Lomi Lomi and Haupia.  Very ONO!

Don't forget to save room for a piece of Chantilly cake
I gave this place a try on my way home from Las Vegas.  Awesome kalbi short ribs!  The staff was nice and efficient.

I know another update? I want share food experience with my fellow yelpers plus there more then couple things on any menu. I tried the kailua and cabbage. It was winnah! The kailua had just right amount of saltiness, moist, juicy, and hand picked/shredded. The thing enjoy about this version at Island Flavor is the cabbage not julienne cut so dig in get best of both worlds kailua and cabbage. Or hell if want cabbage in one bite then kailua all you. Again not emphasis portion size got love LOCAL food best deal under ten bucks lunch or dinner. 

I tried the banana bread pudding. Honestly ok. I never really got any hint of banana in the bread pudding and not as dense. That just my personnel preference. Now the haupia cake still reigns supreme out of the desserts had at Island Flavor. 

One thing forget mention is only local style they have heat warmer that keeps spam musubi wrapped individual portion ready too go. Like pay the bill and take some spam musubi for late night snack or munchie. Yay!!!!!

Went here when my family is in town. We loved everything that we ordered. The service was fast and always with a great smile. They are always willing to help you with your order. That day was my third time going in there but it was my family's first time. They want to go back again when they visit me. 

Sweet and sour short ribs was the special for the day and it was AMAZING!!! 
Chicken katsu and shrimp furrikake was so crunch and stayed that way until the next day when I was eating leftover. 
Kalbi was great since it was so tender!!!

Can't wait for my next visit!

Love this place it has the best customer service everyone makes you feel right at home and the food is on point my new go to spot in town prices in comparison with the portion size is the bomb guarenttee kanack attack and they get live music was awesome

Been going here since it opened and always enjoyed the great feast of menu options.  First time in forever I had the saimin a week ago and it was so bland I will never order it again.  Large bowl with quarter filled with noodles eggs, fish cake, char-su pork, green onions and half filled with warm water broth, had no taste to it.  Last time I ordered for grand daughter it was filled to the brim, now only half filled and with tasteless broth.  Gotta learn how to make the broth before you can make the saimin.  Broth is the key to any good noodle soup dish.  Cooks are really not that good because everything else comes tasting different every time.  Strange how that happens.  Lots of people post some very positive things but I have not experienced that since a change of ownership.  Noticed how the cooks change also when I go.  Must maintain highest level of taste that this place was known for, hope it all comes back.

This place is on point with their food! They definitely know how to make that authentic island food that only Hawaii can give. I went in with a few friends and was surprised to see how much food you could get for under $10. I had the Chicken Katsu Loco Moco and it was hands down the best I've had anywhere in town.  They give you a large bowl filled with rice, a huge piece of Katsu, and 2 eggs cooked how you want, all of this is covered and filled with gravy. I highly recommend this dish.  No doubt about it, I will be back here again, and again.

Love local food so was happy to try this place. It was a good substitute for local grinds but not quite as good as the real thing. Musubi appetizer was a high point. My husband loved his chicken katsu loco moco-- other reviews were accurate, the portion was HUGE. My chicken katsu was a little plain and the sauce was flat. I didn't find the kalbi as tasty or tender as other reviewers, found it tough and short on marinade time. Haupia cake not recommended, should have tried the ice cream pie. Our companions liked their furikake shrimp and the kahlua pig with cabbage. This place definitely is worth a visit, I just didn't order the right thing this time.

This is the best Authentic Hawaiian spot in Las Vegas! L&L is authentic Chinese now, not that I don't like Chinese, but you can cook Chinese and call it Hawaiian. The vibes @ Island Flavor are super chill, staff is very humble, no rush added after we pay. Air conditioned for us big islanders but the food was on point! Furikake Chicken/ Kabli plate w/ fried rice and mac salad. So good!!!! Oh and the Poke so fresh! The best tho is the Guava cake. My wife gets the Chantilly cake! So good

So I have given this place numerous tries and he food portions are always huge which is nice. The service is just sub par. I usually call in my order and the people who answer usually are not in a good mood. Sometimes when I come in, I will come across some nice servers but its not consistent. I haven't tried anything at this place that is outstanding. I usually go here for the convenience of location to my house. My default order is the kalbi ribs.
Best Hawaiian food in town. I love the pork chops. They bring you huge plates. Everything we ordered there was more than one person can eat. Great prices to, so you cant beat it. A must try

So went here for a late lunch on a Wednesday... It was around 2pm, and the place was packed! Luckily we were seated right as the extra people started coming in... At first, the lady working was a little intimidating, like a tough older sister. My family joked that we didnt wanna ask her for anything! Later on as the things settled down, she became more friendly, and her big sister attitude stayed (love it!)... 

Anyways... 

Oh my goodness... I had the furikake chicken... To be honest, I tasted just a tiny hint of furikake on the glazed pieces of chicken. It mainly was a sweet taste that was yummmmy!... I also got hamburger steak that comes smothered in gravy with a little bit of onion and mushroom. A super heavy meal, those plates are good for sharing! My husband had the chicken katsu loco moco. Again, A huge serving that comes in a big bowl, also tasty... I later tried my moms leftover chicken teriyaki.. That too had a good taste that wasn't too sweet or salty, but full of flavor. 

I love the family vibe I get from this place. Big sister (aka our server) even told my husband she'll give him a slice of cake for free next time we visit! (After seeing him eye every slice of cake that came out of the kitchen)... We were too full to get a slice at the time.

Pls come check this place out!..
This place is awesome. Great food, great price and great people! Must try! Brought family from Texas 1st time eating Hawaiian food and all love it!

After awaking from a long first night, we had built up our appetites. Since a couple of my friends were craving spam and eggs, this was the first place I thought of. I had this bookmarked in Yelp for awhile. 

When walking into Island Flavor, I felt like I was on vacation! Well, I was already on vacation anyway. I meant to stay vacationing on the big island of Hawaii. The restaurant wasn't busy and accommodated our group of five guys easily. Since I was the only one who wasn't craving spam and eggs, I went for my next best choice. The Chicken katsu loco moco.

The menu offerings looked so tasty, but I wanted to stick with the egg themed entree' at our table. When I got my loco moco, I felt like I was in a eating competition. The bowl that my meal was served in was huge! I had  generous portions of chicken katsu and rice. I didn't want to use the gravy, so I opted it on the side and get the katsu sauce instead. The chicken katsu was nice and crispy from the breading, yet tender inside with the chicken. The egg was a perfectly cooked sunny side up egg. 
Mixing the yolk with the white rice is always the best!

The staff here were very helpful and attentive. If your ever in Vegas and craving some authentic Hawaiian food, check out Island Flavor and give them a try!

First and foremost we ordered beef kalbi and oxtail soup for late lunch around before 3pm 11/11/17 corner left table at the very back,  me and my wife were surprised with the food portion and the quality is 5star! Food Taste its damn so good! so for me its the bomb!!! if i could give them 6star i would, the chef did an amazing job in the kitchen...

But unfortunately the service is 2 star, told the server its our first time so i needed to ask a few questions on the menu cause we were  just kinda curious if whats everyone like and etc, i noticed the female server is not being attentive, as soon as they served our food she doesnt even come up and check on us if everything taste right or anything, and when she finally noticed were done eating thats when she ask if needed to go boxes and she didnt even offer dessert. 

Busser doesn't even offer refill with my wife's drink...

But come on now, all they need is to improve the customer service, you have great food and the only missing piece is the great customer service, crack a smile atleast and make your customer feel at home specially your representing this great hawaiin food.

After you eat here you will not eat any of Hawaiian theme style restaurant in town blows everything out of the water definitely is the king of Island food local Mocho is amazing come to think of it anything I've had  there is out of this world seven stars for me

I love the food here and I am never disappointed. The teriyaki chicken is delicious and the kalbi ribs were delicious too. I usually get the pork with gravy which is yummy too. You know it's good when you see a lot of Hawaiians in here. The Chantilly cake is my personal favorite of their desserts. You get really large portions here and I always have left overs. Service is always nice too.

My favorite Hawaiian Restaurant here in Las Vegas.  My go to spot when friends and relatives visit.
This is an great find. A very clean and friendly place. The staff is very friendly and attentive.  It is located in a little strip mall but never had a problem finding parking.
The Furikake Chicken totally rocks this place.  They serve up some good Kalbi and I love the Saimin.  You can't go wrong with either the Chantilly or the Haupia cakes.  The only weak point, for me, is the Kalua Pua'a. It lakes the smoky saltiness and is a little bland for me.  
This is a great find that I think you'd really enjoy and should not miss.
Great food and so tasty, a lot better than those fake Hawaiian places! I tried the Teriyaki steak and Furikaki Chicken with macaroni salad.

As a Hawaii resident, I believe in supporting our local community.  I am here in Vegas at least half the year as I also have a residence here and...dont know why I have never come to eat here before but today was the first.  

Started with the Pork Won Tons as an appetizer.  I loved it - but I love deep fried stuff. Nuff' said.  I had the Furikake Chicken which was awesome.  The portions on the plates are worth your money.  I barely finished one third of my plate and took the rest back home.  The chicken is boneless and smothered with their Furikake sauce. My husband had the pork chops. 2 big chops topped with onions.   

Service was great - with Aloha.  Decor is okay. Not too "tourist" looking but you can tell from Hawaii.  

Left with a takeout menu as we will definitely do take out as well as dine in again.

I love coming here when I'm in Vegas. The portions are so big and the food is delicious!

Definitely a spot off the strip.

Don't mind me I'm just going to start listing items you just got to try here.

Fried Rice Omelet plate is huge perfect for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Comes with a large portion of fried rice with pieces of char siu mixed in, topped with an omelet of who knows how many eggs, and also thick slices of Portuguese sausage.

Kalbi short ribs mighty tasty and probably the thickest cuts of Kalbi here. Not the best for those who are dieting.

Shoyu ahi poke very tasty perfect on it own or with beer on a hot day while grilling.
 
Katsu loco moco, I know weird huh. I've seen it all over the place but never thought of trying a non-hamburger loco moco. I've been missing out its actually pretty good. I guess whenever I'm feeling like loco moco I'll order regular hamburger most times and every other time swap out for a non traditional loco moco.

Huge slice of Kona Coffee Mud pie and other cakes and desserts. If you still have room for this congratulations to you.  Just like their plates, their desserts are big and delicious.

Last but not least the Hawaiian plate which is only offered Fridays, is the best way to end the work week and to start the weekend. The only day of the week they have lau lau on the menu. It comes with two scopes of rice, lau lau, lomi lomi salmon, ahi poke, mac salad, and haupia. This is probably the best Hawaiian plate you can get in Vegas and it's getting so popular that they sometimes run out, from what I've heard, thankfully I haven't ran into that problem yet. Reason why I mentioned it last, I want mine LOL.

My husband went to this Island Flavor restaurant in S. Durango location & ordered 2 plate dinners & oxtail soup to go. When my mom was about to eat her oxtail soup, she noticed that it was only soup & vegetables inside &   it doesn't have any oxtail at all. I WAS SO MAD & called them back & this lady named I think it was Tiare or Tiana said that they just realize that there wasn't any oxtail after my husband left. How can you possibly forget to put oxtail in my oxtail soup. Don't you need to scoop it & put it in the container. They charged my husband $11 for just soup & vegetables w/out oxtail.  I WON'T BE COMING BACK TO THIS RESTAURANT ANYMORE! Yeah they said they'll put credit for me. I might just get a refund. 

They don't have the owner there anymore, the older lady that used to be in the cashier. When she was there, they're not making this mistake. Now that she's not there anymore they keep messing the orders. Last time my husband ordered loco moco w/ over easy eggs they over cooked the eggs. Then on my husband's birthday I want to order haupia ice cream cake. I called they said we don't make it here it's next door Andres World of Cake. So my husband called there to buy the whole haupia ice cream cake. Then when he went to pick it up, it was just haupia cake not ice cream cake. Then after I finished work I stop by @ Island Flavor & told to Tiana that one of their worker told me that they have the haupia ice cream cake next door that's why my husband ordered it there. Come to find out that it wasn't haupia ice cream cake it was actually haupia ice cream pie that they serve at Island Flavor. I told the lady that "you guys should just corrected me that it wasn't a haupia ice cream cake, but a haupia ice cream pie." Told them that my husband was so mad on his birthday because of their mistake. We ended up still bought the cake & I bought 4 slices of haupia ice cream pie because I know that my husband wanted that haupia ice cream pie.

Cute mom and pop shop that caters to Vegas locals. I hadn't had Hawaiian food in awhile and one of our friends had never had it before so our local friend took us here.

I ordered the mixed plate of kalua pork and furikake chicken. Omg the chicken was soooo good. The seasoningnof the cjicand the crispiness were on point. Unfortunately the kalua pork missed the mark entirely; it was wicked bland and way too chewy as if it had been overcooked - utterly flavorless.

My friend who had the mixed plate with kalua pork and roast pork had the same complaint about the kalua pork as well but she was happy with the roast pork, especially the sauce it came with. 

We also had the spam musubi which was good: sauce was appropriately sweet and not overbearing. I do wish the spam slice was thicker. 

We also ordered the ahi poke which they forgot and ended up coming at the end of our meal. The servers apologized but that was it. We couldn't really enjoy it as it came well after our entrees and it seemed like they rushed to make it - the seasoning tasted off.

For dessert, we took home a piece of chantilly cake. The cake and buttercream were soooo creamy and smooth. It's pretty sweet so if that's not your thing, steer clear. It's delicious both warm and cold. 

I would say for a Hawaiian place, I was really surprised that they screwef up the kalua pork. The only saving grace for me was the furikake chicken and spam musubi so 3.5 stars.

We were in the area and decided to visit Island Flavor after reading several rave reviews and checking out pictures on Yelp (mostly just looking at pics). Everyone seemed to praise the furikake chicken, so we ordered that. We also ordered sesame poke and the beef teriyaki after the waitress suggested it as a 2nd entrée. 

The furikake chicken was described by one reviewer as "life-changing." Well I'm writing this review the morning after and I can tell you I feel like the same person I was before dinner and it truly wasn't all that. The breading is thin and crisp, with a strong sesame oil aroma and sweet flavor. They use a combination of light and dark meat. Furikake chicken is a solid 3 star dish- nothing more or less. The beef teriyaki was teriyaki... the sesame poke was great, though. The cubes of tuna melt in your mouth. Probably could have marinated just a little bit longer, but still delicious. Huge portions!

We also ordered the guava cake and it was both beautiful and delicious. It really doesn't need the whipped cream dollop, though! It mixes oddly with the flavor of the sauce. Our slice of cake was huge and was the best part of our dining experience. 

The restaurant was clean and I noticed they have received an "A" from the health department. Kinda funky lighting, but still a nice aesthetic. All of their tables have pull-out chairs, no booths. Service was friendly, but it took a very long time before our water was refilled, we were offered dessert, or we received our bill. We probably won't return before trying other bookmarked Hawaiian spots.

My favorite Hawaiian place to eat in Las Vegas.  My favorite entrees are the teriyaki chicken, kalbi, and poke.  Have yet to try the saimen soup but will do so when it gets cooler.  I didn't like every item.  Loco moco is not the greatest in my opinion and I thought the oxtail soup is way too salty.  Doesn't matter though, I pretty much stick with my favorite items when going there.
Food was great and super flavorful but honestly the guava cake it's what did it for me! Try the cake and you will be obsessed!!
I got a fever for the flavor all the time.  I absolutely love this place.  It is insanely cheap and and great quality.  You can even get spam musubi to go.

I'm pretty picky with my Hawaiian food, but island flavor is pretty alright in a sense of portion.

I came in here and tried their furikake chicken and spicy avocado poke.

So lemme get to the good stuff first: their poke is spot on good; fresh and delicious. If you get their 1lbs option it's a pretty good deal and you can share with friends.

We also tried the slightly cooked poke option but to be honest, I didn't care too much for it. It just reminded me of teriyaki cooked fish, nothing really special.

My main course was the furikake chicken, portions were huge! It lasted me that meal and fed me the next day (but then again I don't like to waste food, so I'm a huge left overs kinda guy..) ha!

As for the disappointments though, the flavor of the chicken got boring quick, and the texture was way too tough and difficult to digest. The chicken was also a bit too dry, I think it was deep fried way too long. The sauce was a little too salty for my preference but if you want something to fill you up on a deal, I suppose you're getting your money's worth. 

Island flavor is alright if you want quantity over quality, and some decent poke but I can't really see myself coming back here again unfortunately.

This place is so good, I feel like I should write another review on it. Whenever I want some comfort food, this is the place to go. The staff makes me feel at home and the food never disappoints. It was my first time having POG here and it's so good. 

You can also find little Iron Man here with hulk hands. So cute. lol

Food is really good and worth it, but this is not the place to come for a "quick bite". Service is extremely slow. 5 stars if the service was a lot faster. (We're talking almost an hour from the time we sat to when we got our food)

What can I say? Love it love it love it!! I visit this place at least once a week, this is one of my favorite restaurant in town. 
The items are price friendly, super tasty, and satisfying amount.

Appetizer: Poke with avocado sauce is the best option, make sure you have 2 or more ppl in the party for this, it's  too much for one person and it's not a good idea to take it home since it's raw fish.

Main dish: I love the mixed plate options in here, teriyaki steak is a must for me every time. If you are a meat lover, I recommend you to try Kalbi short ribs with teriyaki beef steak. It just like in the heaven. (Honestly additional $2 fried rice taste just ok)
They also have special food item of the day, beef stew is my favorite, it might be on Saturday (not sure). 

Dessert: lava cake taste so good! Usually after my mixed plate I can't have dessert right away because I was so full, i just order it to go instead. 

Overall: Taste good, great amount, good price!

I'll start and end on a good note. The price is low.

After reading the high praise this place (just down the street from me) got, I was excited to try it out. I ordered the Mixed Plate with Kalbi and Chicken Katsu. One thing many people have said about this place is the large serving size. I figured, by ordering the mix plate (choice of two items), I would definitely be able to bare witness to the large portions. I was mistaken. They made it look heaping, but it was an illusion. All in all, there were 5 short ribs, and 7 small strips of chicken.

It didn't get any better with taste. Okay, the Kalbi was okay, but I have, without a doubt, had better. My wife and in-laws are Korean. It's hard to beat authentic Korean Kalbi. So, I'm willing to let the Island Flavor slide on that. I can't, however, give any slack on the chicken. There was more breading than chicken, and it didn't have ANY flavor, let alone Island flavor. I'm guessing this is why they give you the small little cup of dipping sauce. After taking a bite into the unnaturally crispy strip, you can vaguely see a sliver of chicken.

The fries are good. But I don't visit restaurants just for their fries, except maybe Gordon Biersch.

With my fiancé from the islands, I've pretty much adopted Hawaiian food into my diet and trying every single Hawaiian restaurant in town has become a requirement for us. Being that we both live in the west side of town, we usually don't stray too far from our frequent traveled routes, UNLESS it's to fulfill a foodie adventure. On this particular day, we decided we'd finally pay a visit to Island Flavor. 

When we arrived, I was immediately drawn to a plate of pre-made, saran wrapped musubis that sat on the register counter for 2 bucks a pop. I thought to myself, how brilliant is that?! We were seated and my eyes were drawn to one flaw-- Several teriyaki and sriracha sauce splatters on the wall. I know, I know... Trust me, I HATE being a stickler for something like that, but it made me feel like a saw remnants of a booger flinger on the wall. ANYWAY, back to the good stuff.

My fiancé and I ordered two mixed plates. One beef teriyaki steak and korean chicken and one chop steak & onions and korean chicken. When the plates arrived, we were pleasantly surprised by the big portions. Two scoops of rice, one scoop of macaroni salad, and MEAT GALORE! The food definitely tasted delicious. However, as a fan of thinly sliced beef, I had expected my teriyaki steak to be sliced thin as described on the menu, but it was not. It was actually the opposite of what I had expected--The chop steak was sliced thin and the teriyaki beef was more "chop[py]". Nonetheless, I ate it. 

I hope to visit them again soon to try a few more items off their menu. I think maybe next time even consider sharing a plate to leave room for some of their desserts that I watched longingly pass my table.

Island Flavor has become a once a week stop.  The specials are off the charts-will large portions and hearty ingredients. 
The Beef Stew is my dad's favorite-and the girls there always know what I'm there for on the weekends.
Service is great-nice weekend entertainment too!

This is my go to spot for Hawaiian food. The portions are enormous! No way I can finish everything in one sitting. I end up sharing with someone or eating half. I love their teriyaki steak, teriyaki chicken, & Furikake chicken. I really, really love the Furikake Chicken. I can't believe I've never tried this amazing style of chicken! Where have you been all my life?! Other favorites are poke, macaroni salad, and spam musubi. I have a sick addiction to their guava cake which I heard they get from the bakery next to them. It's one of my favorite cakes and I find myself thinking about this cake often. 

Some of the dishes I didn't care for are the Korean chicken wings & galbi. I'm picky with Korean chicken wings and galbi. I'm not a big pork lover so I don't usually order pork dishes but my husband enjoys them.

Definitely a good choice to stop by to satisfy your Hawaiian food cravings!

Hawaiian food has alot of flavors.  Mostly sweet and not too spicy. I prefer the spicy side. I ordered the furikake chicken and shrimp.  They were good but too sweet.  The mac salad was ok.  Overall a decent lunch.
Everyone is so nice and food is amazing. I always crave for the ahi poke and this place is simply the best for satisfying it!

The best hawaiian food ever!!  My husband and I have been religiously coming here just about every weekend.
