Their portions are so big that we usually order one entree and share it and we still can't  finish it.  Our fave is their Lau Lau which is usually served on Fridays and they do run out pretty quickly so I recommend going early before its all gone.  

This place is definitely on top of my list!!!

Finally a place that serves a bombness Portuguese Bean Soup! The cup is a perfect size for this manly man. Portions here are legit. Also ordered Kalua Pork; Very enjoyable and not salty like other places we've been to. And We've been all over Hawai'i and here in LV. Friends know I don't play when it comes to food. The Furikake Shrimp comes with this amazingassness dip, but always tend to ask for lemons for any shrimp I get, it's a Texas thing, or it just me?! Anywayz... the shrimp, lemon and the sweet tangy dip is Onolicious. Don't come here trying to stick to a diet . Enjoy and share the Aloha

Grabbed some take out from here tonight... Overall very good meal.  Had the combination plate with chicken furikake and kalua pork and an order of fried rice.  First off, portions are big, which was nice.  The fried rice and chicken furikake were excellent... will order both again.  Pork was OK, but not on the level of the other two dishes.  Definitely will be a return customer... just will try to find a different third item to match the fried rice and chicken.
Great place! Great customer service, they obviously care about what people think! Which is rare these days!
tasty food and good size portions, homemade presentation and flavor.

Very yummy food! The portions were great and the prices were very reasonable. 

We were visiting from Colorado and ate here for lunch 2 days in a row because it was so good. It's sort of a small hole in the wall so if your party is larger than 8+ I suggest getting there earlier or calling in your order. We had to do that on the second day because it was packed but they still got our food out quickly. It was worth having to eat in the car lol 

We also had the poke which was bomb  The Guava Cake and Chantilly Cake were also our favorites. We will definitely be back whenever we are in town. And will continue to recommend this establishment to all of our family and friends. Mahalo nui loa

The hawaiian food here is great with generous portions. The teri beef is great because they use better quality beef. The loco moco is top notch and I forgot the name of their fish dish but that also is good!!!!
Really good, probably in my top three Hawaiian places in town. One star off because it doesn't seem really clean, but hey, they're busy. It won't stop me from coming back.

Honestly the best Hawaiian food place to eat at in Las Vegas, hands down! Great customer service. Fast and always friendly. Joslyn packed my To go order and was very friendly. She hooked up with extra salad dressing, which is literally the best dressing in the world. Thank you again Joslyn, now my chicken katsu is going to be extra good....

I have to admit...I've been to Hawaii, but I never really ate hawaiian food until I moved to Vegas. 
And until I had Island Flavor I never really knew just how good it could be.
I actually stopped in without knowing anything about this place and just went for lunch with my roommate Mason, who has been to Hawaii numerous times so I figured why not give it a try.

As a southerner I am fundamentally pre-programmed to like most of these dishes because they have the same principals of many southern dishes. Slow cooked pork, greens, rice, gravy, fried chicken steak, and a mayo heavy pasta salad as a nice foil to the abundance of savory flavors.

I had the pork lau lau combo which came with 2 scoops of rice a side of the ceviche style ahi poke salad and that coconut pudding that I could happily eat every day for the rest of my life. All of this was $10 and the portion was too much for me to finish and made for great leftovers the next day.

This place has the typical kitschy interior that you would expect with any small hawaiian joint. And the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful with making suggestions based on my limited experience with the cuisine.
Although this place is now a bit of a drive from me, and for anybody else who is not in the extreme SW, it is beyond worth the drive. 
I would have to pass 3 different hawaiin places on my way to Island Flavor, and to those who have been there...you know why this makes total sense.
My favorite place for Hawaiian food. Their musibis are soo good for a quick mid day snack.
I loooove this place! Their ahi poke is delicious. My favorite dish is their furikake chicken and portions are huge too! This place is a must try and one of my favorites.

Come hungry , be prepared for great food and the buttons off your pants to pop off! You will be reminded of the taste of the island!  A friend recommended this restaurant and without a doubt this is one of the best recommendations!

We are hooked on Aloha Fridays (the only day lau lau is served).  Once they run out their out!  The Kalua Pig and cabbage, Chicken Katsu  and Kalbi Short Ribs are one (and many more) of our favorites.  The Hawaiian Style Saimin soup comes with everything (not like other places that charge extra for wontons or vegetables, crazy!?).  Island Flavor also caters to customers who rather have steak.  The top sirloin and rib eye are served to perfection (tender and juicy) as though it was cooked in a gourmet steakhouse.

Now if you have a sweet tooth for good dessert, this is also the place!  Their Chantilly, Hopia and Guava cakes are to die for! Kona Coffee Mud pie and banana bread pudding are also a must to taste.  You will savor every taste by flavoring each layer of awesome goodness.

The servings are mammoth and the price is worth every penny, especially when you have enough for another meal the next day!

Island Flavor has such a welcoming atmosphere.  The staff is extremely friendly and attentive!  As often as we eat here, we came in as customers and leave as their friends.

Pure bliss. I feel like every other meal I've had in my entire life was leading up to this. My first real Hawaiian meal. Now I'm afraid no other place will ever be able to match up. 

Appetizer: Fresh Ahi Poke (Furikake style) - Perfect flavor combination. The Ahi was super fresh and the onions. Oh man, the onions.

Entrees: Hoisin BBQ Ribs - That sauce. Just give me a bowl of that Hoisin and a spoon. The ribs were so tender, like they'd been marinating for years. The sticky rice and mac salad sides were excellent. Huge portions. What a plate. 

Furikake Shrimp - Crunchy. Perfectly cooked. Delicious, tangy dipping sauce.

Dessert: Coconut Pineapple Ice Cream - We didn't think we had any room left, but figured why not? We received a heaping, refreshing bowl and finished the whole thing. A really nice surprise to close out an already transcendant meal. The real coconut chunks really sealed the deal for me.

Don't be fooled by the humble exterior, this place is the real deal. If you are anywhere in the vicinity of Las Vegas, this is a must stop.

Came here for lunch with my sister. Ordered the furikake chicken and kalbi ribs combo plate because I saw it on someone else's plate and it looked really good. It was good, but it was just slightly over-cooked. I ordered it again a few days later, and it was better. I suppose some days are good; just depends on the cook, maybe? But I'm not complaining. I was satisfied.

I typically check yelp scores before walking into a new restaurant. I drove by this place SO many times without giving it a chance because I stereotyped it. After getting a haircut at the barbershop next door, I was hungry and desperate so I walked in here for takeout. Boy oh boy this place is pretty darn good. Shoyu chicken is the Thursday special and its a sweet type of adobo that tastes great. The Kalbi short ribs are thick and VERY delicious. As a Korean guy, I'm telling you this is the best ribs in town! I don't think we have had anything we didn't like here. I highly recommend this place.

My favorite restaurant in Vegas, hands down. I lived in Vegas for a few years and still miss this place to this day.

With all of the culinary experts and great restaurants in the 702 area code it can be difficult to set yourself apart. This place does it by combining top of the line taste with comfort and a casual ambiance. 

Must trys: Kalbi ribs (personal favorite), Poke, furikake shrimp. 

Grab a spam masubi to go if they have any left by the time you get there.

I've been wanting to try this place for a while and finally had a chance yesterday. Because of 4.5 yelp rating, I was so excited and had certain expectations. Unfortunately all food was a total disappointment. 

Furikake Chicken: WAY TOO sweet. Too much batter. Couldn't eat more than 3 pieces.

Furikake shrimp: Overcooked, dry, salty. Ate only one piece

Kalbi short rib: ALL BURNT! After cutting out burnt parts, not much meat left to eat. It was bland and lacked flavor, but I thought bland is rather better than too sweet or salty.. 

Chicken katsu: Dry and not so crispy. Katsu dipping sauce is too thick and salty. 

Spam musubi: I didn't try so no comment on food but when my husband ordered, he had asked if they have teriyaki musubi as that is our son's favorite. They said they don't but they can give us teriyaki sauce on the side. My husband said ok and surprisingly, we were charged $1.75 for the teriyaki sauce. And btw the sauce was WAY TOO sweet and salty, even my 8 year old son didn't like it.. 

Plus this place is more expensive than other Hawaiian restaurants. I don't mind paying a dollar or two more per dish as long as food tastes good but too bad we didn't enjoy any dish. =(

YAyyy!  We found our favorite Hawaiian food spot here in Vegas.  Aaand you know this city has a million to choose from lol.  I lived in hawaii for about a year, and i've never had oxtai soup until recently at Island Flavor.  I was apprehensive at first, the thought of eating oxtail and all.  But I must say, i'm glad I gave it the benefit of the doubt, because it was delicious.  The broth  was so comforting, the meat of the oxtails were so tender, and the order is huge.  Now, i'm an avid oxtail soup eater at Island Flavor.

My husband swears by their korean chicken.  I've tried it and it's pretty good.  My 4 year old grubs on their barbecue chicken, which tastes ten times better than other hawaiian restaurant bbq chickens.  I also like how their beef is an actual steak.  None of that thin sliced beef teriyaki allllll the other mediocre hawaiian joints serve.
This lil hawaiian eatery just a lil bit on the side of vegas have awesome Ahi Poki! Theres a live guitar accoustic too! Even though it is rated #33 reason to visit vegas, for me it is top 5!
Great Hawaiian BBQ and friendly service. Their chicken katsu was perfectly battered and fried. The portions are huge and can probably feed two people. Pricing is affordable as well.

Aright so I moved to Vegas recently, but so far this is one of my favorite places to eat.  I came here for lunch yesterday with My T. and Thao T. and I have to say it was pretty dang awesome.  I haven't had lunch yet, so I'm getting hungry just thinking about it.

Aright, I'm going to give you the low down.  The portions are big here, so I would suggest you go with a couple people, and you guys all try each others' stuff.  These are the 3 things we got, and I'll probably get them again.  

1.  Korean Chicken - I have had wings like this once before in my life, and it was called Dry Fried Chicken at a restaurant in San Francisco called San Tung, and they are legit.  I wouldn't make a meal out of this, that's why I'm saying share.  Juiciest wings ever, and that Korean sauce is wicked

2.  Kalbi Short Ribs- Again, it's a lot of food, so most people would die if they had this whole plate.  They are so tender, you can pull them off the bone.  I want it now.

3.  Baby Back Ribs (can't find on menu for some reason, maybe new item) - My least favorite, but fantastic in the least.  It just doesn't compare to the top 2 items I mentioned.  

Owner served us, he's a great guy.  So humble, very chill vibe in the place.  You can tell it's really Hawaiian.  I will come back.

The staff: I wish I caught her name, she was incredibly friendly, especially towards the end.  It wasn't busy so I think she was actually the only server working.  But she was able to tend to our table and a few others, very efficient.

The goods: AMAZING.  I got the mixed plate with teriyaki chicken and furikake shrimp.  i was in heaven.  The meat was so tender and I could just pull it apart with my fork.  Sounds of food ecstasy kept coming from the other side of the table; my friend was really enjoying her meal as well.  And the portions were huge!  We ate a good amount and still had to get a to-go box for the rest of her Kalbi and my chicken.

The atmosphere: It reminded me so much of home.  They had satellite radio playing Hawaiian tunes; a very nice touch.  It wasn't done up all crazy, just a few pictures here and there, a wall fixture of the islands.  It had a very personal feel to it.  It reminded me of places we would eat when I was younger in Waianae; the same fading color scheme and plants, same kitchen layout.  It actually made me quite nostalgic.

After Aloha Grill closed down and Aloha Kitchen kind of went downhill, I thought my only hope for Hawaiian food would be the Marketstreet Cafe at the Cal, and I only go there for the saimin anyway.  But my "haole" friend as he refers to himself, instructed that it was CRUCIAL I check out Island Flavor.  I am so happy that I did.  Amazing food, and great quality for the price.  I was afraid it would be more on the pricy side because of other reviews, but that wasn't the case at all.  I was pleasantly surprised when I saw the bill.
First experience there was brilliant, it definitely won't be my last.

This was the worst Hawaiian food I've ever tasted! I'm not sure if I just ordered the wrong food or what happened since there are such high reviews here. I ordered the poke shoyu and the mixed plate with chicken katsu and Kalua cabbage. The poke was okay the sauce was very salty to me compared to what I've had before but I was able to eat all of it. The chicken katsu didn't have any sauce I'm not sure if it's suppose to come with it or not but the breaded chicken itself tasted like chicken nuggets you'd get from a banquet frozen dinner and the Kalua cabbage had No flavor no smokiness or any seasoning and was SUPER dry. I gave this place 2 stars because the macaroni salad was pretty good.

Researched on Yelp for some good Hawaiian food and found this little gem within 2 miles from our home. Who knew it was so close and had such great food.

This place was poppin, even at 8pm. About 10 people outside and two couples in front of us. We waited for about 15 minutes for a table and was pleasantly surprised to see live music  being played inside. They have live music on Friday and Saturday evenings between 6-8:30pm. 

We checked out the menu and ordered the furikake chicken 5/5 with fried rice and veggies and the chicken Katsu loco moco 4/5. The servings were extra large which meant plenty to take home for leftovers. Overall delicious Hawaiian style food.

I wanted to try the spam musubi but they were sold out. Will have to give it a try on my next visit.

The desserts also looked very delicious but we were so full we didn't save room.

The service was great and very nice 5/5. And the 10% Yelp cash back made everything a little better :-)

Always hit the spot. The portions are huge for the price. I love their poke and their fried poke salad. I think we've ordered every combo you can think of along with all the sides. Furakaki Chicken, beef stew, Hoisen ribs and kalbi are our favorite. Don't forget to leave room for desserts,  Chantilly, guava, haupai cake and coco puffs. 

They also offer daily specials and readily available spam musubi!

Two year's ago when my Family and I first ate here it was decent, nothing crazy amazing, but decent for local food with big portions and good mac salad. We didn't frequent here much after two years cause its a ways from where we live and like I said, the food is okay, not worth the drive for us. Last weekend my cousin ate here and said their poke was ono and we should give this place another try; so we did! 

The service was awful from the minute we walked in, granted it was a Fri nite, we didnt know they played hawaiian music on the weekends so they where busy. The cashier/fill in server (heavy set girl) was rude as hell! Chomping a mile a minute on her gum, no smile, no greeting and says "you guys got reservations?" I said "No", She then tells us "I gotta check if we can serve you guys den", and walks off. Wow!!! Local kine style would be...No worries, we goin make room for you guys, not to mention the fact that I don't know of any restaurant that would turn customers away! We immediately felt unwelcomed/uncomfortable from the get. I'm local, born and raised in Hawaii, so the lack of Aloha ecspecially from a Hawaiian place put me off even more!

She comes back tells us kay can, as she's seating us I tell her "sorry, I didn't know we needed to make a reservation", she tells us "no you no need, but mandatory that you do"... Huh?!?. As Im looking around, there is 3-4 tables with reserved signs. The table we got sat at, the one next to us(customers sat about the same time we did) and other tables with people already sitting had no reserved signs. Not to mention the fact that no customers came in after us for any reservations, just a couple people coming in to pick up their takeout order, so I don't get why she needed to ask if we could be served in the first place. The vibe I got was like, who you? You not our regulars, hurry up eat & get out! 

She seats us, right off the bat not letting us even look at the menu ask, "what we wanted to drink". I remember two years ago they had p.o.g . Was not even sure if they still had it? Wanted to at least ask my kids and Husband to see what they wanted to drink, we didnt even get the chance! Her attitude was hurry the f* up!, we ended up just getting waters after being rudely rushed. She brings us our waters and is ready to take our order, I was unsure of what I wanted so I asked if we could get a minute more. She looked irritated and walks off. She comes back 10 min later, giving me dirty looks. I'm trying to order and she's cutting me off while I'm talking, "you cant order it like dat, what you said? On da side?" Her attitude was just plain rude, again, like hurry the f* up! 

We get our food and it was not good. The lau lau plate was a chunk of dry, tasteless pork wrapped in one thin layer of luau leaves(luke warm in the middle and shaped like a rectangle loaf, looked nothing like lau lau) bummer it had no butterfish either. Worse part, as I'm eating my rice I find a short black hair in the middle...ewww! my Husbands terri beef meat was chewy and burnt, my daughter said her korean wings where dry and bland. The poke was ono and the mac salad was still as good tho. 

We already felt uncomfortable and just wanted to leave. Since we paid $50 for our food, we didnt want to just throw it out and thought we could give the leftovers to our dogs. We asked for boxes and got no bag for our 5 boxes, before we could even ask for a bag from a server (not the rude one) they ran off! You would think to give a bag if the customer got that many boxes no? 

Needless to say, we will not be returning here again. Rude unwelcoming service and subpar local food!

Lived down the street for 2 years and never knew this little place was here untill a friend took us. It is now our favorite place :) 
    Huge portions, a beef teriyaki plate will feed my two year old, my fiancé and I for only 9$ but we order our own food and fight over the leftovers hehe. 
    As for the decor, it could be a bit nicer but it makes it more comfortable then a big fancy restaurant. 
    Also the service, you don't really have a server when someone walks past they check on you and who ever is available takes your order. Sometimes it's better then others but normally service is amazing. 
    I highly recommend this place to anyone who likes Hawaiian food.

Um...yum!

I went quite a ways out of my way to eat here. All the reviews gave me hope for a good meal. I ordered a combo plate of chicken teriyaki and kalbi short ribs. To order the ribs in the combo is an extra $1. The plate came with 2 scoops of rice, 1 scoop of macaroni and a mountain of meat. I could not finish it all so now I have leftovers for later. The ribs had great flavor but they were kind of fatty, though that is where the flavor is... The chicken teriyaki was moist, not too sweet nor too salty.  All of this was $13 and change plus tip. Oh, and the waitress was good at refilling my water when I needed it and she brought be sriracha when I asked for it so she's good people in my book.

If I am in the area I will certainly go back. Check it out for yourself

Any Hawaiians looking for great local food in Vegas should definitely come here. Portions are HUGE but you must must must save room for their dessert (which is huge as well). I personally like to get the combination plate with kalbi and furikake chicken. The guava cake is also to die for. Also have great service!
Food almost always comes out quick. Friendly staff, clean venue with nice Hawaiian ambience. What makes this place legit are the constant island people who always dine here when I come.

This is easily the absolute BEST place for local style Hawaiian food in Vegas!  My family and I have tried other places and Island Flavor has everyone beat!  We've been living in Vegas for more than 10 years (born and raised in Honolulu) so we have a very good idea at what makes up good "local kind grindz"!

The food is so ono (delicious, for my non Hawaiians) and the portions are, as President Trump would say, YUGE!!! I had my usual mixed plate consisting of furikake chicken and steak and onions!  Yummy!  Wife had the same chicken and kalbi, younger kids shared a chicken katsu and older son and his girlfriend had two different versions of the loco moco.  Her loco moco had roast pork and his had chicken katsu.  Yeah, they were all good!  Wife and I shared a large slice of haupia ice cream pie for dessert. The whole meal was a festival of flavors in our mouths!

Along with the food, the ambiance of the place is worth mentioning too.  It always brings us home to Hawaii.  There's Hawaiian music playing in the background.  The place is decorated with Hawaii themed memorabilia and the workers are friendly, just like the people back home.

Bottom line: don't waste your time with the other places, they just don't stack up.  If you're craving truly authentic local Hawaiian food, then this is the place to be, period!
Food was delicious. Service was good but they could be a little more friendly. Prices weren't that bad.

Island Flavor is a go-to spot for a LOT of my friends during their trips to Vegas so I figured my trip wouldn't be complete unless I went, too! I honestly went in with pretty high expectations because of all the hype built up by my friends and I was not disappointed. My friend and I shared the spam musubi, furikake chicken, and the hawaiian roast pork with gravy.

SPAM MUSUBI. WOW. Honestly one of the best musubi's I've ever had. Everyone talks about how it's so simple to make, but every time I've tried to make it isn't quite as good as ordering from a Hawaiian restaurant. The rice was perfectly cooked and the furikake in the middle was a nice, sweet touch.

FURIKAKE CHICKEN. Okay, the hype for this is definitely real. And I wish they had this in LA. It reminded me of orange chicken, but with a slightly sweeter sauce. The breading of the chicken was really crispy but the inside of the chicken incredibly tender. So. Bomb.

HAWAIIAN ROAST PORK. This was a bit eh for me. I love the gravy that Hawaiians enjoy topping on their meat and I was definitely not disappointed by the gravy. The pork was very soft and tender but it had way too much fat on it and was not that pleasant. It was also a little tooo peppery for my taste.

All in all though, I was pretty impressed by Island Flavor. Especially because of it's cheap price and huuuuge portions  Definitely will be coming by again!

I was told by a good friend of myne that this place was awesome! He said that they served choke food! So I went with my ohana to check it out for myself. We were greeted by the nicest people you'll ever meet and the place was very clean too. We ordered da chicken katsu moco,chicken katsu, Portuguese bean soup, and to top it off... Chantilly cake!
Everything was ono!!!! I will definitely pass the word about this place and I will be back for the laulau next time!

Update: Da Lau Lau was so ono, I try to go every friday for my LAU LAU fix!

Aloha! I know it's odd getting Hawaiian food in Vegas but apparently, they do have a huge population of Hawaiians, thus the good restaurants you'll find here. Island Flavor is one perfect example.

We started with their very fresh shoyu POKE for appetizers. Half an order is half a pound for $7.25. It's hefty so it really is a steal! Color, taste, and texture of the tuna passed our standards with flying colors. 

With so many good things on their menu, it's rather convenient that they offer you the option to order a MIXED PLATE ($11.25) with two items and a side of rice (white or brown) plus salad or macaroni salad. Kalbi is an extra $1 but trust me when I say it's money well-spent. FURIKAKE CHICKEN and KALBI were my two choices. The chicken had a beautiful sweet and sour glazed exterior with seaweed flakes drizzled on it. Each bite had a good crisp and could make you work on a chew, but in a good way. The Kalbi beef was marinated and grilled to perfection pleasing my tastebuds while getting envious looks from others on the table who didn't order this. I looooove their macaroni salad here so don't be like my sister who opted to get a salad of greens and regretting it shortly after having a taste of my side order. 

The ROASTED PORK are shreds of meat doused with their own version of gravy that is out-of-this-world delicious. The taste reminds me so much of eating "lechon", a Filipino dish which is literally, roasted pork. In addition, their CHICKEN KATSU is remarkably right on the money. The breading was great in all aspects and how everything held together execution-wise was simply perfection. Our server messed up our order and gave us Korean chicken wings instead of the katsu in the beginning but she fixed it right away without even taking back the wings. Their KOREAN CHICKEN WINGS was bone-in with crispy skin outside and juicy meat inside. Flavor profile was good but I've had better. Bottom line, it's free so I can't complain.

It seems like the CHICKEN KATSU LOCO MOCO is the deal here so we also ordered that to share. An order is ginormous just like everything else we had. We only consumed half of it and took the rest home but the rave reviews on this dish is true to its words. A specialty not to be missed indeed!

Their GUAVA CAKE ($5) however was easily almost everyone's highlight on the table including those without a sweet tooth. Pair with it their refillable Kona coffee because there's just no other way for you to end a meal here. Ahhhfreakingmazing! Not only is it pretty in pink but the cake itself is moist and each layer of icing and guava syrup delivered its purpose giving you that tropical flavor you thought you could only get from the islands. Easily the best thing I ate here!

Service was a bit spotty, almost like on island mode but nonetheless they were friendly. With onolicious food, generous portions, and reasonable pricing, it's worth the little drive off the strip. 4.5 Stars!

Very poor customer service.  The server was a total bitch and we ended up leaving before getting our food.  I usually dine at island flavor at least twice a month because I love the teriyaki steak but I was treated so horrible that I will not be back!  Extremely disappointing.....

Food is great. A little bit pricier than other places but the portion of food is a lot that three of us couldn't finish.

This restaurant cares about what their customers think. Bruce, the owner of the restaurant responded me five mins after I left the review about the long waiting. So that make me change two stars to four.
Amazing food, friendly staff, great prices.  I would definitely go back here, hands down!

Whoa!  What a find!  We were just searching for some decent hawaiian food outside of the cal and we decided to check this place out.  We got a bunch of things so we could all try and we were all blown away with every dish!  

Hoisin Baby Back Ribs: Skeptical at first but dude, these rival the best baby backs that I've ever had.  Perfect crispiness on the outside.  Moist, fall-off-the-bone meat on the inside.  Perfect sweet glaze.  I think this was my favorite thing we tried.

Furikake Chicken: Wonderfully flavored.  Moist chunks of chicken.  Just good.

Kona Coffee: Yep... I'm putting the coffee on here cause it was good.  Another one I was skeptical of cause it came out of a typical diner style 'dennys' pot, but it was actually flavorful.  

Chicken Katsu Loco Moco: Probably had overly high expectations on this one, so wasn't as much of a fan as other people, but its still very good.  Gravy is flavorful and the egg just makes everything better.  

Guava Cake: We were all pretty stuffed after our meal so we were gonna pass on dessert.  We decided to share the guava cake though and OMG... so good!  Very light.  Not too sweet.  Perfect ending to a perfect meal.  More coffee please!

The only thing I would complain about is the service.  Dude that waited for us was slow and didn't seem to care.  Yeah, you could call him laid back, but it was almost like he knew he was getting an 18% tip cause we had a party of 6 and didn't even try.  I'm not gonna bash too much, but that could have been improved. 

Overall this was a great find and our whole party loved the food here.
Best Hawaiian food in town. Great portions. The seasoning on the spam musubi is so yummy.

Me and the husband love this place. The employees seem like their all related, which makes it feel homey. The portions are big and a good deal. The fried ahi poke salad is HUGE! I think 3 or even 4 people could munch on that. My husband always seems to get the loco moco and he never seems to finish it, trust me he can pack it away. I had the roast pork and I could not finish that plate as much as I tried to. We've also had their fried rice with egg and portuguese sausage. I really like this place and they seem to get alot of people in. The only cons of the place is #1 their closed in Sunday and Monday, #2 the place should be bigger because it seems sorta small and sometimes their people waiting outside or their cars just to eat there.

For casual Hawaiian in LV, this is the place.

What I had: I was in the mood for greens (after eating too much fried food and pizza), so I tried their salad, mixed plate of cabbage & pork + ribs.  My friend had fried noodles.   We couldn't even try dessert.

The salad was very simple just cut romaine with a couple of slices of some type of sweet purple potato (?), cucumber and tomato.  The dressing was really good and it was topped with all these crispy fried wontons.  nothing special, but pleasing.

The meals were really enjoyable.  Cabbage & pork is my comfort food, and this was perfectly seasoned and moist.  The ribs are to die for:  really must have.  And the fried noodle special was thoroughly enjoyable.  Can't wait to go back and explore more of the menu.

The service wasn't so good. I had to wait ten min for them to get to me and the lady that was helping me out didn't  seem like she was in a good mood also. 

I got a take out(Chicken katsu). When I arrived home, I found out they forgot to put the katsu sauce in there.. Which pretty much ruined a perfect meal.

Hopefully just a miss this last time.

Furikake chicken, hoisin ribs and loco mock were really good but the beef Teri and Korean wings were really salty.  And I like salty food.

But I know Island Flavor cares so they took care of it.

Will still come back.  Just hoping they correct the two dishes cuz want to order it again.

Went by for lunch today.  Ordered the roast pork loco moco.  Probably not the healthiest thing to eat but  I was starving.  Probably the most noticeable thing is the gut busting portions.  Holy carp!  The gravy lacked flavor.  The pork was was good but could be a little more tender.  I should have tried some of the more colorful dishes like the korean chicken.  Also, should have ordered a side of kimchee to put on top.  This place definitely has gut busting portions and good prices.  That's why I gave it the 4th star.  I'll try it again but next time it's the korean chicken wings

I've never been to Hawaii, but I adore their food.  It's a great balance of comforting calories and guiltless raw fish, playing with Asian flavors of sweet and salty.  And just as I imagine the warm culture of Aloha, I can taste the love, the bear hugs and coconut massages in the food of Island Flavor.

It's a tiny space, usually PACKED on weekends, and even if they have live music on Friday nights, the place remains to be a low key, well lit family restaurant.  Go here with family, with good friends and a HUGE appetite.

Hubby and I always get the same thing - half a Furikake ahi poke order, and we share a combo plate of Kalbi ribs and Korean fried chicken.. with extra macaroni salad and fries.  Real tasty stuff, and a good bang for your buck.  Our bill always stays within the $30 range.  Their teriyaki chicken, steak and onions hit the spot, and their Chantilly cake ROCKS.  It's also the first time I've ever tried a loco moco.  To the Filipinos out there, it tastes exactly like a burger steak meal with thick gravy, except it's served with egg.  Perfect hangover or stoner food.  Go go go.

Recommended to me by a Hawaiian friend, I came here for the first time with the family for lunch. The staff is real friendly, the atmosphere is relaxing, and the food is AWESOME!!! We tried a few different items off the menu such as the sesame Ahi Poke, melt in your mouth goodness, we had the Kalbi ribs which were cooked to perfection, flavorful and juicy, the Fruikake shrimp which was crispy and seasoned just right, the Saimin which was full of many wonderful goodies and a flavorful broth, the grilled steak and onions, delicious sauce and tender, fried rice, macaroni salad, and guava cake for dessert. The plates come FULL of food so you won't go hungry and perfectly priced. The Chantilly cake was recommended but the family wanted guava cake, 3 layers of moist, fruity goodness. It's about 20 minutes from Luxor but totally worth the drive. GO HERE!!!

This place is worth the small drive from the strip! Best Hawaiian food I have ever tasted hands down! 
All the food that was ordered was amazing in it's own way. 
Kalbi short rib 
Chicken Katsu loco moco
Furakake chicken 

I honestly can't decide which one was better . 

If the amazing food isn't going to convince you to come here, the hospitality definitely will. The lady helping us was so friendly and make us feel like we are lifelong friends. She correctly recommended items based on our cravings. She was also very accommodating with our special request with no problem.

Went here for the 1st time on my birthday. Food was really good, I had the Korean Chicken (wings) and they were very moist and tasty. I love chicken wings and these were in the top 10!
My husband had the Hoke Poke, and it came in a huge bowl full of rice, a large hamburger patty on top of the rice with 2 over easy eggs on top of that and drowned with brown gravy, a meal for 2 easy. Of course he ate it all.

Beings it was my birthday we ordered dessert, it was a hard decision between the Guava Cake and the Mud Pie.  We chose the Mud Pie, and it was awesome, a huge peice.  Oreo cookie crust, with coffee flavored frozen ice cream like pie with whipped cream drizzled with chocolate & raspberry.
 
 Here we thought oh boy we are packing in the calories & fat tonight when the waitress came over and asked how we liked it and told us that is was carb & sugar free!!  Wow, so we ate the whole thing right then and there!

The staff was very friendly and attenative!!
We will be returning again!!
A bit off the beaten path of the strip, but worth the drive. The food was fantastic. Reminded me of being back in Hawaii. Don't forget to try the guava cake. I will be back next time I am in Vegas ..

Tasty dishes + Huge portions + Low prices = Happy tummy & even Happier wallet.
To top it off, staff is so friendly... Treats you like family!

Can i just say big portions and affordable prices? Hell freakin Yes!!

My boyfriend and I were looking for some dinner options and stumbled upon this restaurant via yelp (thank you )

He orders the furikake chicken and i order the teriyaki chicken salad (watching my girlish figure.. pssh not really)

Anywho 
Furikake Chicken portion basically can feed 2 ppl (yup that huge of a portion)
and my salad was huge as well

both of us ended up eating only half of our dinner entrees and the rest was eaten for lunch the next day.

Taste wise?
Furikake chicken is so yummy! (yes i took a lil bit from my bfs plate cause it looked so appetizing) So crispy, soy saucy and sweet all at the same time

Teriyaki chicken salad came with a huge amount of creamy dressing - i only used half of it. It tasted of sesame oil/ garlicky goodness 
The salad had lettuce, tomatoes, crispy wontons and taro/ube in it! so satisfying!! wouldve liked more tomatoes though

Overall.. bomb food.. reasonably priced. This restaurant is here to stay

I have been here many times, my favorite Hawaiian food. 
Beautiful salads, excellent poke, and ribs.
I have never been disappointed.
The food is tasty, plentiful, and very reasonably priced.

One of my most favorite places to relax and enjoy hawaiian food! The environment feels exactly like Hawaii. My go-to is the chop steak & roast pork combo! Prices are very reasonable and they give perfect sized portions! Staff here is always friendly! Superb service!

It seemed really popular given how many "locals" were eating there but our food was way too salty and a few dollars more expensive than other Hawaiian places we've tried.

I still get a little sad that they replaced the aptly named Pho 777 that used to be here. Sniff, sniff.

HOPEFULLY THIS IS THE RIGHT SPOT!

I enjoyed eating here with my friends. The staff made me feel like I was back home in hawaii. 

The one thing about this place I loved:  THE PORTIONS WERE BIG! Just like back home in hawaii!  Most Hawaii BBQ spots are pricey and don't give much. This place the price was okay, but at least it was big. 

I'm sure to go back, its just far from where i live.

Seriously yummy!  I love Love Love Hawaiian food, Hawaiian people, the hospitality, oh But did I mention the food! This place was truly delicious! I got the Kalbi ribs and Korean fried chicken combo with Mac salad and rice! I ate every last drop , but I can't wait to go back. Every item that Walked past our table looked fantastic I want to try everything on this menu! The people were so friendly, the service is great, prices were reasonable, food was ready fresh and in a hurry! Highly recommend!
Super delicious food!!! Friendly staff.. My new favorite place. I love the furikake chicken and kalbi, per order is good for two person, just depends how you eat

I had the Kalibi Ribs and oh my goodness!!  Amazingly tender and the flavor was phenomenal.  I also had the Ahi Poki, which was ono-licious.  The Ahi was fresh and seasoned perfectly.  We went there on a Saturday night and there was a live band playing island music.  A very casual restaurant with amazing island flavor with huge portions and the staff was equally great.  You definitely feel the aloha here!

This is the place to go for authentic Hawaiian food. We went during peak hours for dinner on a Friday so we had to wait about 20 minutes. Once we sat down, our ears were treated to some live Hawaiian music. The food is spot on and we felt like we were back in Hawaii where we vacation often. I am a huge mac salad fan and this place did not disappoint.

It was me and my boyfriend's first time coming here, and let me say we will definintly be coming back. The service is fantastic, very friendly people. The enviroment makes you feel you're in Hawaii, it's very relaxing. 

Now the food, wow. We had the Furikake Ahi Poke and it was delicious. The portions of the food is 2x bigger than we expected. One plate can feed two people. If it's your first time, I would suggest a mixed plate. But be wary, the place gets busy very often. So try and make a reservation if you can. 5 stars!

Hands down the best Hawaiian restaurant! No other place compares to this place! The food just feels so authentic the staff is super friendly they make you feel at home! And make sure you order the guava juice!
AWESOME food and service!  Brings you back home with their menu and flavors.  Outstanding service....and Chantily cake and Coco Puffs
Great service and HUGE bomb portions  a must try. My island girls recommended me here.

First time here came with a small group. Great stop for your island fix. I ordered the mixed plate with ribs and teriyaki steak.  My GF would always make a point to stop here before she would leave Vegas . Definitely would come back again

Every time I'm in Vegas, I always stop here to get my hawaiian food fix! You can get lau lau, kalua pork, tripe stew, kalbi, chicken katsu, & roast pork to name a few hawaiian dishes... Even spam musubi & loco mocos!  All completely authentic! 

Plus, the atmosphere in there is just like back home. Hawaiian and Island style music fills the air! And on some occasions, they will also have live music!  The servers and staff are friendly and definitely spread the aloha spirit! I will always come back whenever I'm in town!

This is by far the best kine local grindz in Vegas it feels like homestyle kine cooking in the 808.  The portions are worth the price here the service is beyond 5star no complaints everyone is friendly the ahi pokè is so fresh like they caught it somewhere near by....i don't think anywhere can get this close to what they have here to serve u! Chicken katsu and hawaiian style pokè is 187!!
So yummy! I love Hawaiian food, and this is the best place I have been to in Vegas so far. Very authentic and delicious. Service was good too. Will be coming back for sure!

Island Flavor is my number one go to place in Vegas. Along with the food, the staff here is great. They are always friendly and attentive. Depending on when you come it can be pretty busy since it kind of is a smaller restaurant. If it is busy my usual wait time to be seated is usually 10-20 minutes.

Their food portion sizes are on the generous side compared to other restaurants and isn't pricey at all. I'll usually have enough leftover to have a small meal for another time as do most people that I've seen eating here. My usual order is the Furikake Chicken, but change it up now and then. I like the classic staple of the Loco Moco and the flavor of the Korean Chicken.

Ideally I'd like to see this location expand in size as well add more locations. They have another location on Eastern and Pebble is that location is closer for you.
Food is outstanding, service can be a little slow sometimes. Although I think that's just because they are always so busy!! We frequent them when we want Hawaiian food

Chicken katsu is my usual dish. I have only had it as pickup so can't speak to the service. Portions are huge and it definitely hits the spot. Macaroni salad is also great, not to mention larger than what you receive at other places.
Love the macaroni salad, ahi app, Korean wings, chicken teriyaki oh and the hamburger steak, basically we love everything

Decided to try Island Flavor again and I'm glad I did. Lunch was delicious and more than plentiful. The staff were all kind and attentive offering plenty of genuine smiles that made for a pleasant memorable experience. Can't wait to return and try the dessert. Highly recommend if you're in the mood for home style Hawaiian cuisine.

This is the best Hawaiian restaurant in town. The staff is very welcoming & friendly. The food is excellent & the portions are very generous. I just found out on Friday nights there is a live band performing. Any dish we order is outstanding.

Furikake chicken is probably the best here.. 5/5..crunchy, sweet,savory and a lot !  Their portions are so big that sharing is good here.

The teriyaki steak is tender and flavorful as well.  I don't really care for the macaroni sides.. it was just alright.

Dessert: guava cake was very moist and not too much guava flavor, just a hint of it.  I don't like the guava jelly.  3/5

Ono grindz!!!! Food makes me miss home so much. Take out or eat in is always delicious. Staff is always very friendly & they even play live music! Definitely a favorite spot to eat. Everything we have ordered here is delicious.

This place was outstanding!!! For folks that think this place was kind of pricey, I would think again. The amount of food given for the price charged is more than generous. My family had the spam musubi, furikake chicken, chicken katsu, and mixed plate (kal bi and teriyaki chicken). I was especially happy that they had the fruit punch normally served in Hawaii. Again, definitely a bang for your buck and I appreciate it that they had a military discount. Thank you for supporting us. Only downfall (in general) is I wish this place was closer to where I live (Northwest LV). Thanks again for the great experience and excellent food.

The food here is amazing! Huge portions and authentic flavors. 

Whenever I go to a Hawaiian restaurant I begin my experience with an order of spam musubi, just to kick off my meal. I ordered the furikake chicken and it's truly a mouth watering experience. Fried chicken glazed in a sweet and savory sauce with fried rice and a side of Mac salad.

We didn't have to wait too long to get seated, but there were plenty of people coming in and out. The only down fall was they seemed a bit short staffed, so getting our drinks and ordering took a little longer than what we were used to.

If you're going to eat here, you're going to have to be patient. They also do take out, if you're not the patient type. All in all food is great and customer service could be better.

Was in the area around lunch time and I mean literally in the area because this place is really out there. About a couple miles west of the 215 off the Durango exit, you will find a little bit paradise at this location. Well, foodwise anyway. 

As you come in, you will see that they have plenty of tables. Since it was lunchtime it was a bit busy but I was still able to get an open table. I was greeted warmly and was sat down right away. 

Looking over the menu, I decided to go with the mixed plate combo of Kalbi Ribs and Kalua Pork. I went with Brown rice for no extra charge which is a plus. Lastly, it comes with a side of Macaroni Salad.

I got 3 nice pieces of Kalbi Ribs. I thought they were a bit on the salty end but still ok. The Kalua Pork came in a cup mixed with cabbage and basically in its own cooked juices. Good flavor. The Macaroni Salad was really good. I can taste the pepper that has been mixed into it. The Brown Rice was a bit dry like they cooked it early in the morning and it has been on warm the whole time. Overall I think the Ribs could have been a little less salty and the Brown Rice maybe could of had some kind of teriyaki sauce on it so that it wouldnt of been so bland.

Service was pretty good. Got everything I needed in a timely manner. I spent a total of 13 bucks and some change because the if you get the Kalbi Ribs as one of your choices, its a dollar extra. 

Overall, its not a bad to place to eat especially if you are in the area. Next time I am thinking of trying their Poke Salad although people have said that it has doubled in price. I guess I missed out on those days then. Once I try it, we will see if its worth the price.

Yelp 2014 365 Review Challenge #107 "Island Flavor in the boonies, literally"

I give it four stars for spectacular flavors in the spare ribs, teriyaki chicken, and the shrimp. However, the meat quality is not always great. The steak and ribs were too fatty for my preference. I would pay twice as much for higher quality options with the same intense savory flavor. Also, the music was a bit loud for the size of this place
Best Hawaiian food! It's so authentic and the vibe and music makes you feel as if you are on the island.
Damn good food. Fresh made to order.  Taste of the islands at its best.  Popular spot for live music on Friday. Friendly staff and wait help.

The service was awesome. The food portions are crazy large! Definitely shareable foods! I didn't even finish a quarter of my plate. I got the plate with two main items and two sides. The kalbi beef and the furikake chicken. Our group also got the oxtail soup. My buddy got the roast pork which was my favorite. Reminded me of comfort food I ate as a kid. Hawaiian dishes in Vegas and they did a great job. If you're hungry then I definitely recommend this.

Recommendation: Roast pork, furikake chicken, and oxtail soup

Definitely feel like a glutinous slob after this meal!!! HUGE portions, friendly staff and delicious food. What more can you ask for?

Feeding my Hawaiian food addiction, we finally ventured to Egypt to eat here. I've eaten here before, but it's been years and wanted to see if it was as good as I remembered. After looking at pics prior to our visit, we opted for sesame poke, furikake chicken and kalbi short ribs. When our food finally arrived, we both knew there was no way we were going to eat all of it.

The poke came out first. They offer different flavors; furikake, shoyu or sesame. We opted for the sesame and it was delish.  Lots of onions for crunch, fresh fish and a good amount of seasoning. 5 stars.

I ordered the furikake chicken which comes with macaroni salad and I opted for brown rice. For everyone who doesn't know what furikake is, it's a seasoning containing bits of seaweed, sesame seeds and salt. The chicken was fried to a good crisp and the furikake added that extra flavor. The mac salad was good and creamy, a bit heavy on the mayo but it was still good. The only  thing I didn't like was the brown rice. It was just too mushy. It was like normal white rice but brown. I like the pieces of my brown rice not to be stuck together. Had to drop this to 3 stars cuz the rice was a huge disappointment. 

The bf ordered the Kalbi ribs. These ribs were like Kalbi ribs on steroids. (Only saying that for description.) They were huge, thick pieces of meat, not the thinner pieces you are normally used to eating. Good char on the meat and good ratio of fat. 5 stars for this. 

All in all, solid Hawaiian food joint. I will definitely be back if I am in the area.

Ordered catering.. for time specific .. they didn't know we had an order  until we arrived and they had to revise the menu without having comparable --  had to wait an hour and a half to get food ready - and we had had hungry guests -- DONT ACCEPT CATERING ORDERS IF YOU KNOW YOU WONT BE ABLE TO FUFILL IT !!   Chicken Katsu as a substitute for sweet and sour spareribs is not comparable ! Not even one star ..

I am comparing Island Flavors to Zippy (if you are from Hawaii you will be familiar with Zippys). I would rate Zippys 4 stars, but I'd give this place 5 stars.  They have a smaller menu than Zippys but everything they offer is 5 stars.  I've had the Roast pork, Furikake Chicken and the Loco Moco here with the Chantilly Cake.  This is easily one of the best Hawaiian restaurants in Las Vegas. The only issue is limited seating inside the restaurant, because it has become so popular with the Hawaiian transplants in Vegas, the wait could be 30-45 minutes for a table but the food is worth it.

This is probably my favorite lunch spot in town. It doesn't look like much from the road considering it's in a plain shopping center, but trust me this place is a diamond in the rough. Awesome atmosphere when you walk in with a nice island vibe and laid back tunes playing at a comfortable level. The food is amazing here and no matter what I've ordered I've loved it. The portions are huge! Usually when portions are big they skimp out on the quality but not this place. All the chicken and need dishes are amazing and the Mac salad is one of the better Mac salads I've had. This place can get busy though so make sure you have a little time to wait. Trust me the wait is worth it and you won't regret stopping in!

The food and portions are good. As for customer service and "aloha" atmosphere..did not see it or feel it from the staff. Seemed not friendly and no smiles. Sorry I would have rated this better if the staff was more customer service friendly. Other Hawaiin restaurants have  better customer service.
Love this place oxtail soup and furikake chicken are my favorite !!!! i always suggest this place to all the people i know i come here atleast 2x a month maybe even more sometimes !!!!

I have a hate love relationship with this place. I love the food so much, which is why I keep going. I hate the take-out service, they have the worse phone service and heres why. A lot of the time they will not even answer their phone, other times they will answer and instantly hang up, and the worst is when they answer and put you on hold indefinitely. Food wise this is one of the best Hawaiian resturants I have been to, and believe me I have been actively searching for a place to replace this one. I would give the place 2.5 stars but not 3 because the service is a headache its like I have to bother them to take my business.

Why am I am giving this establishment a meager 2 stars? Short story: OK food doesn't make up for bad service. And bad service should never be present at a hawaiian restaurant. Chinese, OK. Hawaiian, no.

Long story:
My sister was visiting with her baby and I wanted to take her, the baby, my dad and my brother somewhere near my area for a quick lunch. I found Island Flavor on my Yelp app and liked what I saw. It wasn't very packed when we came in and they had enough room for our small stroller. Immediately noticed our waitress seemed perturbed that we had brought the stroller in. As we sat down, my sister noticed that her child needed a diaper change so she asked the waitress if they had a changing area in their restroom. Nope. But that was ok, not all restaurants have this luxury. So she took her baby back to the car to change her there. She was back in around 10 minutes and as soon as she sat down, our waitress came by and asked if we were ready to order. We look up at her quizzically because I was sure that she saw my sister just sat down. The waitress scowling then adds, "Are you ready? Yes or no?" I chose to ignore her curt behavior at that moment. My sister quickly made a decision and we got our food. 

The portions were very plentiful. My dad and sister's order of kalbi ribs was pretty good. My porkchops however were bland and were not grilled as how I imagined porkchops would be. My brother's chicken barbecue was just OK but not as good as other hawaiian barbecue places. After we all got a drink refill, our surly waitress never came back to check on us. I even had to ask for the check from another waitress who I overheard talking to another customer. I believe she said that the owner was at the cash register and that our sour waitress was apparently the owner's daughter. Well, after what seemed like forever, the entire restaurant is almost empty and no waitress to take our credit card, we all get up and I hand our payment to the cashier/owner. I believe we have been perfectly reasonable customers and the baby didn't even make a big fuss so I'm very perturbed by this place. More unforgivable that an owner shows bad customer service at a hawaiian restaurant. The aloha spirit has left this building, folks.
Great customer service.  Katsu loco moco....Awesome!  I'll definitely be back again and again.

It seriously felt like I was back home in Hawaii eating a plate lunch. The vibe was just that good ol' local feel.

Prices aren't the cheapest but Hawaiian food is never really cheap, portions were huge, and the food was good. Even the cake slice was huge. I think they get it from the cake store next door but it's still good.

This is my current favorite spot for a quick 'take me back' getaway.

Came here on a packed Friday, but we were still seated fairly quickly and got to enjoy some chill island music and vibes from the person performing that night. He did a great job making people laugh, having some playful banter and just keeping the overall mood light and fun. Be sure to tip the performer too if you find yourself grooving along :D. I got the Laulau which is usually only available on Friday nights. It contains haupia (coconut-flavored) and smoked fish flavors, but I happen to be a really big fan of those seemingly conflicting tastes and would definitely order it again. The other Hawaiian staples all look delicious here and their portions are huge! You'll definitely have enough food for breakfast or lunch the next day and I would recommend everyone at the table getting something different so you can get a taste of everything. I've also been craving POG since I was last in Hawaii, so I was excited to see that they give 50 cent refills here! I was super appreciative that the owner took time to talk to us on a busy night and welcome us since it was our first time here. He even apologized for the not-so-long wait, which was actually the most enjoyable wait I've ever had at any restaurant. This is definitely a great place to bring friends and family, without the hustle and bustle of the strip.

We used our restaurant.com certificate here and I gotta say I would come back even without the coupon. We're from California where there's plenty of Hawaiian joints including L&L and we gotta say this place is awesome. Of all the Hawaiian places we've eaten including those in Hawaii, this has been the best so far. The Korean chicken and the shrimp were our favorites. Mac salad was not our favorite but Hawaiian food is not all about mac salad. The restaurant was very clean and our waitress was awesome.

I wish we have a place like this in San Jose.

This place is definitely a gem in Las Vegas. The food is absolutely delish, especially the gravy! The portions are definitely HUGE! We ordered 2 dishes to take out for the 2 of us and lasted us 3 meals. Wish we tried this place earlier as it is so close to our home.

I am Hawaiian, & that has nothing to do with my one star of this place. We went there based on The Las Vegas Weekly review & Yelp. Boy were we disappointed. We ordered a combo plate of the chicken katsu & the roasted pork. The katsu was just breaded chicken with no flavor & the 2 sauces it came with were like sweet ketchup... YUCK! Then the roasted pork was so salty & dry. DOUBLE YUCK. We also ordered the Korean chicken wings, they were okay, that's it & the pork fried rice was bland & funky tasting. There was plenty of food, but it was horrible. We figured they may be able to redeem themselves with the Haupia cake.... .nope, it sucked too.  All the waitresses seemed distracted & there was only 3 tables filled. Whoever gave this place 5 stars, needs to get their taste buds examined... DON'T SAY I DIDN'T WARN YOU.

This place has been a favorite for years until recently when ownership changed. The menu changed and portions were cut in half if not more. They still have their great staff (reason for the 3 stars) and food is still good, but it's not as good a quality as it was before. My husband's favorite dish the pork chops are now cut very thin and dry. He was not happy. My son says his favorites furakaki chicken doesn't taste the same with lots of chewy pieces (I think he was talking about the ligaments in the chicken). We are now on the lookout for another Hawaiian favorite.

Choke food, and not that bad of a price.  Island Flavors plates kinda of reminded me of Masu massive plate lunch on Oahu.  So pretty much you'll be taking home leftovers when you come here.

The entire staff is very cool, but service can be very much like a bottle neck from 95 going to the spaghetti bowl during rush hour, but what the heck, this is a Big Island restaurant....we all take our time, and get it right most of the time.

When I come here, I usually get the teriyaki beef, and Korean chicken combo.   The portion is are opu-busting, and teriyaki is very good.   The chicken was a pre made fried chicken, but the Hawaiian style Korean sauce this chicken is dipped in made it a keeper.   

Why the four stars, the Portuguese bean soup is too darn sweet, and have way too many beans, and not enough meat.  Also the mac salad was a bland Oahu style mac salad...not too impressive with those two items.

Only once, i made it out there for the Friday night for their Hawaiian combo plate, and the Lau Lau is pretty killer.      I highly recommend this plate, but I hate this drive on a Friday night from Henderson.

THE INCIDENT
I found Island Flavor by mistake one day while getting gas at the local Short Line Express.  It just so happens while I was at the pump, I miraculously look away from the ever-changing numbers of the digital LCD and see "GRAND OPENING" for a Hawaiian themed restaurant.   It must have been fate that I saw it or close enough for me to see since I'm near blind as a bat.  Hmm, Hawaiian sounded good to me that night...yummo!  So, since I paid for my gas w/my debit card, I trudged my rear end into the Short Line Express for a pack of cigs and to ask the store clerk if she thought the restaurant was any good.  In her thick Asian accent, "Oh yes!  Vewwy goo!!!  Goo, goo."  Sho'nuff, she was right!!  

THE PARKING LOT
Because I'm lazy, I drive from the convenience store to Island Flavor, which is in the same parking lot, possibly 100 feet away.  HEY, they made cars for a reason!!!!!

Island Flavor is on the right side of a strip mall next to Short Line Express convenience store.  The strip mall also houses a dance studio, massage parlor, Familia Pizzeria (I just posted a review for this one), and some other small businesses.  If you are looking for an easy way to find it while driving, look for Bomas Bar & Grill.  Island Flavor is fairly new, in fact, I had to "Add a Business" on Yelp to review it.  When I got into the restaurant the server told me it just opened back in October 2008.

THE DECOR
Anyways, once inside there wasn't much ambiance.  I think they're still trying to find their niche to whom they will identify with.  Though, the waitresses did wear floral blouses with dark trousers.  In the center of the restaurant sits a large square granite bar which looks like it was supposed to be a hibachi grill or regular bar.  There's no alcohol back there or any cooking utensils.  Who knows?  I only know this because I chose to sit up there while I waited for my (take out) food; I didn't want to disturb any of the waitresses' clean tables.  Around the bar, there sits about a dozen or so plain dining tables.  

THE MENU
Ahh...this is what you really want to read...They serve all of the traditional island fare from...ahi, burgers, chicken katsu, KALUA PIG, kalbi ribs, loco moco, mixed plates, saimin, teriyaki.  For my fellow SPAM lovers, I did NOT see musubi.  Maybe we have to ask?  Okay, so this is how I judge Hawaiian restaurants...kalua pig.  Theirs was EXCELLENT, BOMB SHIZZLE, FANeff'NTASTIC!  The downside...their prices are a tid bit higher ($1-2 more) than your other Hawaiian restaurants.  To me, it's still worth it.  I guess you figured out what I ordered for take out, Kalua Pig (no cabbage) w/rice and a side of brown gravy.  The total was $10.51 w/tax included.

THE HOURS TO COME BY
Monday-Friday 11am-9pm
Saturday           11am-8pm
Sundays & Holidays Closed

THE CONCLUSION
When we dine or get take out here again, I'll update this review to include more of their menu.  Support the locals, this place impressed me with their food.  Oh yeah, my bf who had my leftovers thought it was EXCELLENT, BOMB SHIZZLE, FANeff'NTASTIC as well!

I love days like today. I love it when I discover a fantastic place that serves tasty and flavorful food, with generous portions, providing friendly service, .....and all at a good price. Today we discovered Island Flavor! 

In an effort to try as many different things as we could we each ordered a Mixed Plate Combo (which comes with your choice of 2 meats, rice/or fries, salad/or mac salad.) ($11.25 each, with an added charge of $1.00 for kalbi). I ordered the kalbi and teriyaki beef while my friend ordered the furikake chicken and hamburger steak. We both had the white rice and mac salad as sides and also ordered a side of fried rice with portugese sausage.

- Portion sizes are very generous! We actually ended up taking some of the food to go because we quickly realized how much we had ordered! lol Very filling and very satisfying!
- I tried all 4 meats and have to say that all 4 were tremendous! The teriyaki beef and kalbi certainly stood out for me in  big way. These are going to be two items that I will be ordering quite frequently in the future! So juicy and each item packed so much flavor!
- With that being said, this was my first time trying furikake chicken and I was not disappointed at all! Very crisp outer layer and juicy, meaty, and tender inside! The hamburger steak was also some of the best I've had in recent memory!
- Service was fantastic from the word go! We were acknowledged and seated right away. Refills were taken care of in a friendly and expeditious fashion. Everyone I interacted with was friendly and smiling. I can't think of a way it could have gone better from a service standpoint. Very, very satisfied.

This is a slam dunk as far as I am concerned. You can bet that we will be here many times in the future for both dining in and taking orders to go! What a great find!

I love days like this! Now I'm ready to lay down and take a nap after eating all that  delicious goodness!


5 stars.

As good as it freaking gets!
My boyfriend brought me here and I LOVE IT!! I cant wait to go again, food was great!! No doubt about it, you have to try this place!!

I have a friend (hi, Garrett O.) who can eat an inordinate amount of food. If I have yet to clean my plate, I can knowingly pass my leftovers along to him to finish it off. At Island Flavor, he'd be an invaluable asset to me.

The portions here are fit for a proper luau. You get an inordinate amount of food for most humans to consume in a single serving, so I highly advise splitting dishes unless you're the type to go HAM at buffets - which, in Vegas, wouldn't be hard to believe.

Mixed plate is my jam: 2 meats with 2 scoops of rice for about $12 is unbeatable. With kalbi (an extra $1) and furikake - my tummy is rumbling just thinking about how good it was.

Did I mention how much food you get here? I left a couple pieces of chicken on my plate because I was about to burst, and my hotel room didn't have a fridge for leftovers. Garrett O., where are you???

The overall environment is what you'd expect of a Hawaiian restaurant - friendly, laid back, chill. You feel like a part of the family by just dining here.

Island Flavor is a definite pit stop the next time I'm in Vegas. And Garrett O., you're coming with me!

The place is packed with islanders every time we go. I love everything I've ever had but my main favorite is the mix bbq meal which gives you more meat than anyone should consume. I also get the spam musubi.  Always have leftovers and save the musubi for a snack. This food makes me happy and full in the best way. Sooo good.

I find it quite hilarious that I thought I was calling in an order to the Hawaiian takeout place that's in the same shopping center of the Vons at Warm Springs & Durango (I had ordered takeout there before but had forgotten the name). I called the order in and then, when I saw the address, realized I had ordered from a different place!  

Being a business owner myself, of course I didn't want to leave my order uncalled for so I went down a few blocks and retrieved my order from Island Flavor. What a pleasant surprise!

I only ordered two plates: chicken Katsu and kalbi beef (?). The question mark is there because I swear when she confirmed the order it sounded so different than how I had pronounced it. 

That beef was insane! So tender and delicious. The Katsu was good as to be expected at other Hawaiian places I've been. 

I will definitely return and I'm glad I made that mistake! I actually hate macaroni salad because I hate mayo, but this was decent and had great onion flavor.

I almost feel bad about not giving this place 5 stars. It *absolutely* deserves the 4.5. It's absolutely the best hawaiian dining place I've been to in Vegas. At other places, things are a but too dry, a bit too chewy, a bit too small. This place hit all the marks. 

My only gripe was the wings were a *bit* too salty. Just a bit. They've got just the right amount of breading, crunch, moisture, sweetness, and savoriness. They're just a skooch too salty. The Kalbi was the real surprise here. I always feel like Kalbi's a gamble. This kalbi was a good one. Not too sweet, not too chewy, not too fatty, and they give you a nice meat-cuttin' knife just to make it that much easier on you. 

This place is dope. I was in a hurry to get back to work, had a brain fart, forgot to leave a tip while paying at the register, I'll be back at 5:10, right after I get off work PLEASE DON'T BE MAD AT ME. FIVE STARS.

Also, they have daily specials on their physical menu that I didn't see online. Peep those
Oh this place is like back in Hawaii! Great food! Excellent prices! And remember save room for dessert!  Coco puffs, haupia cake, guava cake and lot more! Highly recommend this place!

We always love the food here. Can seem pricy compared to other Hawaiian places, but the portions are large to compensate for that. We often get two or more meals out of one plate! Never had any issues with the food, and every time our family is in town they like to go here. The staff is always friendly and treats you well. I often order ahead and pick it up to take him. Very satisfying food to a crazy work day! Highly recommended.
Our faves: mixed plate beef teriyaki and kalbi ribs, poke, and katsu. Don't forget the desserts!!

This is the best Hawaiian food I have had outside of actually being in Hawaii. 10 years living in Vegas I hadn't been able to find any worth mentioning. But THIS place?! Wow. The furikake chicken is literally perfect! It has so much flavor and so evenly glazed. The Mac salad is regular but when you mix it with the rice and furikake glaze its an explosion of goodness! I am so glad I live by this place and as long as I do, I will NEVER go to L&L or any places like that again. Amazing!

This was my first time trying Hawaiian bbq, and I must say, that while I enjoyed the flavors and tastes, I felt the execution was rather poor.

While we didn't have to wait for a table (party of 2-myself and my boyfriend), we did wait an extremely long time for a server to come take our drink orders. They seemed very understaffed for a Friday afternoon/early evening. Our server was very nice, and she even brought out a sample of their special stew for me to try, and she gave me props for even trying it, considering I'd never had Hawaiian food before. I ended up ordering a combination plate with chicken katsu and beef teriyaki. 

After the waitress took our food orders, a rather large party of 10 or so people came in, and she asked us if we would mind moving to another table to accomodate the party (pushing the tables/chairs together), so we moved, and she said she would give us dessert on the house, which I thought was really nice of her.

We ended up waiting around 40 minutes for our food. I was starving at this point. They must have been short staffed in the kitchen as well. I dug in to my food the second I got it. Their macaroni salad was divine. I have never had macaroni salad that tasted that good before; it was this creamy and salty sensation that hit all the right taste buds. I wish I had more of it. Their rice was just as amazing. I felt like I could have eaten 4 scoops of it instead of 2. 

The entrees weren't as good as I hoped. The chicken were cut into huge pieces, which I thought was a plus, but that katsu sauce was extremely salty and potent. I only put a dab onto each piece and it still overpowered the chicken completely. I didn't care for the sauce at all. It was so salty and meaty tasting (probably loaded with MSG) that it made me dislike the dish. I had better hope for the beef teriyaki, but that let me down as well. It was again, extremely salty, almost to the point of where I couldn't eat it. The meat wasn't cooked uniformly, some pieces were immensely rare, and others were extremely well done. The meat was also very fatty, and I didn't enjoy having to constantly cut off the fatty parts from the meaty parts.

The meal was really saved by dessert. Their mud pie was so huge! I have never seen one like that before. It was covered in whipped cream (yum), nuts, and a duo of caramel and chocolate sauces along with a drizzle of honey. It was perfection. I wanted to eat all of it, but alas, my stomach is only so big. I savored the parts with the crust the most, but this was definitely one of the best desserts I've ever had the pleasure of eating.

Overall, the service was good, the wait times were atrocious, and the food was hit or miss; thus, deserving of 3 stars.

Definitely worth the quick drive from the strip to enjoy authentic Hawaiian cuisine and aloha. The food is so fresh and Delicious. Not to mention extremely authentic. The staff is very kind and the service is quick. The poke is great!! We also got kahlua and fruikake chicken. So amazingly delicious. We will come back!

Alway great service  for the price , the rice was dry on the outside, like they left it out for an hour under heat lamp,  it every thing else was great and lots. Hawaiian should not have dry out rice we are from the islands.

Usually like this place but, they need a more than less crunchy furikake chicken. I know it is double deep fried, but for it to be SO crunchy is unnecessary. You cut your mouth up just eating or your jaw hurts from chewing so much on the first bite. It's so unbearable. SOMETIMES it is good when I order, but most of the time, it's like a dig gnawing at a bone. They should have like different levels of how to deep fry the furikake chicken. Somethings like when ordering a steak. Where they ask if you want it medium, rare, or something like that... I don't know about this place...

I don't normally yelp. But today I had tried island flavor for the first time. And it was ONO! Worth yelping.  I ordered  Kalbi, was tasty! Furikake chicken... amazing! Portion size, huge. When I left I had extra food that made another plate lunch. Yes that's how much food they give. Must try!!! Friendly ladies that was working as well! I will definitely be back!

Growing up on an island, I was so stoked to try out this place based on the reviews! 

Island flavor is a friendly casual environment that has a  lot of diverse to it. Their chicken wings is yummy! The proportions of the food is very large but growing an appetite ever since I moved out to Vegas, I can finish the whole meal that was served :) I also loved their fried rice with eggs on top and sausages. A true Hawaiian plate.

Love the Hawaiian atmosphere... always feel like I'm at home when I come here.  

I get full just thinking about the amount of food they give you for the price.  The staff is always full of aloha... even the tita's. Lol.  I've had everything on the menu even the specials they have going on everyday and  I love everything.  It makes it so hard to decide when I go there.

They put their own Big Island twist on Hawaiian Food that gives it that extra wow factor. I was going to explain each dish but I can't write anymore bc im making myself hungry.  

Try it and you'll love it.  I'm gonna go grind there now. =)

And for the locals 411 they got GUAVA CAKE!!!

Musubi good poke good Kalbi good but the chicken furikake taste good but I wish they would drain the extra sauce it was too greasy but they have my favorite which is guava cake which made my day will be retuning to try other things..my nieces aunt owns this place so I must show support

This place is in Rhodes Ranch or on Durango a couple miles south of Warm Springs on the East side of Durango.  Had the fried chicken.  Came with a scoop of mac salad and two scoops of rice.  The chicken was perfectly cooked.  Got a wing, drumstick, thigh and breast.  All was tender especially the breast.  I expected the coating to be sweeter but it tasted great anyway.  Everyone in my group loved their food.  Poke was excellent.    They serve a lot of food so prepare to take some home.  Oh, heard the cakes are great.  Heard they are made by the cake store in the same shopping center.  So, take some leftovers home and enjoy the cake.

Guys at Island Flavor: "Oh, back again, huh?"  

Ummm, I totally Yelped this place a week before going to Vegas and came here twice in three days.

So I totally live for plate lunch.  Note that my profile's "last meal on earth" is Hawaiian plate lunch, and my home city is surprisingly short on Hawaiian restaurants. (So short the number is zero.) So I had to get a fix in! Or two or five.

The meals here are so big that it just hurts. There's a reason why 90% of the bouncers at XS are Samoan. They don't get that kind of mass needed to punch creepy misbehaving guys in clubs by eating salad. I've made 5 meals out of my 2.

This is the most legit Hawaiian food I have had in the lower 48. Everything is seasoned well and tastes sooo bombbbbb. SO. MUCH. FLAVOR. 

Service - 5/5 All the waiters working here are legit! Either they got island accents or fake them like bosses. Love how genuinely nice they are. Service is not over-the-top or fake. Just nice people being nice and bringing me tasty things. (If you split a plate, don't forget to tip like you ordered two entrees! These guys won't make sheet otherwise!)

Food:
Basic menu is on website, but they have a paper insert with daily specials. So if you're calling an order for take-out, ask them if what the specials of the day are! Also, the desserts aren't on the menu. They are listed on the table (see picture). 

Aloha Friday: Come early so you can get a seat! This place is jam packed on Friday! They have the most amazing family come out and play bass, uke, and guitar while singing traditional Hawaiian music. I grew up on an island, and it felt like coming home. I didn't realize I was getting my soul healed while eating lau lau.

- Lau lau- 5/5 wrapped in delicious leaves, juicy, and the perfect saltiness when you eat it with rice!
- Lomi salmon- 2/5 This was almost all tomato and no salmon :( I guess it counted as my vegetable of the day?
- Mac Salad- the guy asked me "Are you sure?" when I said I was fine with the mac salad and white rice. Was he expecting me to sub a vegetable instead? Please, bee-atch. I'm not from California.
- Kalbi ribs- 5/5 These are BOMB! Way thick slices and grilled with a nice caramelization on them! They don't skimp, and the pieces are super big!
