- Furikake chicken- 5/5 Super crunchy exterior so that it stands up to the glaze and stays super crunchy. You know how Panda Express orange chicken gets all soft if it's been sitting there awhile? No flaccid chicken here, folks.
- Haupia cake- 5/5 I used to work at a bakery on island, and we made haupia cake. Theirs here is even better. The cake itself is perfect density, and the flavor is dynamite.
- Kona pie- 2/5 Ehhhh eat the haupia and guava cake instead! The coffee flavor isn't strong, and the other sauces they schlepp on the plate overpower any coffee taste.

I'm glad this place isn't in my home city. I'm not looking for employment as a Samoan bouncer at XS quite yet, which is what I would probably be if I lived in Vegas and continued eating here. Fill up on aloha spirit, leave happy, and then go take a nap.

I have only eaten Hawaiian food about three other times at L&L Hawaiian BBQ. I wasn't very impressed with their food at all but I thought it was because it was more of a fast food restaurant. I read all the great reviews about Island Flavor and was anxious to give it a shot. The restaurant itself is clean and the staff is pretty friendly. I ordered the Hawaiian Special which was LauLau with a side of fried rice, macaroni salad, some fish and tomatoes, and a creamy white dessert. 

LauLau is tender BBQ'd pork served in some type of edible leaf. I was told the leaves were edible so I cut it all up and added the house bbq sauce. The leaf was very bitter and odd tasting. It completely ruined the flavor of EVERYTHING else that was in my mouth so I moved as much of it aside as I could. After that, the meal wasn't horrible, but it didn't really impress me either. My friend ordered the saimin which is a bowl of ramen in broth and sprinkled with egg, imitation seafood and vegetables. He told me the broth was incredibly bland. Needless to say, I don't think that we will be keeping this place on our list of incredible places to eat.

Decided to stop here for breakfast on the way to Redrock.  I had the Loco Moco with a side of fries and wife had the Portuguese sausage and eggs with a side of mac salad.  The portions here are incredible.  The fries came in a bowl that would equate to 8 large orders of McDonalds' fries.  It is the first time I have not been able to finish an order of Loco Moco - it was a huge patty with generous gravy and a "pot" of rice.

With that being said, service was so-so and food quality was average compared to other Hawaiian food out there.  So three stars it is...

Really good poke! I like that they offer fried poke too :-) I ordered the Kalua Pig, but it was really dry :-( 
Overall, this place is more legit than other "Hawaiian" places I've tried :-)

Huge portions love furikake chicken but I always order that so I changed it to Korean chicken and now back to furikake shrimp!!! Thank God they butterfly the shrimp coz last time I ordered it it was with skin, battered, fried with furikake not so very good. I love this restaurant but it's not consistent. Last time we had the Poke sooooo salty swimming in soy sauce. Lately so bland we had to put sauce sauce. Wish they can be consistent. Service improved and the owner is always very friendly.
The vibe is good, the employees are nice, the food is great, but what's worth it is the portion! Large meals for a great price!
We eat every time we're in Vegas. Their Furikake chicken is full of flavor. The servings are huge and the price is affordable.  It's not your typical tourist area, but there's plenty of parking.
Best Hawaiian restaurant in Las Vegas. Hands down.

When it comes to island flavor, they sure have it.  This restaurant is small, quaint, and fast.  Frank and I stopped by here on our way to check out our new home nearby, and when we walked in it felt as if we were back on Guam at some mom and pop restaurant.  The staff is friendly and helped a lot when it came to choosing lunch.

I grabbed their ribeye steak with white rice.  It comes smothered in grilled onions and mushrooms, just how we make it back home.  It was delicious, but I have to say that they have this adobo-like chicken dish that Frank ate, and the sauce was CRAZY GOOD.  I poured it over my steak and rice after tasting it!

Love the food, love the people, and I will stick with the local fare rather than their American choices, because they do their food the best.  '

Oh, and save room for dessert.  Their haupia cake is HUGE and can feed four people, or two hungry islanders like Frank and I.

Stop by, say hello, and chow down at island flavor.

This place has been on my "must try" list for over a year and all I have to say is I should have tried it over a year ago...it was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING...I have never been to Hawaii but if Hawaiian food is anything like what they serve here...I'm on the next plane out!

I was not disappointed.  

Had the Loco Moco, and it was an extremely hearty portion.  The gravy used to smother it all was very tasty.  Even the beef patty seemed high quality. 

I will be back!

OMG. We love island food, and this was the best ever - ridiculously good and served in ridiculously gigantic portions. My bowl of roast pork loco moco (a special) could have been breakfast, lunch, and dinner for me. So good! Everyone in our group of four loved the food. This is the place! (The guava cake looks astoundingly good but needless to say, we didn't have room.)

Hands down the best Hawaiian food in Vegas. Everything on the menu is so Ono! It's hard to choose just one option, but they have mix plates too. The prices are inexpensive and the quality and portions are awesome! They even have live music on the weekends. Make sure you save room for dessert too!

Best Hawaiian food not on the islands.  I live in L.A. and the "Hawaiian Food" we got over there pales in comparison to this spot located in the 9th Island.  Been here many times on our Las Vegas excursions. The Lau Lau is to die for.  The chop steak is good. The roast pork is good. The whole freakin menu is good.  And the portions are huge.  Customer service rocks!  They treat you like you're a cousin.

Open up a location in So. Cal.....PLEASE!!!

Found this place on yelp and seen that it had great reviews, they were right food was amazing. The portion was huge, took a whole plate home to go. I would highly recommend. They also have live island  music playing.

A loooooot of hype about this place has been going on since I have been talking about how I was going to be in Vegas this past weekend. Great local feel!! All the employees were like auntys and uncles (Hawaii slang) and it was as if I was dining at some restaurant at home =]

I had a hard time choosing between chicken katsu and the katsu loco moco. They both sounded SOO SO OSOO OOSOOSOOO good! Not to mention the people around me were eating katsu loco mocos and I might have droooled a little...

But I stuck with ordering the plain katsu because I knew I wasnt going to be able to finish all of my food and so I thought it would be easier to save! Saving a katsu loco moco makes me think of soggy chicken katsu and Idk if I am really a fan of that.

Katsu was ON POINT. I love it when katsu is crispy and their katsu was just that! Omg and their macaroni salad was super delicious too. They have huge pieces of pepper and it really gave your mouth a little kick while eating it.. i enjoyed that. 2 scoops rice, a mound of katsu and 1 scoop mac salad for $9??? WIN. WIN. WIN. 

They also give you a nice container of sauce. Im a sauce lover so I NEED lots of sauce :3

Plus the service was so friendly and wonderful! "You need to eat half of your plate to get a take out box!" *jokingly of course. But we laughed. I think all of us were a little beat up from clubbing and shennanigans from the night before so eating a large meal of meat and rice was not high up on the agenda before a 6 hour car ride to LA... Still delicious though and I am actually eating my leftovers as I type this!

Bit far off the strip but I wanted to give it a go.

I ordered Poke, Hoisin rib and Saimen.  Rib was freaken awesome.  Tender, fall off the bone awesomeness.  If this was a BBQ place, there would be line out the door just to get a taste of the ribs.  5 stars for the Rib.  

Poke was good.  I don't think you can immitate the freshness that you get from Hawaii.  You purchase by weight and we were allowed to place a mix of 3 types of poke to come out to a pound.  Saimen was descent and I'm sure that it's the authentic flavor but my taste is skewed from Aloha Factory in Alhambra's char siu saimen wonton soup.  After eating Saimen in various places, I'm deducing that Aloha Factory's saimen wonton is not authentic but I still love it nonetheless.

This place works! If you're in the mood for Hawaiian cuisine in Las Vegas, stop in. This place is definitely off the strip, which is always a plus in my book. 

Our party had the Korean ribs, Chopped steak, Roast pork, Kalua Pig, Korean chicken, Fried rice omelet, and Fried poke salad. I did sample all of the dishes and would say they are all great with the exception of the pork dishes. I am a big pork fan, so I am particular of pork dishes. Having had Kalua pig in Hawaii I would say it did not meet my expectations. It wasn't as smoky as I would have liked to be, and it was lacking a bit in the flavor department. 

Other than that, it was a good meal.  Will be back again.

We love Hawaii & of course the food.  This is so authentic & no one will go away without leftovers.  So many people came in for takeout & as the plates came by with other people's food, I gawked as everything looked good & huge.  We came behind 6 other groups so it took a little longer for our food to come but when my kalbi with salad & rice ($9.75) & my son's furikake shrimp & chicken teri with mac & rice came ($9.25), all was good.  We had enough for a whole next meal.  Mahalo.
This place is the bomb. Food is delicious. The teriyaki steak is sublime. Big portions. Reasonable prices.
Best Hawaiian restaurant in Vegas, hands down! Portions are ginormous! Furikake shrimp is a must. Poke appetizer is to die for and you get such a generous serving for the price!

I really do enjoy this place! I love the Kalbi and the Shrimp! Their Kaluha mudslide pie is amazing!!! Their service is a little slow, and the waitresses are nice but you could tell they are tired and just doing their jobs. When we first started going there they had live music on the weekends and the last few times I have gone they didn't have it & I miss that.

I came into this place thinking typical Hawaiian place. Boy was I wrong! The food was awesome! And it came in huge portions! my leftovers lasted for days! I recommend this place for anybody who just love to eat great Hawaiian food. And a lot.

MIssed local Food So Much. Been away from the Islands for to long, so when I moved to Las Vegas from New York my friends brought me here. Let me just say In Pigeon "Broke Da Mouth! Aunty from Big Island I heard own dis place winas winas chicken dinna" Trying everything on the menu, Thanks so much. I go at least once a week now!!!

Food is very good service is good and the servings per entree is huge. Worth waiting for it. Expect waits for 30-1hr this place is busy all the time but still worth the wait. I recommend to everyone. Try it yourself and be the judge I have spoken on my behalf thank you have a good day

GIANT-SIZED PORTIONS!

Thank goodness my sis-in-law and I split our food because the portions are seriously large enough to feed two people.

We ordered their chicken katsu loco moco, which I have never seen on a menu back in Seattle. Everything in this dish was perfect! I love how the katsu had the right amount of crispiness to it. I definitely would order this again for my next visit...and come on an empty stomach.  I also ordered a side of their mac salad and I wasn't a fan of it. It had a little bit of a sweetness to it and I personally didn't like that.

For dessert, we and two other people at our table split a piece of their guava cake. So GOOD! I'm glad we ended dinner on that note.

Everything about Island Flavor is great.

Reasonable prices, friendly service, excellent food, and great atmosphere.  People dine here reguarly and for good reason.

I enjoy the poke (furikake style) and I usually get the oxtail soup.  You can get a 2 meat combo for under 10 bucks.  Tonnnnss of food.  The qualiy of their food is really good.  Kalbi short ribs, katsu, shoyu chicken all very good.  

I believe on Friday nights, they have specials such as Lau Lau, etc.  

I also like how they play Hawaiian music in the background.

This place made me feel like I was in Hawaii! 
The furakake chicken and Kalbi were favorites.  It was like you were at backyard BBQ!   I would skip the furakake shrimp and chicken katsu, no bad but the other two dishes mentioned were preferred.  The guava cake was yummy and unique.  Can't wait to head back there and try some other items in the menu.

Ono grinds!

Decided to look for a Hawaiian plate lunch place, since so many folks from the islands visit and live here. It was authentic, including the pidgin, and was outstanding! I will note that the Kalbi was cut too thick. BTW wife is born and raised in Hilo and I'm from Maui!
i miss the bigger portion sizes! taste is amazing still but bring back the bigger portions!!

Finally tried this spot since I moved here 3 years ago and after recommendations from Hawaii friends...including friends visiting from Cali who orders plates to take on the drive back...this place is legit! When I'm craving some home style local cuisine like loco moco, furikake chicken, katsu, etc. go here! Skip the "hawaiian" food chains for some authentic island flavor made by islanders.

Food is fresh and delicious! Furikake Chicken hands down my fav. The Kalbi Ribs were great, tender, with a delicious flavor. All the staff was super nice, great fast service. Lots of food for the price, will return to try other items.

Good Lord, another Hawaiian restaurant to review. Luckily, this is one of my new favorite ones in Vegas!

Some friends of mine suggested this place to my boyfriend and I literally RIGHT before we were leaving to Vegas. They had found this place through yelp one day and mentioned it. Thank goodness I'm always down to try ANY food. 

This place is located in a plaza that's not hard to locate. The restaurant itself was pretty clean, and a little bigger than the other hawaiian restaurants I've been too. We were seated quickly upon arriving and the employees were all pretty friendly and attentive. 

Most of the menu items looked amazing, but thanks to Yelp I narrowed it down to two dishes. To be honest I really wanted to try a little bit of everything. We ordered the Korean Chicken (chicken wings fried Korean style) and the Chicken Katsu Loco Moco. I instantly fell in love with the loco moco. I've never had it in this style before and the gravy that it was covered in wasn't too overpowering. I was told the gravy is homemade in the back by the owner's grandmother (I'm not exactly sure if this is true). 

Upon leaving we talked to the owner and he had mentioned he was looking to open a location somewhere in LA. I really hope he does. Because I would absolutely come back. Which is what I plan on doing next time I go to Vegas.

Ok.... This is by far the place to go if you want authentic local food.  Their ox tail is to die for and their Chantilly cake and cocoa puffs just like liliha on Oahu.  I'm very picky when in comes to food...... And I rate this the best!

I've been here a couple times and I think the first time was better. The one thing that brings me back is the furikake chicken. So good and and I haven't ever seen this item at any other hawaiian restaurant. Definitely need to order that entre. The mac salad is also very good. Service is always good and it feels like a local restaurant in hawaii.
Had to try because of Yelp reviews. Food is pretty good. Had Furikake Chicken and wife had Oxtail soup. Huge pieces of tail. Will go back to try more.
We used to come here often. Food not so great and service went down hill. Disappointed.

Reminder, you better go there hungry! Big portions of island plates. We had furikaki chicken, my fav! Huge. Locomoco, huge(okay gravy)! Fried rice (eh), huge! Mix plate(yum), you know...huge. Mud pie...definite yes! Poki was delish ( wish they made one spicy) Food flavor, was okay on some, but great on others. 

This place packs it in, plus live music Friday! I think they need to expand. Will come back to try different items on menu.
Best Hawaiian food I have ever had in Las Vegas! Best Poke in Las Vegas. More food than you can eat in one sitting.
My 4th week in a row coming here and can't get enough of it. The Hawaiian plate is off the hook!!!

I came in here on the spur of the moment for some take out and I have to say the customer service was okay.. not great but not bad. I explained I never been before and to make some recommendations and the guy working the front was good but who ever else was working with him wasn't Now they lost a few stars for a few reasons with me because what could've been a 4-5 star review turned to 3. Now you may ask what happen to get the rating right? Well the service and the fact that they basically told me in so many words that the spam masubi that they sold if it wasn't in that little oven in the front then that means there are no more? What kind of place does that though? And an hour before you are closing? I could see if I walked in 10 minutes before you are closing but is that spam masubi that hard to make that you couldn't request one or two more to be made? Yikes! Not good service in my eyes especially when somebody is trying it out for the first time. It's simple things like that, that would steer me away from ever coming back.  My dish I ordered was like a two item combo and I selected the chicken katsu and the Furakaki chicken with double mac salad instead of the rice. No complaints on that! No whether I'll be back or not is in the air but for now...

Me: Came here for Hawaiian food and got a better version of every dish I've ever ordered before at any other Hawaiian place.  Really, the execution of each dish and it's components were just done more skillfully. If you want outstanding Hawaiian food, come here. (And free refills on POG!). Also, portions are huge. 

Him: I like spam musubi. This place had the best musubi. The chicken (furikake) was amazing. It was as delicious as the chicken I had in China! I would come back here for the chicken [says the lover of spam musubi].

Hats off to the chef or chefs at this location! Our dinner was flavorful and delicious! Come hungry because you will get big, and I do mean BIG hearty portions, well worth the money you spend. The owner definitely cares about the quality in the dishes being prepared and from the first bite, you can taste the TLC the chef has placed in every dish. It's worth the upgrade for the Charshu Fried Rice and the Shrimp Furikake was simply delightful. We love this place and we will continue to come back with our friends and family! Keep up the great work!

Ate here last night and wow it was so yummy! They were pretty busy but the wait wasn't long at all. The price is good for the heeping plates they serve! Its a very friendly place and if ur looking for good Hawaiian Local Food this is the place!

I love the Kalbi Short Ribs. I get this order 9 out of 10 times coming here. I only try something else if I happen to go here 2 times in a time span of a few days.

The furrikake chicken is AMAZING, but as my friend says "stairway to heaven", it'll probably give you a heart attack if you eat it too much.

The teriyaki chicken might be a little plain/bland for my taste buds BUT! try it in the teriyaki chicken salad and the flavor really comes out! Somehow the rice really zaps the flavor away on the teriyaki chicken.

The coffee mud pie dessert is awesome. Yummy! A huge ice cream pie slice that's enough to feed 4 people (that's if all of you already have leftovers from the entrees haha)

I have eaten at a lot of mainland Hawaiian places, with most all of them not much more than mediocre and some of them a lot less than mediocre.  I have eaten at some of the best places in the islands, including Helena's where I have gone multiple times.  I gots to tell ya that the food at Island Flavor is AT LEAST as good as Helena's, and in some respects even better.  Everything was fresh, and real, and traditional.  The place is family owned, with the family being from Kona on the Big Island.  Portions were huge.  The oxtail soup was to die for.  Even the macaroni salad, which I normally hate, was very good with not too much mayo.  This place is awesome, Brudah.  Mahalo.

We tried this place about a month ago and had a pretty bad time. Firstly, we went with a group and the food took a very long time to come out. Of course longer waits are expected with a larger party, but it was a slow night and we waited much longer than anticipated. Then I had an extra wait because there was a mistake with my order (not the correct rice).

I wasn't really fond of the roast pork loco moco. I enjoyed the first bite but after that all I could taste was gravy. I only managed to get through about 1/3 of my meal because it was extremely filling, which brings me to the topic of our server.

Our server was the reason I was so irked after our visit here. After we got our food he commented on how little I was eating at least 2-3 times, and then again when we were on our way out. I thought it was very rude. The portions were huge and I actually ate all that I could eat - I am a paying customer, do not criticize me for how much of my food I decide to eat. It would have been one thing if I had wasted my leftovers, but I was taking it home anyway. On top of that, I thought he had an overall condescending and judgmental attitude while taking our orders and whenever he spoke to us throughout the meal. I am generally an easy going guest, honestly I can't even think of another time where I have ever disliked a server aside from the guy we had here.

Our last issue came when it was time to pay the bill. One person in our group paid the entire bill and didn't realize until after he paid that gratuity had already been added on the price. He said it didn't show on the receipt that he signed, and he didn't realize until we were on our way out that he had paid two times more tip than he should have. I didn't see the receipt myself so I can't pinpoint the issue here - but it added to the overall negative feeling of my experience here, especially because it was a large bill (and subsequently a large tip).

On the plus side, the hostess who greeted us on our way in/out was very nice. And again, portions are huge and gravy is plentiful - so if that's what you're into then I can see this being a nice place for that, but for us it was an awful experience.
Great food, great people... Great place!! Probably the best Hawaiian food I've had in Vegas!

Another Gem in Las Vegas! The food here was delicious! We tried chicken katsu, furikake shrimp and chicken, fried rice, spamasubi, and Korean fried chicken! All so yummy! The service was also great! Very fast and friendly!

Small place with good food! Luckily this is only a 5 minute drive for me and my boyfriend.   What makes this place so good (other than the food) is the people who work here. As soon as you walk in you're greeted and seated quickly. The service was fast and drinks were always filled before they were empty. Good quality food with huge proportions and the prices are very reasonable.

Hands down: one of the best things to ever happen to Las Vegas!

I seriously got on YELP and was browsing through all of Island Flavors pictures because I miss the food so!

The orders for our party: Oxtail soup, chicken katsu, kalbi short ribs, and shoyu chicken. When those orders came out, my jaw dropped! The portions are huge! Everything was flavorful and delicious. I have a grand feeling that everything on that menu is just as delicious as the meal I had that night. 

Now, what really made me cry tears of joy was the kona coffee mud pie. That thing is huge! It easily fed our party of 4. The yummy coffee ice cream, whipped cream, oreo cookie crust and macadamia nuts was marvelous! 

The service was also great! She was friendly and made sure to serve us with a smile. 

Island Flavor, you won a place in this girl's heart!!
Place has good food but the wait for take out is ridiculous. I wouldn't even be mad but they told me 14-20 min and I'm on 35 min already. Not cool.

Very impressed. Moving from a city where we had one Hawaiian place to LV where they are abundant I had to try most of them, and this is my favorite by far. It was busy when we went but that wasn't an issue. We were seated rather quickly. The portions are HUGE, the Mac salad was amazing and the staff was very friendly.

This place is great, the Loco Moco is my favorite. I love chicken breasts, and I believe most of their chicken is rib. (That sounds so dirty). We've tried every dessert here... and hot damn they are all delicious. You can tell this is true Hawaiian cuisine when you walk in to the restaurant and it is loaded with Island natives. I always feel like the record scratches and all eyes are on use each time we walk in though. My friends love the short ribs, and daily specials. Make sure if you come here you save room for dessert.

Have you been looking for a great Hawaiian food? Then you found the right place! 

I've been here several times already and Island never fails to serve great Hawaiian dishes in huge portions.  You can get a combo plate and two people can share it.  So far we've tried the kalbi ribs, Korean chicken, loco moco, tonkatsu, opaka paka salad, shoyu chicken and the guava cake and they were all awesome!

Servers were also very very friendly and attentive.

The only con I can think of is the macaroni salad. It was missing something and can't figure it out. 

We will be back!

Choke aloha here....very friendly kine staff...food ONO...Teri beef and furikake chicken broke da mouth...a vegas must

Mahaloz

Very good food! The Kalbi short rib will make you come back over and over again. Food is amazing. But what really might send people away is the service. The waiters have a "what you want?" attitude. If you are easily butt hurt then don't dine in. Just order to go and call it a day!

one of the best local kine grindz in vegas.  the portions are huge and price is reasonable.  usually i can only fish half my meal and have the rest for dinner.  roast pork loco moco is a definite winner.  korean chicken and roast pork mix plate is also awesome.  whatever you order, you can't go wrong.  but i did come in for the hawaiian plate on friday and i was sadly disappointed.  the lau lau was super dry, haupia was more like a grainy runny pudding.  for hawaiian plate, kauai cafe is much much better.  but all in all, island flavor is a really good place to eat.
Damn this place is awesome! their ribs are amazing, so tasty and soft. Their OXtail soup is one of the best in town too!!
Best Hawaiian place in Las Vegas! Deserts are the best! It's out west and I drive clear from Henderson to eat here when I want Hawaiian food.
This restaurant is definitely worth a try everything had big portions and the food was delicious and fresh.service was great food was affordable and my family that enjoyed it very much.

my parents and I decided to eat here because we love Hawaiian food. It wasn't our first time here, but tonight was the first time we were disappointed out of all the times we've eaten here... it's a Friday night, I was excited Bc there was live music which I always enjoy. my parents ordered the Aloha Friday special which is choice of pork lau lau or Kalua pig with rice, Mac salad, lomi lomi And Haupia... I ordered the Korean chicken, which was very good -- no complaints about that! However, the aloha Friday special was very disappointing.. Our server told us in advance that they ran out of lomi lomi and for both the Lau Lau and Kalua pig, it would be $7 extra and I told her that's fine.. Soo when we got the aloha Friday special plate, there was Lau Lau + Mac salad + rice and a bowl of Kalua pig on the side.. when we finished our plate, I asked the server if we're getting our Haupia and she said, "oh, we ran out of that too." -__- my only reaction was "WOW!" all I could do was shake my head.. if she told me that both the lomi lomi and Haupia they ran out off, In advance, then We woulda ordered something else but server failed to mention all.. seriously though, you might as well have said that they were sold out of the aloha Friday special instead of serving half the plate.. I basically paid for a full entree, but only get ¾ of the order.. That's crazy to me.. for the aloha Friday special, it cost me $18.75 ($11 for the lau Lau, rice, and Mac salad + $7.75 for the bowl of Kalua pig) that was NOT WORTH THE PRICE! Our server should've offered something to compensate what they ran out of OR discount the price of the plate!!! would you pay that much for ¾ of what you ordered?! hell no! I will post a picture to reference this review and owners and workers of island flavor, please tell me if that aloha special plate was worth $18.75 Bc I can tell you and others I've shared this with can tell you it's not!!! and then you got the nerve to charge me full price?! Or not even offer anything to compensate for the lomi lomi and Haupia?! I'm not one to complain but that just made our experience tonight, a horrible one.. I still tipped, only 10% because the service could have been better.. Our server didn't even smile once to us or the table next to us.. and she didn't even check up on us, not once.. Island flavor should really take this into consideration.. You shouldn't be charging your customers full price and not give them the full order.. It's not fair.. I left a comment on the receipt as well.. so please take this as constrictive criticism.. the next time we eat here, I don't want to have another experience like this..

Well, looking at my pics of Hawaii got me thinking of all the good kines of food. So me and my hubby are enjoying  a lunch date at Island Flavor on the south end of Vegas.  We are having shoyu poke. Then, I am having a plate lunch of Adobe, brown rice, and mac salad.  Hubby is having loco moco with Mac on the side.  Just love this place with Hawaiian style music in the background.

The poke was delicious! The Adobe was tasty and I wanted more.  My hubby's loco moco was pretty big and looked delicious too.  It's a Monday and not crowded for lunch.  Service today was spot on and quick.  Definitely will be back again.  Aloha!

I have been to this location a handful of times. All of which were pleasant experiences. Servers were friendly and very attentive all of the times we visited. 

Please don't get me started with the food. Oh.my.goodness! My personal favorite is the Furikake Chicken. It's so flavorful and delicious! Huuuuge portions for a small price. One plate can feed two. Chantilly cake is to die for. Definitely must try! Best Chantilly cake I've had. 

Only downside is the small, cramped space. I don't like sitting and eating next to strangers. It's weird. It's always busy so there may be a wait. But other than that, I can't complain. I'll definitely recommend this place to anyone!

Holy moly this place brings back memories of Hawaii. They serve large portions of all the local  favorites for a great price. We came here looking to get our poi fix. We ended up ordering way more than we could fit in our stomachs but happy to have enough leftovers for dinner. I had the mixed plate with kalbi and roast pork with gravy. My girlfriend had the loco moco. We shared the shoyu flavored ahi poke as an appetizer. And of course the order of poi. 

The roast pork is very moist with great pork flavor. The gravy on top makes it all the more savory. Smothered over some rice and bam! Just a good ol' fashion local kine meal. The loco moco is similar to ones I've had in Hawaii but that is exactly what we were looking for. The ahi in Vegas is not as fresh as it is in Hawaii so the poke wasn't all that great but that isn't the restaurant's fault. Fresh, medium grade ahi for a reasonable price in Vegas has eluded me so far but I'm still hoping to find some. We will definitely be back!

Came here on a Sunday morning on a good hangover.  Some good local friends assured us that this place was the BEST Hawaiian food in town.  I haven't had any other Hawaiian food out here in Vegas but it sure is better than the few I've had in San Diego.  I ordered the Loco Moco and the serving was like home (Enough to feed 4).  You know how us islanders do!  Chicken Furicake was full of taste and hit da spot on point, as the Kalibi Ribs were big cuts and good as expected.  Of course I had to try the Poke, it didn't disappoint for being a whole state east from the Ocean. Overall if you on an empty stomach, make a stop here and expect to leave with a full stomach feeling more than satisfied.  Its DA KINE!

Big portions and awesome food!! We ordered furikaki chicken, chop steak & kalbi, soak musubi, sesame póke, and the kona coffee mud pie. 

They also play Hawaiian music which I love!! Makes me feel like I'm back home! Our server was friendly!! We will definitely be back!!

After trying a few different hawaiian places I would recommend this one out of all of them.   There is plenty of parking available and the staff is very friendly.   I would recommend their Kalbi ribs or Kahlua pig with cabbage.  They both cone with macaroni salad on the side.
This place is so incredible!! Best food I've ever eaten and the owner is the best looking person I've ever laid eyes on. I'm going to start eating here three times a week!!

What more could I say about this place in leu of all other reviews? Well for one, I can say is this: For the price, the large quantity, taste and quality and great customer service gives this place a 5 star and no less. 

My new years resolution is to try EVERYTHING on the menu by the end of this year.  Yeah, it's that good!
Awesome. Best Hawaiian food I've ever eaten and great portions for the price. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu

Oh. My. Gosh.

All your reviews on Yelp have compelled me try this place out and now I am afraid that no other place in Vegas will do what this place does for me.

It's Friday and today's special was the "Hawaiian Plate" which consists of:

- Two large scoops of rice
- Macaroni Salad
- Lau Lau ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lau_lau )
- Ahi Poke in Shoyu ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poke_(Hawaii) )
- Haupia ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haupia )
- Lomi-lomi salmon ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lomi_salmon )

I am completely ruined from other places.  The serving size is awesome, the service was as good as it gets, the atomosphere made me feel I was in Hawaii.

I never tried this place sooner because it's kind of far from home and work.  I considered "far" from work anything past Warm Springs.  Far doesn't seem so distant anymore.

I highly recommend this place to anyone.  I'll be dragging my significant other to this place in the next few weeks whether she likes it or not. And I know she's gonna LOVE it!

Love this place! Definitely authentic food from home. Hits the spot every time. The oxtail soup, loco moco, and pokè are a few of my favorites. But call in advance to place an order if you aren't dining in. This place is always poppin.

Great selection of "Island Flavors".  Good portions and everyone loved the flavors.  Huge homemade Lau Lau on Fridays only.  Luckily we were there Friday night!  Awesome live Hawaiian music Friday and Saturday evenings with Gary Haleamau and Sheldon K. Haleamau.  Everyone started eating so quickly I missed photos of many other delicious items.

They have amazing korean chicken here! If it's your first time and you're not sure what to try, go with the korean chicken. The girl behind the cashier recommended it to me and it's crispy and comes with a fantastic dipping sauce. The chicken katsu is good as well and though not as good as the ones in Hawaii, they'll do. I can't wait to go and try their loco moco next time; i miss Blaine's!

Note that Yelp has incorrect hours, but I unfortunately can't remember the right opening hours to share :( So call ahead and ask them!

The orders reflect the size portions as you find in Hawaii. HUGE also known as regular and the mini does the job for me. Like other have said the furikake chicken is a great choice. Heard one of the daily specials, the sweet and sour spare ribs is real good, I'll have to try that next. This is my spot for when I need a taste of home.

Since my previous review I've been there at least once a week, because the food is fantastic and I've had little to no issues. There have been some new faces meaning they have hired extra help to keep up with the high demand this restaurant has. If there is a long wait, they have given me advanced notice. I am very pleased with my positive experiences since.

Ate here during a recent stay in Sin City.  Heard about it through a co-worker and am glad I made the trek out to this place.  Oxtail soup was really tasty.  Loco Moco was a handmade/seasoned patty and portions size was exceptional.  But the Haiwaiian style roasted pork with gravy that a co-worker got was EXCELLENT.  So much that I regretted getting the Loco Moco which was very good in itself.  It does get busy so arrive early or late if you don't want to wait.

It's location is a bit of a drive off the strip but worth it.  As good as it gets for Island food.

5 Stars!!

I overuse the term food boner, but unghhhhhhh, food boner.

I got the mixed BBQ plate; it was real teriyaki steak and teriyaki chicken. I picked up 2 20 oz diet pepsis, and my total was $14. Yum. Cheap AND delicious!

Ohana BBQ is down the street. I love Ohana, but Island Flavor was better quality. It's also closer to my house, so I think I might be sad to admit that Ohana might not be getting as much of my business anymore!

Definitely recommend going here for food. Portions are enormous; 1 dinner is actually 3 dinners.

Best food and Paleo friendly for all my crossfitters.  This place is kid friendly as well as ohana friendly.  This place is clean, wholesome, and feels at home.  I wish you guys were in NYC.  I always come back here every time we visit LV.

This is now one of my fav Hawaiian spots! Always great service and always, always good!!! I've tried their Korean chicken (sorry but aloha specialities wins this one but it is still good), chicken Katsu, roast Pork, kalbi ribs and the guava cake! Let me just say wow to the guava cake!!!! I only wish they had a location closer to me!!

I'm from Hawaii so when I crave Hawaiian BBQ it needs to hit home. The location is perfect since I live in the area. A plus is that this is a family owned business so you see the same friendly faces when you go in. 

My personal favorite the loco moco. The beef patty reminds me of a well seasoned and cooked meatloaf. My second favorite is the teryaki chicken the marinade isn't salty and its actually cooked on a grill. I hate those Hawaiian "barbecue" place that cook their meat on flat tops. The flavor profile of meat cooked on the grill is irreplaceable. The desserts here are delicious and huge so order one for the table and share away. 

Highly recommend  this place. The only downside is that they are closed Sunday and Monday but I guess they need days off too :)

A bit of a drive, but well worth it. Service was friendly and eager to explain ingredients and preparation. Food was delicious and fresh, portions were huge. We started off with the Poke appetizer. Very fresh, full of flavor, the full portion easily could serve as a filling meal.  Moved on to the kalbi short ribs and furikake chicken, both fantastic. Sides of macaroni salad and rice hit the spot. Coco puff dessert was good, but with an odd butterscotch frosting. The consistency was grainy and lacked flavor. The restaurant is very family friendly, complete with many kids running about. The vibe is very friendly and warm. This style of food is a bit heavy to say the least, and I won't be able to do this weekly, but I am already planning what to eat on my next visit. Hopefully soon.

The place is nice, clean, food was delicious! We tried the furikake chicken and kalbi combo. Coffee was ok, nothing special but wasnt bad. Portions are huge, plenty of parking outside. Service was okay-ish....they didnt have togo cups and lids to take our leftover drinks...so how do they put drinks if people ordered togo?
When I ordered chicken katsu Togo we got no katsu sauce for it, it basically ruined my day.
Food and service is excellent. There's no better place to get Hawaiian food. This is one of my top favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.
service was great and attentive. food was mediocre. i would say their best dish is the poke. true authentic hawaiian poke. all the other dishes were ok. HUGE portions too.

Best Hawaiian food in Vegas.  The food is delicious.  The prices are reasonable for the huge portions you get.  The service is awesome and the staff is friendly.  I would recommend going when they open, or in between lunch and dinner because the place gets pretty packed.
Service is superb! Large potions and food is very delicious. Went to Hawaii early this year and food is authentic. Hidden gem!

Whenever I walk into Island flavor, I feel a sense of being home.  The Aloha spirit and hospitality the staff at island flavor shares with their guests are hands down what sets them apart from the rest.  

Their food is amazing.  I love to get the korean chicken, kalbi combo with kalua pork, ahi shoyu poke and of course their chicken katsu loco.  I occasionally get their specials... which are amazing! In the past I've had their beef stew special, shoyu chicken special and their smoke meat special! Portions are massive, so come hungry! I really wish their oxtail soup had a bit more taste to it, because driving to the cal downtown is a bit of a drive to get my fix. 

Definitely one of the spots I have cravings for every now and then, and would recommend it to anyone looking for good Hawaiian food in Las Vegas!

Favorite, favorite, favorite, favorite, favorite, favorite restaurant in the entire world! Well, maybe not if I go to Hawaii but as far as Hawaiian food on the mainland goes, this is absolutely the best I've ever had! I live all the way in North Carolina but I've seriously considered getting a we can flight to Vegas just so I can come have this amazing food! I like the relaxed Island atmosphere and diner feel! Everything about this place I love!

Nice people but food is not good. Everything was over cooked. We tried the pork katsu, fried chicken with Korean sweet soy sauce, poke, kalbi, chicken teriyaki, beef teriyaki, pork chops, and more...over cooked and dry!!! We were really looking forward to this place too. Unfortunately they did not meet our expectations. Sorry.

Ono grinds... Especially if you want that BIG Island Flava from back home!
Maile and Bruce do a good job of bringing you memories from da islands!

Hands down best Hawaiian restaurant in town. The beef was really tender and tasty and the the furikake chicken was amazballz. I wish it was closer to home so wr can eat thier more often. The portions we're really good to. I'm a good eater and had enough for lunch tomorrow. Can't wait to go back and try something new.

The food here was authentic Hawaiian, just as god as I got in Hawaii. We ordered the Loco Moco, 2 burger patties, 2 eggs and gravy over a lot of rice, the lau lau, which was almost as good as Super J's, and the Kalua pig & cabbage. This was enough food for 5 people and my cousin and I ate most of it. The poke was fresh, the food was hot and tasty, and the cost was low. What more can you ask for? Definitely worth a drive away from the strip to eat here.

Best Hawaiian restaurant in town. Their food is tasty and the portion is huge! I can get three meals out of one entree haha. Love the kalbi here; very flavorful. They give you nice cut kalbi too. Their kalua pork is good as well. Very tender and juicy. Even their macaroni salad tastes better than other places. Their prices are very reasonable. Most entrees are around $9. They get real busy during lunch or dinner hours, so try to get there earlier to secure a table or be prepare to wait. Friendly service all around. They also have another location on eastern and pebble. A must try if you love the island flavor! ;)

This place is always so great. The services is always on point. The food is always delicious. I love the chicken teriyaki plate, moco loco, and today I'm trying the shrimp furikake for the first time and I'm sure it'll be amazing. 

I love the portion sizes here. I can hardly finish my food so you definitely get your money's worth. This place is doing it right. Will continue to come here as long as the service stays strong. Definitely recommend this place.

Found this place on Yelp went to try it the portions are huge the fried rice is amazing they have somebody playing music on Saturday nights which was super fun the Kona mud pie for dessert was delicious along with everything else we tried
This place is by far one of the best Hawaiian food spots in Las Vegas. All is good but spicy alvacado  poke is by far my favorite.
Ordered kalbi to go the other day but Kalbi portions got way smaller than usual. What happened?

A few days later we called in for pick up and got teriyaki chicken and kalbi ribs. Not only was the food delicious this time, they gave us a free piece of some ridiculous strawberry like cake. Yummy! Thanks Bruce for going above and beyond to make me a happy, now repeat customer.

I had never been to a place that served Hawaiian food before. My coworkers have been talking about this place for a while and i was finally able to join them. 

Being that it was friday they had a special "Hawaiian Plate" which has :

- Two large scoops of rice
- Macaroni Salad
- Lau Lau ( Only after 3pm )  or Kalua Pork 
- Ahi Poke in Shoyu
- Haupia
- Lomi-lomi salmon

My coworker recommended it as a way to be aquainted with the tastes of hawaii. 

Let me tell you the food was AMAZING.  The pork was tender , flavorful and definitly a repeat. I quite enjoyed the ahi poke , mac salad.  Im not a huge fan of salmon , so i ate very little of the lomi-lomi salmon.  

I detest coconut , but the Haupia was amazing as an end to a terrific meal. 

The wait staff was attentive and for the price i was stuffed.   

I will definitely be bringing my wife here to try it out.
Great food, best Hawaiian food I've tried so far in Vegas. Excellent portions, very flavorful. Everyone is very friendly and makes you feel welcomed. My fav dessert is the guava cake.
Short ribs and Korean chicken wings are to die for. Be sure to check stores hours before going.
Yummy Hawaiian food, spam Musubis are really good. They have POG & cakes that actually taste like the ones in Hawaii, maybe even a bit better.

Mahalos to Island Flavor for coming to the 9th island and sharing what good Local food is all about. Island Flavor does local food right...Thank God!!!

If you have a craving for local food this is the go to place in Las Vegas. Its a sit down restaurant but they also have counter service. The place is clean, everyone is always friendly. and the food is ONO!

Not many Hawaiian restaurants in the mainland make me feel like i'm back at home but Island Flavors does exactly that every single time. I've tried a lot of their menu but my favorites are:

1. Love their Oxtail stew- Its ONO period.
2. Any of their Loco Moco's- hard to finish off its a mountain.
3. They got good poke...best on Fri/Sat when fish comes in
4. Pocho Bean soup...very good, almost like my Aunty's-almost
5. Roast Pork...melt in your mouth! 
6. and of course their hand wrapped Laulau's- I think its served only on Aloha Friday. Its a good thing they only serve it on Fri or I would have to buy new pants.
7. Their mixed plate is like the Zip pac on steroids! So much food...and much better.

This place is a winner in my book. They would put a lot of local restaurants in Hawaii to shame. What are you waiting for? Stop Yelping for a minute and drive your okole to Island Flavors. And don't forget to bring your appetite because they pile it on. Trust me, you'll be taking food home unless you are sharing your plate with 2 other people.

Aloha to you too!

Seriously, I have hit the jackpot of all Island gourmet! 

I cannot even begin to explain how good everything is that I have had here.

Even the regular chopped salad is amazing with that dressing, those freshly fried wonton chips, the slice of TARO! Yes, fresh taro. Ughhhh, I have been back  multiple times and they are on point EVERY time.

I have had the hoisin baby back ribs (TWO RACKS OF RIBS, SO TENDER THEY FALL OFF THE BONE!), sweet & sour spare ribs (JUST THE RIGHT AMOUNT OF TANGY-NESS AND SWEETNESS), the Korean Chicken (DRUMETTES WITH A LIGHT SAUCE), the Furikake Shrimp (DEEP FRIED AND SIMPLE)... and my boyfriend is extremely fond of the Hawaiian Style Roast Pork. He also bragged about how juicy their laulau was, and oh, i almost forgot, the portions are HUGE. 

They have great daily specials. The Smoked Meat is amazing. NOT Pipikaula, but it's DEEEELICIOUSSSS.

MAKE SURE YOU'RE HUNGRY and don't plan any heavy activity after you eat here. You will probably have to sit for longer than you were eating in order to make a safe exit!

I love this place! My husband and I really feel at home here. 

Excellent customer service! Great tasting food and plenty of it! And if you need a little bit more of HI because you're feeling a lil homesick, go on  Friday night for live Hawaiian music. 

Warning! Because the food is so good, be sure you leave a lil bit of room for dessert. A slice of cake can feed 2 to 4.  Restaurants that serve moist guava, haupia (coconut) or my personal all time favorite, Chantilly cake (chocolate cake with buttery sweet frosting) is far and few in between.

It is "broke da mout" good!

Best place for Hawaiiian food outside the Hawaiian Islands. The restaurant has a feel as if you were back in Hawaii, especially the great customer service, as you would see it back in Hawaii.

Quality of food : Superior!!! It hard to describe it but its very delicious. Portion size is huge! One entry can serve two people or come in very hungry.

Will go back when im back in town!! Good job! you earned another loyal customer!!!

Found out about this spot from a friend who is Hawaiian and man, we can't stop thanking here. EVERYTHING here is so freakin tasty and delicious. It's food heaven! This is definitely our go to spot. After eating here, no other place can even compare of satisfy the craving for some island food. The service is always so friendly and helpful, and the food is always big portions. You definitely get your moneys worth. My favorites are the chicken katsu loco moco, and the furikake chicken....though everything else is delicious too. All of the desserts are soooooooooo yummy too!!!!! GO HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Did an order for pickup off the EAT24 App. First time trying this place. 2nd time trying Hawaiian BBQ. 

I ordered the chicken Katsu and teriyaki steak. The steak was JUICY and delicious! The Katsu is really good but the app didn't let me opt for gravy instead of the Katsu sauce. I would have preferred gravy. So that's my ONLY minor complaint.

My boyfriend ordered the furikake chicken and the chop steak. The furikake chicken is BEYOND delicious! The steak was juicy and amazing. 
Next time I won't order the Katsu but everything else I will order again! I highly suggest the two meat plate, get the furikake chicken and the teriyaki steak and you will be soooo happy you did!! 

I'll be back! The woman who gave us our order was kind and the order was ready for us when we got there.

I love Hawaiian food. It's usually very affordable and the portions tend to be generous. The flavors are suitable to my tastes as well.

I don't remember anything particularly standing out about this Island Flavor, but overall it is a solid Hawaiian food establishment.

Best Hawaiian food on the mainland!!  We ordered the mahi mahi special, chicken katsu loco moco, and oxtail soup.  Portions were huge and everything tasted great.  Save room for dessert!  We couldn't resist trying the chantilly cake.  Very moist and light chocolate cake with condensed milk frosting.  You must try it!  Very friendly staff!

I should order something else other than the Terriyaki Chicken. I can't help it, I really like the taste. Oh, and if the Opakapaka fish is available (seasonal), try it! Like most fish, it's expensive, but it's my favorite. And yes, big portions.

Excellent everything food and service were great, best hawaiian food ive had here in vegas. I just hope they open one a little closer tobme with a bigger location but till then I will keep going there

I would drive all the way back to Las Vegas, just to come eat here! 

It was such a random find...we were driving to Vegas and I was really craving some poke and somehow found this place because it was still open by the time we reached the area. 

Located off the strip, in a small strip mall with plenty of parking. Upon walking in, I knew we were going to have a nice hawaiian meal. Almost everyone there was hawaiian and there was a guy singing and playing his ukelele. 

First and foremost, the service here is beyond amazing! The lady running the place is the sweetest. She's fast and efficient, makes great suggestions and she cares so much about her food! 

And the food...oh my goodness!!!! So yummy. We ordered the shoyu poke as an appetizer. And it was such a large amount...I definitely had my poke fix:
http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=liUDL0_QkxmQ6GZwxsd8YA&userid=h4o8e_Xbca2kXQO_vzOqgg

I ended up ordering the chicken furikake, which I've never had before but it was suggested:
http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=p_62gNsitkBL2YWYKZDETw&userid=h4o8e_Xbca2kXQO_vzOqgg
It was probably the best thing I've ever had in a long while. It was so good!!! 

My sasquatch ordered the kalbi short ribs:
http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=Hvuk6dldYcVr1aajI25Rrw&userid=h4o8e_Xbca2kXQO_vzOqgg
He was so hungry he started eating them quickly. The nice lady who was running the place saw that the short rib was slightly undercooked. She was so concerned, even though he didn't mind much. And she ended up putting in a nicely cooked new piece into our to-go boxes. She was so sweet. 

So definitely it was a 5 star experience for me. The food. The service. It's worth the drive! I miss this place already and wish there was something like this in LA!

Gigantic portions that you can easily eat for dinner later. I ordered the teriyaki chicken salad which came with freshly fried wonton strips, tomatoes, small slices of purple potato and cucumber. 

I liked my salad and if you ignore the strips and use the dressing sparingly, it can be quite healthy!

I want to come back to try their Kailua pork, furikake shrimp and more.

Love this place..........
I ordered mixed plate, Kaibi short ribs with Furikake chicken, fried rice and Guava cake.
Everything was perfect. Every time I visit from San Francisco, this is my go to place for Hawaiian food.
Food is always consistently Great.......

Been here twice. The new guys have a lot of customer service skills to learn, but the ladies are awesome & very friendly. The food was great both times so far. I love the way they make their mac salad, creamy. The flavors of their dishes are delicious. You really cant go wrong with whatever you order. Save room for dessert, their cakes are so soft & yummy! We are definitely returning customers & recommend this place to others.
Wrote a review, gave it another 5 chances and this is my place for my poke!!! At least  two days a week!!!

I have eaten here a couple times.  Their food was delicious and if my boyfriend was able to like it (he is a picky eater) then obviously the food must be amazing.  A lot of my family are from the islands so their input was very important to me.  They loved the food there which can add to the authentic feel to it.  

I give it 3 stars because of their  service.  Though they were friendly when we first walked in, their untimely manner upset me.  I am a huge water drink and when they didn't refill my water it irritated me a bit.  I had to wait approximately 15 minutes just to get my water refilled.  Maybe it was just yesterday when I went.  I will come back again and hopefully the service will be better.

DESSERT!!!!! AMAZING! 

Where has this lil gem been hiding! We came here to eat dessert and it was packed! After I saw that I knew we were in right place! 

We sat down and ordered the following  

Haupia Cake 
Bread Pudding
Chantilly Cake 
Kona Coffee Mud Cake

Not just with the first bite but every single bite was an eye closer! When you put that fork in your mouth with that fluffy Chantilly cake you close your eyes and need a moment of  silence! 

We only went for dessert and will be coming back for food! Service is great, casual relax place! 

One of the best desserts I have had in my life!  

Ps  portions are big! Share with friends we did and still had leftovers!

We stopped by this place for lunch on a Saturday afternoon.  We ordered the furikake poke and mixed plate of kalbi ribs and Hawaiian roast pork. We ate all of the poke and had a misubi and our plate of food still did not come.  The waitress gave us the bill, that's when we realized that our waitress didn't get our order right and thought we only ordered the poke. So after waiting another 10 minutes, our plate of food arrived.  It was big, just like other yelpers said.  There was enough food for both my wife and I to share one plate for lunch.  There were three pieces of kalbi ribs and a decent pile of roast pork with gravy, two scoops of rice and macaroni salad. But one piece of the kalbi ribs was all fat, with very little beef on it.  I was not too impressed with this plate, as the whole plate was lacking in flavour.  The kalbi ribs could have been marinated longer, the roast pork was not that tasty and there wasn't enough gravy for the two scoops of rice.  The macaroni salad is standard fare just like any other Hawaiian cuisine restaurant.  The misubi wasn't fresh, rice was on the hard side.  I do like the big portions of the mixed plate though and their poke was fresh and quite tasty, so I will come back and try some of there other menu items.

This is sit down Hawaiian restaurant. My friend and I were searching for a place to eat while we were in Vegas and  saw the good reviews of this place. We were wondering why it had two  $ signs and realized that it was a sit down restaurant. Don't be scared of the two $ signs when you come here. The serving size more than makes up for the couple bucks more you pay. Most of my friends paid about $11-$12 and had half a meal to spare. I, on the other hand, devoured my food, partly because it was delicious  and partly because i was so hungry. I ordered the chicken Katsu plate and it kept me satisfied for the rest of the day until late night for dinner.

The staff is super friendly, service is fast, and food is delicious! My husband is from Oahu and he says that it's the best Hawaiian food in town. I usually get the chicken Katsu and it's always crispy and juicy, my husband gets a variety of things but he orders the furikake chicken and the chopped steak often. We recommend it but I would call to see if there is a wait time because we have tried going twice and it was super packed.

Great place for authentic Hawaiian food.  Service staff is also very good and friendly.  The portions are huge and great for 2 people.
As for the food:
- Loco Moco - very tasty.  Probably the second best after a dish I ordered at a Cafe in Hawaii
- Fried Rice (one of the specials of the day) - good but probably would order something more authentic Hawaiian next time.

I would definitely come back here again and want to try more of their Hawaiian dishes and will post another review next time I visit.

We also ordered an order of the spam masubi;however, it was pre-made and pre-wrapped.  I would have given this place 5 stars if their masubi was made fresh

Let me get straight to my points. Ugh, this place is guaranteed to have you leaving with a to go Box. The food is cooked really well, flavorful, and portioned to feed you for lunch and dinner. My favorites are loco moco, katsu moco, furikake chicken, poke, and kona coffee cake. Their Mac salad is made yummyful also. You can tell their recipes or food are made with quality. This is a must try in Vegas!

Our go to spot here in Vegas.  Big Island Grill was our go to spot when we lived in Kona so naturally we loved the food at Island Flavor.....

Walked in, and as always, was greeted by a friendly worker and seated right away.  Service was friendly and quick.  Ordered our food and it was out within 10 minutes.  Food came out hot and fresh.

I had the Loco Moco.  Perfectly cooked rice.  Thick Beef patty was juicy and nicely seasoned.  I ordered over easy eggs but came out hard, no biggie...  And the gravy, Can't get enough of that stuff.....  I wish they offered the B.I.G. Loco Moco.  Choice of 3 different meats!

Wife got the Saimin.  Standard Saimin with the usual toppings.  Char-sui, kamaboko, eggs, green onions, etc....  The broth was a bit under seasoned.  Nothing a little shoyu couldn't fix.   The dumplings were good though....

Daughter got the furikake chicken.  She usually pounds her food but she barely touched it.  I finally tried a piece and it was hard and dry.  It's as if it was cooked, sat out, then refried to heat it up.  The sauce was good.

Son had the Korean Wings.  This is his go to plate.  He always orders it and it's always BOMB!!!!  Big freshly cooked chicken wings and dipped in a nice shoyu/sesame sauce.  Perfect every time.....

The best Hawaiian Food in Las Vegas so far.  The Mac salad is very authentic, like from the islands.  The Lau Lau is good and not too salty.  I usually get the Chopped Steak w/onions and Korean wings.  The taste is very sweet and savory.  The chicken is crispy.  The Ox Tail soup is also very flavorful w/o being too salty.

The Guava Cake is extraordinary.  I know they get it from next door, but it's Island Flavor's recipe.  The guava is infused in the cake batter and you can taste a hint of it with every bite.  Not too over powering.  

The service is great and they also refill your Guava or POG juice!  If you are feeling homesick and miss island food, this the place to go!

With so many reviews I procrastinated in writing mine.  Clearly, the food is LOVED!!  

Though my family pretty much stayed with our trusted favorites, I do regret not being more adventurous in trying other favorites.

We live only 5 mins away and became quick weekly patrons.  Our favorite is the teriyaki beef w/ fried rice.  The fried rice alone is a meaty meal!!

If you like Hawaiian BBQ, this is a must go!

Lacking 1 star for the location and lack luster restaurant.  The staff is friendly but seemingly always rushing because they're constantly busy!  
It's ambiance gets zero stars.  

* I think that they'd forgotten about our take out order once which kept my husband there for approx 20mins.  They made up for it by sending a dessert for each entrée - and they were GOOD!

You expect to exit and instead of Durango you're looking at the ocean off Ala Moana Blvd. That's how authentic this place is. Tasty food served with the spirit of aloha. Mixed plate will give you your best value but everything is always delicious and plentiful.

Also. If I am to be stranded on an island with only one thing to eat the rest of my life, let it be their spicy avocado poke. Amazing.

Fantastic food! We got the teriyaki beef and chicken katsu plate - the katsu was ok but nothing special. The beef was super tender and juicy! The mac salad and rice were good too. The best thing we ordered was without question the furikake chicken! so flavorful and great texture. We couldn't get enough of it. Would def come back for the furikake and also to try out their yummy looking desserts!

While we were visiting Vegas, we wanted to venture out of Strip and found this lovely restaurant.

Everything is here is huge, so prepare to share or come very hungry :)

If I am on a diet, this is a very dangerous place to be since I would push myself to eat them all, because foods are all that good.

Service is friendly and excellent, it's not just foods but their hospitality reminds me of our vacations in Hawaii, too.
I got the Furikake chicken and my bf had the roast pork loco moco both were really tasty and came in large portions!

OMG the best Hawaiian food ever! The portions are huge and the flavors are strong. I usually get the mixed plate with Teriyaki Steak and Furikake Chicken. The wait can be long and the service slow but the food makes up for it.

Island Flavor needs to CHAIN UP! Much better than L&L. 

The portions are definitely ISLAND portion and it's good too. 

This is the hawaiian family originally from Big Island's favorite. That itself should say something to whoever is looking at this. 

This last time we were a 8 top and service, bless her heart, was a lot on the slow side. It's ok-we forgive since the food was so ono. 

I had the Kalbi & Katsu plate. Both ono. The kalbi was cooked perfect and can't complain about the Katsu. 

Get the coffee. 
Get the Guava cake. 
Be aloha. 

Do it.
Staff here are fantastic when they see me come i. They already know what i want and put in my order

My go to place for bomb.com Hawaiian food. Great service , great food, great dessert. Big generous Hawaiian portions, for the poor people like me . Well worth the money. My favorite is definitely the chicken teriyaki salad. Loco moco is delicious , best gravy in town.

I decided to use the order pickup button on Yelp to pick up some delicious furikake chicken! The wait for the order pickup took a long time. The app said it would take about 20-30 minutes and they were right! The food is made fresh so obviously it was going to take about 20-30 minutes. However, when I finally got my furikake chicken I could not wait to eat it! As soon as I got home, I ate that chicken real quick! It's so flavorful and they give you a lot of rice with it! It also comes with Mac! I would highly recommend this place! I saw food coming out from the kitchen and it looked DELICIOUS! I recommend calling in an order instead of using the order pickup button, but other than that the food is amazing!

I wish we had this place back in LA! Such amazing local food that I did not expect to find in Vegas. There were so many options I chose to order two mixed plates with two items and a side of rice and macaroni salad. 

I ordered the roasted pork with gravy, the Korean chicken wings, kalbi, and chicken katsu. The portions were large and easily sharable. All we're delicious, except next time I think I would just order the chicken wings and kalbi because they were my favorite, hands down. Even after all of that food, I managed to leave room for dessert and ordered the chantilly cake. Please get the chantilly cake. It was so light, moist, and will really change your life. 

Prices were decent and the service was quick and friendly. 

I miss this place already.

Everything I've ordered here has been A1! From the poke choices to the korean BBQ. And the hospitality is as if we stepped foot onto the islands. Food is always amazing! Definitely would recommend this place to anyone looking for real island/Hawaiian style food.

If I could give thus place 10 stars I would they have the best customer service  ever I am so happy with the food and dessert it's so warm and welcoming coming in this place....be warned u will be full half way through the meal I can never finish my plate I have to always  take it home. I love u guys thanks so much

Best Hawaiian food in Las Vegas. We have been eating at Island Flavor since 2008. When we lived near the restaurant, we ate there 3 times a week... you could experience a new flavor every night. When friends come to visit we drive all the way across town for them to have the Island Flavor experience. Recently, there was an ownership change and the new owner has kept Island Flavor the same! We discussed them opening a restaurant on the n/w side of town.... we are on the lookout for a location! Bring it on! Do not hesitate....  go in and experience it for yourself!

I saw some pics on Instagram of Island Flavor and decided to roll up for dinner. In a small strip mall area near Rhodes Ranch sits this little gem. It's a medium size dinning area but it fills up fast.
 I ordered a spam masubi to start. A decent sized masubi and flavorful. For my entree I did the combo platter with the Kalbi and Furiake chicken. I definitely made the right choices. Kalbi was some of the best I had in Vegas and Furiake was crisp and flavorful. The plate comes with rice and Mac salad. I upgraded to pork fried rice. They give you a hefty portion so I had enough for a filling lunch the next day. Can't wait to go back and try some more of their selections.

We haven't been back ever since my "Kanak Attack" UYE, so we decided to pay another visit for some onolicious grindz.
"Wow! the counter space is gone, place looks more open" I told wifey...Aunty behind the register says "Yeah, Small Kine, Small Kine"...meaning yes, we made a few changes and the place looks a little different. Just love it when I hear local transplants talking pidgin to da max(NOT the bird!) and KCCN is playing on the stereo. Makes me feel I've never left home.

perusing the specials, I come across something that is only found on Maui(up until now) Guri Guri(pronounced goodie goodie) which is basically sherbet. I asked Aunty if its made, or if they got it from Maui, and she says "Nice try bruddah, I not gonna tell you!" LOL!!!!..they offer Strawberry and Blue Vanilla and for $4 it comes in a half-pound size poke container...That's dessert, but back to the food....

We got The Fried Rice Omelette and Furikake Shrimp and they were Onolicious as usual. Can't go wrong with any of the food here, just come with an appetite because one entree could seriously feed two people.

Still wanting dessert, we were gonna get the Haupia Cake but it wasn't on the menu.
what they did have was a Haupia Ice Cream Pie, so we tried that and also got a Strawberry Guri Guri. The Pie was okay, but not as good as a cake and the Guri Guri was good, but slightly harder from being prepacked. Service here is always great, everyone checks up on you and always making you feel welcome...ALOHA!!!

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2013-(5/100) "Get Your Guri Guri Here!"
Best place to go if you're craving some kind of Hawaiian comfort food. The portions are big and the service is great. Can't wait to go again!
The only disappointment with this place is that my stomach is never big enough !!! This place is great, my wife and I love it! Food is great, portion size is very generous!
island style portions for my rhino appetite. i would rate this place for having the best hawaiian food in lv.

Came by via Nelson's UYE/B-Day and had the kalbi with 2 sides which had good flavor, nice little char along with the traditional mac salad and a huge side of salad. Had some of the fellow Yelper's poke and it was all pretty good. As you would expect at a Hawaiian joint, there were tremendous portions, I took nearly half my meal home. Pretty much the only concern I had was the heavy mayo like dressing for the salad and a couple of complaints of other Yelper's katsu and roasted pork being (and looking) pretty dry other than that, I don't mind heading back here again. 3.5 rounding up.

Still as great as I remembered! I'm in love with their portions and I don't think there is a lack of quality with those portion in my opinion.  I took my aunty and uncle, who I believe would know the diff and were visiting from Hawaii, and they agreed that this place is awesome. My uncle said the oxtail soup was ono, but little bit different from how he usually gets it because the ginger is usually grated on the top.  He also said that compared to Maui the oxtail here is couple dollars cheaper. My aunty liked her order of kalbi too.  It was an extreme portion and she finished it all.  I got kalua pig and cabbage, which was an awesome portion too.  My auntie's looked the best though.  Afterwards we got chantilly cake and I got to say this was one of the best chantilly cakes I've had.  We weren't expecting such a big piece and I took it home to my boyfriend, who never had chantilly before and liked it.  When I come back here I'm definitely getting kalbi and sharing the cake.  It was all so good and it got my family's approval!
I love and appreciate the amazing food as well with the big portions but the waiting time needs a big upgrade. As well as better customer service!

We consider Island Flavors on the top of the list of very good local (Hawaiian Asian Fusion) restaurants.  It always hits the spot when we're looking to eat good local comfort food.  We almost always order the kalbi ribs (barbecue short ribs) and the miso glazed opakapaka and they never disappoint.  Soo good!!  The portions are very generous but somehow we end up eating most everything on the plate.  They also have great desserts so make sure to go when you're extra hungry!

This is a great place to go for island food! The place is like a little hole in the wall. When I walked in I didn't expect to see so many people. The place is literally just a small square. The girl that seated us was very nice. I ordered the chicken katsu and the teriyaki beef. It was very good. The quality of the meat seemed to be better than other island style restaurants around town. The chicken on the other hand was on the soft side. I guess you can say I like my chicken a little more "well done". (Hey, you can't please everyone! ) After I ate I ordered the "huapia cake". Unfortunately they were out of it. I was disappointed because my friends dessert arrived and then they told me they didn't have mine :-( I ended up ordering the "huapia ice cream pie". The cake was cheaper than the pie so our waitress charged me for the cake for the inconvenience of not having it. Let me tell you the pie was amazing!!! The creamy texture of the ice cream was so nice and rich. Is was really really good. It comes with nuts, honey and raspberry sauce drizzled on top. Over all, I like this place and would recommend it to my friends and family. I can't wait to go back and try the cake! Lol

This is one of my favorite Hawaiian restaurants... No, correction: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas!

Their portions are HUGE, food is very delicious, prices are very reasonable (very cheap for their serving size, if you ask me.. but I'm not complaining), and it's a nice family owned restaurant that gives you that "Ohana" feeling.

My favorite dish is the Furikake Chicken. I eat a lot of food, but I always have left overs enough to satisfy my appetite for my next meal. Their Kalbi BBQ is also really good.

Their bathroom is very clean. For a restaurant whose been around for several years, I was expecting a not-so-clean bathroom. However, I was totally wrong.

The servers are friendly. However, every time I come here, they always miss 1 thing we order or they forget to bring something we asked for.... And it happens all the time!

Nonetheless, I still love coming here & am definitely a regular.

I've been in Vegas for a week now and I've already eaten here twice.  Each time the staff has been friendly and quick, even when the restaurant is busy. 

The portions are enormous so my fiancé and I share the mixed plate with short ribs and furikake chicken (both delicious), and we always leave full.

I highly recommend the tropical iced tea, which is refreshing and flavorful.

My only problem is that everything on the dessert menu sounds delicious, so I cant avoid ordering dessert, and at the same time, I have a hard time deciding what to have. There are a variety of cakes and ice creams that sound wonderful. Last time we split a Kona Coffee Mudd Pie. The Oreo crust and coffee flavored ice cream were perfect. 
Definitely trying the banana bread pudding next time.

Not a fancy place, but good food!  I like the teriyaki beef.  For about ten dollars you get a very generous amount of tender beef that looks like sliced steak, 2 scoops of rice and one scoop of macaroni salad.  We also like the Loco moco.  Talk about a gut bomb though!  Is dense and tasty, and no way will you be hungry after.  The service is hit or miss depending on who you get.

Been wanting to try this place out for some time now being so close to wear I work. Ordered the Mixed Plate: Furikake Chicken + Terikyaki Beef Steak that came with 2 scoops of white rice and 1 scoop of macaroni salad. Added a side of "tossed vegetables" (yellow squash, carrots, onions, zucchini) so I could feel better about myself. Unsweetened ice tea was also very good! $16 to-go order. 

Staff was super friendly. They knew who I was the second I walked through the door. Food was delicious! 808 Hawaiian Mixed Plate in North LV might still have my heart for the furikake chicken. However, I live and work much closer to this one so I can't wait to try everything on the menu! Will definitely be back.
Amazing food, big portions and nice people. I highly recommend the Kalbi ribs and furikake chicken.

So funny. After a day of Christmas shopping, I wanted to bring my mom to a local spot that we don't get to go to before because it's kinda of outta the way of our usual haunts.

Came here and got their misoyaki opakapaka & my mom got their oxtail.
I got the opakapaka bcuz I've gotten hounded by friends to try it; and I loved it but, was not expecting how big the filets of fish were going to be. Granted, I'm an idiot for even trying to complain about the size so I won't complain....it's just a shocker! I swear the fish filets were bigger than my fork. lol

Mom loved the oxtail. She said it made her heart warm. AWWW! lol
She said it's better than the oxtail from The California Hotel because the oxtail was all meat as opposed to The Cal's fatty oxtail. I liked how they had bok choy in their soup. Not something I've seen in other oxtails. Def adds to the specialty side of Island Flavors soup.

The workers all loved my mom and kept asking her if she liked the soup. lol Idk what it is about my mom; whenever we go to these fam local style spots, they always wanna make sure my mom is good. Which is great....adds to the family style establishment they got going here =)

Add this to another "MOTHER TESTED, MOTHER APPROVED" places my mom requires me to take her to in the future!

Came here today at the recommendation of another yelper Anthony P. I've been here before and ordered the normal kalua pig or kalbi and It was pretty good. Anthony recommended I try the Hoison glazed ribs and holy shit he was right. They are fall off the bone perfect and for the price I think they are losing money. Most places charge $20 just for the ribs but for $14 you get some great ribs and 2 sides. Suffice to say I have a new rib place.

Don't think they are being rude if you don't "feel" the service, They treat you like family which feels really good. Aloha spirit is all over this place and it feels pretty good.

I absolutely love this place! The food is always delicious! Love the Kalbi, Poke, mac, Chicken  Katsu, fried rice, everything! The people make you feel like family. Even us Haole's, Lol!
