There is a Restroom which is also Maintained Very Well!
The Portions are Very Generous- Meaning 2 People can Easily Share a Plate!
Prices are Very Reasonable & There is Plenty of Parking! 

The One Thing that Made Me Sway More Toward this Eatery is Because they had My Chantilly Cake, Which I Could Not Find Anywhere in Nevada! 

The Location is on Durango, Near Rhodes Ranch on the Left Side of the Road!

Guarantee...I'll Be Back!!!  =)

Happy Yelping, Guys and Gals!

The food here is amazing. There were places in Hawaii that didn't even compare. It is definitely authentic Hawaiian style food. 

Sometimes there is a bit of a wait, but it's always worth it. I use a delivery app for delivery from them all the time. That way I can stay at home and enjoy.

The portions are pretty big, so you could do a bit of a family style and just order a few different things and share. You will want to order an extra macaroni salad though. That stuff is way too good to share.

What! How have I not reviewed this place before!  This is definitely a great hidden specialty in Las Vegas.  If you didn't know, there's a small population of Japanese-Americans that enjoy visiting Vegas and staying at the Cal Club.  An authentic Hawaiian restaurant seems out of the ordinary for a city like Vegas, but it makes sense considering this ethnic group that enjoys hanging out in Vegas.  It's a pretty small restaurant, so it gets pretty busy with the long wait times.  As soon as you walk in, you get a very authentic feel of Hawaii, with the smell of delicious legit Hawaiian food and friendly service from Hawaiian locals.

The menu is filled with all the best Hawaiian food you can think of.. and the best part about it is that the portions are definitely worth your buck.  My dad got the poke avocado dish, my mom the furikake chicken, and me the chicken katsu loco mono with a fried rice substitute.  My dad said that the poke with the house special sauce was one of the best poke dishes he has ever had.  I'm not a fan of poke so I never tried it, but it was like a salad assorted with poke and avocado and a light soy sauce looking sauce.  My mom's furikake chicken dish seems to be a restaurant favorite (according to Yelp).  The chicken is sweet and tastes like candy, with a crunch and furikake sprinkled on the outside.  It's similar to a mochiko chicken, but with a twist.

I get the loco moco every time I go, but they allow a mix of adding chicken katsu and substituting the rice with their fried rice.  This dish is HUGE, so I highly suggest sharing with 2-3 people.  The chicken katsu is perfectly crispy and the fried rice is filled with all the good stuff (including chashu).  The gravy is the real winner here that tops off the dish and makes it taste amazing!

Island Flavor has a very homey feel that makes it enjoyable to share good homemade food with friends.  One time when I visited for dinner time, they had a live band playing Hawaiian music.  I highly recommend this place when visiting Vegas!

Absolutely hands down da best Local food in Vegas!!! The furikake chicken and Korean chicken is super moist and tasty. The roast pork has the right amount of salt/pepper on the edges which also seeps into the middle too. The kalbi is huge and thick. 
This is a must stop!!!

Hands down one of the best Hawaiian place in town, my always go to place. I ordered teriyaki chicken with Mac salad-good as always. However tonight's service was very slow, they seemed short staffed, not on top of it. 
I thought the live music was a little too much, as much as it brought an island vibe, I couldn't have a conversation with my friend without shouting. It was very uncomfortable- Rather order takeout next time. 

Advice: tune down the music

A fantastic spot. It was recommended by a co-worker/friend of mine who had some amazing things to say about it. Naturally, I had to come witness  it myself.

I'm a beginner when it comes to Hawaiian dishes, but so far I'm quite impressed. I had their Hawaiian style pork with gravy as well as terriaki chicken, with rice and mac as the side. 

It was both filling and satisfying--the pork being the highlight of the meal. The rice was a perfect texture and complimented everything. A complete dish that will have me coming back for so much more in the future.

4.5 stars for Island Flavor! My craving for some spam musubis lead my fiancé to pick me up some from Island Flavor! He also decided to get the Portuguese sausage fried rice to bring home too. The spam musubi's were huge!!!! bigger than what I had in Hawaii, but they were delicious. Rice was cooked perfectly and the spam was not too sweet and not too salty. One spam musubi would have filled me up, but since I'm a hungry hippo I just had to try the fried rice. Fried rice was good, maybe a lil too soggy for my tastes, but that's Hawaiian style? It came with 4 big pieces of sausages and there was a huge scrambled egg on top. The rice itself had lil pieces of BBQ pork which was fatty but tasty. Overall, I was pretty impressed and I know I will be returning for more musubis!!

This was our first meal in Las Vegas.  We figured this would be the only time to actually go off strip and sit down for a meal.  We got the poke here and it was delicious! We also tried their special chicken and it was just OK.  The short ribs were decent also.  But you should come here for the POKE!

GOOD FOOD, LOTS OF IT & FRIENDLY SERVICE: My GF and I went on a Saturday evening and it was packed. We had to wait about 10 min to be seated. I recently went on a low carb diet so my selections were limited. I went with the Kalua Pork & cabbage with a tossed salad. Very savory and I could have easily hurt myself eating if there was 2 to 3 times as much in my bowl. Pork was super tender as was the cabbage. Will be trying the Oxtail soup next time. And there will be a next time.
Oh! BTW: The Kona coffee was nice and strong. 

This is a small setting in a strip mall and if you're not the laid back & patient type you may be put off when the servers get busy. It's a regular folks kind of place so don't expect strip resorts level of service. But you will see an honest effort. Respect begets respect.

Just like home! After being in Disneyland for 4 days we were really craving rice! Checked out yelp and found this place, it was a little far from the strip but well worth it. Hubby ordered hamburger steak. Daughter ordered combo plate of roast pork and chicken Katsu and I had roast pork and Kalbi. All was very good and our waiter was funny. If you missing Hawaii grinds check this place out.

When that craving for some food from the island hits, there's no escaping it.

It's a hunger like no other. Luckily, over at Island Flavor, they give some of the largest portions that I have ever seen. It's like Hash House A Go Go-portions for Hawaiian Cuisine, except the food here is actually good.

The place was a bit on the empty side around 11am on a late Saturday morning. Seeing an empty place on a weekend always leaves me a bit hesitant to eat somewhere. But, I had a gut instinct telling me to eat here anyway. I'm glad I did. Here's what we went with:

Fried Rice Omelet - When this dish is served to you, it looks like a majestic mountain pile, capped at the peak with a generous amount of scrambled egg. Along with it, comes three giant pieces of Portuguese sausage, nestled around the edges of the plate. The fried rice, packed underneath, has to be some of the best fried rice that I've ever had in this town. It had a bit of a unique sweet flavor to it, mixed in with some small bits of diced pork. I'm pretty sure this serving was good enough to feed 3-4 people. I stared at this modern marvel for a few seconds before I dug in. It was beautiful sight.

Loco Moco - Another heavily portioned dish with a likewise amount of brown gravy, to boot. I sampled a bit of it. Not bad! the hamburger patty included with it was humongous, as expected. Loco Moco is much too heavy a dish for me to conquer on my own. I'd probably come back for this if I wanted to drown a day of depression in gravy.

Huge portions, great flavors, friendly staff.. there's isn't much more I could want in a restaurant.

best Hawaiian food in Vegas period. everything on the menu is delicious, but if you're going there for the first time I recommend that you get the combo plate so that you can try multiple things at once. if you have room for dessert their Kona cake... wow.  they also sell spam musubi and banana bread at the counter. grab those when you can because they sell out quick! in addition to the food very friendly service. it's definitely a must try. you won't regret it.

Island Flavor is always a good choice! The Loco Moco here is the best!  It's creamy and so huge, you can easily split it with another person.  The spam masubi is warm, big, and delicious!  Tried the Kona Mud Pie and was super stuffed after lunch!!  Good service, good food, just wish the decor was a little better.

This place is absolutely amazing. We ordered for the first time a few days ago and was so happy with our choice. Living in the Mountains Edge area, there are not a lot of great solutions for quick food so I was pleased to find a new place that had great food that was quick and definitely worth the money. I ordered grilled chicken and rice and the portions were so nice I was able to have left overs. Will definitely be going here again :)

Ono! It was so nice to visit Vegas and have some delicious island food. You just can't get that where I live and miss it. Place is casual and has the local vibe. The mixed plate is awesome because there is so much to choose from. I suggest you get it with the fried rice.

We went here on the recommedation of a friend of ours. She's originally from Hawai'i and she said it was close to what it tastes like "Back Home". I've been to Hawai'i but don't remember the cuisine so I had to go on her word lol, whoops!

We Ordered:
1. Poke (Shoyu)
2. Saimin Soup
3. Loco Moco
4. Kona Coffee Mud Pie

Poke is very flavorful and it being an appetizer, we were expecting it to be very small, which it was not. It was enough for me and the guy I married to share.

Saimin Soup, man, there was a lot of flavor that I was not expecting! First off it was a large bowl, and there was so much in the soup by my standards. Wontons, the pink & white fish patty thingies (I don't like 'em but they're always in Saimin), and the noodles. The broth was so tasty! I was expecting it to be bland, considering the broth was very clear, but it was so flavorful, yummy!!! 

Loco Moco, gees, this thing is huge and yummy! Enough said.

Kona Coffee Mud Pie, OMG... I love coffee ice cream and this is so MUCH better! Topped with whipped cream, macadamia nuts. 

The service is also a thumbs up! They're all so welcoming, very attentive and always really sweet when we come in. 

Yes, I'd recommend this place to friends and fam. Yes, we would go back, and have repeatedly.
SAD! I was straight up looking at my order just chill for  20MIN just waiting for it to get bagged. Wasn't even BUSY!

Had this for the first time tonight and oh man! We will be back. I had the furikake chicken which comes with 2 big scoops of rice and a big scoop of macaroni salad. This is the best Mac salad I've had. I could eat a bucket of that. My BF had the mixed plate with teriyaki chicken and Korean chicken. This also came with the rice and Mac. He loved it so much he ate the whole thing! Portions are huge, food is soooo yummy and staff is really nice. I came home with enough for another meal!! Mahalo Island Flavor!

Vegas is the 9th Hawaiian island for a reason. So many good Hawaiian restaurants, so little allowed calories in a day to eat them all. Island Flavor has 2 locations, this one being larger and more of a restaurant than the other location (other location is more for takeout). 
Furikake chicken. Furikake chicken. Think of wet, sticky, juicy fried chicken with some furikake flavor. Favorite thing on the menu. 
The chicken Katsu is better than some of the other places I've been to in the city, but the meat to fried portion is still lacking. 
The Yelp takeout menu doesn't have the mixed plate option on it that they have in restaurant. Definitely the best bang for your buck!
Love this place! Awesome korean chicken and kalbi. Yum!

I had the oxtail soup, to go. It comes with two sides; Mac salad (in a tiny clear plastic cup) and white rice (2 scoops). 
The soup was okay, would be perfect for a cold winter day. My personal preference as for oxtail is for the fat to be trimmed off before it is cooked. . But I let inner fat girl have her way and I slaughtered  it. Well, not really slaughtered it-i have left overs as they give you the soup in two cups. It's only three oxtails in the soup, they're an overall healthy portion.
Atmosphere, friendly but I don't think ill make it back to this establishment in a hurry. .but you might like it.

sending everyone i know your way!! the food at Pure Aloha was terrible! ok I get it, lets charge ppl $10 for 1 teaspoon of food & fill up the plate with rice! NO! Ill gladly pass! 

My 1st visit to you guys was over a month ago with my little family! OH.. HUGE portions, well seasoned meat & HUGE portions! we all had leftovers to take home! food was authentic && even tho its a restaurant, felt & tasted & is 100% homemade! Poke plate takes the trophy tho! now that? we ate all of lol 

Dessert was the best! As full as we were, i had to try the Guava cake!! ONE MONSTER SIZE CAKE arrived at our table & tasted sooooo good! 

This place is a little bit more than your regular "hawaiian" style dive...but u get all your moneys worth and will leave with a very satisfied palate!!

Ill be back! with all my friends lol

YES THAT GOOD!
alofa atu!
Very good food with generous portions for a reasonable price.  My favorite is their kalbi ribs and oxtail soup.
I had an order of furikake chicken! Received a large portion for like three people for less than 13$ I think. Very tasty! Would go back to get some more.
First time here ..the ox tail soup was amazing ! Not to much ginger either ... I'm actually full as hell I have two beef ribs left lol I will be back

Huge portions. I had the short ribs. A bit fatty but tasty. The Korean chicken sauce was extremely spicy. Don't think I'd recommend it to others. The mac salad was really good. I'd come back for sure!

I have been here twice and the food has been amazing both times. We even had them cater a birthday party for us. Everyone is friendly and on Friday and Saturday they have a live Hawaiian band.  There mac salad, chopped steak and onions, teriyaki chicken are to die for! The mud pie is also amazing.
Awesome place, great portions, good taste! Cashiers were friendly and attentive. Ordered through yelp and food was ready when I arrived.

As authentic as it gets!

Huge portions... HUGE guys.. Plenty of flavor and island hospitality

I don't live by this area but if i'm around for work, i'll definitely be stopping by for some good grub

repeatedly order the chicken katsu loco moco.  last time, eggs were overdone, not enough gravy.  But, I didn't send back as I was hungry.   poke' is good. 

they were slow to my order and serve (sat next to the cashier), but very quick to collect bill paid.  

- food 4 stars
- service - 3

I guess for a place with so many 5 star reviews I was expecting to be blown away and definitely wasn't. The Loco Moco was fine but I've had better. I've never had Chantilly cake before and it was ok too but not anything I am dying to have again. Overall everything was GOOD but absolutely not GREAT. Much better than the horrible Hawaiian place in the Vons shopping center but not 5 stars. 3 stars for a very adequate experience but I need quite a bit more for a 5 star review. Sorry.

I absolutely love Island Flavor! My family lives in Hawaii and I've been to many local restaurants on Oahu. Island flavor definitely is up to par with those local restaurants. I would recommend a favorite dish but it's difficult because they are all exquisite! Definitely recommended!

i wished they had  opened a little closer towhere the bus goes through, coz they are the BOMB...ONOLICIOUS!!! everything they had was good, the price is a little to pricey but for what they serve and cook, it is well Worth buying!!! keep it up guys.

Maile is back!!!  Where better for Ghost Monkey to haunt than the best Hawaiian food in Vegas?

Monkey do:
CHOPPED STEAK & ROAST PORK w/gravy aside (ToGo)- absolute favorite 
LOCO MOCO- easy and hope not to pass out in barber's chair next door
POKE(shoyu, sesame or furikake)- while new poke bowl joints pop up around town, they can't touch this!  At MP, get a full pound of fish at $14.50, not silly scoops!  

Servings here are no joke. Most plates can be shared or if you have the willpower, eat half here and then later. Monkey power is at three quarters here and a teaser snack later. Desserts are big, too. Be prepared. 

Packed at 1pm on a Friday, 5pm on a Tuesday, it seems it's always busy here no matter what.  Whole party must be present to be seated.  Order ahead if you're on the go. Plenty of free parking and service is always friendly.
Whenever I'm in town, I stop by to get the mix plate. Kalbi short rib with furikake chicken, fried rice and Mac salad! The best island food in Vegas!!

My son loves the teriyaki chicken plate from here. I usually order their kalua pig and cabbage with extra cabbage. Both comes with macaroni salad and two scoops of rice. I would recommend this place for casual lunch or dinner.

Went in on a Thursday evening---it was packed!  Wait time for a table was 20 minutes so we decided to order for take out.

35 minutes later...which was 10 minutes longer than the given wait time, we were on our way home with a couple of food items. 

We ordered the loco moco.  Reminded us of large portions we'd order in Hawaii.  Great flavor. Would order this again.

Also got the Korean chicken.  After finishing all the wings, I was craving more!  Really good!  

Mac salad was on the weaker side--needed some more flavor but I still finished it anyway.

Took a piece of guava cake home too--delish!

Crack! The Furikake chicken should be illegal! This thing soo damn addictive! It's flavorful, crispy, juicy, sweet, and sticky - this should be a song :) I've also tried the Kalua Pork and Kalbi Ribs. All are really good. The winner for me however, is the Furikake Chicken. Who created this wonderful thing????
The double meat plate is enormous, it lasts me about 3 meals. Oh, the coffee mud pie is really good too. The only downer is that this place is soooo far from me. Maybe it's not such a bad thing since I'm trying to be skinny :)
I ordered to go and dined in, both experiences were great. It looks like this spot is pretty busy, no matter what time. No surprise.

This was our second time, brought the kids (18-20) with us. To experience a new place. Last time we were greeted by an amazing hostess, they were busy but you'd never know it by the way she treated us. She was even our waiter, and answered many questions along with some awesome suggestions. The food and service was 5 star.
However. Hate to say it but this time... Wow! Not a good Wow unfortunately. Not busy tonight we walked in and barely got a "hi" and led to our table. Menus dropped off and she left to Visit with the table next to us to a flurry of hugs and conversation. The waiter came by got our drinks order, have us time to order and delivered the food in 15 minutes tops. We all specified rice, but maybe didn't say rice ONLY NONE of us like macaroni salad. When we asked about a plate to shop it on to we got a sigh, but we're asked if we would rather have salad which was very nice and we took it. The waiter came over to say we didn't specify it. I said no problem it was taken care of. This was the lady time we saw him. All of us had no drinks, I asked the hostess for some refills during her other conversations and was rushed of, saying be right with you. Witter came back no talking took the drinks filed them up and walked away. 
Not sure what happened but the good was still very good, but the service alone may keep me from returning. Ashame people can ruin an experience. Maybe we will try again at another date....maybe

thank you yelp for this awesome find! its a lil far off the strip, but totally worth it.  being from the south bay, we are starved for good local food. yes theres a ton of places, but nothing every lives up to your expectations!

this place was pretty good and reminded me of my moms home cooking.  if im ever back in vegas ill be coming back here! its definitely worth the trip off the strip!

I was told that this place had the best Hawaiian food around.  As a fan of L&L, which in my opinion is pretty good, I had to give this place a try.

DEFINITELY WORTH IT.

Service was fantastic.  The waitresses are very friendly.

Food: THE BOMB.  Portions are ENORMOUS.  Most of their entrees are $9, but for $11, you can choose two!  And the way they serve it is like getting two meals for the price of $11.

The best hawaiian food in Las Vegas, hands down.

4.5 stars

The Hawaii withdrawls brought my family and I here this past Saturday after shopping at the outlets. We haven't found any decent Hawaiian restaurants in LA but Island Flavor hit the spot! Didn't get here until about 1:30pm but there was still a lunch time crowd. The plates come with two scoops of rice and your choice of side - large portions! We shared 4 dishes between 5 people and had leftovers. All for under 50 bucks! 

Chicken Katsu ($9): Crispy chicken katsu served with katsu sauce (blend of soy sauce, tomato paste, applesauce, onions, carrots). 

Furikake Chicken ($9): Favorite! Bite sized pieces of chicken deep fried and coated in furikake sauce. Can you ask for anything more, seriously? Must try! 

Kalbi Short Ribs ($11): About 4 pieces of short ribs on the plate! Marinade was on point and the short rib was nice and juicy. 

Saimin ($8.75): Noodle soup dish served with scrambled egg slices, fish cake, wontons, and char sui. Interesting, but not my cup of tea.

Definitely coming back the next time I visit Vegas.

Felt as if I never left the 808. Food was the bomb.com, live hawaiian music was on point & the workers showed the meaning of aloha. If your missing local kine grinds from Hawaii, I recommend you eating here. This place will not disappoint.

i went to this place from a suggestion from a friend of mine.  The hours has changed so please be mindful of the new hours of operation.  

i went their for lunch since i'm from hawaii I'm always looking for a good place where they have hawaiian food.  

I have to say this place does not live up to the hype of my friends and everyone I asked about this place.  i ordered the mix plate where you can choose 2 main item from a list so I picked teri chicken and roast pork  which is a basic item for hawaiian restaurants.  First their menu is very limited, they didn't even have spam musubi.. anyways.  when they food came out it looked good. Nice big portions just like my firend said.  but when i started eating  the gravy was turkey gravy and not pork gravy.  the mac salad was too sweet in my opinion.  although the chicken was cooked perfectly, there was too much sauce on it and ruined the chicken..  the rice was over cooked and mushy.  i didn't want to anymore of that so I ordered the saimin.  which is another staple of hawaiian food.  when it came out it looked very nice.  it had wontons, fish cakes, bok choy, teri beef, scrambled egg.  but again when i tasted it i was very disappointed.  the soup was a instant soup bases.  the noodle was s&s saimin.  i asked for chinese hot mustard so I can dip the wontons in it.  what came out was wasabi and shoyu already mixed together.  right then and there i lost my appetite.  the saimin is not worth the $8.75  you can't have mustard with your saimin.  Oh!! they don't even have Aloha Shoyu..  I would really like to see this restaurant do good but they have to change their flavors and stop advertising like they have hawaiian pride when the flavor of the food clearly states otherwise....

WHY DID YOU LOWER THE PORTION SIZE AND INCREASE PRICE????????
After the new owner took over, Island Flavor lost its magic. This used to be the best place to go to for Hawaiian food. They were always so generous with their portion size which made me ALWAYS come back. To the new owner: YOURE DOING IT WRONG and you're losing so many customers. Stop changing things, nothing was wrong. I'm so disappointed because this was my favorite place to go to whenever I was craving something. Bring back the OLD island flavor!

Edit: to the owner who replied: the cost of losing customers outweighs the cost of business. Get it right

Located in a strip mall with plenty of parking, this place appears to have expanded from one store front to two.  The photos on the wall don't appear to be the same kitchen pass through window.  I can see why this place has 200+ reviews and a high average.  This is no fluke. This is not 200 friends of restaurant yelp-up this place.  The food is just incredible and it's not that expensive.  I had the kalbi and slow cooked pork combo with a side salad.  I knew this was going to be good when the side salad rocked.  The freshest romaine lettuce I have ever seen in Vegas with fresh tomatoes, cucumber and a slice of bean cake.  A creamy sesame dressing with crispy wonton chips made a starter for what's to come.  The mac salad was very good.  The kalbi was tender on the outter region and nice and flavorful chewy near the bone.  You get 9 bones in this order.  The bbq is really good and has a slight char for more flavor.  The slow cooked pork was tender on the inside and chewy on the outside where the heat dries out the meat into a nice chewy texture. Not quite a chicharone texture, but almost.  The table next to me got the pokii and it looked fantastic.  I'm definitely coming back with my friends who are arriving to Vegas later.  This place is for real and the chef is doing things right.

Oxtail heaven!
The only reason I went here was for the oxtail soup. I didn't need to look at the rest of their menu because oxtail was all I cared for. I'm sure their other dishes are delicious but I'm here to talk about that damn soup. I've had oxtail soup at home, at casinos, at other Hawaiian eateries, but none of them were as good as the one here (sorry mom!). It came with four, big, meaty servings of oxtail per order. It also had vegetables to actually eat and not just as garnish. The order came with two whopping scoops of rice and macaroni salad. I honestly couldn't finish it all. For dessert the waitress recommended their new guava cake. At first I was a little apprehensive, but I finally gave in. Thank goodness I agreed on ordering the guava cake since it was THE BEST CAKE I've ever tasted ever!! It was moist and you can definitely taste the guava flavor. It was sweet but not overly too sweet. sigh. It was heavenly. I looked around to check up on other people's food and let me just tell you their servings are huge! This place takes their food seriously. I've tried my friends dish and it was packing with flavor, melt in your mouth goodness. If ever I'm craving Hawaiian food again, there's no other place to go to but here.

Great food and prices!
Went with my Hawaiian family to this spot that they've been raving about and it was good! 
The prices are very reasonable and you get zone much food. Definitely going back!

So a bit late in reviewing. Oopsy! Was in LV in May and decided to read reviews on Yelp, and find me some Hawaiian food.  It was a toss up between a couple but decided on Island Flavor. So, glad we did!  

Very large portions, great taste, waitresses were very friendly with locals,  ours was pleasant- no complaints! 

We had the biggest portion of Poke' ever,  pork with cabbage, and a mixed plate.  We had  2 to go boxes left over,  Can you say, cold cabbage and pork for breakfast.  Lol 

I ordered the cake for dessert, nothing compares to Saimin Says where we live...so that's why I deducted the star. Would have done a half star..but not an option. lol It wasn't great it was ok!  

Overall we made our family jealous with pics of our food and prices were fair for the portions. 

Definitely going back in Nov with family.  :)

Wow laulau! This place is off da hook ono to the max! We came here to pick up kulolo and poi to take home to Nebraska with us. As soon as we walked in there was live music playing and pau already we decided to stay to eat. The family playing music had me in tears and their beautiful voices and music made me miss my island home. 
So my hubby had the saimin, my son had beef stew and I got the Loco Moco. The place was pretty packed but our food came out pretty quick and yes everything was absolutely delicious and portions were huge! Truly worth the drive and the money we spent. And all the people there from beginning to end was so friendly and polite. Would definitely recommend to anybody wanting local kine food and atmosphere and a perfect place where the aloha spirit is alive and well! I know where we going hit up again next time we come visit. Island Flavor you rock!! Mahalo for a wonderful time. A hui hou kakou mekealoha pumehana! The Ninete Family from Nebraska.

Love the pork the most. Authentic Hawaiian. Great staff! 
My friends took me here for lunch, and this is my favorite spot now. Cheap, cheerful, fast service, and great food!
Always delicious. I keep going back.If you guys was in summerlin I would go more often.I highly recommend this resturant. It is so good!

Oh amazing. We were looking for the best hawaiin place prior to our vacation. Place was packed but wait was minimal. Windows are tinted so dark it looks closed even at night. All of our food was amazing. Huge burger on top of mashed pots with eggs and gravy. Wish we had room for dessert. They looked amazing. Will be back.

Not even going to lie, this place isn't close to the strip. If you don't have your own ride, don't bother. You'll spend more for the cab ride then the food itself. However, if you dig that island grind brah, have your own means of transportation, and don't mind driving out southwest of the strip then this is a good spot to try.

We had some peeps meet us up in Vegas from that cold country to the north of us. They requested "Hawaiian" and after some research, Island Flavor was the chosen spot. Most people would've probably said to hit up the Cal hotel in downtown LV, but since I've been there before, I figured a new spot would be more interesting.

Heidi our server was funny and very friendly. She had that legit Hawaiian accent and looked like she can beat me to a pulp if I acted up on her. She suggested the sesame poke to share. A full order is a whopping $18 so we went with the half order for $9. The tuna was surprisingly fresh, the sauce was perfect, and the block cuts of fish were generous. There was enough to share between four people. The full order would've been overkill. I've never found a place that served decent poke except when on the Hawaiian Islands. I think Island Flavor proved me that good poke can exist on the mainland. 

The entrées here are no joke ginormous. I had the katsu chicken loco moco. I mean, talk about a heart attack waiting to happen. Fried, battered chicken, over rice, TWO egg cooked the way you prefer it, topped with this thick and rich gravy sauce that dominates the entire bowl. I worked half way into it and instantly ran into a wall. It wasn't even a subtle build up to getting full, it was as if my brain told me, "Stop now, you're done." By no means was this a negative thing. The katsu loco moco gets an applaud by my standards and if you can conquer this beast of a dish, I give you mad props. It can easily be shared between two people.

Got to sample some other goodies from my company like the Korean bbq short ribs, macaroni salad, omelet Portuguese sausage fried rice. All were tasty but every ounce of my concentration was zeroed on my katsu loco moco. In the end, man lost, food won. Togo boxes please. On a side note, we ate the left over cold the following day and it was fine.

Overall, this was a pretty good spot. I'd recommend this little Hawaiian joint for those of you willing to drive a little away from the strip and try something different then fancy hotel food. The prices were decent and the service was great. There definitely was an authentic island taste here. Be ready and bring your Polynesian sized appetite because you're going to need it. Only downfall was that they don't serve musubi!

Nice servers, but too slow. This aint hawaii. It shouldnt take 10 minutes get my water. Everything is salty and huge. I think this restaurant is more of a big island style than oahu style. I give them 3 stars not because of their service but because if the taste.

I was supposed to go to another "Island" place but ended up coming here and boy....that was meant to be!!!

My son and I sat at the counter area and the sistah server was so warm and nice and I felt like I was home. 

I was not sure what to get but she helped me decide and I made a great decision!!!  I had to get my fave-anywhere I go I always get BEEF TERIYAKI.  I had to try the POKE....three types to choose from and sistah helped me choose the shoyu type. 

YUM! YUM! YUM! YUM!

My son chose CHICKEN TERIYAKI and he loved it, also.

Not only did it taste good but  the portions were "Man-size!"

We were not able to finish...which is fine so I have a meal for the next day.   My son still was craving some GREEN TEA ice cream and when the bowl came....it was a giant portion.  We are used to getting one scoop when we go to sushi places.  

This place will be one of my favorite places to go to from now on. 
I still need to try their OXTAIL SOUP....then I will have to update my review.

Holy freaking big ass plate of food!

Had a 30 minute drive all the was down south, but it was definitely worth it though. 
Had to try their Ahi Poke Furikake style.8
Standard Teriyaki chicken.8 
Their Katsu was overcooked and meat was pretty dry. Im hoping it was just a bad batch because i really love Chicken Katsu.6
Those Kalbi ribs though.. ugh! (Rick Ross) I thought was going to die eating those. They're the entree size for a baby dinosaur and really really tasty.10

Jump on this spot, because you will liike.

Went here with a few friends for the first time and it was a great experience. Food portions were big which was awesome and the atmosphere was nice. One thing that would have given this a 5star was the service. Got seated and wait about 10-15minutes just for the drinks and another 10-15minutes for the food order. Other then the service I would recommend this place to others.

The Korean chicken was more like Korean wings.  
The sauce was heavy with soy and the wings were overly breaded to give it crunch.  Taste was not that great.  Oil still oozing out after each bite.  They definitely looked better than they taste.  The roast pork was definitely better. Not as salty.  The gravy was very good and complemented the pork.  Rice is okay and mac salad was very good.  I would say this place is a hit and miss.  Also it wasn't crowded but still had to wait to be seated.  Servings are large for price.  I think there are better Hawaiian places, but not necessarily in the neighborhood.

If you're missing Hawaii, this is the place to go. Ono Hawaiian food & big portions! Nice atmosphere with Hawaiian music played in the background, friendly service backed up with Aloha. We like the Korean chicken & kalbi ribs. We tried the oxtail soup but we've had better. The meat was a bit bland & the broth was plain chicken stock. All in all, we'd definitely dine here again.

Tellin you know...I'm not even there as I post this but we have been there many times and we are planning on going there this week from LA for the day and we are planning to definitely make a stop.  I am havin a hard time to recommend what to order cause everything is sooo good.  But if I had to choose it would be the combo furikake chicken and ribs plate....I can taste it already all the way from LA!!!!  ... oooohh the loco moco...mmm If you are in the area you need to stop by ... and oh by the way the portions...forget about it, wear stretchy pants....it's a lot!!!!  Oh!!!  Gotta give a shout out to the staff...very nice!!!  They do a great job taking care of you!

This was my first visit for lunch on a Tuesday afternoon.  They were located on S Durango Dr/W Windmill Ln in Las Vegas.

I ordered Spam Musubi and Kalbi Short Ribs.  The server brought out the Spam Musubi on a little plate right away still wrapped in plastic wrap.  She could have at least unwrapped it. The Spam Musubi had a layer of seasoned seaweed sprinkles on the spam which gave it a little more flavor.

This was of the best Kalbi Short Ribs that I have had in a Hawaiian restaurant in Las Vegas. There were 4 thick, tender, juicy, perfectly grilled slices of Kalbi.  Just a little fatty.  It came with a steak knife.  The Kalbi was on a bed of rice and raw cabbage with a scoop of rice and macaroni salad on the plate.  The macaroni salad was good.

I asked if they had a Military discount and they gave me a generous discount.  Many of the Hawaiian restaurants in town honor a Military discount.

I will be back!

We went on a Friday and they provided live Hawaiian music! It was packed, and yet they still had plenty of time to tend to our needs! Pro tip: Ask for Leilani, she will take care of you! She knows the ins and outs and had our dishes come out perfectly! The furikake chicken was the best and everything we had was cooked to perfection. The cherry on top was the guava cake, so light and delicious you could eat fifty of them! I was most impressed by how much the owner and staff cared about the customers in the end!

Pros:
1. Amazing waitress
2. Spectacular customer service!
3. Furikake chicken ftw
4. Delicious guava cake
5. Live music!!!

Cons:
1. Took two tries to get it right
2. Food was so good you have to eat it all
Awesome Kalbi & fried rice omelet! This place never disappoints! Friendly service and delicious desserts!
Portions are great and they offer brown rice :) I especially love the furikake chicken. Can't wait to try more!

This place is a little out of my way but it was worth the trip because the food was delicious! I had the Ox Tail soup on a hot day and it was so good! The broth had a savory taste and it was filled with meat and veggies. I like that the rice and mac salad was also included. I like eating rice with my soup because it reminded me of Sinigang . I don't know if I spelled that right but it is a Filipino soup that my mom makes. The mac salad was awesome I could have easily ate two scoops! 

I had the guava cake for desert because it was pink ..that is my favorite color . The waitress also recommended it .  The cake was nice and moist and it wasn't overly sweet. If I'm ever near this location  Island Flavor would definitely be on my list!
So great to find a taste of the islands in the middle of the desert. Shoyu ahi poke and spam musubi. Da Kine!

I have been coming here for a while since this place opened up a few years ago but finally got around to writing a review. Everything I've had has been delicious and the servings are huge even for me. This last visit I had the Chicken Katsu Loco Moco. I was very good but the brown gravy need a little more flavor. Downside they ran out of Spam Musubis and they are closed Sundays and Mondays. 

On a previous trip I tried bringing some friends from out of town here but they were closed Sunday :(
My friends and I thoroughly enjoyed this spot. This is definitely a place to come to for quality Hawaiian food. I definitely plan on visiting this place on my next trip to Vegas!

Been going here for years since it's down the street. But the food has been a little inconsistent. My little brother's furikake chicken had some raw pieces, and the portions are significant smaller while the prices have gone up. It used to be five kalbi pieces, now they give three. I'll probably still go here because it's close, but will probably start trying the newer establishments. Heard there is no management, which probably contributed to the change in portion and size.
Best Island Food Hands Down Furikaki Chicken melts your heart into pieces and everything else in this place! Island flavor I love you guys

Poke = Fire 
Ive been keeping my eye on this place for a while but have found other restaurants until now.  They close at 930 p so we got there at 8pm.  The restaurant was packed, but we were able to find a seat (party of 2).  

Once we were sat, our server gave us menus and took our drink orders.  We couldnt decide what we wanted to eat because we were craving everything.  We started kff with poke, Hawaiian style.  It had inamona (kukui nut), onions, ogo, and soy sauce.  It was so good!!!! The best poke ive eaten in Vegas so far.  We both decided to get the mixed plate ($11.50) but you add $1 if you choose a mixed plate with Kalbi.  It comes with 2 choices of meat, 2 scoops rice, & 1 scoop mac salad.  The portions were humongous!  We decided to get the katsu/kalbi, & korean chicken/furikake chicken.  We enjoyed it.  For dessert, we shared a guava chiffon cake.  I believe it came with a guava coulis and a lilikoi coulis.  It is a F A T slice of cake with a lot of whipped cream.  It was also good. 

I suggest this place if you want poke because the poke was really good.

The portions are huge, the food is great and the people who work here are very helpful and friendly!

I drive by this place all the time but have never noticed it because of the pitch black tint they have on the windows.  The parking lot is also kind of dark. Thanks Yelp for letting me know about this place!

5 stars for portion size.  If you like to eat a lot, this is the place.

However, found it to be quantity over quality.  The teriyaki chicken dish was good but could have had more flavor.  Loved the portion size though.

My bf I think ordered the wrong dish. Laulau I think it is called - with all of the leaves and meat.  I tried it -- and perhaps it is just not my thing- but what a strange flavor!  i could tell he didn't like it either and was almost forcing himself to finish half the meal.
We couldn't even touch our macaroni salad the portions were so huge.

Fun/different for us to try since there isn't anything like this in NYC.  Perhaps other certain dishes really are better, but ours were just average.

The closest thing to feeling like you're on the islands back in Hawaii. The staff here really brings out the Hawaiian vibes. Compared to the food back on the islands this is as close as you can get. The portions are very generous and you can always take it home for later if you can't hang with it at the moment. Over all this place is onolicious!

When my craving for Hawaiian style food is larger than what L&L can handle, this is where you'll find me. Large portions at fair prices and the owners are very friendly. Check out their daily specials. One daily special, Beef Curry, is just terrific and too bad they do not serve it on their regular menu. Mud Pie anyone? Better bring a couple of your friends to share it.
My all time favorite place to eat when I want GOOD Hawaiian local foods. No ka oi! (The best!) friendly service, owners work and cook there too. Family place, love love love it!!!

One of our fave spots to get our local taste on! Born and raised in Hawaii and now living here in Las Vegas im so glad Island Flavor has a way of satisfying our needs.

Located in the SW area of Las Vegas on Durango.

One tip if you are going for dinner be sure to get there early. The seating is very limited inside and gets packed real quick especially with the large ohanas coming to eat, we tend to take up a few tables. Lol!
The menu is exactly like back home, traditional white rice and mac salad with every entree plate. Us Hawaiians Love our rice! Got some local classics to choose from...Saimin, Chicken Katsu, Oxtail Soup, Hamburger Steak and cannot forget Hawaiian plate!!!! Every Aloha Friday stop by to get your hawaiian plate fix. Laulau, lomi salmon, haupia....mmmmmm so ono! The laulau is by far the best ive had since moving here. Plenty meat and real good size for what you pay. No manini action over here ( manini=small, tiny)

If you ever wanting that local taste or missing home stop by here. All the workers are from Hawaii and full of the Aloha spirit thats what keeps us coming back. Prices are reasonable, big portions and Ono, Ono, Ono! They have a marketplace next door if you wanna snag some goodies to take home. Poi!!! Pocho Sausage!!! Hawaiian Sun!!! Cuttlefish!!! Soda cracker!!!!

Been here a couple times and they never dissappoint.  The food is always great, great portions and the staff is very friendly.  Glad it's close to home.  Way better than most of the other Hawaiian places in town.

Right up the road from where I live this place never let's me down when I'm craving local food. Big portions like back home  2 scoops rice and 1 scoop mac salad cant go wrong. Service is outstanding. It gets really busy during lunch and dinner time so be prepared to wait.

For my island crave, this place is definitely my first pick.  The food are amazing and the serving are huge.  The services are always great.
My favorites the bbq ribs and the oxtail soup.  My husband love their Loco Moco.

This is a local favorite of mine! Located southwest of Las Vegas about 16 min from the Vegas strip. It's definitely worth the drive if you want good Hawaiian food. See my short video review of the food we ordered here at www.JensVegasReviews.com. The plates are HUGE and warning you will be stuffed.  My favorite is the Furikake Chicken and for dessert don't forget to share or not share an Island Mud Pie! Yummmm 

The servers are always super friendly with quick service.  Price is just right. Wait time is not long on weekdays but it can get busy during weekend especially with a live band. Definitely a must visit if you have never been here!

What a great find!  So glad it's off the beaten path from the strip.  It looks dark from the outside and judging from the Vegas sun, that's understandable.  Once in, it is warm and inviting on this cold Vegas evening.

When we ordered, I was thinking along the lines of some of the Hawaiian places in San Diego.  The portions here are big!  The partner started with the Portugese bean soup...flavorful and hearty!  He thought the salad was coming on his teriyaki beef plate, but a large side salad appeared as well.  My mom  and I ordered the roast pork....a mound of pork covered in gravy with two scoops of rice and a scoop of mac salad.  I was in Hawaiian food heaven!  I also ordered the special fried noodles, and a large plate came out with char siu pork....very good!  My dad had the oxtail soup and really enjoyed it!  

No wonder this place gets crowded because lots of locals were coming in.  I saw two desserts go out, and we ordered the banana bread pudding to go.  This came with a delicious vanilla sauce!  It's good to know there's another alternative to come to instead of eating at the California Hotel...LOL!

The staff was really friendly and our server told us that they've been open for seven years now.  I can't believe we didn't find this place sooner!  This place is legit!  Can't wait to come back!  If you're a haole and do not understand Hawaiian culture or food, please go eat at Jack-in-Box...I think there's one down the street...
Really good Hawaiian food, and typical with this type of food, they are a bit heavy on the salt. Just like in Hawaii. Large portions.

I give it a 2 star because of the new management. 
I've been going there for the past couple years and never had any issues I live way on the other side of town and it's a long drive there . They charge more for refills and they don't serve the same way they use to it's a shame that people buy a good restaurant and then want to change things up that's when you lose clients ! 

I don't if I'll go back there last time it was not worth the drive .

This is my favorite Hawaiian spot. Their specials are delish. I had the hoisin babybackribs and that was yuuuum! It fell right off the bone.  It was such larg portion that I saved the other half for lunch.  Even better as left overs!!!!

We came in at a perfect time right before the rush and were seated quickly and while we ate we listened to some live Hawaiian music. For dessert since I couldn't make up my mind my fiancé and I shared the haupia AND we took home the chantilly and guava cake. Yup, their dessert is that good!
Amazing!! I crave the food here and I think it's the coolest thing you have bands play on the weekend!

This place blew our minds. From the entree and BOMB macaroni salad, to the amazing mud pie dessert and absolutely amazing and friendly staff.... This place is 5 stars all around. We'll definitely be back!!!!

So the first time I ever walked into this place, I noticed one thing.  Hawaiian people working the kitchen and Hawaiian people eating in the restaurant.  I knew I was in for a treat.  Unlike your run-of-the-mill fast food Hawaiian joints, Island Flavor stands atop my Hawaiian list of restaurants that are a must visit whether you're local or from out of town and craving that island fix.  The spam musubi is always a must for me to start, and my favorite two item plate is the Chop Steak and Furikake Chicken (this dish is so good, it will literally change your life or make you slap yo' mama, one of the two).   The Loco Moco and the Kahlua Pork are also staples if you're in the mood for something more savory.  Either way, everything here is top notch and you won't be disappointed.  The service here is also so friendly and fast! Mahalo!

This is the closest Hawaiian place to us and I was so happy that they got such great ratings on yelp. Although I didn't feel like it was mind-blowing, Island Flavor will now be our go-to Hawaiian place whenever we have the craving for it. 

Furikake Chicken- I have never had Furikake Chicken before this and first bite was AMAZING. It was crispy, sweet, and cooked just right. After about the third bite, it was getting to be too sweet for me so I stopped.

Kalua Pig- Every time we try a new Hawaiian place, I ALWAYS order their Kalua Pig first. (i don't know why) There's was good but I feel like I could use a bit more of the juices. The meat was tender and the cabbage was cooked just right, but I would have wanted some of the soup to moisten my rice with

Chicken Katsu- pretty standard. Their sauce with the katsu was delicious. Finally, a katsu sauce that hasn't been watered down!

Roasted Pork Loco Moco- I know there are a lot of amazing reviews on this but I thought it was just 'meh'. The gravy was a little lighter than I would like and it lacked a bit of flavor. Maybe it was just an off night? I feel like loco moco is a hawaiian staple, so to mess it up would be blasphemy.  I mean they didn't "mess it up" but I have had and (made) better. Again, it may have been an off night and it definitely won't stop me from coming back. 

Spam musubis- these were awesome and even had a layer of extra flavor in between the spam and rice. I'm not sure what it was but I know it was green and may have had sesame seeds? Whatever it was, we loved it!

Chantilly cake- DELICIOUS! it was as if chocolate cake and tres leches had a baby. 

Guava Cake- So good and so PINK! it wasn't overwhelmingly guava-y and not too sweet. Just right!

Our first impression was not as good as I would have liked. We ordered our food to-go and when we got home, we realized we didn't have the right order. Thankfully, it only takes less than 10 minutes to get there from our house. My bf drove back to get our order and he came back with a complimentary piece of guava cake. They were all really nice when we were there, so not mad at all. Definitely coming back!

Can't get enough of this place. The vibe here is amazing and the service is great.
Closest food we have to home  

I recommend them to everyone that ask where to get the best Island grinds!!

4 star service.
1 star food.
Came here last night on a friend's recommendation. Did it live up to it? Not by a long shot. 
Poke trio: All poke lacked flavor. Poorly dressed/seasoned. Saku block tuna.
Furikake chicken: Too much sweet sauce and batter. 
Roast pork: Was actually decent. Tender. Gravy was good. But inconsistent. Again, loved the gravy.
Kalbi: Either really burnt, or just charred. Not a lot of flavor. 
Fried rice: Not so good. Poorly made. Don't get me wrong, it was a generous portion. Chasiu pork was overcooked. And there were lots of parts where there was just white rice and it wasn't evenly tossed together.

Now for the nitty gritty:
The pork chops were a disaster. Overcooked would be a nice way to put it. It's as if someone went out of there way to sabotage these. 
In my career, I've seen med, med well and well done, even x-well. But these chops-2 entrees worth, were a disaster. I felt bad for the person who made these. Whoever taught person how to cook should really re-evaluate what they are doing. 
When we ordered another entree since 1 of theses orders was sent back, it took an eternity for it to come back out. 

Our server was great though. Thru some miscommunication, a combo came out incorrect. She kindly brought out some teri-chicken to make up for it. 

They were kind enough to remove the two pork chop entrees from the bill. Nice of them.
And of course they added gratuity to the bill. Maybe they thought we weren't going to tip accordingly?

Simple rule of etiquette: When a restaurant has a lapse in food or service, they should never add gratuity. It's like adding fuel to the fire. A major slap in the face. 

BUT, in this case, they actually saved us some money. We would have easily tipped based on service, and in this case, we would have tipped in addition for the items they removed from the bill. But they didn't give us the opportunity.

I chalk it up to every kitchen has a bad day. But in this case, it was awful, but saved with some nice service. 
And it amazes me no owner, manager, or other came by to address the issue.

I love this place! My local friends introduce me to Island Flavor and I have to say, the grinds = AMAZING! Plus the aunties are wonderful. The best in the mainland!!!

My favorite dish is the Loco Moco. They're very generous with the gravy and the hamburger is enormous!

LOVE LOVE LOVE Island Flavor!
Best oxtail soup in town!  Only place I've seen carry chantilly cake.  Furikake shrimp is bomb!

No surprise, I got the Roast Pork Loco. Really flavorful, tender pork, with brown gravy. What isn't there to love?

Heard many things about this place and they live up to the hype. The restaurant is on the small side so go early to avoid the wait! But the cozy atmosphere makes you feel like you're in someone's home. This compliments the great service and family feel.

Back to the food though - Roast Pork Loco & Sunday's special Kimchee Fried Rice w/ Korean Chicken. Portions here are HUGE! We had leftovers for dinner and even had some for lunch the next day.

Roast Pork Loco - the pork reminded me of kalua pork, but less salty. Tender, succulent, and when mixed in with the signature brown gravy and some egg yolk .. I can't even. Words escape how amazing this dish is. Each bite delivered an intense pork flavor with egg and rice playing a supporting role. I would recommend getting a side of their mac salad as well to help cut through the richness of the dish. 

Kimchee Fried Rice w/ Korean chicken wings - The plate came with a mountain of fried rice, 5-6 wings, and a hefty scoop of mac salad. They make some juicy wangs here! Crunchy exterior, juicy interior, with a sweet kick taste. The fried rice also had a healthy amount of kimchee. They do not skimp on anything here!

Definitely got a taste of island flavor here! I cannot wait to come back to try their other dishes like the Chicken Katsu Loco and Furikake Chicken.

My second time here and I'm not sure if I posted a review the first due to food coma. 

We've tried:
Kalbi and loved it.
Loco moco with brown rice and loved it.
Furikake shrimp and loved it.
Shoyu poke and loved it.
But today's special was hoisin baby back ribs and it was out of this world. Meat was falling off the bone. I really enjoyed this plate. I'm def calling ahead of time just for these ribs. I hope they put it on the menu cuz it made my day for sure.

I made the mistake last time and ordered way to much food. I ordered poke for appetizer last time and I could of ate that for my meal by itself it was huge. 

Service is always great, place is always packed cuz the food portions are huge and tasty.

Island Flavor Island Style!

Exactly what everyone says... HUGE portions of food like home for a good price!

LOVE IT!

I ordered their ahi poke with sesame oil, and they handed me a mountain of deliciousness.  It's not a coincidence they call it "BIG Island Style."  Humungous!  The quality of the ahi was cold, fresh, and smothered in flavorful sesame Shoyu, scallions, and onions.  I wanted to try their chantilly cake but there was none avail at the time, so we ordered their signature Kona Coffee Mud Pie.  WARNING: This is at least a 2 person portion.  The pie is made up of homemade fragrant Kona Coffee ice cream on top of a Oreo cookie crust.  It comes with a side of whip cream, and topped off with crunchy peanuts, chocolate & raspberry sauce.  You really have to try this place out to see the size yourself.

You'll feel like you've won the jack pot when taste anything on the menu. They do get busy but the wait is worth the delicious food. The extra for fried rice is bomb. The steak was juicy and the chicken was yummy. I would definitely want to order desert but I was over come with the portion sizing. This will npw be a must stop by when ever we go to vegas

I found out about this place through the shining recommendations of my Hawaiian friends. I can't quite agree with their praise, perhaps I'm missing out on some special Hawaiian taste buds, but the experience here is lackluster. 

Strangely, the portion sizes were uncharacteristically average, the service was downright cold and bitter, and the food flavor wavered from tasteless to over-seasoned. The saimin had crisp ingredients, but it lacked flavor overall - the broth really was like water, and it was lukewarm. The poke had great fish quality, but it was so over-seasoned with onions and garlic that the quality of the ahi was obscured. The galbi was solid, but just that - good, and nothing more. The saving grace of the day was their perfect guava cake and chantilly cake - nice, generous sizes, and delicious layers of distinct flavor without being cloying. 

Thanks to their amazing cakes, I will be rounding the 2.5 stars to a 3. But it's a close call - the service is in serious need of help. We were not greeted by anyone upon entering. The waitress was curt, not very accommodating, and very impatient, and the only warmth I ever saw from her was with the delivery of the check. Pre-tip, that is. While I can't know what she was thinking then, that always makes me suspicious, particularly when the service was so lacking for the rest of the time... And for such a casual, laid-back place, especially a Hawaiian place, the service (and saimin!) should be at the very least warm.

I've only eaten here once, but I'm already a huge fan.  I had the Hawaiian plate, which consists of Pork Lau Lau, I think it's called Ahi Poke salad, some other salad, haupia... and of course rice and mac salad.  Everything was top notch and tremendously enjoyable.  To top it off, the people working there are just extremely friendly and welcoming.  I must eat here more often!

Our family's favorite Hawaiian style restaurant in Vegas. All the employees are so full of Aloha! Very helpful and welcoming. 
Our favorites are Furikake Chicken, Shrimp, Kalbi, Teri Beef, Fried Rice, Chicken Katsu Loco Moco, Ahi Poke and of course the Hawaiian Plate on Fridays.  
Desserts are awesome as well. Kona Mud Pie and Guava Chiffon.
They have live music on Fridays as well and the ambiance is just like being in Hawaii. 
Also important, they have Poi on deliveries Thursdays. It sells out fast.

I really don't know why some give this place a one star? What are you comparing this place to? This is my third review because I love this place. It is the Best "local" Hawaiian food place in Vegas! I don't think you would find a better value for the portion size of food they serve. Overall, most of their food is awesome. Can you find better food in Oahu? Of course you can, but we are in Las Vegas.

the best....the end

o in case you want to know whats good? almost everything, ok not everything but get the roast pork with chopped steak/or kalbi combo and i promise you'll be have weird cravings throughout YOUR LIFE for this

One of our favorite places to get our Hawaiian/Island food in Vegas!! Everything we've tried here is so good... you really can't go wrong! Loco moco, chicken teriyaki, Korean chicken, roast pork, oxtail soup, chantilly cake!! Service is always great and welcoming as well!!

I've been here a couple of times now and the food, while having huge portion size, is just okay.  If it wasn't super convenient to my house, I would not eat here.

The loco moco items are just too heavy and greasy for my taste.  There is often literally puddles of grease throughout.

The kalua pork is alright.  At least they actually drain it, unlike Ohana up the road.  The proportion of meat to cabbage is good.

The teriyaki chicken is too overcooked and rubbery.

Their desserts are yummy and have a homey taste and is really what keeps me coming back here.  Honestly those huge portions are just too big and I would rather have the option to do like a "mini" or half-order for half the money.  I don't want to eat this unhealthy food for three meals in a row.  Vegas is really bad about getting more money out of people by giving them huge amounts of mediocre food.

Although, I occasionally go to a wide variety of the many Hawaiian fast food places around this part of town, overall, Rice Trax is the best. And L&L at least is very consistent.  They all have dishes that are a lot better or a lot worse though, so depending on what you like, you should just try them all once and see what works for you.
Our favorite Hawaiian food in Las Vegas.  The roasted pork and mac salad are amazing!!!   We try to come down every few months

Whenever I'm stuck on the 9th island for all work (no play), I visit Island Flavor. Almost...almost...makes me forget I'm in the desert and instead right back at home. :) What's cool is the guy who runs it is from the Big Island. So if anyone is going to do local food right in Vegas, it's going to be this guy.

My friends had mixed reviews, but I've not been disappointed. I stick with the teri chicken or the chicken katsu loco moco. Always large portions.The only thing I would recommend if you don't like to drink gravy, is to ask for it on the side. They give a BEEEEEEEEG vat of gravy. :) 

Depending if there's room, you can't go wrong with the mud pie or haupia cake. YUM!

And of course, when paying the bill at the counter grabbing a spam musubi for the road. Good local eats when I'm away from home.

To start off we've been here many times before and haven't had a bad experience but this one left a lot to be desired. Our server was good and the place was pretty packed when we left but when we first arrived I waited about 5 minutes so that a table could be bussed so we could sit at it when there were a couple others open and set. This ended up being horrible as everytime someone opened the door I was crippled by the blinding sunlight and as I said it was busy so I was blinded a lot. 
The Furikake chicken was amazing as always and we always get it but the poki however was very inconsistent and some pieces were down right bad. For a pound of poki we are about 1/4 of it and I decided it's better to waste it then to get sick. Overall a disappointing experience that could've been fixed with a little more quality control and attentiveness from the staff. 
2 stars because I know they could do better.

This place was the first HI resto I ever been into.  I went here in 2006 for the first time.  Totally in love with their home cook meals.  The friendly ambiance. And the Ohana love.  This place is a must for authentic and clean HI traditional food.  The loco moko is unmatched and is so hearty.  I wish I can bring them to NYC with me.

Best Hawaiian food in Vegas. Futukaki chicken and beef plate is what I think about at least once a week. Never tried anything else because I know I'd be so sad if I didn't order this every time. Maybe if I go everyday I'll get sick of it and try something new.

A hidden spot serving up amazing Hawaiian food! My friends and I decided to stop here before the drive back to LA after our little impromptu trip to Vegas. The wait was over an hour, but that gave us plenty of time to peruse the menu and decide on what to order. 

After being seated, we decided to start off by sharing the Tuna Poke Sampler, which consists of their furikake, shoyu, and sesame-marinated poke. I also ordered the Furikake Chicken for my main. Although the poke sampler was fresh and delicious, the different flavors all ended up tasty of soy sauce and got a bit salty after a while. The Furikake Chicken was great, sweet from the glaze but a little bit salty from the furikake mix, and tender inside and crunchy outside! However, it ended up just tasting sweet after eating it for a while aha.

My only gripe about this place was how understaffed it was. I do not know if it is family run or not, but they basically had two servers on the floor who were not able to fully service all the large parties that were there. A lot of the tables were left dirty for a while until a server had the time to clean it up. But besides that, everything else was great! Great prices for quality Hawaiian food. We all left in food comas, which was not great for the drive back to LA, but we were happy and content^__^ Definitely visiting again the next time I make a trip to Vegas!!

Always prompt and excellent customer service. I've probably ordered most of the menu by now and never been disappointed. You know it's good when you ask someone from Hawaii where to get good Hawaiian food and they suggest Island Flavor!

The workers always greet you with a smile on their face and a very welcoming, "aloha!" I've never had to wait for a table. They usually seat you right away, but that doesn't mean they're never packed. 

The food is amazing!! The price is reasonable since their portions are so huge. I love love love a good spam musubi. Their flavor is just right, but sometimes I wish they would lessen the rice. The fried rice omelette is good! I think they use sticky rice for it butttt I'm not sure. The oxtail soup is also really good. The chantilly cake is sinfully amazing. If that stuff wasn't so fattening, I would probably eat a whole cake to myself.

Their customer service is always on point. My water is refilled almost instantaneously. I will definitely keep coming back here!

The portions are pretty big - my bf and I usually share a combination plate of beef teriyaki and kalbi short ribs which also comes with rice and salad, or get our own and have enough for 2 meals each.  The beef teriyaki and short ribs are super tasty!  I've also tried the fresh ahi poke and pork won tons - both are really good.  I wasn't a fan of the chop steak or chicken katsu but that could just be me.

if you want a taste of real hawaiian food this the the place to go..any local from islands will free right at home here. There is no haole inspired terriyaki chicken with pineapple at this place..true katsu, authentic short ribs, home made mac salad..and the portion size arein true hawaiian tradition...I have eaten here over a dozen times and the place is familly run..so you feel like you are going to a bbq at an aunties house rather than a formal dining place..which is awesome for family dinners with a 4yr old..the ladies that work the night shifts call my daughter by name and treat her like their own little neice..letting her order herself and occasionally getting a free ice cream if she is a good girl
The food here is not low-fat by any means..but if you want some amazing hawaiian comfort food here you go..this place is run laid-back island style..so go here to just cruise and relax not if your on a time schedule..this is not the place to get in and out for a quick bite..its a place to bring the whole ohana and talk story of some ono grinds...its a place to remember that a meal is a time to make memories and share family values while breaking bread..not a place to just feed your stomach when your hungry..i feel like I am back home in da islands everytime we come here

gotta try the short-ribs
mixed plate
ribeye steak
korean chicken katsu dip
and the chantilly cake..omg

nothing on this menu is small portioned or prepared wrong..you can tell the food is made with family love..so go enjoy some Aloha!!

Being a Kona girl living in a Cali this place made my soul & belly happy!  The staff was full of Aloha!  The music feels like home.  The food portions are huge!  My husband had the loco moco & he loved it.  It was served in a huge bowl smothered in gravy & an egg cooked to perfection!  I had a cup (cup was huge too) of the Portuguese bean soup & it tasted amazing!  I also had a mixed plate of chicken katsu which was delish & furikake shrimp. The shrimp was a little on the dry side, maybe over cooked.  The plate had 2 scoops of rice & a scoop of mac salad that was perfectly seasoned.  Will definitely be back next time we're in Vegas!  Gotta try the guava cake!!!

I have been here twice, one dine in and one to-go. I am a chicken Katsu addict so I get that all the time from any Hawaiian restaurant. I love their chicken Katsu and chicken furikake. I also ordered some spam musubi that disappointed me. Basically, my spam was covered in between two thick rice. The whole thing was too much rice. It's like a treasure hunt for my spam. I am not going to get any more spam musubi from them. I'd rather go to L&L for that.

Another lunch and another trip to Island flavor. This time the original location in Durango. Today I had the chicken katsu loco moco. It is too good. It has rice, gravy, crispy katsu fried chicken and two eggs on top. My son had the kalbi ribs again and fried rice with a side of Mac salad. The portions are huge! Come hungry. Two dishes fed my family of four and we still have enough leftovers for another meal. The ribs were juicy, the heaping pile of fried rice was delicious and the Mac salad is always consistently good. I honestly have never had a bad meal here. The place does get busy but we were served quickly and the whole staff is always friendly and helpful. My coworkers like coming here every Friday and I join them sometimes, so at least twice a month we are here.
First time here and loved the food and service. Had the Pork Adobe. A lot of reviews recommend the Katsu chicken so I will have to try it on my next visit

It's hard to ignore raving reviews claiming the best Hawaiian food in town (of course, I was skeptical). I haven't found a single place that emulates the Hawaiian dining experience I miss about home. I understand the appeal of Island Flavor with its large portions and seemingly bold flavors, however, it's simply not comparable to Hawaii eats (specifically, Oahu). Surprisingly, it's not even the best Hawaiian food I've had in Las Vegas.

The Spam Musubi was good. They add sauce and furikake around the spam and have an acceptable rice-to-spam ratio. I'm not a fan of adding other flavors, especially sweet, to my Spam Musubi, but this was subtle enough to still enjoy it.

The poke was sad. I ordered a pound of their Shoyu Ahi Poke (MP; $14.50) and I was rather disappointed. There was way too much soy sauce (yes, this is possible) and it made the poke salty. Also, the ingredients didn't have enough time to mingle their flavors together and the raw onions were too sharp (and I love raw onions). All things that could possibly have been avoided had the poke been made earlier. This is one of the worst poke I've eaten.

For my entree, I got a Mixed Plate with Kalua Pig & Cabbage and Furikake Chicken ($11.25), plus Fried Rice (add $2). I normally wouldn't order something like Furikake Chicken, but it seems to be a favorite here. It's deep-fried boneless chicken tossed in a Furikake glaze. Pretty tasty, albeit salty, but not something I desire to eat again. The Kalua Pig was so MEH. The pork was slightly dry and it needed A LOT more of that Hawaiian salt. This is one of my benchmark dishes since it's a personal favorite and this one made me very sad. The silver lining is that the pork and cabbage helped cut the saltiness of everything else! I'm torn about their fried rice. It's not the Hawaiian-style fried rice I was yearning or expecting, BUT it has an appeal. I don't like the prominent and slightly overbearing soy sauce flavor of their fried rice, however, it was still enjoyable (as long as I forget my Hawaiian-style expectation).

I also tried the Furikake Shrimp and Kalbi. I'm almost certain the shrimp is the frozen breaded type tossed with Furikake after frying. Shrug. The Kalbi, on the other hand, was pretty good!

Yes, the portions are HUGE. You can definitely share a mixed plate (especially with that enormous addition of fried rice) with two people and still be stuffed. Service was wonderful. All three servers on the floor helped us (yay teamwork!) and were extremely attentive - though they didn't refill waters.

Although there were many disappointments, I wouldn't write off future visits (must try other favorites) and I need to try their desserts!

Food was really, REALLY good, but I wasn't feeling the aloha spirit.  Server was a bit rude.  LOVED the desserts... I got Pineapple Coconut ice cream and enjoyed it so much I went out and found it in pints at the store.  My date bought the chantilly cake which was amazing.  This place is on the other side of town, so I'll prolly come back occasionally for the food and maybe just get it as take out.
My favorite Hawaiian restaurant. Portions are huge and flavor is on point. Need to come here more often but eat less
Great service and the food is delicious! Very inviting and casual atmosphere! Reasonably priced and I'm already looking forward to coming back!

If you come here, you better come hungry!  The portion sizes are no joke.  

The food quality is excellent and everything I've had was solid.  I did the mixed plate with Chicken Katsu and Roast Pork.  What was cool was I asked if they can do fried brown rice and they did, so they're very accommodating.  

You really can't beat the amount of food you get for the price.  I think my total came to $13 and I had to take it home, so it basically fed me for two meals.  The portion of fried rice alone was the size of a full order of fried rice you'd get from a Chinese restaurant.
Far away from the downtown but worth to go for sure. The food is tasty, especially after days on stripe
Hands down best Hawaiian in Las Vegas.

Very disappointed! If I had reviewed this before I'm sure they would of gotten 5 stars but after tonight's visit they deserve only 1 for overall service. I used to be quite a regular here, so much that the waitress already knew what I was going to order and she welcome me with a glass of lilikoi as I walked thru the door. 

Today's visit was quite the contrary; as I walked thru the door the older lady turned her back to us but I simply went straight to an open table. A few minutes passed as we waited and another couple walked in thru the door, the older lady was delivering food to a table and she stood there to have a 6 minute conversation with the table (I was looking at my watch) not giving any aloha's that we were going on almost a 15 minute wait and that there was customers standing at the entrance. 

After the long conversation, the older lady decided to sit down the couple and hand them some menus. My mom had to get up and ask the older lady for some menus after she sat back down the phone rang and she totally forgot about us. The younger waitress that's always there came out from the back and I calmly asked her for menus for a second time - let me just state that there was only two other tables that were already eating, the place was not packed for such lack of customer service! - still no menus came! The older lady walked to the back twice more and brought the table next to us a to go box and even decided to take the couple's order that had walked in after us. 

Finally! She decided to bring us the menus. I ordered a lilikoi and my mom a sprite, the older lady looked at my mom like she was dumb! She turned to me and tapped my menu with her hand and asked what my mom had said like she was non existent and she didn't know what Sprite is AND to tap my menu as I was reading demanding to know what she wanted!!! How freaking rude??? Apparently, they don't carry Sprite but Sierra Mist. Either way she could of said that, my mom looked at her like ok? where are your drinks on the menu? She snatched the menu off my mom's hand and turned it to the back but that menu was missing the back page! She didn't even apologize! 

My blood was boiling at this point. I opened the menu and realized that the ahi poke I'm a regular for is now $18 from the $8.95 it used to be! If you can't afford an item on the menu, take it off don't double the price. The price was modified with a piece of tape. I about had it so I grabbed my keys and we walked out the door made me lose my appetite!

Island Flavor and I have gotten to know each other pretty well over the past year or so.  Always in search of good local food, Island Flavor has become king of Las Vegas as far as I'm concerned.  First L&L...then Aloha Kitchen...and Ross J's...it was like climbing the ladder of local food with each one being better than the last.  And at the top was Island Flavor.  Entrees under $9.  Gigantic portions that will feed you for two meals.  Delicious, consistent food.  Make you feel-at-home service.  This place really has all of the ingredients for creating a regular customer out of me.  

My favorite dish to order is the mixed plate with Chicken Katsu and Teriyaki Beef.  Each plate comes with two scoops of rice and macaroni salad.  The katsu is breaded just right, not too thick, with the chicken still moist inside.  The teriyaki beef is out of this world!  Honestly, anything beef on their menu is amazing (from the hamburger to the teriyaki, from the steak and onions to the loco moco) and is highly recommended.  I've also had some of their pork dishes and was very impressed with them as well; I don't really like pork, but here is a place where I'll order it.  

No joke, I'm getting some intense cravings for their food as I write this review.  Yes, I was just there a week ago...but for a good 6 months or so I pretty much came here once a week!  Highly recommended.

This is my favorite Hawaiian spot. There food is delicious and the service is very friendly. Love the Khalua Pork, Furikake Chicken, Katsu Chicken, loco moco, pork roast, Teri steak, haha I love it all! Get a spam musubi just for starters.

I am afraid to write a review for this place because it's my favorite Hawaiian place. It gets really busy during dinner time as is. If you want real Hawaiian cooking then come here.
