Leaving at least four cups of rice behind, along with a few bites of macaroni salad that was actually quite enjoyable with plenty of creaminess packed in each bite, it was with an "all-in" approach that sweets were ordered up, and despite warnings and raised eyebrows from more than one staff-member the finale to follow was almost entirely worth the indulgence, the $5.50 Mud Pie a bit of a disappointment due to gritty ice cream while each cake from nearby Andrea's was presented at a bargain $5 per large slice, the faintly coconut Haupia not unlike something one might find at a wedding while the chantilly and guava came across sweet yet balanced, the quivering bread pudding taking a far less subtle approach with each banana-packed spoonful making a strong case for best in the city, or at the very least a good reason to come back.

Purporting no expertise in Hawaiian cuisine, but hoping to learn more in the coming months and years, Island Flavor represents a tremendous bargain to those looking for something familiar yet different with service and setting far superior to most eateries broadly grouped as 'ethnic,' the desserts a particular strong point even if they are mostly outsourced.

Wow. This place is amazing! 

A few people at work keep telling me about this place. I swing by on a Thursday around early evening time to try it out. The inside of the restaurant looked like a place I would see in Hawaii. It wasn't over done but it was nice. The place looks like it could fit 100 people easily. What did scare me was the place was empty. Well, when I first walked in, I did see some ladies sitting on a table... but to my surprise they were the cooks and help just sitting around waiting for hungry patrons like me.

After telling them I wanted to order to go, they handed me a regular menu menu with daily specials and let me at it. They had the typical things you would see on any Hawaiian restaurant menu. What thing I did notice is that they didn't have any Spam entrees. After a good five minutes of looking over the menu, I decided on the following:

Beef Teriyaki Steak - (Bottom sirloin marinated with our special Asian sauce then broiled to perfection and sliced thin - $8.75) Wow. When they say Steak, they mean it! I have never seen Beef Teriyaki so large. Its like regular Beef Teri on steroids! Check out my pictures on how huge the portions are. The beef was tender and flavorful. I would definitely order this again.

Hawaiian Style Roast Pork - (Cooked local style with Hawaiian salt, cracked black pepper, sliced thin and topped with our rich homemade brown gravy - $8.25) Yum! What makes this dish work is the homemade brown gravy. The roast port was tender and soft. Large portions as well. Great dish. I would definitely order this again as well.

Korean Chicken - (Golden fried drumettes $ wings tossed in our delicious Korean sauce - $8.75) Yay! This dish was awesome as well. When I first cracked open the box, I just saw crispy chicken wings. I scooped some rice and pick up a piece with my fork and placed the chicken on my plate. I licked my fork and damn.... it was over. Just the taste on the fork was really really good. I had to dig in. So many flavors hitting my taste buds! I love this dish! Would definitely order again.

Each dish comes with two scoops of rice and a side mac salad. The mac salad was good as well. Overall.... I love this place! The food is awesome. The portions are large the price is comparable to other Hawaiian joints. I would seriously recommend this place to my friends and everyone else who reads these reviews. You will not be disappointed. 

Pictures included!

Once I landed at McCarran Airport, my friend picked me up and gave me three options for lunch. Island Flavor was the winner! I was craving Hawaiian, after all. Kevin said the place is typically busy during the week, so I'm glad we easily found an empty table on the Sunday afternoon that we visited.

We decided on a half pound of ahi poke and an order of furikake shrimp. The waiter asked if we wanted a half or full pound of poke, and even though I had to resist, I'm glad we said half pound. It was plenty of food for two people. I wasn't a huge fan of the shrimp, but I could tell it was expertly made. The crispiness was on point. I also loved the freshness of the poke. Overall solid meal!

Been coming here when I'm on this side of town. This is one of the best Hawaiian Restaurants in Las Vegas! They have real authentic Hawaiian AND Island Style food. They have good Daily specials. Tasty and they give a lot here. 

Another good thing is right next to the restaurant they own a store where you can buy stuff from Hawaii. From Hawaiian Sun juice to Mochi Crunch, Candies and more.
Very good Kalbi & Chantilly cake! Deducted 1 star because I couldn't eat the Korean chicken - it had ginger BUT that was my fault because I don't like ginger =) Highly recommend this place!!!

Food here brings me back to vacation in Hawaii! Portions are huge and food is consistently good. Haven't ordered something that I wasn't satisfied with, even the side salad is tasty.  Chicken katsu is crispy and juicy, teriyaki steak is tender and flavorful.  Fresh poke in three different varieties. Daily specials are great as well, I really like the short ribs.

Health code violation- they repackaged a takeout order that I brought back because they gave me the wrong food, they gave it to a guy who came in after me.  

This place used to be good. There has been a decline in pretty much everything from service to food since the change in ownership. 

I'm very disappointed in the new ownership and staff. I ordered take-out, which included 2lbs of pokè. I got home opened the boxes and realized they gave me the wrong food and I only had 1lb of pokè. I left the food that was right so my kids could start eating and went back to the restaurant to get the missing pokè.  

I brought the wrong food back to the restaurant and they asked me whether or not I touched or ate the food- which I hadn't. Apparently they also gave me the wrong pokè and asked me where it was at. The girl didn't want to give me the food I actually paid for unless I brought back the pokè I "took." The girl even asked me if we started eating the pokè and if we could bring it back. I didn't want to argue with her and said just give me one of my pokè so I can go. 

I saw her take the food I had brought back, re-bag it up, and give it to the guy who came in asking for his takeout just a few minutes later.  I was completely disgusted.  I worked in a restaurant for over 10 years and repackaging food that may have been contaminated is a health code violation.  I won't be eating here again.

Two stars because their mac and cheese was really good - was really light and fresh.
the place it self was really cheep and run down looking. No Alcohol license, so they dont even serve bear..
we felt really out of place, menu has no pictures or explanation that someone that never lived in HI would know what they are ordering. We left hungry.

I had to come back to bring my family (6), on a wednesday evening. I ordered the mix plate: short ribs and roast pork. My family had all sorts of things..I remember it being pretty cheap, 70?

- This place doesn't FAIL. GREAT FOOD!
- It was still sunny outside, no curtains. sun beaming on face. tinted windows aren't tinted enough. lol
- short ribs were tasty! some fat. 3 huge pieces.
- I take that back. the Roast pork was a fail. tasted like roast beef. It had gravy on it. tons of fat..
- My sister had another pork dish. Now that was really good. I recommend that over the roast pork. she also had, i think, fried chicken. very crispy!
- My dad had the Ox tail soup. it was delicious. it reminded me of nilaga, a filipino soup. 
- My brother-in-law had the loco moco and the patty was HUGE!!! He's like an MMA fighter, big appetite, and he still couldn't finish that. lol.
- I shared my meal with my gf. SHARING IS CARING! taste everyone's food :)

My go to spot for authentic homemade Hawaiian food. Portions are huge so I would recommend you share. Don't even try to finish your meal, I don't know anyone who has ever finished one of their plates in one sitting. Staff is super friendly and are very accommodating with large parties. Splitting the bill was simple. We ordered the Furikake Poke (prices vary based on fish market value), Loco Moco (with amazing gravy), Mud Pie, and Lilikoi drink ($0.50 refill). You can't go wrong with any of their dishes!

This place is great. I always get the furikake chicken with a side of their sesame dressing. Their portions are huge and I always have left overs. I recommend getting their combo plate so you can try two of their entrees for a smaller price! The wait staff is also very polite and quick!

Ok let's start off by saying I'm prejudice to this place because I'm Hawaiian. After my favorite Hawaiian restaurant closed (Hawaiian hale) 

I was feeling kinda bummed out. But low and behold I heard about this Hawaiian restaurant that opened up and they come from the big island. So u know what that means, had to come and try it. 

I was expecting L&L style cuisine the norm for most Hawaiian dubbed restaurants. But was greatly surprised to to see the menu. It still has some classic L&L dishes u would expect. Kalbi ribs etc. 

But it's the non L&L dishes the caught my attention. Portugese bean soup (one of my favorites), Aloha LauLau Fridays, hoisin baby back ribs, Korean chicken and roast pork loco moco to name a few.. I have tried all of these and they are delicious.

You must come and give this place a try..

Got the roast pork Loco moco. It was really good. Only qualm I have is when I asked if they could add a burger patty to it, I was told that it would cost an extra 7.50... $7.50???? MIGHT AS WELL GET ANOTHER FREAKIN LOCO MOCO. GG. Regardless, food was still really good.

Compared to Hawaii, this has got to be one of the best Hawaiian food places I have ever eaten at. Every time we have come here the food has been so damn good and tasty. The staff is very welcoming, upbeat, and always makes sure you're doing okay. Nothing but yummy foods here!

Finally!  We found the place (opposite side of the Strip, not Henderson) that reminds us of home the most!  This place has been around for over a year or so now, opened by a Big Island guy!  So, you'd better expect BIG!  Expect to bring home some leftovers for dinner/lunch/breakfast the next day!  Every time we come here, we feel like we're back at home again!  For some reason, food (and music) will always take us back to the islands...

*smack!* the Chicken Katsu Loco Moco!  First time ever trying both local favorites - together!  MmmMmmm!  Aaaand, leftovers to take home!  OHH!  And you should try their Fried Rice and Omelet!  I think it's on their Specials Menu!  That fried rice is soooo tasty, with huge pieces of sausage in it, and so very moist and perfect!  They serve it with 3 slices of Portuguese sausage, I think it's the Maui or Big Island kine!  HUGE!  And ONO, too!  Other goodies to try, Korean Chicken (saucy!), and their Kalbi!

If you are from Hawaii, and you live here in Las Vegas now, forget about L&L for your local fix!  Summerlin finally has a place that serves up one of the best local foods I've tasted since living here!  Broke da Mouth!

So far the best Hawaiian restaurant I've tried in Vegas!  The Furikake Chicken...still can't talk, broken mouth :). We tried to go back on Sunday but they closed early. This is one spot I will always visit when I'm back in Vegas!

This place probably deserve a 5 for service.  Someone recommended this place and we drove 17 miles to eat here.  I am not sure if we would come back.  
The place is definitely a Hawaiian place to eat at.  The food was plentiful and delicious.  The Kalbi beef was good but I personally like it with more seasoning.  The hamburger steak was yummy yum yum.  The chicken katsu loco moco was my husband total satisfaction.  My son had the Kalbi and Kalua pig.  I like it salty and smokey tasting it was missing that to me.  But seriously this place is awesome.  I think you would be happy eating here. 
I was told the Hawaiian food is delicious like the island but I don't like the Lau Lau but definitely people ordered it and they were out of it so I am sure it is good.
The place is really good, I will go when I am in that area.  
See my photos it was plentiful and the service is excellent! The owner even comes out to greet you and wipe down tables.  Seriously it is a breath of fresh air. 
Btw the mud pie look to die for.  We had to get to a basketball game otherwise we would of ordered dessert.

Island Flavor.. Hmmm I don't really know what to say about this place...

Ambiance: Total FAIL. It feels as if they just put some chairs and tables in a empty lot. No color on the walks but they did just put some random potted plants in the corners..

Food: portion wise they give you a TON. I love loco moco's so I have this one a try. The gravy was too thick and the worst part... My meat wasn't cooked. I didn't complaint to the server since I didn't want to wait again while my partner was finished with her food already. 

I don't know if I would go back for their loco moco but I've heard good things about the other plates. So maybe ill go back and try something different... But not anytime soon.

Each time I come here, I continue to love it more and more. Maybe I was too enthralled in all the great conversation with my fellow yelpers, but I could find little to fault in last nights UYE at Island Flavor. It was a great evening in celebration of a really nice guy. 

This was my third time here and the third time I had ordered the hoisin baby back ribs. Do I regret ordering the same thing and not deviating? NEVER! I did however shared the love and was shown some back when my companions offered me some of their plates. If they didn't, I would not know how good some of the other stuff was. The steak was delectable. The Korean chicken was perfection in taste and crispiness. The galbi was a disappointment. It was tough and chewy, unlike my amazing ribs. When I lifted one to take a bite, the meat slid right off. My plate was one of the few that went back bare, but I swear I shared.  The sesame poke was amazing and the serving is generous for $9.95. I might eat that when I am craving a "light" meal. We ended the night with some dessert. The banana bread pudding was good, but so dense. One bite and I was done. Then again, I did inhale a whole piece of the kona coffee mud pie. Sorry guys, you handed me a spoon and turned your back. I cannot resist ice cream. I still remember someone turning to point at how big the slice was and found a sliver left over. I ended up finishing that too. Both desserts are a great deal at $5.50. Just be careful who you decide to share them with.

I've eaten at a few Hawaiian plate restaurants in Las Vegas and Hawaii and this was the best I've had so far. 
We went on a week day for lunch, some other customers were coming and going but not too busy. Staff was excellent, we waited for some friends before ordering and they kept checking back with us until we were ready to order our food.
Prices were great for the amount of food you get. I got the special of the day which was Mahi Mahi grilled in an egg batter. It was good but a bit bland. Their macaroni salad was not the best, a bit disappointing since I like macaroni salad. My husband got a Combo platter of Beef Teriyaki and Chicken Katsu with Korean Sauce (recommended by the waitress) they use on their Korean Chicken. All of his food was delicious. We decided to get a slice of  Haupia Cake...OMG! One of the best cakes I've ever had. 
I will definitely go back again.
Generous portions and excellent food. I had the Kaluha pork and sesame poke, yum!!!!!!
Absolutely the best place for eat for Hawaiian grinds . I would recommend island flavor over any other Hawaiian spot in town .
Wish it was closer to my Northwest side of town . Always enjoy their portion and prices! Best one I always order is Kalbi and furikake chicken mixed plate! Taste and feel just like home!

Seriously yummy Hawaiian food with very large sized portions.  So much fresher than other local competition.  I love chicken katsu loco moco and the Chantilly cake.  The poke is really good too.  I always do take out and my order is ready and waiting right on time.

The place is clean, the staff is nice but the food is overpriced ($18 for one plate) and very mediocre... I had the poke plate which was ok, quite dry and didn't taste like sushi grade fish but if I was desperate for poke (which I was that day) I would maybe give it a 10% thought. The Mac salad wasn't very good either but not horrible. In my opinion it's somewhere to go if nowhere else is open.

Hands down to the BEST Hawaiian place in Vegas! The food here is delicious! Way better than L&L or Aloha Kitchen in my opinion. It also deserves extra stars for the amount of food you get! If you enjoy Hawaiian style plate lunches and have a good appetite, this is definitely the place to go. Two words: FURIKAKE CHICKEN. It's definitely a must try!

The food here is wonderful!  I had the mixed plate of Kalbi and Chicken Katsu.  The Katsu was moist, crunchy and not oily.  The Kalbi was tender.  The mixed plate had three huge pieces of Kalbi, 10 pieces of Katsu, macaroni salad, and I paid extra to get their pork fried rice.  I took home a little more than half my food and it barely fit into the to go box!
The servers were friendly.  But the reason I didn't give them four stars was because the service was SLOW!  We waited over 30 minutes for our food.  Granted they were busy but...
All things considered, I'll definitely be making the drive to try more of their food.
If you are in the SW definitely visit Island Flavor!
Got the chicken katsu. All the chicken was awesome, no crappy pieces like you sometimes get at LandL. Really good food!

Ordered take out for two, good food, and large portions decent prices so overall a pretty good experience 

Got the short rib plate which was really tasty and came with rice and mac salad 

And got a combo plate of chicken katsu and furikake chicken, I didn't care for the furikake- not that crispy cause of all the sauce, but my boyfriend liked the seaweed flavor. The chicken katsu was good.

Really authentic food. Good price. Great service. As close as you can get to Hawaii in Vegas.  The waitress was one local girl and was really cool.  Nice to see some Aloha spirit made it out of Hawaii intact.  Aloha is dying everywhere, but not at this place....

Found this incredible local restaurant on Yelp and come back every time I'm in Vegas.   Hubby loves their oxtail soup and their Kalbi plate and macaroni salad is my fav. Don't miss out, Island Flavor is worth the drive!

Great place to feel the Ohana and Aloha of Hawaii, both with the employees and through the food. This is a really good place eat  'plate lunch'  but in a upscale way. The choices are really good, the quantity is plentiful, the flavors are authentic and the service is full of Aloha. 

There is a daily special, Friday's is my favorite, the true Hawaiian plate, includes Laulau ( come early they do run out). The regular menu includes all the Hawaiian specialties and you can make a mixed plate as was our choice tonight. 

I got the Furikake Chicken--Boneless chicken deep fried and tossed in a furikake glaze and Kalbi Short Ribs--Tender short ribs marinated in a Korean sauce and broiled to perfection. Two scoops rice and Mac salad finishes it off. The chicken was crispy chunks with lots of flavor, the kalbi was tender and so good! 

My husband got a mixed plate as well, Teriyaki Chicken--Boneless, skinless chicken thighs marinated in a homemade Teri sauce and broiled, he also got Hawaiian Style Roast Pork--Cooked local style w/Hawaiian salt, cracked black pepper, sliced thin and topped w/rich homemade brown gravy. Also came with two scoops rice and Mac salad. Both so good. Teriyaki sauce is well flavored and the pork tender.

Of course we had to have dessert, tonight's choice, Chantilly cake, Chocolate cake, Chantilly frosting (evaporated milk, sugar, egg yolks, butter, vanilla extract). Moist, rich frosting, good choice!

Service is always excellent, they treat you like family and ensure you have everything you need. On Fridays and Saturdays they have live music but, you might have to wait for a table so plan ahead.
They have the best service ever. It didn't feel like we were waiting a long time, we didn't even noticed & they came out with a free appetizer and they apologized. They are awesome!
Love this place! It is up the street from my house and has the best fried rice! They also have huge proportions!

*updated* been here a few more times...off and on.  Food is still great as always! Flavors are closest to home cooked "Hawaii" food.  Most times we get take out because service wise we just don't feel totally comfortable eating in -- service is hit n miss at times.  Like I reviewed before, they are not rude--just not very friendly/welcoming.  Dishes we love are the roast pork loco...super good gravy and the Teri steak or kal bi is very Ono.  Their kal bi is not those skimpy kine you get from L&L or Ohana BBQ...it is big juicy pieces.  They now offer brown rice and their toss greens is so good with homemade sesame dressing and sweet potato! Bumping up a star since last review since the food is on point.  Thank goodness this restaurant is close by and take out is available.  Tip: Friday Hawaiian plate always runs out early so call ahead....they also don't let you substitute.

Best authentic Hawaiian food in the US.  I am going with this bold statement because I have not had anything close to the food at Island Flavor.  The pulled pork, the ox-tail soup, and the loco mocos are awesome.  These meals come with a side salad(including macaroni salad) and rice.  

The prices are great and one dinner can feed two people.  The portions are super huge.  If you can still muster up some more, their desserts are a good compliment.  The mud pie is super good!!  Enjoy!

The food was very good. We ordered the short ribs, pork and teriyaki beef.
The quality of the meat is outstanding.
The Portuguese bean soup was also very good.
Service was fast, the place was clean.
Food is very cheap compared to its quality. Would definitely go back.

I would give them a 3.5 if I had the option. We split the teriyaki steak with rice & macaroni and also the furikake shrimp with rice & side salad. We phoned in our order and were a little disappointed that they didn't have mashed potatoes as a sub for the rice on one of our orders, it is on the menu.
I zipped over and picked up our order and shot home to the wife with a bag full of Hawaiian goodies. The teriyaki steak was good but nothing out of this world... maybe I was looking for a tad more flavor from the meat. Don't get me wrong, the steak was good, but could've used a little seasoning and to be less reliant on the teriyaki alone. The rice was good sticky rice and the macaroni was pretty good too.
The furikake shrimp was a good size portion, 7 large butterflied shrimp, but was a bit on the overcooked size and a noticeable dark brown was given to the panko crumbs. Again, good sticky rice and my wife enjoyed the side salad.
Island Flavor did nothing wrong and we would try them again in the future but nothing really stood out to us as being out of this world. Maybe we should try eating in next time?
Most delicious fried rice !! And the moco loco is the hangover cure of the century !!! Love this place anytime I hang with mom this is what we order huge portions

Ordered the Kalbi Short Ribs and the Teriyaki Chicken. The beef was bland but the chicken was so over salted and drowned in teriyaki sauce, I couldn't eat more than 2 or 3 bites. I also opted for the brown rice and it was so overcooked and mushy almost like mashed potatoes. I'm not sure what all the hype is about this place. Definitely not a place I would recommend since the quality is so low. Perhaps I ordered the wrong dishes, but how do you mess up grilled chicken, short ribs and rice? Big FAIL!

I got the ahi poke plate from this place.. Was the worst tasted like the fish came out of a bad part of the ocean or they may have had left overs that they needed to get rid of.. Service was good but I will say the cooks/whoever places the food order for the restaurant need an evaluation.. No disrespect but I should have took my money over to 808 sushi.. Island flavor you take the L for my meal you served me today.. And Yelp! this is facts.. Good day my friend

Before we found this place, we have already been to 2 other Hawaiian restaurants in Las Vegas. We have only been here once and so as the other 2, but this place is the best of the all. I ordered the mixed plate -  2 scoops of rice, mac salad and two choices (I picked Kalbi and Korean chicken). Man, something about their recipes here that makes their food so much better. My friends and I suggested that we come here every weekend...its that good!

My husband came here a few months ago and said it was so good.... came here today... the location is about 15 min off the strip... in a nice area... we came at about 11am... not too busy... ordered furikake chicken and hamburger steak combo... the food was so good... staff was nothing but friendly and efficient... about 1130, the place filled up and was very busy... 
the chicken, very tasty and crunchy... something different but so good... hamburger steak was huge, grilled to perfection, topped with onions and mushrooms and gravy... everything was yummy!  Also, before we left, we packed up our leftovers, and they even gave us a to-go cup of Pepsi!  Who does that these days?!  Love this place, will most definitely be back!!!

Food is delicious ! And the portion sizes are over the top ! I Had lunch and dinner the next day , that's how generous the portions are . Loco Moco is the best that I have ever had !! You must try it :)

Born and raised in the 808 definitely gives me the right to let everyone know whats the real deal about the food from Island Flavor.  The terms "broke da mouth" or "ono" are used when you have consumed foods that are so delicious, full of flavor that you can eat it till you go into "polynesian paralasys" hahahaha! This place cooks and serves their food as if they were still back on the island, plated with "choke" (lots) of food and with lots of local flavors.  All the other restaurants out there in vegas attemp to serve you what they call "hawaiian bbq" but Island Flavor doesnt sell theirselves to be a bbq spot, they stick to their name and serve you exactly what you want, Hawaiian food and more. The best Kalbi, well-done everytime and their chantilly and haupia cakes are just like home, maybe even better. Poke is fresh and the loco-moco's, three scoop rice, huge hamburger patty and choke gravy witht the mac, winner! Go in for the authentic Hawaiian plate on a friday or saturday night when they have live hawaiian music. Very laid back, everybody is family; auntie, cousin, uncle. You wont be disappointed

Hey, pretty good! Got the combo plate of Furikake chicken and the Korean style chicken. The Korean style chicken was delicious!

To work on:
-Furikake chicken had too much breading:chicken ratio

Aloha bradah and sistah's! This place is serves food like it just travelled from Hawaii. Nice atmosphere, live music on Saturday evenings and man you can grub on some good Kalbi Ribs. Don't forget to order their specials, it changes every time I go there. Also try the Spicy Poke Avocado, you wont regret it. Enjoy the food and then call a flatbed to scoop you up.
DELICIOUS!! First time have Island food and it did not disappoint. The Guava cake is the $***!!

Being from Hawaii, I tend to crave Hawaiian food! I ordered the Laulau special at Island Flavor... They never disappoint!! The Laulau plate came with 1 huge and tasty Laulau, Lomi Salmon, Haupia (Hawaiian dessert), Mac Salad, and rice. I requested brown rice with my plate.  The brown rice was the sticky brown rice, it was perfect!  I also ordered a cup of coffee.  They used Kona Coffee, which is one of my favorite coffees.  The restaurant was busy, the wait staff was friendly and attentive. All in all Island Flavor deserved the 5 stars!!

pretty good....

Fave thing i always get is the Furikake Chicken. 

Pretty good service and good local vibe of the Restaraunt. Poke pretty expensive but its understandable.

Fridays there's usually live music and gets pretty busy so come early.

What is that you hear upon walking in.....locals speaking pidgin (FYI if you don't know what this is, google it!)..yup this place must be the real deal =)  Having lived in Hawaii for a brief period of time...the food here definitely compares to the plate lunches from the island.  

My personal favorites are the korean chicken wings/drummettes and the fried poke plate!  Now, how do you fry poke...isn't the point for the fish to be raw?!....normally that is true but they serve a seared poke that I would describe as mini ahi tuna steak nuggets...served with a huge portion of rice and mac salad.   They offer to cook the poke all the way through, but don't do it unless you want to ruin your meal...just a light sear is all you need for the fish to have a melt in your mouth feel =)  

I've also had the katsu loco moco (katsu covered with a fried egg and copious amounts of gravy) and this is not for the faint of heart....I believe my take out box felt like it weighed 5 lbs...this order quickly puts me into "droopy eyelid mode".....in other words food coma...so be forewarned.
Furachi chicken (sorry spelling) is so good!! We always have our food delivered and it never disappoints. Our favorite Hawaiian spot

So I had never had authentic Hawaiian until island flavor. Man the furikake chicken is something else. So many flavors. The portions should be called sumo sized. Will definitely eat here anytime I visit Vegas again.

i can't get enough of this place!! reminds me of back home!! chicken katsu loco moco bomb good, ahi poke, and every friday they have the hawaiian plate i can't get enough of it, good prices and biug portions and service is great!!!

Jewel in the desert. This place brings me back to the islands!!! The Furikake Chicken is to die for! I brought my daughter and niece here and they loved every item they ordered. Come here hungry. Their servings a huge!

Being from Hawaii, it would seem redundant for us to eat at place like Island Flavor, but one of our friends, who lives in Phoenix was in the mood for plate lunch, so our Las Vegas connection told  us about this place.  It is easy to find in Durango, not too far from Silverton Casino and Hotel.  The place was busy, but we were seated in about 10 minutes.  I could see from the orders coming out that the portions are huge!  Make sure you go hungry!
I ordered the teriyaki beef and Korean chicken mix and the chicken was outstanding!  The teri beef was tender and flavorful.  Others in the group ordered, chicken katsu, kal bi, and teriyaki chicken. Each one that came out was piled on the plate and seemed to please all my friend's palates.  Most of the plates were priced below $10.
If your a Las Vegas resident, you could take the leftovers home for lunch the next day.  If your visiting, you might want to share your plate with someone in your party unless you KNOW you can finish it.  If you share, you might have a little room left for dessert, which looked and sounded good, but none of us had any room for it.

We drove from the North end to the Southwest on this cold and rainy night. Did I mention we had to drive in fog. Big deal, right? Well yeah if your night vision sucks, and you've NEVER had to drive in fog, ever...in your life.

We were invited back to give it a second shot and I amq so glad for the invitation because I probably wouldn't bothered coming back just because I originally felt I wasn't missing out.

For a Tuesday night and all the rain...I was so surprise to see how full the restaurant was. It was busy. We were quickly greeted by Mark, who then became our waiter for the evening. He was such a delight to have. My son spilled water and he literally did not lose his delightful vibe as he was cleaning it up. I felt so bad. I give Mark 5 stars for his professionalism and welcoming feeling.

Tonight between us all, we had  ordered the furikake poke, kalbi, kalua pig and cabbage, opakapaka misoyaki, chopped steak and onions, and the furikake chicken. When you get the furikake chicken...your eyeball will fall out its sockets because of the portion. I saw that thing from afar and was so shocked. More so, this plate was for my 6 and 2 year old son...and it could easily have fed me as well. Note for next time. I gave it a bite and definitely loved the crispy chicken and the glaze used over it. The furikake was definitely evident.

My husband had the opakapaka (pink snapper) and of course he loved it! The misoyaki sauce used over the fish was light, and had a sweet taste to it...it paired well with the fish. I can't tell you much about the chopped steak my 8 year old had, because he literally devoured it...literally. Since I had ordered the kalbi and kalua pig combo, but really cared for the kalbi...I shared my kalua with the hubby. Kalua pig was legit.

Then there I was, with the kalbi I had tried the first time we visited. The one that I said was missing that island flavor I was looking for. Okay, well...Kalbi came out with a vengeance because tonight's kalbi was exactly the flavor with the char I was looking for the first time around. It did NOT disappoint. 

Seeing the place a second time around....I say they have a better menu selection wise than 808MP. They offer fried poke, and I slapped myself for not ordering that tonight, but I came for the kalbi. So you know what that means...I will officially be returning. They serve BIG portions and it is definitely worth it for the price you pay. I can officially up the star it deserves.

Highly recommend if you are craving Hawaiian food.

Thank you, Bruce! Dinner was deelish.

Came here with my girlfriend the other night and we got Kalua pig and cabbage and a mix plate of the furikaki shrimp and the furikaki chicken. The chicken was my favorite.

This is one of the better Hawaiian food places here in town.
The food is really good. Family owned business with authentic food. Their portion sizes are soooo huge!

I never would have thought of having food that reminds me being back on the island. This place has the authentic island vibe. I like how they stream the local Hawaiian radio station.

My Kalbi lunch plate was huge as expected. Fresh grill marks and charbroiled taste. Not Kalbi cooked on a flattop with a rubbery chewy texture. Will return again on my next excursion off the strip.

So I've been coming here off and on since they opened and I love it every time, just found out they are open on Monday(they used to be closed) so that makes MY weekend even better.  The portions are always big and delicious and they make you feel like you are back in the islands as soon as you walk thru the door, with their local accents, genuine smiles and the local music isn't bad as well.  Definitely coming back more now that it's open Mondays.
Best Hawaiian food ever. Service is good and are cool people. Atmosphere is casual and chill. The portion size are massive! Furikake chicken and fried rice is my favorite.

This restaurant is one of my favorite Hawaiian restaurants in town. It is a sit down restaurant in a casual atmosphere with island music playing in the background. There is one server who is always super sweet, quick, and she is very attentive. Unfortunately, some of the other servers,  not so much.

Come hungry! The portions here are HUGE! 

My favorite dishes are:
- Furikake Chicken (not the same on the shrimp, would recommend chicken only)
- Kalbi Short Ribs
- Fresh Made Ahi Poke (2 sizes, half and full)
- Macaroni Salad

i went cause i was craving some chicken katsu

i was disappointed by theirs cause it was fried wayy to much for my liking. I like GOLDEN brown not DARK brown. there was a lot of it but thats about it. 

The rice was soggy. but the mac salad was decent. 

I will try the other items and update if  they are better.

VERY HUGE PORTIONS! 
You can share a plate with 3 people!! 
Food was great. Just the wait was ehh but still, the food was great and delicious.

Man, their portion is HUGE~! So definitely, bring your appetite. And this place certainly has the "Island Flavor" all around, with very friendly service too. Terriyaki beef was my fav out of 6 other dishes we had on our table. However, I kept thinking..."man, were the dishes made by chef school drop-outs?" (Not to offend the "chefs" there, but dont expect high quality or eye-applealing presentation here.) Overall, cool place and I would go back there again for sure. Wish they just "clean up" all the clutters tho, esp. the dirty rug that was covering a long table in the corner X(

I love this place... Feels like home. The Aloha Spirit is alive & well within these walls... There's no bettah compliment I can give a Hawaiian restaurant. Island Flavor is located in an unassuming strip mall on Durango. It's probably a good 15-20 minute drive via freeway from the Las Vegas strip. It is worth the drive. Trust me... Drove up and I knew it was gonna be good cause there were people waiting outside to be seated and also I could hear a small group (3-piece band) inside singing Hawaiian music. It was great. I felt at home... It's kind of how Hawai'i makes you feel. Aloha all around.

 I ordered the chicken katsu loco moco after seeing photos of it by other Yelpers (mahalos!). It came served in a giant bowl. Let me just say that I feel classic loco moco dishes or any variation of a loco moco should be served in a bowl. It's only fitting. The katsu was delicious. The batter was light and chicken was not dry. The gravy that was generously poured over tasted great with the katsu and the bed of white rice. SO ONO... Sadly I was a weakster and could only finish half of this heavy handed portion of a meal. Even our waitress was giving me grief saying I cannott leave if I cant even eat half. HAHA.... Apparently, I didnt hit the required quota. I will make sure to represent mo bettah next time.

And of course we couldnt leave without having the coco puffs... I havent had them since when I was fortunate enough to attend my coworker's wedding on Oahu in which she had Liliha Bakery supply coco puffs & green tea puffs instead of slices of wedding cake... It was so good & so appropriate. Quite possibly one of the more delicious sweet things I've had in my life. Now Island Flavor's coco puffs are not exactly the same as Liliha's original version but they are delicious in their own right. Totally worth the $6 or so for the half-dozen. They top it with whipped cream too but that really isnt even needed. They are great and are a taste of Oahu for sure.

I will make sure to eat here next time in town which is thankfully enough next weekend... I'm gonna bring some of my friends that havent been there before & I'm sure they will like it as much as I do and spread the word as I have.

UPDATE!  Wow, Incredible customer service.  Ok, so we got sick  from eating the food at Island flavor.  It sucked and it was what it was.  Literally minutes after writing the previous one star review I got a message from the owner Bruce.  He was so kind and apologetic that he offered to give us a full refund on said dinner.  He continued to guarantee that all of his food is prepared fresh daily and that the turn over on food is so quick that food never sits.  I believed him.  This particular situation prompted him to look deeper into the problem as far as checking in with vendors that supply his restaurant to try and find the source of the problem.  

Due to the overwhelming amount of concern, professionalism and care that he has given me and my friends...I think I'm gonna write this off as a fluke accident.  It happens to the best of em. Besides that Furikake chicken is too good to ignore!  

Again, thank you Bruce for the amazing customer service and I definitely won't give up on Island Flavor.
laulau today and new this time for me chicken katsu loco moco. excellent. not a ton of chicken but certainly enough!

Solid Hawaiian cuisine and a family run business.  The amount of food is almost obscene but still high quality.  The place was slammed when we were there and they were turning them fast.  

The service is a bit haphazard but they got the job done.  When the food arrived and we all were like WHOA that is a lot of food!   

No complaints and we will go there again.

This place is my favorite Hawaiian place! Portions are extremely large and you can add a second entree for a dollar or so ( perfect for left over nights at home). Really great value for your money.

The place is very simple looking, decors are very outdated.. Has this third world country feel. They are always always understaffed thus expect to wait long yet, the servers are really really nice. You have to be there very early to beat the crowd.

Aesthetics aside, I will Always always come back to this place. I adore the food and the price! I plan to try all their specials. 

Try their guava dessert too, always moist!

Best "local" restaurant outside of Hawaii.  I swear when I am there - I feel like I am at home.  The food is delicious and the portions gigantic.  Spam musubi is made fresh every day!!!  Love the staff!
Great food.   My favorite Hawaiian food so far!   Love the furikake chicken and fried rice!!!

This place is amazing it's my absolute favorite place to eat. I got the salmon in a lemon butter sauce Wow and spam fried rice and the mac salad is out of this world. I even bought a t shirt from them cuz I want to advertise for them and see their business flourish.

This place has great reviews from Yelpers, so I went with Chad S. to see what was up.  We arrived around 7:30pm on a Thursday night and there were only two tables open, as the place was busy, always a good sign.  I already knew that I wanted Kalbi, so no need to really peruse the menu.  Our friendly waitress took our orders and then our food arrived quickly, which was a great thing because we were hangry.  I was very pleased that I got four big pieces of Kalbi and there was meat on them bones, not a lot of fat, which can happen with this dish.  There were also two big scoops of white rice and a scoop of mac salad.  I ate one scoop of the rice and didn't touch the mac salad, but only because I am trying to be more protein-oriented and eat less of the bad carbs, but you gotta have some rice with your meat, right?  The kalbi looked and tasted like it just came off the BBQ in someone's backyard; after three pieces, I was fully satisfied.  I'm just sad that we couldn't get any of the Spam Musubi before we left.  They have musubi in a warmer next to the cash register so you can buy some to go; they sold out while we were eating.  Oh well, it just gives me an excuse to go back.  Aloha!

Great reviews so we decided to give it a try and I'm so glad we did.

Price is great. Portions are large. A lunch plate will cost you an average of $11. 

The food is great. I'm from Hawaii and I can tell you this is as close as it gets in getting authentic Hawaiian lunch. And they also sell bags of Poi here!!

The staff is so sweet too and always checking to see of your okay. I'd recommend this place :)

Two words too describe this place, BIG PORTIONS !!! This place is really famous for their furikake chicken that I always go here to die for. I can usually finish their food here which is a place so I can bring it home to eat. Lol anyways always order a side of Poké and Kim chi cucumber is really good A+ in my book. !!!

Loooove the furikake chicken!!!! The chicken katsu loco moco is not bad too. Portions are huge.. Could feed 3 women. But i dont mind, im looking forward to taking my leftovers to go. Definitely coming back!
I always get the chicken katsu loco moco. I get into a food coma and end up in pregnancy. I have no regrets.

OMG I have dreams about this place. I can't wait to get back to Vegas- this'll be the first place I stop. I had a little bit of everything and it was ALL good. The Furikake chicken was great, as were the desserts. Plus they have Meadow Gold POG!!!!

Portions at this place are massive! You will be leaving with leftovers. Food is flavorful and very affordable. I had the mixed plate with furikake chicken and kalbi along with fried rice. 2 people can share this plate and there will still be leftovers. Furikaki chicken is delicious. The kalbi and fried rice were good but a bit too salty for my taste. I was too stuffed to try any desserts but they all looked great. Service was wonderful also.

Went here this morning (6/1/14) because I didn't have all the ingredients I needed for ossobuco. I decided to pop on over to this place by myself before I headed off to work. With nearly a 5 star rating, my expectations were through the roof.

You know those movies where token "not whatever race everyone else is," walks into a bar and everyone turns around and looks at them and a soundtrack of a disc stopping plays in the background. Umm, yeah, that's what it felt like when I walked in. I was the only white person here and everyone turned around when I walked in. Super strange. Plus, two tables of people kept staring at me during my meal and trying to make eye contact. Whatevs.

Anyway, I guess I was channeling Michael U. and decided to try more than one item off of the menu. This is how I wound up spending $34 (including tax and tip) on a meal just for myself that consisted of soup, salad, and a piece of cake. Yeah, I can't order like that on the regular, regardless of the fact that I walked out with enough leftovers for another large meal.

I ordered:
Hawaiian Style Saimin $8.75
I am convinced that the egg had to be rancid in this soup. It smelled and tasted off. Noodles were very grainy tasting and the broth was bland. I picked around the egg. Would not get again and would suggest you refrain from ordering this.

Island Flavor Salad $13.95
The Opakapaka (pink snapper) was great! This salad comes with a TON of dressing on the side and luckily, it is delicious. Loved the combo of flavors. The only thing that would have made this better is if it had some chunks of citrus thrown in to the salad. Would get again.

Guava Cake $5
BLAND. Tasted like nothing with Cool Whip for frosting. I was served this in a to-go box for whatever reason, but it worked out because I didn't eat the whole thing so it was already ready to go.

Service was whatever. I would have loved a water refill at any point in the meal. Seems as if there are a bunch of regulars because the waitresses were chatty and friendly with everyone. While the salad was good, I don't know if it was good enough to warrant another trip back here.

Comparing this place to the other hawaiian places on this side of town, this one is by far the best in the west. (Ross J's is best in the east). The portions are large and the choices are many. I have a few friends that are familiar with true hawaiian cuisine and this place is their favorite. 

I typically have the mix plate which gives you the opportunity to try the teriyaki, short ribs, chicken katsu, spicy korean chicken........etc. All the meat choices have been fantastic. 

I have gone there for breakfast a couple times and the french toast and loco moco are tremendous.

One of the best Hawaiian places in town! I ordered the mixed plate that came with rice and macaroni salad and it was delicious. First time here and I live down the street. How have I not seen this place. Will definitely be a regular.
I've passed this place for so many years. I only tried it last year....so sad :( Their food is really good and well priced. I come here often now :)

yes yes yes, big island ono grinds!!! my cousins and i got three plates and shared everything. and i had to get my ultimate fav: lilikoi passion fruit juice to chase everything down with. mmmmm! my mouth waters just thinking about that juice!

now onto the food: i ordered the hawaiian plate which included lau lau, rice, mac salad, haupia, salmon lomi lomi, and tako poke. and my cousins ordered the chicken katsu loco moco and two item plate special with kalbi ribs and teri chicken. the loco moco gravy is like no other i've tasted before, and with the chicken katsu, to die for! the teri chicken was standard, but not dry to a plus in my book. the kalbi ribs were just right, and the lau lau made my freakin' trip! a little bit of pork for the fattyness and flavor and chicken for variety. add some hot sauce on everything, and i was damn good to go!

if there is one complaint, they were a little slow. but since i now live in nyc, i'm used to being super rushed. i've forgotten what it's like to be laid back and relax! i def need to fix that one, maybe a trip back to visit nanang and tatang in kalihi?!

all the food was delicious and i would eat here all the time if it wasn't for these three factors: i don't live in las vegas or anywhere near it; if not eating it all day everyday would make me a fatass, literally; and i need variety in my life when it comes to food. i can't just have hawaiian food for the rest of my life. but it's not to say that if it was all there was left to eat in this world, that i wouldn't be happy as all hell!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Looking for a Culinary Adventure...Las Vegas is the city!  Wanted a Hawaiian culinary adventure and Island Flavors came highly recommended.  Have to say, thinking this is my Fav restaurant in Las Vegas, so far.

Ordered the Mixed Plate Combo which comes with your choice of 2 meats, white or brown rice and macaroni salad.  I had the Furikake Chicken and Kalbi Short Ribs.  Furikake chicken are boneless chicken pieces deep fried and tossed in there special Furikake sauce. The Furikake chicken was out of this world!  No words can describe this soooo delicious, scrumptious culinary Flavor!  Island Flavors knocked it out of the ball park with this chicken!  Also, had the Kalbi Short ribs which was so delicious, 2 big scoops of brown rice and Mac salad.  Portion sizes are  very generous here...they definitely don't skimp on portions.  
Prices are very reasonable, especially for the generous portions you get.  As you walk into the restaurant you're greeted by the Waitresses who are very friendly with lotsa aloha attentive love and beautiful smiles.  The Restaurant decor is Hawaiian and clean.

Can't wait to come back...Keep thinking about the Furikake Chicken...they're as addicting as the Senorita Bread in Sacramento...Best Hawaiian food if you can't be on the island. Island Flavors represents!!!

I love this place. Everyone from the server to the cooks in the back are very friendly. When we got there I ordered the terriyaki chicken plate (to compare it to the other terriyaki chicken plates) oxtail soup, chicken katsu, and I believe some type of pork. I can't really remember much about the pork because of all the other food I ordered but let's just say from the several bites I had it melted in your mouth.

Let's start with the terriyaki chicken. I have to say that this is the best terriyaki chicken at a Hawaiian restaurant. L&L's is too fatty and chewy, Aloha Kitchen always requires you to remember to ask for it with no skin, and there are a couple other places that weren't so memorable. It sounds strange to say but the chicken tasted like ... chicken. Real meat, not covered up in fat and that chewy gristle, just meat, that might not make any sense but if you've had that chewy gristle you know what I'm talking about.

The same goes for the chicken katsu. The chicken was solid meat and the breading was crispy and clean, not soggy and greasy like some other places. Same goes for the oxtail soup, while the oxtail was extremely fatty (I never knew ox carried so much fat in their tail) the actual soup was not greasy but crisp and gingery. It tasted a little bland at first but once you start eating the oxtail and bites from a couple other dishes the soup actually complements the flavors.

If I'm craving some Hawaiian food, this would definitely be among my top choices. However it loses a star because believe it or not I'm a fan of the canned mystery meat known as spam. They don't have any spam dishes and their spam musubi is pre-made and sits out on the counter which means first come, first serve and if you get there at night then you're SOL. But even if you were to get it, you have to eat spam musubi that's been sitting on the counter for awhile, for some reason it's not made to order, kinda weird but all in all a good spot.
Don't know why everyone likes this place. Ate here three times in hope I was wrong. I was right, this place is over rated. Their ahi poke was salty. You can't have hawaiian food and mess up poke.

First time eating here. It was ok I had the Saimin noodle soup. For me it was too much carbs. Most dishes were served with rice and macaroni salad not much greens on menu. Everyone else (8 people) enjoyed it. But we shared a piece of the Haupia ice cream cake which was absolutely out of this world!  I would just come for desert next time. It was coconut pineapple ice cream with graham cracker crust whipped cream topping with chocolate sauce and nuts and about 8 inches high.

First time here. Just moved here from the Big Island a couple of weeks ago. My boyfriend and I have been looking around for some local hawaiian food and found this place on Yelp (and also recommended from some guy that we met at another island food restaurant, who is also from hawaii too). 

Anyways, we were not disappointed. FOOD WAS AMAZING and plates were HUGE. We were only able to finish half of our plates. I would recommend ordering the FURIKAKE CHICKEN, AHI POKE, FRIED POKE & BBQ KALBI plate. Looking forward to coming back and trying other dishes, and hopefully save room for dessert this time haha.

Other than that, it made us feel like home with the island music and friendly staff^_^
Easy to find, lots of parking.  Excellent service, great local menu and the portions were large and tasty.  We'll be back for sure.
YUMMY!!! The best Hawaiian food I have had here in Las Vegas!!!! Tastes like Kauai!!! The Ahi poke was delicious! Huge portions and great service.  I will definitely be back soon!!!

They have been consistently great! The food, hospitality, and atmoshpherel. My dad and my family are starting to become here and there regulars, lol.  They've been so accomadating to my 1 and 2 yo boys. Thank you for a consistent, understanding, and kind service!

The owner have reach out to me and appreciate your time boss! He invited me and my family back much Mahalo.

THANKS for an awesome dinner experience today!

It was a pleasure phone communication with the Boss Man thanks.

Mark, Joseline & the other guy server (SERVICE WAS EXCELLENT).

To the cooks (Food was cooked perfectly today)

MUCH MAHALO ONCE AGAIN EVERYONE!!!

My family and I have been ordering appetizing Hawaiian fare from this dining establishment for quite some time. We have been very satisfied with the quality, portions, and delectable meal offerings. It was disappointing to have had an unpleasant take out experience last time we ordered here for an incomplete dinner. However, the owner Bruce contacted me right away regarding this. I am delighted to have such a warm local business with delicious meals so close to home. We will definitely keep ordering from here and highly recommend. Move over Aloha Kitchen and L&L! :)

I have driven by Island Flavor several times. Today I wanted to visit a new restaurants, so I visited Yelp to help me decide. We decided on Island Flavor, and we're so happy we did. The chicken katsu is great. We also had pork hawaiian style with gravy. It was thin cut and very moist. We took home a slice of guava cake as well. The two ladies waitressing were very helpful and friendly. 

Keep in mind that the portions are huge. I would advise sharing. We will definitely go back!

Wasted my night. My friends and I ordered food from here. The girl on the phone said it would be 20 min. We arrived 25 min later. When I got there I heard them call my name. Another man claimed the order. I asked was there two orders with that name. She said no. Fast forward 45 min a total of 1 hr and 10 min of waiting still no food. The hostess and a waiter also kept peaking out from the back and giggling while looking in my direction I believe because I had complained about 40 min into waiting. I think they had intentions on messing with our food. Extremely rude and creepy!I buy food here at least once a week and now I will never buy from them again.

Best Hawaiian food in town!! Lau lau , poke ,  chicken katsu , and kalua pig are my favs! Mac salad is on point! They even have coco puffs!! ( for those of you who know what they are! ( not the cereal) . Must go!!!

5/5 for the food
1/5 for the service

In between, which is why I'm giving 3 stars. I have been there several times. Foods on point every single time. I always get their loco mocos, and I love it.
However, each time I go to eat there, service gets worse and worse. They're now at the point where you actually have to get their attention. I feel everytime, after they give us out food, they never come back to check up on us. This time we had to yell across the diner to get their attention. It wasn't even busy. There were only two other tables seated. I wished they would check up on us at least once, especially since we needed to box out leftovers.
Now on I'm only ordering it for take out. I can stand their delicious food, but not their service.

A large group of us dined here to celebrate a friend's birthday. I had heard tons of good things and couldn't wait to get my plate of food. Since we were such a large group it took a bit to come out, but the wait was well worth it! The portion sizes were ridiculously huge, so I had enough for both lunch and dinner!

I got a combination plate with the Hawaiian roasted pork and the Teriyaki beef. The roasted pork is something dreams are made of! It is almost like turkey, but slices of fork tender pork covered in the most delicious brown gravy. This was the highlight of my meal and the white rice just balanced out each bite. The teriyaki beef was also good, a little chewy, but I loved the sauce. I also tried the Chicken Katsu covered in the Korean chicken sauce. It was crispy and delicious! I wasn't a fan of their mac salad, although I tried it a couple of times just to be sure.  

Now, Island Flavor really excels at dessert! They get their cakes from the bakery next door and they are seriously out of this world. The Chantilly cake is beyond amazing! Run, seriously run now and get a piece. It is the most moist and delicious chocolate cake. I also enjoyed a piece of the guava cake today! It has the best whipped cream frosting which makes each bite so delicate. This is definitely the pinnacle of Hawaiian food in Las Vegas, you won't be disappointed!

We waited awhile for our server and our food. I ordered the steak and onions and the quality of the meat was unbearable. They were good with my kid but it's not my type of spot to eat at. My friend had read all the great reviews but honestly... I don't get it. Maybe Hawaiian food is not my thing. I gave three stars because they were nice.
What's with the 4.5 stars ? Food is so mediocre ....I had fried rice omelet ( how could you messed this one up ) unevenly cooked,  taste terrible .

This place was so good! And it was packed and busy the whole time I was there. You can tell it's authentic island food when the place is filled with "locals". The staff was friendly and was very helpful at making suggestions and describing the menu items. I will definitely be back here very soon.

One of my top spots for Hawaiian food. Great atmosphere, people, home cooking. This place has been my to go to spot for the last 7yrs. Always same quality of food. Always delicious and always great service. I'm addicted to the kalbi short ribs furikake chicken mix plate. I'm actually waiting for that order right now as I write this review.for dessert  their Chantilly cake is absolutely delicious.
I know island food. I'm a samoan girl who grew up in New Zealand & lived in Hawaii. This is as good as it gets! So glad my co-workers introduced this place to me :-D

ALOHA LAS VEGAS yelpers!

just moved to Las Vegas and I found myself craving Hawaiian food!

Found I.F. on yelp and got super excited!
Called in my order and picked it up.

I had the mix plate- pork/kalbi, kona coffee mud pie, and shoyu poke.
It was my guys 1st time having hawaiian food so I talked him into getting the hamburger steak. I grab 4 spam musubi's at the counter.

We loved the food! 

I'll def come back for more! 

Take out or dine in. casual. indoor seating.

Big serving! 

My whole order came out to around $50 fpr 2 people.

If you love Hawaiian food, stop by Island Flavor!

Aloha!
- Miss Yelp 2011

Overall: Island Flavor serves up some good food, and the service is great.

Food: 4

Mixed Plate with Kalbi Short Ribs and Furikake Chicken: For the price, this dish was very worth it. There's enough for at least two people, maybe even three if you don't eat a lot. The kalbi short ribs had a nice char, and it had the actual smokey taste of being cooked on a grill. The furikake chicken was crispy, and it had a really tasty glaze. It might even be better than orange chicken.

Sweet & Sour Short Ribs: I know a lot of people who would absolutely love this dish, but it wasn't for me. The short ribs were tender, but they were drowning in a bowl of sauce that was too sweet and too sour without any balance.

All orders come with two sides. The usual is white rice and macaroni salad, but we subbed the macaroni salad for stir fried veggies in both. The white rice is pretty good and similar to Korean rice, so its higher starch content makes it a little sticky. The stir fried veggies was mostly zucchinis and it was well-cooked.

Service: 4

The servers were really nice and they even thought to bring out extra plates for us to share. They were pretty attentive, and they stopped by frequently to ask if we needed anything. Although the thought was nice, I would have actually preferred if they didn't ask quite so often (~4 times in a one hour lunch). The shop is small enough where I can flag one of them down easily if I needed anything.

Ambiance: 4

The restaurant is located in a strip mall with plenty of parking. It isn't a super large restaurant, but it has plenty of tables and it doesn't feel cramped and it's pretty clean.

When this place first opened, I used to drive all the way from Green Valley just to come here - I was addicted to the amazing haupia cake (freshly baked at the bakery next door). The food was also good, enormous portions and the waitress Heidi was so crazy and fun. Over the years, quality and size went down significantly, so I stopped going a while ago. It's ironic because I now live on the SW side of town, and drive to Island Sushi, which is down the street from where I used to live. Anyway... 

I've kind of rediscovered Island Flavor because a couple friends still really like it. I resisted for a while but finally gave it a try, and the quality and large portions seem to be back. I think all the original people are gone, so maybe it was sold, but they got rid of that huge counter that took up the whole middle of the restaurant and added more tables and chairs. New layout is better, and I'm loving their furikake chicken even more than my old fav the off-menu katsu dip (chicken katsu dipped in korean chicken sauce). Even their mac salad seems better, although Island Sushi's potato mac salad is still my all time fav for plate lunch. 

The owner of Island Sushi was working in the kitchen last week for some reason (no he didn't buy it) so maybe that's what the change is. Whatever the reason - I love this place again! Although I tried their new to me dessert - haupia ice cream pie. It wasn't very good - tasted like cheap coconut ice cream, smelled like suntan lotion. I'm sticking with the haupia cake. 

They're also open a little later and  7 days a week now. Not sure if they still close for about a month around xmas/new years though.
The food was good only small issue was the katsu was different than i have had before. I 1would recommend this place to everybody
Best Hawaiian food in town. Large portions for a good price. Original owners are from big island and I've been to that restaurant and the food is the same.

giving them a 4 star because its my first hawaiian bbq spot and it was good and packed. it ws recommended to me by some big islanders. i had the pork with the brown gravy, beef ribs and friend rice. the guy at the counter was so nice and gave me a combo since the portions are so big. he also recommended the rice wrapped spam. it was good but could have definitely used some more seasoning in it. i would say ill definitely go back and ask try some other dishes.

Very disappointed in the new ownership.  I certainly can't speak about what the financials were when they took over, but either things were good, or not good.  Something there made them make the changes they did.  

One day I walk in and all of a sudden, my favorite dish, the Kalbi Short Ribs went from $11.99 to 16.99.  I bit the bullet at the time because one thing they were known for was their generous serving.  They usually have gave you 5 strips of the short ribs. I told myself $11.99 was a steal, $16.99 is a huge jump, but I guessed the portion was worth it. 

When the dish came, they now only give you 3 strips of short ribs.  So I can't blame anyone but myself.  I just ate it, and left. L

I will say this, their service was, and still is one of the friendliest in town.  The cooks are still doing a great job as the ribs still tasted good.  This where the 2 stars come in, it's one star each to thank to them for their hard work.  I simply can't give these new owners any more of my money.  It's not the prices, I spend a hell of a lot more at other establishments, but the way they did it was not smart.  It's the principle.  

My quest begins for a new Hawaiian BBQ place...if anyone has any suggestions, please let me know!

Response to owner - I trust that you know the quality is even better.  Quality of beef was never an issue for me.  That's why I always went in the first place.  The quality is still great.  You asked an earlier reviewer what dish changed portion.  Well, the Kalbi Short Ribs is one of them.  Higher price, and lesser quantity.

Ordered a mixed plate with the teriyaki steak and fudukaki shrimp. We have come here for a few years and over the year the food is either salty, but they always gave plenty of food especially the meat. Tonight it looked alittle skimpy on the meat and the shrimp was tiny. 
Of course they give you the two scoops of rice and a scoop of mac salad. 
When we go we always split a plate as it gets kind of costly and we come for the delicious Chantilly Cake!
Service is alway friendly and awesome when we go there.  They do there best when you go there. ALOHA is always there, service with a smile!
Nah mean the grinds. Great place to come to get your hawaii grinds fix. Ono to the max laddat

On point!!!  Been waiting for the lau lau since my bf had it when we were out of town - it's not on the menu and is only available on Fridays.  We were told that the lau lau leaves are flown in on Thursday to make/prep for Fridays.  Anyway, it was worth the wait!  Delisssshhhh!!!  I called and ordered take-out and less than 20mins later upon arrival, my order was ready.

We ordered (for 4 ppl to share off each other):
1 - Aloha Special plate (Lau Lau)
1 - Aloha Special plate (kalua pig)
1 - Chicken Katsu w/gravy on the side
1 - Chantilly (giant slice)

Lau Lau: flavored well and generous amounts of pork and fish
Kalua pig: also flavored right w/a generous portion 
Chicken katsu: Nice n crispy w/CHICKEN inside (other places are tight on the chicken to the point that u find yourself only eating the breading) WTF?!!
Chantilly cake: YUMMY!!!

***Bonus: the Aloha Special plate comes w/haupia!!!  Love love love it!!!  I felt like I was at a luau back at home  The haupia does NOT disappoint***

No photos to share...we tore it up before I remembered to Yelp  Sorry!

I didn't realize how much I'd be back here since my last review, but that furikake chicken keeps me coming back. 

I've also tried the oxtail soup. It is heavy on the ginger, and the meat was a bit tough, but the broth was above average. Don't expect the same type of flavor as California hotel. I think they use bouillon cubes or some heavy MSG, so it isn't as salty. 

The beef stew on Saturday's is super popular, but I didn't like the taste too much. It sorta seemed like they added a lot of cornstarch, flour, gelatin, or something to thicken the sauce and I was not enjoying the flavor. 

Still yet, for the service as well as their standout items like the loco moco, furikake chicken, and their chicken katsu, this place is a solid win when it comes to bang for your buck.

Came here a few times and every time I come here staff is always nice. Most of all the food is good and very good prices. Not really a big place to have a party but good to bring the family when you want some island food. Music is good as well playing in the background just makes me miss home more lol!!

After reading the reviews and looking at the pictures of the island, local grinds served, I convinced my work to order lunch for pickup, boss to pay for it and so glad I did.
 
I ordered a katsu chicken loco moco which was infused with great island flavors, which consist of plenty steam , katsu chicken seasoned well with a nice breaded crunch, topped with 2 over medium s and indulged with rich, carmel gravy along with tasty mac salad on the side. Like Whoa! Did I enjoy every bite, food coma if eaten at one seating but worth it, OH YEAH! Don't know what eveyone else ordered because I was focused on my food but I know everything was a hit since everyone ate what they had ordered, leaving no leftovers for me to pick on the next following work day.

Dont know about the in-dining experience yet but the ordering was easy, pickup was fast and the food was a hit. Can't wait for another Island flavor food experience.

Of course I got the loco moco but instead of hamburger I swapped for spam. The brown gravy on point, rice cooked perfect. I was a little sad though because I asked for over easy eggs and they were cooked all the way, no runny yolk for me. Plus I like a little more crisp to my spam not burnt but a bit more browned. I'll be back and next time I'll let them know about the type of cook I want and to make sure my yolk runs. Lol!

I love this place!!  My only complaint about this place, they don't have a location in Houston.  The place is laid back, portions are stupid big, and the food is excellent.  If you are in Las Vegas and think the strip is the end all for food, you are dead wrong.  Make a trip out to this place, you will not de disappointed.

Totally surpassed my expectations for yet another Hawaii comfort food place in Vegas. So far, based on my multiple visits, ordered dishes have been good. Most recently, I tried the Portuguese Sausage with 2 eggs, Hoisin Baby Back Ribs, and Furikake Fried Chicken. Everything, I mean everything was good. The sausage plate came with rice and mac salad. The sausages were sweet and not too salty. The rice and mac salad just sealed the deal. Drizzle that egg yolk and mix with the sausage and rice, and get ready for some hit the spot goodness. 

The baby back ribs were near perfection. Pork meat nearly dropped off the bones and the Hoisin glaze was quite a unique sauce experience. The glaze was sweet but not that overly sugary taste you would find at a traditional bbq joint, but more of a refined sweetness. Not sure how to describe in words. Just order the rack.

Furikake chicken was delicious. The texture was crunchy and no where near soggy. Sweet, but not overly sweet. Paired that rice, and my goodness. You can't stop!

The location is off-strip, but on the way to Red Rock. In fact, it's nice to get away from strip madness on a Vegas strip. Regardless of the location, this is one of my to-go places on every one of my Vegas excursions.

I don't eat Hawaiian often,  but when i do ;)  i come to island flavor.  This place has great service,  great food and the price is right.   I got the furikaki chicken and their short ribs and when it came out it was massive!   I knew i was in trouble.  The taste on the ribs was smoky and delicious and the chicken with the glaze was on point.   I definitely recommend this place!   Will be back to try the poke!

Just went here for the first time with some friends. Go here if you like Hawaiian food. Best teriyaki bowl around. Blows teriyaki madness out of the water. The inside is small and always busy so I would make a reservation for a guaranteed place to sit. They just opened a place up in Henderson can't wait to try it.

It's like being in Hawaii!!  All the servers are Hawaiian or you think they are because of their pigeon talk!  The spam musabi is my kids favorite meal on the planet and they would eat it for breakfast, lunch and dinner everyday if I let them.  I eat the Teriyaki Chicken Salad (the dressing, oh the dressing)!!  I bring a lot of our out-of-town guests here and I have had them cater some parties, everyone is always happy when they are done!!  I love this place!!!  When you are a regular here, you feel like family!

Came here while visiting in Vegas, and I ordered their ahi poke. OMG I fell in love! I've never had such thick chunks of poke before and I love onions also. They were not cheap about how much fish they give. I have never ever gotten full off of poke where I couldn't finish. Good job! 
I also tried their kalbi ribs and it was delicious. 

Service was nice and they were always there to fill up our drinks. 
My cousin made an order difficult in my opinion and they got it right with a smile on their face. 

Everything about this place screams HAWAII ! 

Whenever I come back to Vegas I will be sure to stop by here again.

I recommend their poke and their kalbi ribs

I bookmarked this place the second I got to Vegas (which was a year ago, #facepalm). If you've read other reviews I've written about Hawaiian restaurants I always say that I'm Hawaiian in my heart and my belly. 

The spot is super dark from the outside due to the the tinted windows but inside it's well lit and ready to serve you. When temperatures rise outside, it gets a bit cramped in the entrance. The decor is nothing special but that's okay because the shining star is the food.

The servings are very generous, which is great for my hunger and bad for my waistline, and the food is delicious. They were out of spam musubi (insert crying emoji here) but I ordered a mixed plate with their pork and katsu. Holy Hawaii batman. The gravy on the pork was the real MVP and the mac salad was heaven. 

I convinced my dining buddy to share the mud pie with me and although it was beautiful - it was the one dish that left me wanting a little bit more. It was tick icy and not as creamy as I would have loved.

This was my first time trying this restaurant. It was not busy and there are only 17 tables. The service was excellent and the staff were all very friendly. I got the chicken furikake and the beef and onions mixed plate served over fried rice. The proportion was huge and everything bite on the plate was delicious. All the food is very reasonably priced and authentic.

The customer service is second to none. I watched how they talked to everyone there. One woman even got a hug when she walked in. Great balance of attentiveness and attention to detail. 

This was my third time getting food from here. I have had maybe half the items on the menu too. The one thing that stands out is the portion sizes. You will not get bigger Hawaiian BBQ sizes anywhere. The teriyaki sauce isn't the best but it is still pretty decent. I am not a fan of the breaded chicken and the fried rice didn't really do it for me. But hey, maybe I just don't understand traditional Hawaiian dishes. 

It was really difficult for me not to give this place 5 stars, Very difficult. I had to really look at other places I gave a 5 and compare this place to that.

Pros - Customer service, portion sizes

Cons - Location

4 stars because l have to try one more time with a more complex dish. I ordered the 1/2lb. Poke and it was the freshest tasting poke that l had in Vegas.  Bit on the too salty side but was good and cold, just right.  The veggies chosen had a good crunch to it and was all cut in perfect slices and or cubes.  Scenery was nice.  I will post pic of the poke.

Growing up in a Samoan family it's hard to find a place to make island foods like grandma does and today I found this perfect place! I went for spam and eggs and ended up with Kalbi short ribs, Portuguese sausage, Mac salad and delish Mona coffee!! Definitely looking forward to going back asap!

A bit out of the way, but extremely worth the trip. The wait staff was extremely friendly and willing to work with us considering that most of my family did not try Hawaiin cuisine. Although I can't confirm the authenticity of the meal to Hawaiin cuisine, the meal was extremely satisfying and tasty. I ordered the Fresh Made Ahi Poke Plate with spicy mayo and avocados, and I can safely say that it was phenomenal. The cubes of tuna melted in my mouth leaving the umami of their shoyu and spicy mayo on my tongue. Mahalo.

LOVED this place!!!

Great food, really nice employees, no Las Vegas strip attitude!

Loco Moco: BOMB
Korean Chicken: BOMB
Roasted Pork with gravy: eh, OK. (wouldn't get it again)
Katsu dipped in Korean Chicken Sauce: BOMB

Too bad they didn't have Poke when we visited. :(

Would I go back here again? HELL YEAH!

I was skeptical about authentic Hawaiian food in Vegas, but Island Flavor proved to be a spot that locals could satisfy their craving at.

Portions: HUGE. One plate could feed three of us had we known they were going to be so big. Kahlua pork is mild, but super tender. I could've used a bit more salt on the meat, but it was still good. Sweet and sour pork ribs were tasty but almost a little too salty. Furikake chicken was bomb. I added Sriracha and it became super bomb.

My only complaints are regarding the rice.
Brown rice - too much water so I basically had two scoops of brown rice mush.
Fried rice - now this is where I think Island Flavor failed because their version of fried rice is basically white rice with some lapcherng and veggies doused with soy sauce. I've eaten and seen fried rice made enough to know we weren't eating fried rice. The portion was a potful. No joke.

COCO PUFFS = yum. I have no idea what the buttery yellow stuff is on top of the chocolate cream puff but it's ONO.
Mud pie = good. I liked the chocolate cacao or coffee nibs in the kona coffee ice cream. Really nice touch. Could do without the flavored syrups on the plate though.

Staff were friendly even though very busy.

Spam musubi was right on. Reminded me of all the musubis we've eaten in Hawaii.

Former Hawaii residents that now call Vegas home recommended that I try Island Flavor. Well I did, and it lived up to every review I've read. I don't know one person that didn't like their experience or food at the restaurant. It's true, IT IS THE BEST HAWAIIAN /LOCAL FOOD IN LAS VEGAS.
