(I've tried several others) I ordered the Hawaiian plate with kalua pig & cabbage (lau lau was sold out) it was good, they give ALOT of food, however I'm here to rave about their desserts. THE KONA MUD PIE IS THE BEST I HAVE EVER TASTED. Food Orgasm is an understatement, also the GUAVA CAKE omg...THE BEST. The Poke...hella fresh. It's sad we have to go to Vegas to eat the best poke, kona mud pie, and guava cake. I'm from Maui and we have nothing that comes close to that. I'll definately go back to Island Flavor whenever I go back to Vegas. HANA HOU!!

First stop for lunch on the way to Las Vegas with friends. I don't usually eat Hawaiian food so I wasn't sure what to expect. The portions were HUGE and the food was SO delicious. I ordered the Chop Steak & Onions, and the sauce was so good with everything! My boyfriend ordered the Furitake (?) Chicken and that was AWESOME as well. The food took about 15 minutes to come out but that was fine because the kitchen was taking their time to prepare it for us, and we all know that when it comes to food, quality over quantity (which in this case, Island Flavor had both!!). :) This is a must-try if you're around Vegas!!

This place seriously has some of the best Hawaiian food I have ever tasted!  The portions are hearty and leaves you wanting more the next day.  I love this place, the only downside is the slow wait and service....but definitely worth it.

Incredible food for an even better price. Always so delicious, and everyone I introduce Island Flavor to falls in love as well. 

The portions are great (large) and you will always want more and more. Wish they would expand the restaurant a little bit since it does get a little tight, especially at the entrance, but overall, the food and service are great.

This is where the real locals come to eat. 

I've lived on the west side for about 6 years now and never ventured here because it was "too far" for me. Your spoiled in Vegas do anything more than 10 minutes away is too far... I needed to check this place out as my beloved Kauai Cafe is now closed so I needed to find a new spot to satisfy my local grindz.

My default order here has been the kalbi and Korean or furikake chicken with fried rice. I suggest that you washit all down with a POG or lilikoi juice for the "local" feel cuz that how we do it on the island. 

Just be warned that the plates here are massive! Just look at the pictures of the massive mountain of Ono-kanack food. Always get leftovers. You want to save room for the Ono deserts like the Kona mud pie or chiffon cake. 

This is the must eat place I recommend to all my 9th island ohana. 

Kanack action

Eat with confidence.

-P

Finally tried Island Flavor for the first time today.  Been hearing only positive comments and recommendations for this SW Hawaiian eatery in a relatively undeveloped part of town, and the experience lived up to expectations.

The portions are way more than generous.  Sides?  They can serve you a "side", but it will still be entree portion.  Just about everyone who dines here, leaves the restaurant with the tomorrow's lunch pre-packed.  The desserts are just as big as the big island, and the ones I tried (Banana Bread Pudding) was delicious.

I tried the mixed plate with the Kalbi Ribs and Hawaiian Style Roasted Pork (serve with gravy), plus the Ahi Poke (Shoyu) and sampled the sesame and furikake ones as well.  I personally really enjoyed the sesame ahi poke. But I think the Poke Salad (entree sized salad) also looks very delicious, and I will most likely try that in one of my future visits.

Besides the good food, the price is reasonable. You are definitely not going to leave this restaurant feeling like you can have a Big Mac Combo.  It is perfect for a family or hungry & growing teenager, football team, etc.  

It is perfect for anyone that wants good food, generous portions for a reasonable price!  The friendly service is added to the package for absolutely no additional charge.

Are you an ahi poke fan? This is the best value and taste for the money in all of Las Vegas.  Sesame flavor is probably the best, but everyone's preference is different, so try them all (just not all at one time, unless you have an army to help you finish it). No joke!

Food:  4/5   Some misses, but most are hits. Definitely worth the drive to this part of town if you are in the mood for Hawaiian food "local" style.

Portion:  5/5  How many different ways can you say the portion is huge?  Each plate is enough to share for two regular people.

Service:  4/5  Friendly service. 

Location:  Can be a long trek for some, considering the location, but I think it is worth it.  If you are visiting from out of town, unless you have your own transportation, I would suggest passing this one up (trying to get a cab out here back to the Strip would be a hassle and costly).

Price:  5/5  For the portion, it is definitely worth it.

Ambiance:  4/5  Hawaiian inspired art works adorned the walls, but I didn't pay it much attention when I saw the plates of food at the pick-up window.

Easily a solid 4 stars!

I love the food here.  Reminds me of being back home on the Big Island of Hawaii.  I'm working my way through the menu and have tried almost everything on it including some of the specials.  I LOVE THIS PLACE.  It isn't your normal main land Hawaii food place.  If you go to hawaii, our menus are not made up of just teriaki, musubis, katsu, and native Hawaiian food (lau lau, kalua pig etc.) Of course not! We have roast beef and hamburger steaks and all kinds of things from around the world.  The thing is, we have our own way for cooking them with our own flavor.  Thats what this place is all about!  It takes foods from different cultures in Hawaii and gives it that made in Hawaii taste.  So from misoyaki opakapaka to korean chicken to ox tail you can get a real Hawaii restaurant feel (Big Island style anyways).  The best Hawaii food spot in vegas I've eaten at so far.  Aloha kitchen is a joke, L & L is imitation, Ross J's is GREAT, but this place this the BEST! (Note: sometimes the gravey salty, meant to be eaten with lots of rice, sooooo gooood!)PS dessert is good too!

Never disappoints!  Can't stop thinking about the Ahi Poke. Maybe add Poke bowls to the menu?  Prices are also very reasonable with the amount of food you get.  Overall, they not only bring the island flavor they also give you the aloha feeling you want to come back too.

Right next to rhodes ranch. This place was packed fof a sunday. They have around 30-40 seats... Very nice staff. Buffet (jimmy) was playing... Everyone reallh enjoying food and conversation. I ordered to go... Because the niners were on TV. Ordered the sesame poke (3/4 in cubes) tasted very nice... My favorite thing thus far. Korean chicken, even though talked about a lot on yelp- i didnt love it... Actually, i didnt even like it... Ribs were done ok... There are some other things on the menu i will try in the future. Ill be back and rate again.

I think the first time we came here was back in 2011, shortly after we moved to Vegas. Ordered the Kalua Pork and thought it was horrible. To be fair, it's been a constant struggle to find good Kalua Pork in Vegas. The only thing I enjoyed was the Kona Coffee Mudd Pie, which was shared between four people since the slices are huge! Never came back for years, until very recently. 

About two months ago, we ate dinner here with friends and the restaurant was very busy. I think we waited at least 90 minutes to get a table. But the wait was worth it because the food was delicious! I ordered the Furikake Chicken, which was very very good. Huge portions, wasn't too salty and they put the right amount of sauce on it. I think I also had enough leftovers for two meals! The Guava cake was awesome as well! I have had bland ones from other restaurants, which basically tasted like yellow cake with whipped cream. But this one had a good guava flavor. Service on this day was great too. Even though they were busy, the servers were attentive and refilled our drinks promptly. After that, I was like "My bad, Island Flavor is pretty good."

Wrong! The husband and I were in the area last week, so we decided to eat dinner here. Everything was pretty horrible except for the Guava cake. They were not as busy on a weekday. I ordered the Furikake Chicken again, and it was not good. The chicken was lukewarm. Ewww. Did they even take time to cook it?? I felt like the chicken was made hours earlier and all they did was warm it up in the microwave, threw some sauce and furikake all over it and called it a day. Yuck! Even the brown rice was lukewarm and cooked with too much water! None of the servers refilled our waters. What happened??

So yeah.....maybe its just luck and it depends on who is working. I'm giving them 3 stars because I know their food and service can be really good. Sadly, its only on certain days.

One of the main reasons I started to be proactive with reviewing on Yelp was because of this place. Over a year ago, after my first visit here, I was so pleased with my dining experience at Island Flavor I felt this place deserved to be found out about. 

I've been here now well over 30 or so times, and have tried about 90% of the menu. Everything has remained consistent including the food and service. Only change is they are now getting busier, it's often hard to get a seat! 

My favorite dishes to date are the kalua pig, chicken katsu, korean chicken, Lau Lau, oxtail soup and the poki is great. 

Things I personally have come not to like are the roast pork loco moco and the fried rice with Portuguese sausage, both a little too salty for my tastes, but many other people seem to enjoy them.

Perhaps my favorite part of being a regular at this restaurant is the overall family atmosphere which is very welcoming and relaxing. I'm always treated like I'm one of their own.

If you still haven't been here, there's a serious problem.

First off let me say that this place is exactly what the word Ono means!!! This place is legit! Bottom line! No where in town are you going to get big island style Hawaiian food and they even have ox tail soup seven days a week?! No place in town has that?!? Everything from the teriyaki beef to the furikake chicken, this place  never ceases to satisfy. A lot of Hawaiian places seem to give you the normal low-grade teriyaki beef but this place makes teriyaki beef the way it should be! simple delicious hearty and more importantly should represent the flavor of the Islands. I had an order that didn't come out very well because I ordered it last minute on a Saturday night. It wasn't very edible because it was the end of the day food, and I called the next day to let them know that I wasnt satisfied and they made sure that I got the same meal waiting for me when I went down to pick it up at no additional cost. This is the meaning of customer service!!! I love this place and would recommend that anyone who wants to try Hawaiian food here in Las Vegas make a trip to Island flavor!

Best local grinds in the Vegas Valley! Teri beef is off the charts(real thick steak, not fatty shredded thin slices), furikake chicken and furikake shrimp broke da mouth! 

Will be a loyal customer of this establishment forever. Thank you Island Flava!

Haven't been to this place for a long time order the short ribs and teriyaki chicken and for dessert the Kona coffee pie. Getting the food to go so once consumed I'll let you all know how the food was.Well, I ate the whole thing lol and it was really tasty.  Short ribs have a tendency to have more fat than meat but this place gives plenty of meat, nice flavor, tender...perfect. The Kona Pie was really good but the crust was a little too sweet for my taste. Chicken teriyaki was pretty good also. This place is the real deal so if you want more of the authentic Hawaiian food flavor come and give this place a try. Have a wonderful day and happy yelping  your fellow yelpie xoxox

Oh Island Flavor, I love you so, but hate you at the same time.  My experience with eating a loco moco will never be the same.  Your roasted pork loco moco was absolutely to die for!  Even after my boyfriend and I split the one order that arrived in a huge pho bowl, we still were absolutely stuffed!  

Their poke is also good as ever, I recommend getting it furkake style.

After a nice dinner out with my friend, we decided we wanted a little dessert to top off our evening. Thinking about all our options in the area, we finally decided to head to Island Flavor. I had never been before, but my friend kept raving about their cakes, so I was excited. I opted for the guava cake and my friend ordered the Haupia cake. I also ordered a kalbi plate to-go for my fella.

The guava was delicious, but the Haupia was my real favorite. Both were incredibly fluffy and light. Delicate flavors, I can't wait to come back for their desserts alone. Service was quick and refills were plentiful. 

Our takeout order was ready quickly and we were on our way. I couldn't resist taking a bite or two of my fella's kalbi plate as well. The meat was flavorful and cooked well. It had a nice smoky flavor and the mac salad was one of the better versions I've had. Not overly creamy and complemented the meat and rice perfectly.

The food was great and I look forward to coming back to try the rest of their menu.
Good food. Big serving. Need to give 4 stars, Service limited. Need more help. Especially on a Saturday.
Absolutely fantastic food!!! The avocado poke is delicious and hubbs loved his food too.

I'm a huge fan after only two visits! The people who run this place always make us feel like family. I highly recommend the furikake shrimp, furikake chix, opakapaka misoyaki style and the poke with furikaki! So ono! Broke da mouth kine good! Beware the sweet potato is not the american sweet potato. Also leave room for dessert, though it may be hard because the servings are huge! But the mud pie is delicious and huge. You could share that between 3 people. It's actually a good thing this place is far because i'd be here all the time!

The portions are huge! It is likely that you will leave taking leftovers. We had the Kalabi Short Ribs and the Furikake Chicken. Both were very flavorful. The both come with a side of white or brown rice and a scoop of macaroni. The kalabi short ribs were marinated in a Korean sauce and the furikake chicken was crunchy white meat.

Literally standing in here for 5 mins now not a single person has said hi, I have been completely ignored by all 3 people walking by...just trying to pickup a To-go order and everyone is just too busy to help the person just standing in the front of the store. And finally got my food it was sitting there the entire time the whole restaurant ignored me....I have gone here probable twice a week for 3 months since I found it and I will never ever come back after this

What you need to know: 
- My sister used to live in Las Vegas and this was always the one restaurant that I always had to visit 
- Island Flavor comes from the lovely Big Island, with a couple of locations still there 
- Live Hawaiian music on Friday and Saturdays from 6-8:30pm - this is the time frame when the restaurant gets packed, but it creates the best atmosphere!
- Leilani, our server, is the veteran waiter and has been at Island Flavor since the beginning.  She showers you with authentic and joyful aloha - she made us feel like family!  
- If you're on Yelp's cash back program, this restaurant offers 10% cash back! ;) 
- In short:  Delicious Hawaiian food, fantastic service, live music - perfect! 

What we ordered: 
- Kalbi short ribs price $11.50 - A full order comes with four delicately smoky, sweet, perfectly cooked ribs (not overcooked, still a tad pink on the inside).  Just get it! All plates come with choice of starch (white rice, brown rice or French fries) and choice of mac salad, sautéed veggies or salad.   
- Mixed plate of Korean fried chicken and Kalua pork with cabbage $11.50 - Leilani, our lovely waitress, suggested we try the mixed plate, where you can try more options.  The Korean fried chicken was probably my favorite thing we ordered - extra crispy on the outside, sweet with rich glaze and incredibly juicy on the inside!  The mixed plate portion of the Kalua pork with cabbage was simply perfect. 
- Opakapaka cooked misoyaki style $15.95 - The misoyaki style is a wonderful way of cooking the opakapaka - the fish retains moisture and the misoyaki sauce is a mixture of savory and a tad sweet.  The opaka was a little on the dry side though. We ordered this dish with the fried rice, $2 extra, but it was definitely worth it!  Soft sticky rice, with generous chucks of pork, it was very moist and savory. 
- Spicy Avo Poke - I refuse to eat poke on the mainland, but when Leilani suggested it, I trusted her and I'm glad we tried it!  Huge cubes of firm ahi mixed with avocado, crispy wonton crisps and drizzled with a spicy mayo sauce.  It was actually very very good for mainland poke! 
- Kona coffee mud pie - $5.50 - By the time we finished our dinner, I was stuffed beyond the comfortable level but my friends powered through and got the Kona coffee mud pie.  I only got a bite of the deep rich Kona coffee and dark graham cookie crust.  Let's just say they had no problems finishing it even though we were so stuffed!

The furikake chicken happens to be one of the most popular entrees there, but it's not exactly my cup of tea. Don't get me wrong, it's not bad but I just don't see myself eating it every time I visit Island Flavor. Also, it's not really that good as leftovers which is a bit of a disappointment. 

On the other hand, I do like the teriyaki chicken, Korean BBQ, and the teriyaki beef. It's so flavorful to the taste that you just want more. Also, the portion sizes are so big that you're sitting here thinking you should probably save the rest for later. With that said, the prices are just right for them. 

Often, I get a to-go order because they're quick and I avoid the rush which is fantastic because sometimes it can get so busy there. Not ideal when you're famished. 

Overall, I would recommend this place for the taste of their entree, price, and portions.

We lived very close by to this Hawaiian spot and one day decided to come try it. Since that day this had always been the spot we go to when we want Hawaiian food. The inside is kinda small but the food well worth coming here. On Fridays there's a family of 3 that sings which is awesome. Everything we've tried here is great from the appetizers of the poke took the desert. Everything is very big portion sized. My husband go to drink is their fruit punch. I like the pog juice since it's something I grew up drinking. When I'm with my husband we usually get the mixed plate since the portions are so big and we add Mac salad so we each can have one. My go to is their chicken Katsu and my husband likes to get the Kalbi or furikake chicken. 

They do get busy sometimes and the wait could get long. The service is great though. I've brought my parents here and they loved it. Overall, we love this place and come back every so often.
